short_description: consider replacing TreeTableView with OutlineView
long_description:
a new treetable-like component has been added to netbeans code base. it has some advantages over the existing and buggy
treetableview: multicolumn sorting drag and drop support in-place editing of tree cells etc. so please consider
replacing TreeTableView with the new OutlineView in your code. the TreeTableView will be deprecated at the end netbeans
6.5 Milestone 2 and there is still some room for extensions and enhancements to OutlineView API depending on your
requirements.

short_description: Multiview: changes in activated nodes not propagated
long_description:
What is the proper way of a multiview element to
propagate the changes in activated nodes?

The current problem is that if the element is a
TopComponent (e.g. java editor) and changes its
activated nodes the change is fired through
TopComponent.Registry which does not pass the
change out as the TopComponent is not the active
one (the multiview TC is active). And there are
actions (like ToggleBreakpointAction) listening on
TopComponent.Registry and updating their state
accordingly - and now they don't receive any
changes (from the java source editor).

There should be a transparent way how existing
TopComponents would work as multiview elements.

short_description: Svn switch uses local directory name as part of URL
long_description:
Let's say I have a working copy of http://svnserver/branches/br1 in a directory /home/me/branch

When I try to switch URL to http://svnserver/branches/br2 I get the following text in output window:
switch http://svnserver/branches/branch /home/me/branch -r HEAD --config-dir /home/me/.netbeans/dev/config/svn/config
--non-interactive --username me --password ******

The last part of URL is came from directory name (not from svn URL!) so you'll never be able to switch a working copy to
br2 until you rename it to br2.

short_description: JAX-WS client generated code should create listeners
long_description:
Currently when JAX-WS creates beans for web services the event change notification code is not generated.  The JAX-WS
guys tell me there's a plugin which will create these properly.

See plugin listener injector plugin at https://jaxb2-commons.dev.java.net/

This will allow binding using JSR-295 (and others).

short_description: Dot paths not available when adding new platform in Ruby Platform Manager
long_description:
I use the Ruby Version Manager gem rvm to work with multiple versions of Ruby on one computer.  Rvm stores Ruby interpreters under /Users/username/.rvm which makes those interpreters impossible to select.  Paths beginning with a dot are filtered out of the folder listings in the Open dialog that appears after clicking Add Platform....  Without the ability to traverse those paths I cannot select my alternate Ruby installations.

I should note however that this was discovered during an attempt to see if I could use NetBeans with Ruby 1.9.  If there's no Ruby 1.9 support then resolution of my issue might not be worth the trouble.

short_description: Performance regression in InstanceDataObject
long_description:
Latest changes in IDO (fix for #11965) causes breaking the IDO.instanceOf
optimalizations immediately during startup.
It is caused by ModuleSystem firing the initial changes in module state
during the startup:
Module change:
java.lang.Exception: Stack trace
        at java.lang.Thread.dumpStack(Thread.java:993)
        at
org.openide.loaders.InstanceDataObject$3.propertyChange(InstanceDataObject.java:1189)
        at
org.openide.util.WeakListener$PropertyChange.propertyChange(WeakListener.java:325)
        at
org.openide.modules.ModuleInfo.firePropertyChange(ModuleInfo.java:120)
        at org.netbeans.core.modules.Module.firePropertyChange0(Module.java:671)
        at
org.netbeans.core.modules.ChangeFirer$DoFiring.run(ChangeFirer.java:113)
        at org.openide.util.Mutex.readAccess(Mutex.java:241)
        at org.netbeans.core.modules.ChangeFirer.run(ChangeFirer.java:91)

for each module before (or during):
@23274 - ModuleSystem.scanForNewAndRestore finished took 15763ms
which causes the first subsequent usage of lookup (e.g. automount) will bring
all the service classes in the IDE (although not resolving them).

See change on graphs from 10/08/2001 to 10/09/2001:
http://performance.netbeans.org/graphs/index.html

long_description:
Found this issue in 4.0 beta 2.

I have a project file with the following classpath
information:
        <java-data
xmlns=http://www.netbeans.org/ns/freeform-project-java/1>
            
                src
                test
                <classpath
mode=compile>E:\cttrunk\dist\adc-debug.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\adc-docobj.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\adc-license.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\adc-profiler.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\adc-schema.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\adc-util.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\conflib.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\confserver-client.jarE:\cttrunk\dist\relgen.jarE:\javadev\tools\junit\junit.jarE:\javadev\tools\dom4j\dom4j.jarE:\javadev\tools\datepicker\datepicker.jarE:\javadev\tools\datepicker.jarplatform/lib/openide-loaders.jarplatform/lib/openide.jar
                E:\cttrunk\build
                E:\cttrunk\test
                1.4
            
        

I have a properties file that contains a property 
dist.dir=E:\cttrunk\dist
I import the properties file into the project:
            
               
../../antpc.properties
            

I then replace E:\cttrunk\dist in the classpath
entries with ${dist.dir}.  Code completion no
longer works for the classes in the jar files.

If I change the E:\cttrunk\dist to a relative path
(..\..\dist in this case) code completion works.

With the ${dist.dir} in the classpath the project
properties view does display the correct paths to
the jar files in the Classpath panel.

short_description: NPE when attaching to remote debuggee
long_description:
Netbeans build 20011005
=======================

It seems that the debugger is trying to recompile source files
when connecting remotely.

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Start some remote debuggee (you can use Debugger Executor).
2. Try to attach to the debuggee.
3. The NullPointerException will be thrown.

Workaround:
-----------
Set _Run Compilation_ property in the Debugger Settings to false.

short_description: Broken atomicity of commands on files + package nodes
long_description:
When a non-recursive folder (e.g. a Java package)
is selected together with an ordinary file there
are always two VCS actions executed - one on the
folder and one on the file.
This can be dangerous for some commands (e.g.
commit) since it breaks the atomicity of the
operation and it's possible to get the repository
into an inconsistent state.

short_description: Show All Details action can easily end up with OutOfMemoryError
long_description:
Show All Details action can easily consume all
available heap ending with OutOfMemoryError.

Simply create a large result set of Find in Files
e.g. by searching for core word in nb_all/core
directory. So far so good. The memory consumption
at this moment is reasonable memory meter shows 26MB.

Click Show All Details and wait a while. The
action tries to populate Output window with
entries for all the found occurences and quickly
consumes all of the 96MB of heap space. After
closing the exception dialog you can clear the
output window and decrease the heap usage back to
where it was.

This action should be able to prevent
OutOfMemoryError by detecting the issue early and
stopping before all heap is consumed or by
limiting the output size some way...

short_description: would like to see module dependencies displayed in the IDE
long_description:
I'm not aware of a way to see dependencies between 
modules except to look at the manifest of each module.  
But that is time consuming to do.  I think it would be 
nice if this information could be displayed within the 
IDE possibly within the global options pane as a property 
of each module.  For example a Module Dependencies 
property with a read-only textual display. It would also 
be useful to have a property associated with the top-
level Modules node that would show the entire tree of 
dependencies for this I think a textual outline format 
for the display would be fine -- but as this would be a 
long list users would want to be able to search the list 
for a string.

short_description: The '#' character is considered as a comment in MS SQL Server
long_description:
The # character is used to create temporary tables in MS SQL Server. In the SQL editor panel it is considered as a 
comment.
So the request is not only badly colored but the 'commented' content is also ignored when executing a SQL query.

This query won't work as everything behind the # is ignored :
CREATE TABLE #TEMP
(
  TEST VARCHAR(30)
)

Tested with the Microsoft SQL JDBC driver 1.2 and 2.0

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200909220201)
Java: 1.6.0_14 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.0-b16
System: Windows Vista version 6.0 running on x86 Cp1252 fr_FR (nb)
Userdir: C:\Users\Degardin\.netbeans\dev

long_description:

droping it onto the Applet Form.  I serialized out the bean instance and then
execute the applet.  It all work well.

However after I close the form window and reopen it the status of the bean
can't restore correctly in the Form Window while the changed property still
keep showing correctly on the property sheet.  If I don't recompile the applet
but execute it the bean show the exact status before I close the form window.

There is anyother problem concering serialize a bean.  We know that there is a
option in the Component Inspector for us to choose to code generate or
serialize a bean.  If we choose code geneartion code will be generate to
record the status of the bean.  If we choose serialize the bean's status will
be store in a .ser file which is generated during compilation.  What the
problem I found is that if I specified in the beanInfo that the bean is only
for serialization code is still generated and no .ser file found after
compilation.

Jennifer

short_description: New code templates related to logging
long_description:
Created attachment 102759
An Options export which will add the templates to your IDE.

Nobody likes writing boilerplate code. Today's IDEs help developers with features like Code Templates which generate boilerplate from a short abbreviation.

I've made a few code templates which help me when adding logger boilerplate to my classes. I'm submitting these as an enhancement. Also forgive me if I accidentally included a template that is already included in the default distribution.

Abbreviation: logr
Description: Static Logger initialization
Expanded Text: private static final ${loggerType type=java.util.logging.Logger default=Logger editable=false} logger = ${loggerType}.getLogger(${classVar editable=false currClassName default=getClass()}.class.getName())

Abbreviation: logrb 
Description: Static Logger initialization including a resource bundle
Expanded Text: private static final ${loggerType type=java.util.logging.Logger default=Logger editable=false} logger = ${loggerType}.getLogger(${classVar editable=false currClassName default=getClass()}.class.getName() ${classVar}.class.getPackage().getName() + ${bundleName default=.Log editable=true})



Abbreviation: logb 
Description: Logging message utilizing resource bundle no parameters.
Expanded Text: ${loggerType instanceof=java.util.logging.Logger default=logger editable=false}.log(${levelType type=java.util.logging.Level editable=false default=Level}.${logLevel default=INFO completionInvoke} ${bundle_key})

Abbreviation: logbp 
Description: Logging message utilizing resource bundle one parameter.
Expanded Text: ${loggerType instanceof=java.util.logging.Logger default=logger editable=false}.log(${levelType type=java.util.logging.Level editable=false default=Level}.${logLevel default=INFO completionInvoke} ${bundle_key} ${args instanceof=java.lang.Object default=args})

Abbreviation: logbps 
Description: Logging message utilizing resource bundle many parameters.
Expanded Text: ${loggerType instanceof=java.util.logging.Logger default=logger editable=false}.log(${levelType type=java.util.logging.Level editable=false default=Level}.${logLevel default=INFO completionInvoke} ${bundle_key} new Object [] { ${args default=null} })



Here's a typical workflow involving these templates:
1. Create a new class.
2. As a class variable type logrb complete the bundle name.
3. Create a new .properties file in the package that matches the name defined in #2.
4. Add logging statements to the class by typing logb logbp or logbps depending on the number of arguments needed.
5. Create keys in the .properties file for each logging message. Include {0} placeholders for the arguments.

short_description: update Spring Version to 3.0.6
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.0.1 (Build 201107282000)
Operating System = Windows 7 version 6.1 running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_26
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 20.1-b02

The Spring version currently packaged with netbeans is still 3.0.2. However the current version is 3.0.6 as seen here:
http://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.springframework/spring-core
I therefore suggest to update this.

For example Spring Security isn't satisfied with version 3.0.2:
http://static.springsource.org/spring-security/site/faq.html
Spring Security 3.0 (...) require Spring 3.0.3 as a minimum.

I know I work around this problem easily by using maven but not all the projects I am working on have been converted to it. ANT projects shouldn't be discriminated too much :-)

short_description: NbEditorDocument leaking through languages support
long_description:
NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 070321)
1.6.0_01-ea Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0_01-ea-b02
SunOS version 5.11 running on x86
en (nb) ISO646-US

custom build of IDE + languages/engine + scripting/javascript

open few .js files optionally edit soe of them and close these file

The editor document are strongly held in memory after this sequence of steps. 
The first path how documents are held is:

Static reference from
org.netbeans.modules.languages.LanguagesManager.languagesManager (from class
org.netbeans.modules.languages.LanguagesManager) :
--> org.netbeans.modules.languages.LanguagesManager@0xc8381280 (24 bytes) (field
listeners:)
--> java.util.Vector@0xc8389890 (24 bytes) (field elementData:)
--> [Ljava.lang.Object@0xc971bc30 (88 bytes) (Element 9 of
[Ljava.lang.Object@0xc971bc30:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.languages.ParserManagerImpl$DocListener@0xc94dfd00 (16
bytes) (field pman:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.languages.ParserManagerImpl@0xc94e8890 (36 bytes)
(field doc:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.editor.NbEditorDocument@0xc94df068 (200 bytes) 

Another path goes through WeakHashMap that contains values strongly refrencing
keys so it cannot work as expected:

Static reference from
org.netbeans.modules.languages.javascript.Semantic.docsToInfos (from class
org.netbeans.modules.languages.javascript.Semantic) :
--> java.util.WeakHashMap@0xc9394448 (44 bytes) (field table:)
--> [Ljava.util.WeakHashMap$Entry@0xc9397ad0 (72 bytes) (Element 0 of
[Ljava.util.WeakHashMap$Entry@0xc9397ad0:)
--> java.util.WeakHashMap$Entry@0xc947b688 (36 bytes) (field value:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.languages.javascript.Semantic$Info@0xc96ea528 (12
bytes) (field items:)
--> java.util.HashMap@0xc96eb328 (40 bytes) (field table:)
--> [Ljava.util.HashMap$Entry@0xc96ebb78 (1032 bytes) (Element 247 of
[Ljava.util.HashMap$Entry@0xc96ebb78:)
--> java.util.HashMap$Entry@0xc96ecfa8 (24 bytes) (field value:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.languages.javascript.Semantic$Declaration@0xc96ed930
(28 bytes) (field doc:)
--> org.netbeans.modules.editor.NbEditorDocument@0xc9400ea8 (200 bytes)

In this example NbEditorDocument@0xc9400ea8 is the key of bucket at index 0 of
Semantic.docsToInfos and the value refers to it.

short_description: [tasklist/javadoc] Reports missing Javadoc for override method
long_description:
tasklist.javadoc/1 [0.8.25 200301310100]

If you are overriding a method from a superclass
(or implementing a method from an interface or
abstract class) you do not necessarily need a
Javadoc comment for it. Often the declaring class
will supply Javadoc describing what the contract
of the method is and assuming you are following
that contract there is nothing more to say. (Your
class Javadoc and constructors or factory methods
may describe everything you want to specify.)

For this reason the Javadoc tool as of JDK 1.3
automatically fills in Javadoc from the declaring
class for you if it needs to.

Therefore I think the tasklist/javadoc suggestions
should omit override methods since they are often
just noise and not real problems. In fact it is
policy for Open APIs source code *not* to add
Javadoc to overrides without adding more
information as there was a documentation
maintenance problem otherwise.

(Ideally override methods should be omitted only
if the declaring class had a Javadoc comment for
that method but in practice many declaring
classes will be available only in bytecode form
so this refinement cannot work.)

short_description: Add Project dialog gets lost
long_description:
Here is how to lose the dialog:

1) Open the Add Project dialog.
2) Leave it open to do something with another application.

The dialog gets lost behind the other windows. The Studio UI will hang until
the dialog is found and closed. 

Restoring Studio to the front by clicking its task bar icon does not show the
dialog.

From experience with other programs the only way to bring the dialog to the
front is to use Show the Desktop (Win-M does not work in this case). Then do
the following:

1) Launch Task Manager.
2) In the Applications tab click Studio.
3) Click Switch To and close Task Manager.

The Add Project dialog is restored on top of the Studio window.

The Add Project dialog should always be on top of the Studio window (is that
modal?) and should never be able to hide behind its parent.

short_description: StringIndexOutOfBoundException in org.netbeans.editor.Formatter
long_description:
I was editing a plain text file containing an XML document.  I have noticed 
some very bizarre behavior in the editor before but I thought it was just the 
auto-formatting at work and I was going to look into the annoyance later (it 
was just a small document).  Here's the issue..


\t
\t
\t\t
\t\t
\t


if the you place the cursor in front of the  tag and hit backspace it 
will jump back to be aligned with the  tag.  however if you hit tab it 
won't fly back to it's former position. it will stubbornly sit there.  you have 
to insert a new line above it tab it over and then backspace the  tag 
up to it.  very annoying.

anyhow while trying to do silly things like that to get around the problem the 
following error poped up so i'm thinking it's a bug and not a feature to try 
and line the tags up.

short_description: Module dependencies are lost
long_description:
I'm building a RCP application on top of:

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200903250219)
Java: 1.6.0_11 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 11.0-b16
System: SunOS version 5.11 running on x86 UTF-8 es_ES (nb)
Userdir: /export/home/antonio/.netbeans/dev

I don't need the whole ide11 so I just select a few modules I need.

From time to time all dependencies in ide11 are lost. It's difficult to reproduce the problem but it seems this is
related to a Clean & Build or a Run of my application. After running if I select Project/Properties/Libraries then
all the modules in ide11 are deselected.

Closing the IDE and opening it again solves the problem as the correct modules are again selected.

I can't see anything weird in messages.log.

short_description: allow to specify column names in tree table with mnemonic using '&' notation
long_description:
i want to add a new attribute ColumnDisplayNameWithMnemonicTTV to org.openide.explorer.view.NodeTableModel as an
alternate way of specifying mnemonic for column display names.
the current implementation uses attribute ColumnMnemonicCharTTV which holds the mnemonic character. however this is
discouraged Mnemonics.setLocalizedText() should be used instead.
pls note that the mnemonic is visible only in 'change visible columns' dialog window.

short_description: Compiled classes used in matisse not updated correctly
long_description:
When a component is added to a matisse form changes to the component class are not picked up. We have lots of problems with this since you need to 
add anything you wish to bind with beansbinding to matisse as a component. For example an added property to a model class that is in a matisse form will 
not be shown in the bindings dialogs. Mostly we need to restart the IDE to get our changes in the component picked up.

To repeat:
1. Create a maven quickstart project
2. Create a new JFrame
3. Create new class CustomComponent which extends JComboBox
4. Compile project
5. Open frame in matisse
6. Create instance of CustomComponent in the JFrame by using the Choose bean and writing the entire component class name
7. Close the matisse view of JFrame
8. Add a constructor to CustomComponent that throws a RuntimeException
9. Clean/Compile project
10. Open the JFrame again the RuntimeException should cause an error dialog but this does not happen.
(the same procedure in a standard netbeans project will work as expected)

The same thing happens in 6.1

short_description: Keymap|Restore does not work as expected
long_description:
The restore button inside Keymap section of new OD does not work as expected:
- it does not restore overriden shortcuts (this is true only for some elements
ie. 'Cut' action)
- it does not remove newly defined ones

Steps to reproduce
-------------------
1) Run the IDE with fresh userdir
2) Open a project
3) Open Tools|Options
4) Goto Keymaps
5) Add some new shortcuts remove some
6) Confirm OD
7) Invoke Tools|Options|Keymap again
8) Press Restore
---> Newly added shortcuts won't be removed
---> Some of the overridden ones are not restored

short_description: [Favorites] My Favourites too long as a tab name

Seems too long as a tab name. On my laptop screen
it does not fit nicely in the explorer mode with
Projects and Files open. Suggest just Favorites
as the tab name. Don't care about the root node &
menu item.

BTW technically it should be Favorites rather
than Favourites in the default locale (en_US)
with a translatedfiles entry for en_UK giving
Favourites. :-)

short_description: [newcodemodel] NetBeans doesn't highlight broken #include
Too much memory used to parse some files
long_description:
There are files with such extensive macro usage (in Boost for example) that parsing these files consume too much memory.
It happens because we tokenize expand and keep the full file instead of a small portion that we need at the moment.

short_description: Nb App should have Multiview enabled by default
long_description: Now when the file template offers creation of MultiView ready code it would make sense to include core.multiview into the set of modules included in any NetBeans 7.1 Platform Application.

short_description: the new code template crashs my old code template
long_description:
You known before 5.5 there's  ' Created on __DATE__ __TIME__' field in the
default code template of class.

And this will convert to the date format according to the locale of the JVM. In
my case it will convert into Chinese date format.

When I open my previous project with NetBeans 6 this date field is gone.

short_description: IDE Installer checks for updates
long_description: In the end of installation IDE the installer checks Update Centers for possible updates. Offline installation or proxy problems might be ignored and installation completes successfully in this case.

short_description: JSF Pages From entity class. Generate exception on jsp create action when using MySQL DB with Identifying Relationship
long_description:
Created attachment 113293
netbeans project

The following Exception thrown when attempting to create an entry in the databases:
Exception [EclipseLink-4002] (Eclipse Persistence Services - 2.3.0.v20110604-r9504): org.eclipse.persistence.exceptions.DatabaseException
Internal Exception: com.mysql.jdbc.exceptions.jdbc4.MySQLIntegrityConstraintViolationException: Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`simpledb`.`child` CONSTRAINT `fk_child_parent` FOREIGN KEY (`parent_idparent`) REFERENCES `parent` (`idparent`) ON DELETE NO ACTION ON UPDATE NO ACTION)
Error Code: 1452
Call: INSERT INTO child (ctext idchild parent_idparent) VALUES (? ? ?)
	bind => [3 parameters bound]
Query: InsertObjectQuery(entity.Child[ childPK=entity.ChildPK[ idchild=0 parentIdparent=0 ] ]) 
NOTE: If using Non-Identifying relationship then the generated JSP’s function correctly.

To reproduce:
1.	Create simpledb database from script on mysql server
2.	Import simpledb project into netbeans
3.	Create parent entry using jsp’s
4.	Create child entry using jsp’s
5.	Exception generated

From looking at the code it looks like the ChildPK.parentIdparent is not populated correctly from the JSP as I would expect this to be set to 1. Therefore this is generating the “child row: a foreign key constraint fails” exception on db commit (as there is no parent object with an id of 0).

short_description: Jar Packager settings
long_description:
I think Compression Level property of
Options|Packaging and Deployment|JAR|JAR
Packager node is not used in JAR Packager module.
But it is visible and editable and could be set to
invalid values (for example: -1 1000).

JarPackagerOptions class contains other properties
also. I think they should be visible as not
editable properties.

short_description: Parentheses after super method call results in ClassCastException.
long_description:
If you type a pair of parentheses between super and .sleep() so this:
super.sleep()
becomes this:
super().sleep()
you get a java.lang.ClassCastException error. This is repeatable happens every time.

Example code:
/*
 * Dog.java
 *
 * Created on October 6 2005 1:50 PM
 *
 * To change this template choose Tools | Template Manager
 * and open the template in the editor.
 */

package testsup

/**
 *
 * @author basilbourque
 */
public class Dog extends Animal{
    
    /** Creates a new instance of Dog */
    public Dog() {
    }
    
    public void sound(){
        //super.sound()
        System.out.println(woof )
        
    }
    
    public void makeLoudSound() {
        super.sleep()
       //System.out.println(BARK BARK BARK) 
    }
    
    
}
--end of code--

short_description: Checkout allows duplicate projects
long_description:
If a project exists and SVN checkout provides a project with the same name the
two projects are duplicated in the Projects area. NetBeans gets confused on
which is which until a project rename is performed.

short_description: The IDE is not robust against .settings files (SAXParseException)
long_description:
200206240100 JDK1.4fcs MDI.
Consider you have some .settings file on some of
your filesystems. But this file is NOT IDE
settings file (XML) it is just another's
application setting (for example DT settings).
The IDE is not able to cope with this situation
it just throws an exception (SAXParseException).
This situation may occur on NetBeans platform very
easily as the home directory is mounted by
default and the DT's .settings files are there.
The exception thrown by empty .settings file is
attached.

short_description: New XML Document ignores template engine
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE 6.9 (Build 201007282301)
Java: 1.6.0_20 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 16.3-b01

Templates/XML/XMLDocument.xml template contains instructions for FreeMarker template engine namely license inclusion but those are ignored if one creates a new well formed XML Document using the New File wizard.

Other templates Java Class or HTML work as expected.

short_description: Completion in #include should switch to 2-nd mode if there are no files in the list
long_description:
Consider the situatin: user entered #include  and called completion
while there are no headers in the current directory.
The completion shows a list with a signle element: ...
Such list should be considered as empty so completion should automatically switch to 2-nd mode (and show all headers
from -I directories)

short_description: got NullPointerException when hitting Ctrl-N
long_description:
I clicked on a node (I think it was an Ejb-module node) and then hit Ctrl-N to 
create a new object in the same package.  As I hit Ctrl-N I noticed that the 
name of the ejb-module was now editable so I must have clicked on it twice in 
succession before hitting Ctrl-N.

I wasn't able to reproduce this exception though.
Code was built from release32 11 Apr 2001 22:37:53 GMT

short_description: Closing Merge Conflict Resolver vs. Cancel button in Question dialog
long_description:
How to reproduce:
1) Have a file with conflicts in CVS FS
2) Invoke Resolve Conflicts popup menu action in
editor of this file
3) NOTE - Merge Conflict Resolver dialog appears
4) Press OK button
5) NOTE - Question dialog appears
6) ERROR - There are Yes No and Cancel button.
No and Cancel buttons have the same functionality
-> remove Cancel button.

short_description: Applet cannot be debugged under JDK 1.3.
long_description:
JDK 1.3 + HotSpot

1. Create some applet.
2. Start debugging of this applet.
3. Debugger starts but later it prints to Output Window left pane: Unsupported Option: -nosecurity. Then debugging dies. No exception is printed.

Debugging applets under JDK 1.2.2 prints: Warning: SecurityManager not installed.

short_description: Inline diff too small (with scrollbars)
long_description:
Created attachment 90806
Not enough space for inline diff

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200911091156)
Java: 1.6.0_16 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.2-b01
System: Linux version 2.6.31-14-generic running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb)

When I change just one line in a file under vcs and click on the blue stripe on the beginning of this line the floating toolbar with four icons appears.

short_description: ExtendedNodeModelFilter extends NodeModel instead of NodeModelFilter
long_description:
This is a typing error introduced in issue #104281.
It's important to fix it before the release. It has no sense for the implementors of ExtendedNodeModelFilter to also
implement NodeModel but for correct functionality NodeModelFilter needs to be implemented.

This is strictly speaking an incompatible API change but any implementation of ExtendedNodeModelFilter had to
implement also NodeModelFilter otherwise it would not function correctly anyway. With that in account this is not
really an incompatible change.

@@ -317 +317 @@

  * @since 1.12
  */
-public interface ExtendedNodeModelFilter extends NodeModel {
+public interface ExtendedNodeModelFilter extends NodeModelFilter {
     
     /**
      * Test whether this node permits renaming.

short_description: netbean editor doesn't show up after switch external editor to netbean editor in MDI mode
long_description:
ide version: build020301_1 Orion EA RC1
jdk version: jdk1.4 fcs
xemacs/gim: /bin

netbean editor doesn't show up after switch from external editor to netbean
editor in debugger session plus MDI mode.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start ide with brand new user set window mode to MDI and editor to vim or
xemacs
2. Load a C++ executable to debugger. external editor is brought up without any
problem.
3. Change editor to xemacs or vim in setup wizard. Close external editor
4. Load an executable to debugger expected netbean editor doesn't show up.

It is OK to open a file to netbean editor. 

workaround: Change window mode from MDI mode to SDI mode and enlarge editor
window

short_description: CVS: Status problem when adding back already removed file.
long_description:
Development build of NetBeans 3.3 #200110040910 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.3.1

Description:
============
This seems rather incredible scenario to me but if the file was removed from the
repository and user wants it to be back after CVS|Add the status still remains
as [Local]. Manual Refresh turns it to [Locally Added New].

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount CVS filesystem and Remove and Commit any [Up-to-date] file.
2. Create a file with the same name so that it is [Local].
3. Invoke CVS|Add on it. Check that after Add is finished it remains [Local]

short_description: Incorrect highlighting for unintialized variables in Javascript
long_description:
See the attached screenshot (sorry I'm not willing to share the code at this point). Note that the 'wsim' variable is
not defined in the method body and is thus considered to be a global variable. In fact this is not true as the variable
is not defined anywhere in the script (except other method bodies).

I would consider this to be a warning as even if the script is depending on other scripts in terms of global variables
definitions it would err if run used separately. And in my case this is a plain error.

short_description: REGRESSION: IllegalStateException while trying to bind database table to table component in visual web

If you follow these steps with recent build
1) Create a new visual web project
2) Add a table component onto the designer
3) Expand the services node connect to any of the database(password is same as the user name)
4) Drop a database table onto the table component dropped in step 2

You'll see the attached exception. Unfortunately you may not see in the console since it is being swallowed

If you do not see the exception try to delete the table component

This used to work perfectly alright do not know exactly when this started hapenning

short_description: [65cat] Hibernate module need to support freeform project types.
long_description:
Currently Hibernate module support Web and J2SE non freeform project types. This issue tracks the feature of adding support for freeform variants of these 
project types. the original issue is #142296.

short_description: Allow custom debugger and compiler configs to be global
long_description:
I have several customized compiler and debugger configurations which I use
regularly.  Each time I create a new project I have to recreate them.  It
would be nice if I could make them part of the default starting project somehow.
wcn

short_description: requestVisible() on TopComponent doesn't work properly
long_description:
If requestVisible() method is called on some TopComponent in some mode (that 
hasn't the focus) there is the problem when this mode gets the focus  -->>  
the TopComponent with last focus [not through requestVisible() but through 
requestFocus()] in this mode is selected so the requestVisible() is ignored!!

scenario:
I have 2 modes (say #A and #B) with similar TopComponents in tabbed pane (say 
#1 #2 #3). The TopComponent #2 is selected in both modes mode #A has the 
focus. When user switches from #2 to #1 in mode #A I'm synchronizing the mode 
#B (I'm selecting #1 via requestVisible()). Now when user is selecting the 
window with mode #B automatic switch from #1 to #2 is occured in this mode #B.
(The TopComponent #2 had the real focus before I was calling requestVisible() 
method).

short_description: [completion]Code completition does not work properly for arrays.
long_description:
Write into some method:

int []a

a.

And here press Ctrl-Space. Code completition offers you some methods and here is NOT field length.
When you press ANY key code completition block will be empty (even if you try to write for example `e`  for equals).

Probably on any platform but I am not sure.

short_description: Debugger does not stop on breakpoints in initializer.
long_description:
Add breakpoint into initializer.
Try to debug.
The debugger will not stop on your breakpoint.

See #296 for the same problem about static initializers.

short_description: Fine-tune the task list window
long_description:
For the 6.5 release we want to make the Task List window open by default. To make it happen we need to do the following:

- rename the window to Tasks (also the menu item in the Window menu)

- if the window is empty it should have a white background and should show a message like:  or  or <No Task 
in File>.

- the table header needs to use platform L&F (currently it uses Classic L&F on Win XP). Compare Task List with Watches to see the difference.

- use new icons - for error use the same icon we use in the editor gutter. I've asked the visual designer to design a new TODO icon. Are there any other old 
icons in the task list?

long_description:
when searching through a memory snapshot using the find next/previous buttons.
after reaching last item containing search term in list the info dialog appears
with string not found. should say something like no more occurences of search string

short_description: Search options persistent between sessions
long_description: It would be nice to have an option to make search scope and options persistent between NetBeans sessions.

short_description: Slow CSS code completion - CssIndex.getAllDependenciesGraph()
long_description:
Extracted from the original issue 197270 with many invalid duplicates (reports with no relation to the css completion).

There's one report (from the two I found in the many irrelevant) really showing the css completion problem:

http://statistics.netbeans.org/exceptions/exception.do?id=461067

The problem has been already described in the original issue:

Caused by very slow Windows disk IO 

FileUtil.toFileObject() ~ 22ms
FileObject.getFileObject() ~ 15ms

Since these are called quite frequently during computing the current file
dependencies graph the result is that the completion is slow.

Easiest way to fix this problem is to cache the dependencies graph for the
edited file and invalidate it only if the index result changes (some of the
deps. changed).

long_description:
Hi

I just had an error with the IDE so I tried to report it using the built-in functionality.

This didn't work because it kept telling me my username ('LudoA') or password was incorrect. After a while of trying I 
figured it out: while the webinterface allows me to login as 'LudoA' Netbeans expects me to login as 'ludoa' - no caps. 
Just adding a .toLower() before submitting the data would probably fix this.

Thanks

Ludovic

a bundle line does *not* insert a space (you need a space before it) so

This is how package-info.java looks like:

javax.xml.bind.annotation.XmlNsForm.QUALIFIED)
package org1.example.duke

short_description: annotateNameHtml discards project-specific HTML annotations
long_description:
Create a Maven project with an unusual packaging for example use org.jvnet.hudson.tools:maven-hpi-plugin as an archetype so you get hpi packaging. The project's root node will be displayed with hpi in control font (blue on Metal) after the regular black . Say you created myproject so you will see myproject hpi.

Now initialize a Mercurial repository in the project and commit it. You will now see e.g. myproject [myproject] with the folder name inside brackets in disabled font (gray on Metal). The packaging is no longer displayed.

The reason is that ProjectsRootNode.BadgingNode.getHtmlDisplayName when it encounters a FileSystem.HtmlStatus which really makes changes ignores getOriginal().getHtmlDisplayName() which in this case has the packaging. But it has no choice since annotateNameHtml is documented to forbid HTML tags. This method is also documented to require metacharacters to be escaped though in fact VersioningAnnotationProvider's impl escapes any incoming '<' and so does MercurialAnnotator.annotate{Folder}NameHtml.

I am not sure what the reasoning is behind the current contract of annotateNameHtml but it seems unusable. Recommend that this method be simplified to accept and return arbitrary well-formed HTML. Then BadgingNode.getHtmlDisplayName would just pass htmlName when not null and VCS code would not try to escape incoming text.

short_description: Numerous NullPointerException problems
long_description:
NetBeans 5.0 Beta 2 on Windows XP
I had been using NetBeans for some time with only an occasional 
NullPointerException but I have been working only with Java files.
I recently tried to port some old C++ code to Java and I was overwhelmed with 
NullPointer exceptions which prevented using the editor to fix the numerous 
porting issues.  Note that the compiler does not choke on the project only the 
IDE.
I am attaching the zip of a simple project.  The code is primitive and has too 
many errors to compile successfully but does illustrate the 
NullPointerException problem well.  I tried creating a simpler example but 
could not create one that was so effective at showing the problem.

To reproduce the problem unzip the attached project folder and open the project 
in NetBeans 5 Beta 2 using JDK 6.  (It will also faile with JDK 5.)
Expand the Project until the source file names are visible.  Single click on 
Parser.java  Look in the Navigator window - it appears to be hung on Scanning 
in progress...  Double click on Parser.java - NullPointer and file opens.  
Click anywhere in file to set the keyboard focus - NullPointer.  Click again in 
same spot or different spot - NullPointer.  Right-click on the Parser.java file 
name on the editor tab - NullPointer.  You also can't simply keep the Exception 
window open to continue working because the keyboard focus keeps shifting back 
to the Exception window.  You are effectively blocked from editing the file to 
fix its problems!  The NullPointers could be related to the hung Navigator but 
closing the Navigator window doesn't prevent the NullPointer exceptions.

A typical stack trace of an exception is:

short_description: [65cat] Unable to install older versions of gems
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200808190201 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.6.0_07 ]

The Gems manager doesn't provide a mechanism for installing an older
version of a gem if a newer one is installed.

EG:

Built-in JRuby comes with Rails 2.1.0.

I need to install 2.0.2 for a multitude of projects
(rails:freeze:edge REVISION=2.0.2 for over 100 projects would be
impractical).

The plugin manager can identify that older versions of the gem exists
but the older versions are not included on the New Gems page and
are therefore unavailable for installation.

short_description: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException while starting IDE
long_description: The ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown while starting IDE. The stacktrace will be attached. The problem was traced down to the org.netbeans.core.FilterList class. The instance variable map can be zeroed by propertyChange from different thread which put the FilterList instance in inconsistent state. This leads to the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException exception in this case and can produce other problems in different situations.

short_description: JavaHelp context-sensitive link should display merged helpset
long_description:
When I (as an end user) choose a context-sensitive link in the Forte for Java
UI the helpset that displays is always the standalone helpset for the module
not the merged helpset for all modules (the one that displays when you choose
Help > Contents). There is no way provided in the module API to display the
merged helpset from a context-sensitive call. Default behavior of the API
should be to display the merged helpset. I think that developers should also
able to use the API to display a standalone helpset if they choose to do so
but that is not as important as changing the default to the merged helpset.

short_description: Use the new annotation to register keywords for panels in Options dialog
long_description:
A new annotation (bug 218312) was introduced to register keywords for various
panels present in the options window. Please add appropriate keywords and/or
use the annotation to any panel you choose to so that the search in options
window works as expected. 

options.keymap module already uses the annotation. Please re-assign if this is not the correct component. Thank you

short_description: Build Project when a default target has not been set should show chooser
long_description:
It seems that there are two different Execute
project actions.

First in pop-up menu on project node. It checks if
project has Default Build target set and if yes
it's executed and then it executes class set as
*Project Main Class*. But Project Main Class is
executed despite the Default Build Target is not
set => NoClassDefFoundError.

Second is in Projects menu in Main Window and it
doesn't check Default Build target setting and
executes class set as *Execution Startup*. If
there is no Default Build target user gets
NoClassDefFoundError since project wasn't built
before.

short_description: Do priority for scans
long_description:
I would like to propose the following when you are
scanning files for TODOs:
1. Scan the current document
2. Scan all other open documents
3. Scan filesystem of the current document
4. Scan filesystems of the other open documents
5. Scan all other filesystems.

It would permit to firstly scan files that have
high interest for the user: The files that he
opened. and the files around them.

short_description: fastCopyIfPosible cannot be disabled programmatically
long_description:
I'm working on a project type module that interacts with a special filesystem mounted as a network share.

When saving files localhistory calls LocalHistoryStoreImpl.fastCopyIfPosible which makes a copy and saves into a new file. This is not supported by my filesystem very well and leads to loss of metadata (saved with the file). I didn't find a way to tell localhistory not to copy files or switch off localhistory completly for my project files as im not working on Windows and my files are not executable (there are some bug reports related to executable files).

After some searching I noticed that I could set a system property (e.g. -J-Dnetbeans.localhistory.excludeFiles=.*) to disable localhistory. With this property everything works just fine but it would be great if I could put some sort of object into the projects lookup that denys access to the project files  for localhistory (hope i didn't miss anything if so please point me into the right direction).

short_description: Palette is blinks while refreshing

When PaletteController.refresh is called the palette is refreshed. But it
changes itself on-the-fly so an user see how the JComponents are removed/added
from/into the palette and how they are layouting ... This makes annoying
blinking of palette TopComponent.
It would be better to implement double buffering.

Possible implementation:
PaletteController.refresh method should be implemented like this:
paletteJComponent.setVisible (false)
...do actual refreshing of JComponent...
paletteJComponent.setVisible (true)
paletteJComponent.revalidate ()

short_description: Scroll wheel reverses direction
long_description:
I was playing around with the output window font sizes and there is a bug in there somewhere.  When I make the font
bigger (using the ctrl+scrollwheel) it will suddenly change the unit increment and the direction will reverse.  Setting
the font size from the popup menu seems to fix the issue...although it can happen again.

This does not happen every time but it only takes about 10 seconds of playing around with it to reproduce for me.  One
way I seem to get it to reproduce reliably is to make the font really small.  Scroll around about with the wheel and
verify everything is working.  (If it is not you reproduced it already.)

Then with ctrl+wheel make the font bigger (like 18 pt not huge).  Now scroll with the wheel again.

I can give more details on the mouse if you need them however this only happens in Netbeans so I doubt it is a driver
issue.  General description: MS Wireless Laser Mouse 8000 with intellipoint software.

short_description: RESTful Java client doesn't see changes in WS
long_description:
- Create Web project
- Create RESTful WS from pattern.
- Generate RESTful Java client for created WS.
- Change RESTful WS in the following way: add @Path annotation with some 
value f.e. : @Path({id})
- Generate RESTful Java client for changed WS.
- Compare two generated Java clients. They are the same.
- Restart NB and generate client one more time.
The result differs from previous generation : there is a method that contains handling of id path parameter .

It means that RESTful WS method is not updated on change @Path annotation.

short_description: Replace button should replace the currently selected text.
long_description:
I just noticed the following behavior in the search and replace panel:

Given the following lines:

1 $foo1 = 1
2 $foo2 = 2
3 $foo3 = 3
4 $foo4 = 4

I try the following:
I select the 4 lines then press Ctrl+h to open the search and replace panel. I type foo in the Find what field and bar in the Replace with field

At this point I do the following:

1. I press the Replace button and it replaces the first occurrence of foo with bar (line 1). Correct behavior
2. I press next foo in line 2 is selected. Correct behavior
3. I press next again to skip line 2 foo in line 3 is selected. Correct behavior
4. I press Replace to replace the currently selected foo in line 3 but the one in line 4 is replaced. The expected behavior would be to replace the currently selected foo

I assume the Replace button always triggers a Next event before replacing perhaps it shouldn't do that if Next has just been clicked or if the currently selected text is already the target of the search.

Regards

Paolo.

short_description: [67cat] Code-Completion/Hint processing erases editor text
long_description:
While coding in Ruby the code completion assistant popped up.  I continued typing and the code completion window
attempted to keep up with me but was unable to do so.

When I completed my line and hit the return key everything I had typed into the editor after the code completion popup
appeared vanished.

How to reproduce:

1) Create a project (I am using Ruby)
2) Open up/create a code file within the project which will require
   you to type in code.
3) Type in some code which will cause the popup to appear at some point.
4) Allow the pop-up to appear
5) Continue typing faster than the popup can keep up.  Include typing past what the system can match against the pop-up
contents.
    An (ruby) example would be:
      aValueString.each_byte do |i|
             (pause after the each until the pop-up appears)
6) As soon as you complete typing the line hit the enter key.

At this time the editor only contains up to but not beyond the each when the pop-up appeared.

short_description: Don't instantiate all CsmFiles at once
long_description:
Now getSourceFiles() and getHeaderFiles() methods of the project instantiate *all* CsmFiles of the entire project.
This is definitely inclrrect - lazy collections should be used instead.
This won't be that important if these methods were not in code completion stack.
Now the 2-nd phase of code completion instantiates *all* the files which increases memory snapshot dramatically.

short_description: Debugger: The resume icon is wrong
long_description:
The standard debuggercore resume icon looks like this: |>
Considering that the iconography of media players uses plain > for play/resume
and that the same iconography uses |'s to denote beginning and ends (e.g. |< for
rewind to beginning) I'd like the resume icon to shed it's | and become a plain >.

This only came to my attention as we started looking at the iconography of 
dbxtool a standalone debugger GUI based on NB. In dbxtool we have the
notion of start running from the beginning and UI designers came up with |>.
Here the bar is being used consistently with the abovementioned notion of beginning.
However users complained that the |> of start from beginning looks too much like
the |> of resume. (resume icon is in a green circle with the |> being white start 
from beginnings icon is bigger and is just a green |>)

It seems to me that it is Resume which has the incorrect iconography.

short_description: Option to prompt for deployment server each time a Maven Web application is run
long_description:
When running a Maven Web project NetBeans presents a dialog asking for the target deployment server.  Two radio buttons in the dialog control how the user's selection will be remembered:

- Remember in Current IDE Session
- Remember Permanently (in pom.xml)

A Do not remember option is not available.  If a user is testing how an application performs on two different servers (e.g. Tomcat 6 vs Tomcat 7) he must either restart the IDE or edit the pom.xml manually to change the target deployment server.

A Do not remember option should be added so NetBeans can prompt for the server each time the user runs the project.

short_description: Auto-complete does not work when classes have same name
long_description:
Reproduction:

1) Create a file with PHP class named Image under namespace Foo.

2) Create static method fromFile in the \Foo\Image class that returns a new instance of the \Foo\Image class. (declared by `/** @return Image */` phpDoc).

3) Create a file with PHP class named Image under namespace Boo.

4) Get the new instance of \Foo\Image `$image = \Foo\Image::fromFile()` somewhere inside of the \Boo\Image class.

5) Type `$image->` and press ctrl+space.

Expected behavior:
auto-complete should suggest methods and properties of the \Foo\Image.

Actual behavior:
auto-complete prints No suggestions.

After renaming the \Boo\Image to \Boo\Whatever all is working again.

short_description: [perf] Closing refactoring window with usages blocks AWT thread for a long time

Closing a refactoring window Usages of FOO

See the attachment for one thread dump taken 
during the closing of the window. However this 
is just one snapshot which cannot tell what is 
being done in AWT during the whole action. You 
must do a more thorough analysis.

short_description: Warning needed if nb-configuration.xml netbeans.hint.jdkPlatform is no longer valid
long_description:
When I initially installed NetBeans 7.2.1 I was using JDK 1.6.0_27 which worked well for a Web Service Maven project using jaxws-maven-plugin (wsgen and wsimport).

I recently upgraded to JDK 1.6.0_37 then installed JDK 1.7.0_10 and changed netbeans.conf to use 1.7 as the default runtime.

When I attempted to build my web service project the maven wsgen and wsimport targets of the jaxws-maven-plugin failed because it was reverting to using the default 1.7 platform.

I looked at the project (Right click project->Properties->Build->Compile) and it showed JDK 1.6.0_37 (first item in the list) I made a bad assumption that it was correctly set to use JDK 1.6.0_37 even though in reality it really wasn't set it was simply showing the first item in the list.  There was no warning or prompt that the current value stored in the nb-configuration.xml file was not a valid value.

Upon closer inspection the value stored in the nb-configuration.xml file showed:

JDK 1.6

which was no longer a Java Platform value yet no warnings or other hints were shown suggesting that this value was no longer valid.

After forcing it to use the JDK_1.6.0_37 it correctly used the right platform.

If  could be validated and a warning displayed on either the properties page and/or the console output during a build stating that there is a problem with the setting it would help.

short_description: REGRESSION: Copying and Pasting Palette items is broken.
long_description:
To reproduce w/ HTML Palette (probably exists w/ all palette types though)

Create a java application.
Create a new HTML file.
Drag & Drop a table (from HTML palette category) -- it works.

Now go to Tools | Palette Manager | HTML/JSP Code Clips.
Find the Table component under the HTML category right Click Copy.
Right Click the HTML Forms category Paste Item to paste the table on the HTML
Forms Palette.
Click Refresh to refresh the palette (6.0 step only not needed in 5.5x)

Now go back to the HTML file.  Open the HTML Forms category and Drag & Drop
this table component onto the HTML file.

Instead of inserting the table the IDE will open a file called TABLE.xml and
you'll get a combination IllegalStateException & ClassCastException (attached).

This is a regression from NetBeans 5.5.

short_description: problems when adding JSF framework to Maven project with no server
long_description:
While reproducing issue 197665 I noticed a few problems. The simplified steps to reproduce them are:

* create Maven Web Project (EE6)
* in project properties add JSF framework

Problem 1:

if I have a user defined JSF library (eg. in my case it was JSF 2.1) then this library is offered in JSF Framework customizer and selecting that library results in mess being added to pom.xml because user defined library does not have a mapping to a pom.xml to use. It would be better to just filter out all user defined libraries in case of Maven project??? Maybe?? What do you think?

Problem 2:

choosing JSF 2.0 library bundled with the IDE results in 2.0.4-b09 version of JSF being referenced. While this is OK for dev builds we should make sure that final NetBeans releases generate dependencies only on some final releases of libraries - 2.0.4 or lower if final build is not available.

short_description: Unable to Update Data Source References
long_description:
When opening a previously created project (i.e. created in a previous NB 6) the Data Source References node indicates an
error see attachment ....Error1 but does not allow the user to Right Click and Update Data Sources. This menu option
on the Right Click is disabled.

The result is that the first time a page is open it can not display correctly because the connection does not exist.
Closing the Page and reopening it appears to resolve the issue this assume the db connection does exist but the Data
Source References Node still shows an error.

When opening a page that uses a currently closed connection eg jdbc connection why can it not attempt to open the
connection before reporting the error.

short_description: Commenting code by ctrl+/ doesn't match current language.
long_description:
Pressing ctrl+/ (comment line) in php tag in .html file makes wrong comment symbol. 
Example code:

<?php
	echo test
?>


Pressing ctrl+/ on the echo line results in:

<?php
	body-->?>

should be: 
	//echo $response->body


The same happens in .php file when commenting html tags:
<?php
	echo test
?>


Results in:
//
Should be:
-->

As we comment code very frequently I think this issue needs higher priority.

[010618_2]

Also entry in deployment descriptor should be created.

short_description: Module's build.xml script can crash the whole testing process
long_description:
When there is some bug or build exception in the module's build.xml file it
will crash the whole testing process. This is highly annoying when testing large
sets of tests automatically (e.g. nighlty builds). XTest instance should run the
module's scripts in a separate VM so instad of using ant task it would call
'ant' with some properties set via exec task.

Hitting OK before Export has retrieved all revisions is throwing an exception as the default output file has not yet
been set.

short_description: Change property cause change tab
long_description:
Scenario:
- create new JForm
- select tab [Code generation]
- change 
property [Form Size Policy]

and now you have selected another tab 
[Properties]

short_description: Icon for annotation type node request
long_description:
Please provide the icon for the annotation type
node. Current impl uses interface icon.

short_description: Post-initialization command-line options could not be run.
long_description:
Netbeans fails to use all the options specified in the netbeans.conf on Mac OS X
because Mac OS X adds a gratuitous -psnsssss (where sssss is the process serial
number).

Currently when NB sees a command line option it does not recognize it rejects
all the options.  My suggested solution is for NB to ignore any options it does
not recognize and process the remaining options.  It would also be nice (but not
necessary) for NB to display the option(s) that it ignored.

My current workaround is to edit the file
Contents/Resources/NetBeans/platform7/lib/nbexec.  I add the following lines in
the function parse_args just before -J*) ... in the case statement (currently at
line 106).

        -psn*)
        	shift
        	

Environment:

The message in the summary appears in messages.log imemdiately after all the
modules are turned on.

Current OS: 10.4.9 (also appeared in 10.3.x)

Current NB: 6.0 M9 (also affected NB all the way back to 5.0 as I remember)

Impact:  NB users who are not familiar with the Unix underneath will not realize
that the various options that they set in netbeans.conf are being ignored.

Hopefully the workaround can be implemented in the next milestone of 6.0 and the
solution be implemented in the final release of 6.0.

short_description: Key bindings available for dummy actions
long_description:
In the Options dialog under Keymap in the Jackpot folder there are actions

  Operators
  Transformers

These are not real actions just dummy submenus so no keybindings should be
offered. I.e. remove from Actions/Jackpot/ in your layer.

short_description: [50cat] After folder rename CVS/Repository keeps old name
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200509151455 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.5.0_04 ]

1) I renamed folder defaulttheme to defaultlayout.
2) Did a 'Show all changes'
3) Non existing files at defaulttheme were showing as 'Locally New'
4) Went to defaultlayout/CVS folder and edit Repository file
5) Changed manually defaulttheme to defaultlayout.

Now CVS system shows files from defaultlayout but can't commit.

defaultlayout root's CVS folder also had Entries file with defaulttheme wrong entry.

I tried to solve this issue by:

1) I created defaultlayout folder on another computer with a dummy file and commited.
2) Now I was able to commit files on the first computer.

But files showed as Locally/Remotelly modified.
Any attempt to Revert Modifications raised an exception. :-/

short_description: Debugging Window container must send activation events to views
long_description:
This will just be a quick summary of the issue since we've already discussed
this at length but basically views embedded in the debugging window needs
to be able to be notified when they are activated this is the moral
equivalent on clicking on the window decorations of true top components.

For example if you click in one of the debugging views the Cut Copy and Paste
actions need to be enabled/disabled based on the selection in this view. 
This should be done from the moral equivalent of the componentActivated
message of a top component.

The FListener with focusGained/focusLost is already doing this general
job for the PARTICULAR case where the debugging view contains an
ExplorerManager.  But that only works for explorer-debugger-views.
So add some kind of focusGained or activated interface to the
View interface and register focus listeners on the component trees
in the views and call these methods when appropriate.

Similarly provide a way to listen for componentShown/componentHidden
of these components since they need to be able to be told when
the view is hidden or shown (many views perform expensive computations
which should only be done when visible).  There are three events which
affect visibility of a component:
  1) it is shown/hidden as the result of the user clicking on the
     toggle button in the toolbar
  2) the view is added/removed from the GUI manager
  3) the main debugging window itself is shown/hidden

short_description: NetBeans doesn't update icon (green computer) in Services tab if remote machine is switched off
long_description:
Scenario:
- Launch VirtualBox
- Add remote host in NetBeans
- Open Services tab
- Switch off VirtualBox
- Check C/C++ Build Hosts|user@localhost:2222 node
==> I see green icon (it is wrong)!!!
- Call context menu on user@localhost:2222 node
==> No any freezes and Connect menu item is enabled and Disconnect item is disabled

I think NetBeans can update icon too.

short_description: New splashscreen for IDE updater needed
long_description:
1. There is new splashscreen gif for NB updater 
  (created by Bruce Lee) which should be integrated into NB 3.3.1. 

2. Because there is also new FFJ version of this splashscreen
  (which hinterto doesn't exist) I should also remove branding 
  hack from org.netbeans.updater.UpdaterFrame.java
-        if ( ModuleUpdater.getBranding() == null )
-            // NetBeans branding
-            jLabel3.setIcon(new javax.swing.ImageIcon(getClass().getResource(/
org/netbeans/updater/resources/updatersplash.gif)))

+        jLabel3.setIcon(new javax.swing.ImageIcon(getClass().getResource(/org/
netbeans/updater/resources/updatersplash.gif)))

Fixed in trunk.

Diff:
http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/autoupdate/libsrc/org/netbeans/updater/UpdaterFrame.java.diff?r1=1.15&r2=1.16

Add duplicate option in query page
long_description:
Add 'At least one duplicate' checkbox in query page. When the checkbox is
checked select reports with more than 0 duplicate.

().append(this.autor).append(this.titul).append(this.isbn)

to prevent some misunderstanding...

short_description: Can't Copy/Paste [Explorer] to another WS because NPE is thrown
long_description:
[NetBeans 3.2 build #9]

Reproduceable by e.g.:

1. start newly unzipped build
2. rightClick in MW on e.g. Running tab and choose Customize Workspaces
3. expand Editing node
4. expand Debugging node
5. rightClick on Explorer (that with the Explorer icon) under Editing node 
and choose Copy
6. rightClick on Debugging node and choose Paste
7. Now click on Debugging tab in MW

-> NPE at 
org.netbeans.core.windows.frames.SplittedContainerImpl.attachComponents will be 
thrown (attached)

NOTE: after pressing  [Explorer] will appear - but empty
      need to restart the IDE to show it corectly

      I've been tracking this bug and it is present in IDE since [NetBeans 3.2 
build #5] (including)
      -> there was only one commit to CVS to this build performed by Marek -> 
therefore assigning to him.

      CC: adding Marian here due to his interest

short_description: Permanent Project folder already exists when creating maven project
long_description:
Dev build 091002.
1) Create New Project -> Maven -> Maven Project -> Maven Quickstart Archetype
2) Attached screenshot (Finish button enabled).
3) If I wish to change the project name in any way it keeps saying Project folder already exists... and the Finish
button is disabled (second screenshot).

short_description: Remote C building errors
long_description:
Hi

I've setup remote C development according to http://www.netbeans.org/kb/docs/cnd/remotedev-tutorial.html. I've set the
path mappings as requested but actually building gives me :

BUILD FAILED (exit value -1 total time: 192ms)

Building on the remote machine works. Is there a way to see what the actual commands and output are ?

short_description: Implements annotation not displayed on NbBundle.PBundle.getKeys
long_description:
Running 040902 on 1.5.0 b63 only default platform
registered. Have NbBundle.java open. In nested
class PBundle (extends ResourceBundle)
handleGetObject correctly shows an implements
annotation and getLocale correctly shows an
overrides annotation. However getKeys shows no
annotation though it implements the abstract
method in ResourceBundle.

Perhaps because the ResourceBundle method is
declared as returning Enumeration whereas
in NbBundle.java (1.4 source) it just returns
Enumeration?

short_description: No pretty string values on elif (Solaris)

short_description: Code completion suggestion with Spring Core & JSF 2.0
long_description:
Created attachment 92788
Web-Configuration-files

Hi

the problem comes up in a web-project with Spring Core (3.0) & Java Server Faces (2.0). I use Spring Core as the bean-factory. That means all JSF-ManagedBeans are provided by the Spring-Application-Context. The related faces-config.xml has only one entry:

org.springframework.web.jsf.el.SpringBeanFacesELResolver

There are also no JSF-Annotations like @ManagedBean in my Java Classes
The Application runs well.

I am missing the ability to have code completion suggestions when pressing Ctrl-Space in the XHTML-Editor. The XHTML-Editor is showing me all my (JSF-) ManagedBeans (which i have none in my project) but isn't able to show me the beans of my SpringBean-ApplicationContext.

There is a workaround to this behaviour so far: I can use the @ManagedBean Annotation on all the SpringBeans which are used in the xhtml-files. Then the Editor will show me the beans as code completion suggestions on pressing CTRL-Space.

long_description:

files. Hence change the file name from Hibernate Reverse Engineering to Generate POJOs and Mappings from DB.

short_description: only works id dest dir when .class and .java are in diffrent files
long_description:
When a user project has a build environment that
compiles all of the .class files to a directory
other than the source directory of the java files
the Metrics module will not gather metrics fro the
source directory.  The metrics can be gathered
from the build classes directory.  This presents
a probelm to users wheren that build dir is
transient and is not addable to source control and
the user wants to approve metrics.  Also it is
counter intuative in this set up since the metrics
are cognativly associated with the source not the
classes.

Perhaps the search for the class files could first
search for class files in just the source mount
and then if there are classes in the source tree
with source and no class file then mounts marked
as execution are aearched for the class files.

short_description: SecurityException in InstanceSupport
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) mount kawt_midp.zip (http://www.trantor.de/kawt/)
2) browse java.* package (or CompileAll on java package)
3) see an exception

Reason:
ClassDataObject uses InstanceSupport but there is a special hack in 
java.lang.ClassLoader which prevents InstanceSupport
from working with J2ME classes. ClassLoader throws a SecurityException if
someone tries to load classes from packages java.* (all subpackages of java) 
the exception is propagated to ClassDataObject (I'm not sure if JavaDataObject 
has the same problem too) and there is not handled. Public API of J2ME (CLDC) is 
subset of J2SE but it also contains private (package private) classes which are 
not part of J2SE (null classloader) but must be loaded from filesystem 
(NbClassLoader) and it causes the exception.

Possible solution:
1) add check for SecurityException into InstanceSupport.findClass and if it has 
been caused by a class from java. change it to ClassNotFoundException.
2) handle SecurityException in all classes that use InstanceSupport. In such a 
case it should be documented in InstanceCookie.

it is not possible to fix NbClassLoader because ClassLoader.defineClass which 
causes the exception is final :(((

short_description: DataShadows should translate the original URL for b/w compatibility
long_description:
Discovered while working on defect # : keymaps store the shortcuts as DataShadows pointing to actions triggered by the keystroke. However if the action .instance file moves/renames (e.g. WhereUsed during 7.1 release) the shortcuts become broken.

Specifically broken DataShadows that point on SFS (layer) is a more general case than just shortcuts so I think some translation mechanism could be used to translate moved paths.

Current Utilities.translate() is capable of such function except its Javadoc claims it can be only used to translate classnames. 

Attaching a patch to DataShadow + javadoc clarification in Utilities for review.

short_description: Inconveniences when working with multiple specializations
long_description:
Now the only way to get the list of template specializations is via annotations.
It's OK if there are 2 3 or several specializations.
But some templates (e.g. ProgramStateTrait in clang) have 30-40 specialisations or even more.

If I need to review or change these using annotations is very inconvenient.
So I now have to use grep with regexps instead of code model.

There should be support either in Find Usages or in Class Hierarchy.

I think the easiest way which won't change UI and l10n is via Class Hierarchy.

If a class is template and has specialisations Class Hierarchy should show them in its tree (with a T green icon like in the list that is available from annotations)

short_description: Searchable (by parameter) code completion
long_description:
Filing this on behalf of my friend Jon Locke.  The haiku like phrasing is because it's copied and pasted 
from an IM session :-)

The idea is quite good - this would be a good help to learning APIs - the main issue would be keyboard 
navigation and how to make it intuitive and obvious what you can do.

my cool features idea...
it's small in a way but has really big impact on how people use apis
when you type control - space
you get a completion thing going
you should be able to search that completion space
it's really hard to find methods in some of these gargantuan java classes
you know exactly what the parameter ought to be
or some /part/ of the name
or some other bit of information
but whether it's called getBounds or bounds or Rectangle getIt() you don't know
so you type
control - space
and the gui pops up a little completion box which explains that you can search
then you type bounds rectangle
and you get the anded search of the matches
wow
this would be huge for figuring out apis
it's so dynamic
and the alternative is to stop what you are doing
and go search a bunch of documentation or source code
make sense?
you can start the search with ?
so control - space works as before
but if you push ?
you can start searching the matches
in some java classes there may be 100 methods 
in the whole hierarchy of available methods
jesus
component subclasses must have 300 methods 
by the time you get down to a JLabel
or JPanel

short_description: Login Configuration dialog works improperly with FORM auth method
long_description:
Bug exists in FFJ Build 020206.

If either Form Login Page or Form Error Page textfields are
left blank then OK button becomes disabled after pressing and
Login Configuration dialog remains on screen. Expected behaviour
is to show Error dialog informing user that these fields
can not be left blank for proper work of FORM authentication method.

How to reproduce the bug:

1. Mount web module
2. Select WEB-INF/web.xml file node
3. In properties window select Security tab
4. Click on  button in Login Configuration property
5. Select FORM Authentication Method in the Login Configuration dialog
   leave Form Login Page or Form Error Page textfields blank and
   press  button. Notice that  button becomes disabled and
   Login Configuration dialog isn't closed.

value(PropertyEnv)->support(VetoableChangeSupport)->listeners(Vector)->elementData(Object[])->PropertyPanel$1->this$0(PropertyPanel)->editor(*Editor)=key

of components in the IDE.

short_description: Long high CPU usage on git projects with many images in ignored folders
long_description:
Created attachment 136344
nps snapshot

When I open a git project that contains many images (binary files) then Netbeans eats up a lot of CPU for a very long time (many minutes). It doesn't help that I keep those images in ignored folders - both in project settings and in .gitignore. Usually these are images that are part of a web site's database like pictures of products - they are not in git repo for obvious reasons (they are ignored) but are there in project folders so that the web application works well on my localhost.

Symptoms:

1. Just after opening a project the CPU usage goes up to >50% on my dual core machine and stays like that even if I don't do anything and even if I close the project. The only way to stop it is to close Netbeans or wait many minutes. For example if there are 4 folders with 26803 jpg images all taking 459 MB then Netbeans stops consuming CPU after about 9 minutes. If I move away the image folders from the project then CPU usage goes down to zero within a few seconds after opening the project.

2. During the high CPU load the files that are changed are not highlighted in blue colour on the tabs and in the file tree panel.

3. During the high CPU load I don't notice any excessive disk activity. I don't know if Netbeans is reading all the images or not but if it is then it must be doing it pretty slowly.

4. When I profile the IDE during the high CPU load I notice a GitRefresh method that seems to operate all the time. Also when I choose Git -> Show Changes -> Refresh Statuses the operation locks up. I've attached profile snapshot in this report.


I have found the following actions stop the CPU problem from occuring:

1. Disabling the Git plugin.

2. Moving the large image folders away from the project folder.

This problem makes using Netbeans painful for projects that need many binary files in them which is often the case with online shops online image databases etc.

The correct behaviour of Netbeans (or the Git plugin) should be to really ignore the files and folders which are ignored but currently this is not the case. Ignored files and folders should have no effect on the time Netbeans/Git scans the project. Ideally both .gitignore and project's ignored folders should be respected but if at least only one of them is respected then this would be really beneficial.

BTW this problem does not occur in svn projects.

short_description: Variable does not seem to be used in scope sometimes marks phpdoc comments
long_description:
Created attachment 110842
Shreenshot of a phpdoc line marked with a hint

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201109170600)
Java: 1.6.0_26 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 20.1-b02
System: Linux version 3.0.0-1-686-pae running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb)
User directory: /home/paolo/.netbeans/dev
Cache directory: /run/netbeans

After installing the latest night build I now Variable does not seem to be used in scope hints are enabled by default.

I find it useful but I noticed that sometimes phpdocs comment lines are also marked.

In example in the following code the line containing @global array $cglngttbl is marked with the hint while the actual code line in the function (global $cglngttbl) is not:

/**
 * Translate string in user's language
 * @global array $cglngttbl
 * @param string $t 
 * String to translate.
 * 
 * @return string 
 * Translated string.
 * 
 */
function cgtr($t)	{
	global $cglngttbl
	return (isset($cglngttbl[$t])) ? $cglngttbl[$t] : $t
}

I attach a screenshot of the defect.

Regards

Paolo.

short_description: error in help files Deleting a File in a Project
long_description:
When you add a file or a directories to the Project tab it appears as a link. 
You can delete
the link on the Project tab without affecting the actual file or directory. 
When you delete a
file or directory from the Filesystems tab the file is deleted from you system.

To remove a file or package from the Project tab:
====error next line: should read Click the Project tab...====
Click the Filesystems tab in the Explorer.
============================================
Right-click the node of the linked file or directory and choose Delete from 
the contextual
menu.

To permanently delete the file or package:
Click the Filesystems tab of the Explorer:
Right-click the node of the file or directory and choose Delete from the 
contextual menu.
