short_description: Incorrect CSS formatting
long_description:
The appearance of CSS comments can cause CSS formatting work incorrectly

Original
========

html ul.topnav li ul.subnav li a:hover { /*--Hover effect for subnav links--*/
	background: #222 url(dropdown_linkbg.gif) no-repeat 10px center 
}


After reformatted
=================

html ul.topnav li ul.subnav li a:hover { /*--Hover effect for subnav links--*/
                                         background: #222 url(dropdown_linkbg.gif) no-repeat 10px center 
}

As you can see the first column of the CSS declaration block is aligned equally with the first line of the comment which is not correct.

short_description: MultiFileSystem.setDelegates not clever about null delegates
long_description:
[observed release31 Dec 7 '00 but not triggered by existing code that I know of]

I have never fully understood the purpose of null delegates in MultiFileSystem
(does not seem to do anything useful) but anyway here is a bug caused by them:

Create a new MultiFileSystem using the protected no-arg constructor from a
subclass. This effectively sets the delegates to new FileSystem[] {null} (for
whatever reason). If you then call setDelegates(new FileSystem[] {someFS}) it
throws a NPE while removing old delegates because it iterates over the
delegates and does not check for null.

short_description: In JavaFX Platform manager Javadoc field doesn't remember location
long_description:
When I'm changing the location of the JavaFX runtime I specify first the SDK directory. As all the RT and Docs are both subdirs with known locations it's annoying that I have to fill those in IDE should pre-fill them. But most annoying is that while the file chooser for the RT remembers the dir I specified in the SDK above and starts me there the Javadoc file chooser starts me back at my computer's %HOME%.

If possible prefill the the RT and Docs but if not at least make Docs remember the location of the SDK dir when opening the file chooser.

short_description: Provide more information for class loading errors from palette items
long_description:
Description:
1. start IDE with jdk 1.5
2. create project with JPanel and JFrame.
3. Insert some swing in JPanel and compile project
4. Set jdk 1.6 platform in IDE
5. Change project from 1.5 to 1.6 jdk and compile the project
6. Through palette manager (add from project) add JPanel into Pallete
7. open JFrame from this project and try to insert JPanel from Pallete into it
Then a message occures but it's not clear and user doesn't know what's the
problem and what is the reason of no possibility to add this java bean in JFrame.

Now IDE announce:
Annotation: Cannot load component class nn.testicek from project:
E:\testing_NB\integration\JavaApplication3.
The class must be compiled and must be on the classpath of the project this form
belongs to.

this package.

New File/Folder
and selected Classes->Class. On the next panel of
the wizard
I specified com.sun.joe as the package and
MyClass as the class
name. I selected Finish and the java class was
created (note
this took a LONG time.. about 1 minute).

File/Folder from
the menu. I selected Classes->Class selected
Next and on the
next panel I specified the class name as AClass
and the package
as com.sun. The class was created but the
resulting display
under the Packages node is a little odd. I've
attached a gif of
what it looks like.

short_description: Make popup menu over tabs in Refactor window consistent with Window System menus
long_description:
[nb40_beta2](200409160517)

It will be more consistent with WS menus if you use :
*Close Other Tabs* instead of *Close All Tabs But
Active*

The popup menu over the tabs in the Refactor
window contains items:
Close Tab
Close All Tabs
Close All Tabs But Active

If you invoke popupmenu over the Document tab
(Editor) :
Close Window
Close All Documents
Close Other Documents

short_description: Option to disable JPQL Parsing in NamedQueries(jpa hints enable/disable option)
long_description:
JPQL code in Java files is quoted as string attributes within NamedQuery annotations.

This limits useful formatting of larger statements. A common workaround is to concatenate as follows:

@NamedQuery(name= CustomerOrder.GET_ALL query=
select\n +
        object(c)\n +
from CustomerOrder c\n
    )
	
Apparently JPQL parsing and code completion does not work here.

Support of this might come in the future but it will be at a cost (bugs CPU load) that some users are not necessarily happy to pay. In other words it is possible that multiple disadvantages outweigh potential or non-existing benefits depending on the use case.

Therefore it would be useful to disable JPQL parsing in the Tools Options dialog
or with a configuration parameter.

I sended a mail to tom ball and here is his reply
-------------------------------------------------

Hi Vincent

I am sorry that you are running into trouble.  There have been and will
continue to be many changes to jackpot's core in order to merge it into
NetBeans 6.0.  Many of these changes went into the 5.5 modules so the two bases
weren't too different.  My assumption is that I broke the rule parser in some
way and your rules are demonstrating the failure.  Your rules appear to be fine.  
-------------------------------------------------

solved in NB6.

short_description: Changing editor indentation doesn't affect BaseOptions
long_description:
I discovered that changing indentation (specifically the number of spaces per tab) doesn't affect indentation in Ruby files.

Indentation in Ruby files does NOT use the old indentation engine APIs (it's using the new indentation api). The indentation task was looking up the 
current indentation size (spaces per tab) by looking up spaces-per-tab on the BaseOptions of the Ruby editor kit.

The bug is that the BaseOptions setting does not get updated when you use the options dialog - ONLY the corresponding IndentationEngine settings are 
updated. Is this intentional? If so shouldn't at a minimum the getSpacesPerTab method get deprecated and/or delegate to the indentation engine?

Here's the relevant code in the options dialog's IndentationModel code.

The old code hardcoded the setTabSize case:

                if (parameterName.equals(setTabSize)) { //NOI18N
                    baseOptions.setTabSize((Integer)parameterValue)

A simple fix for this issue is to do the same thing for the other two indentation settings:

                } else if (parameterName.equals(setSpacesPerTab)) { //NOI18N
                    baseOptions.setSpacesPerTab((Integer)parameterValue)
                } else if (parameterName.equals(setExpandTabs)) { //NOI18N
                    baseOptions.setExpandTabs((Boolean)parameterValue)
                }

Of course you probably want to ALSO set the indentation engine values in this case so the whole code change would be:

Index: editor/options/src/org/netbeans/modules/options/indentation/IndentationModel.java
===================================================================
RCS file: /cvs/editor/options/src/org/netbeans/modules/options/indentation/IndentationModel.javav
retrieving revision 1.10
diff -u -u -r1.10 IndentationModel.java
--- editor/options/src/org/netbeans/modules/options/indentation/IndentationModel.java   18 Jul 2007 17:26:10 -0000      1.10
+++ editor/options/src/org/netbeans/modules/options/indentation/IndentationModel.java   3 Aug 2007 16:23:33 -0000
@@ -21813 +21821 @@
                 
                 if (parameterName.equals(setTabSize)) { //NOI18N
                     baseOptions.setTabSize((Integer)parameterValue)
-                } else {
-                    Method method = indentEngine.getClass ().getMethod (
-                        parameterName
-                        new Class [] {parameterType}
-                    )
-                    method.invoke (indentEngine new Object [] {parameterValue})
+                    continue
                 }
+                
+                if (parameterName.equals(setSpacesPerTab)) { //NOI18N
+                    baseOptions.setSpacesPerTab((Integer)parameterValue)
+                    // Fall through to ALSO set indentation engine value
+                } else if (parameterName.equals(setExpandTabs)) { //NOI18N
+                    baseOptions.setExpandTabs((Boolean)parameterValue)
+                }
+
+                Method method = indentEngine.getClass ().getMethod (
+                    parameterName
+                    new Class [] {parameterType}
+                )
+                method.invoke (indentEngine new Object [] {parameterValue})
             } catch (Exception ex) {
             }
         }

short_description: CVS: Mounting uninitialized local CVS

1) Create empty lcvsclient and lcvsserver directories
2) Invoke Generic VCS mounting wizard
3) Select CVS profile
4) Set lcvsclient as working directory
5) Select local as server type
6) Set lcvsserver as repository path
7) Press Finish
8) See Output Window
9) ERROR - New ouput is opened with Refresh
command with message:

Please check the execution string:
org.netbeans.modules.vcs.profiles.cvsprofiles.list.CvsListCommand.class
LIST_STATUS_CMD LIST_LOG_CMD
cvs [status aborted]:
E:\sources\lcvsserver/CVSROOT: No such file or
directory

This looks really strange.

Please do not invoke CVS|Refresh command when
user is mounting non-initialized repository.

long_description:

Java: 1.6.0_17 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.3-b01
System: Linux version 2.6.31-15-generic running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb)

The code completion in the oql console query editor is a bit strange at least it is not consistent with code completion in the IDE editor.

For example after typing 'java.' and invoking code completion there are no suggestions until the first letter after the dot is written while the IDE editor suggests all subpackages of the 'java' package.

Also the IDE editor suggests packages(such as '.lang' or '.awt') while the oql query editor suggests complete class names ('.lang.String'). If a package contains(together with subpackages) about 1000 classes it is really problem to use the code completion.

short_description: There is missing super node in the Variables tab when the Inherited filter is off.
long_description:
Netbeans build 20010824
=======================

Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
1. Switch off the Inherited filter.
2. Start examples.advanced.MemoryView.
3. Force the debugger to stop on line 98.
4. Look at the Variables tab there will not be super node.

short_description: Canceling New Project/Group Wizard throws exceptions
long_description:
Number of NullPointerExceptions is thrown when
canceling New Project Wizard (of any type).

short_description: cannot set contentType to text/html for jTextPane
long_description:
In GUI mode the jTextPane properties will not allow the contentType to be set to
anything except text/plain. The work around is use the advanced properties to
set it using code: setContentType(text/html). This bug has been around since 5.0.

short_description: NullPointerException on pressing the '.' key in the editor
long_description:
In the java source editor after pressing the point (.) key in any statement
where the editor would normally show the possible entries I get a
NullPointerException.

short_description: XML actions should not generate java code in any non-java projects
long_description:
XML actions like Generate DOM scanner and SAX document handler wizard should be deactivated for non java projects (eg
BPEL projects). This will prevent java code generation in non-java projects.

I think this is incorrect NPB should either support spaces or have asserts to warn if they are unsupported.

short_description: Alllow to mark part of text as guarded
long_description:
Created attachment 158446
Proposed changes

The current Guarded Blocks API allows to create an empty guarded section and then fill it with text. This proposal adds API method to mark range of text as guarded and turn it into a GuardedSection.

short_description: Incorrect fix of String constructor invocation
long_description:
Consider the following code:

        String s1 = a
        String s2 = b
        String s3 = new String(s1+s2).intern()

String constructor invocation warning/hint is shown on the 3rd line. It offers you to 'Remove String constructor invocation'. When you invoke this action then the 3rd line is replaced by

        String s3 = s1 + s2.intern()

This is not correct it should be

        String s3 = (s1 + s2).intern()

The problem may be more explicit on a similar use-case:

        String s1 = a
        String s2 = b
        int length = new String(s1 + s2).length()

The 3rd line become

        int length = s1 + s2.length()

after the fix. Note that the code even is not compilable now.

short_description: ALL: Files found by Find... action have menu with all possible CVS actions.
long_description:
Development build #1160 on Windows 2000/NT Solaris 5.8 Red Hat Linux 6.2
(all JDK 1.3)

Description:
============
All files that were found to meet selected criteria under CVS filesystem and 
are displayed in Search Results dialog have wrong popup menu. There are in 
addition items available only for folders and root of the CVS filesystem except 
items appropriate for files.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount already existing CVS filesystem with at least one [Up-to-date] file.
2. Invoke Find... action from the root's popup menu of your CVS filesystem.
3. Switch to Status tab select Up-to-date Status Name and click on Search
4. Invoke popup menu of arbitrary [Up-to-date] file that has been found and
   check that there is also CVS/Init menu item available in it.

X Evaluation:
Menu items will be fixed in the Find dialog.

short_description: Must manually log in before marking issues fixed in Commit dialog
long_description:
100420 netbeans.vcshook.bugzilla.target_milestone=6.9 netbeans.bugtracking.noOpenProjects=true.

I have a connection NetBeans to https://netbeans.org/bugzilla as jglick defined in Issue Trackers. When in a fresh IDE session I go to commit some files I pick NetBeans (now the only choice) from the pulldown type in a bug number and select Search in the popup. After a few seconds I get an error dialog saying that I am not authenticated.

If I go to Services > Issue Trackers > NetBeans select Edit click Validate then close this dialog and try to commit again everything works.

Since my login information is persisted I should not need to manually log in every IDE session.

short_description: Dialogs appear off the screen
long_description:
When NetBeans is used on a display setup with a smaller screen resolution than the last time the program was run then 
the dialogs may appear off the screen. There is no way to get them back on the screen the dialog does not appear in 
the taskbar.

Steps to Repro:
First set things up in a high-resolution envrionment such as a multimonitor setup:
1. Plug in more than 1 monitor
2. Start NetBeans
3. Open a Java project
4. Right-click on the project and click on Project Properties
5. Drag the Project Properties window to the another monitor.

Now close NetBeans and unplug a screen. Reboot the computer if necessary.

Finally try to bring up the same dialog box.
1. Start NetBeans
2. Open a Java project
3. Right-click on the project and click on Project Properties

The dialog will not appear.

short_description: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException when changing order of browsers
long_description:
In the Options window if you right-click Web Browsers there is an 
action 'Change Order...'.  When you select this action and attempt to change 
the order of the browsers an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException is given (as 
indicated below).

There does not seem to be a reason that the user would want to change the order 
of the browsers so this action could be removed.  However if the action is to 
remain it should not give an exception.

short_description: Introduce a way to update filters selected state after creation
long_description:
Currently there is no way to change selected state of the filters after creation.
Sometimes it is required to change it later in enableFilters based on parameters user specified in find usages dialog.

see bug 230337 for more details

short_description: Files not shown as modified when using JavaHL SVN
long_description:
I have the Windows Subversion 1.5 Client plugin installed (a workaround for issue #152290).  When I edit a file
sometimes its editor tab and diff sidebar reflect the edit that it has been modified but its entry in the Projects
window does not.  (See attached screenshot.  Note that the filename is black not blue in the Projects window.)

There has also been an instance where the file was modified and both the Editor tab and Projects window reflected this
but the diff sidebar did not indicate the modifications (and they were much more than just whitespace changes).  I don't
have a screenshot for this but it probably wouldn't illustrate much anyway.

This behavior has only started since installing the Windows Subversion 1.5 Client plugin.

short_description: Sorting the result table by the first result column marks line numbering also as sort column
long_description:
When selecting the first column of a resultset as ordering column not only this column is marked as the sorting column (noted by the arrow) but also the line numbering column. This can be fixed by setting the corresponding model index for the line numbering column to an impossible value. Inserting 

col.setModelIndex(-1)

in line 93 of JXTableRowHeader.java does this

(I'll refrain from putting a one line patch into this bug :-).

short_description: Show scope for class function/variables definitions in navigator
long_description:
Function definitions with same signature have same display name.
Hence user cannot distinguish definitions in navigator.
More convenient for user if navigator will show full qualified names for member definitions.

Problem is occurred when user define a lot of subclasses in one file. It a common user pattern for small subclasses.

Same problem exists for definitions of name space members (but situation with two name space members with same signature
in one file is rare).

short_description: Ability for a feature to depend on another feature
long_description:
Autoupdate API supports definitions of features:
http://bits.netbeans.org/dev/javadoc/org-netbeans-modules-autoupdate-services/org/netbeans/spi/autoupdate/UpdateItem.html#createFeature(java.lang.String java.lang.String java.util.Set java.lang.String java.lang.String java.lang.String)
and ergonomics module reuses that heavily. Basically there is a single feature per cluster (lists all its AU visible modules).


The goal of the system is to always operate on cluster boundaries. A cluster (or at least all its AU visible modules) should either be turned on or off if manipulated by ergonomics.

This is hard to achieve in current system. Originally I tried to include all transitive closures into a single closure (e.g. JavaEE would contain its modules as well as all modules coming from JavaSE). This works OK when turning modules on but is heavily broken when disabling them (disabling JavaEE disables JavaSE too see bug 187678).

However without having the transitive closure we get bug 177202 - e.g. not all AU visible modules in clusters were enabled. It is hard to find balance between the enabled/disable scenario.

However there seems to be a good solution: allow features to have dependencies on other features. Thus the JavaEE feature would have dependency on the JavaSE feature and the system would know that it needs to enable whole (AU visible) modules in JavaSE but when disabling it would know that only modules from JavaEE feature (and potential features on top of it) need to be disabled (nothing from JavaSE).

Please allow dependencies between AU features.

short_description: Mnemonics collision in Tools menu (Add to Component Palette... vs. Generate R/W Property for Field)
long_description:
[Main trunk build #200107190100]

1. Start fresh build
2. In [Explorer] expand e.g. sampledir/examples/colorpicker/ColorPreview to view its fields and methods then set the focus to e.g. field 
propertyChangeSupport
3. Press Alt+t to go to Tools menu

-> There are two items using the same mnemonic key:
Generate R/W Property for Field
                     ^
Add to Component Palette...
                 ^

short_description: [perf] Deleting folder with files should be made faster
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:
- copy a new folder with 1000 java files into the
open project (in a external file manager)
- refresh the project in Files view
- expand the newly added folder w/ 1000 javas
- delete the folder w/ 1000 javas

Dell Precision 220 PIII 800MHz 512MB RAM
Windows 2000 JDK 1.4.2_04

trunk 200405131800: 6406ms 6375ms 6125ms
refactoring 040513: 15750ms 15031ms 15109ms

With the refactoring build the contents of the
folder is repainted as deleted in Files view after
approx. 6 seconds but an exception is raised (see
the attachment) and the delete action continues
for next 9 seconds and only then the folder's node
is deleted in the Files view. The whole delete
action thus takes 15 seconds.

short_description: Change FileStorage and JCFileProvider to allow reuse of Completion code
long_description:
I am reusing the editor Java completion code in my application which I am 
launching using Java Webstart. Because I'm using webstart all resources have 
to be in jars. FileStorage assumes that the completion databases are in Files
and JCFileProvider just creates the default FileStorage objects.

To allow me to reuse this code I have made the following modifications to 
JCFileProvider and FileStorage and then written my own subclass of FileStorage 
which reads from jar files under webstart. I'll attach a patch but the changes 
come down to:

1) Adding a constructor to JCFileProvider which takes two FileStorage objects 
and changing the previous constructor to use this constructor. This allows you 
to create your own custom subclasses of FileStorage and use them in a 
JCFileProvider.

2) Make bytes and checkBytesSize() protected in FileStorage. This allows 
subclasses to expand the bytes array and read into it appropriately.

Could these changes be incorporated into the main tree to stop me having to 
maintain a branch locally and to allow others to reuse 
FileStorage/JCFileProvider similarly.

short_description: Change names of stub types in web service client wizard

stub selection combobox in the New Web Service Client wizard should be:

For JSR-101 stubs:   IDE-generated static-stub

JSR-109 stub type should be the default type when the the target module is a
J2EE container.  (Note: Default is already handled correctly.  This bug is only
for a changing of display strings.)

This change ok'd by HIE (Jiri K.) Doc. (Geertjian)

short_description: add a wizard for simplified EJB timer
Transitive virtual sources broken
long_description:
Virtual source to document offsets translation is broken if one virtual source is generated from other virtual source.

Today I added EmbeddingProviders for PHP and RHTML generating HTML virtual source. There is also an EmbeddingProvider
creating CSS source from HTML source. So the intention is to have just one HTML->CSS and generate the HTML from the
templatings by special EPs.

However I realized that the offset translation between the original document and the CSS virtual source is broken. There
are some situation when it works but for most (if there is more than one embedding of HTML created by the templatings
EPs) it doesn't. 

Simple testcase is to open an empty PHP file and put following content into:
text


h1 {
  background:aqua
  color: red
  azimuth:center
}


=> You'll realize that the CSS code is colored incorrectly folds are shifted and if you for example invoke completion
at the very beginning of the css section you'll get some CCE caused by the incorrect translation.

Can you please look at this issue as soon as possible? It is quite important since it blocks me with fixing other bugs.

Just a note - sure there is a workaround - create a special EP for each combination of templating language and each
embedding lang like javascript does. But this isn't elegant solution at all.

short_description: Alt+Enter can't handle multiple annotations
long_description:
When a line has multiple annotations Alt+Enter only applies to the currently visible one.

Here is a very common case where this is particularly annoying: A Java method that overrides a method but doesn't have 
an @Override Java annotation has two gutter annotations: One to mark the override (green O in circle) and one 
warning/hint annotation Add @Override Annotation. The first one is on top so Alt+Enter cannot be used to apply the 
hint. Also there's no keyboard shortcut to cycle through annotations so one is forced to use the mouse.

Suggestions:

1. Have Alt+Enter list all hints of the line.

2. Provide a keyboard shortcut to cycle through annotations.
(I'll open a separate issue for this since it is generally useful).

3. Let hints have precedence over other non-error/warning annotations. This just fixes particular cases as the one 
described above though.

Found with build 2007-7161200.

short_description: Unable to send plug-in for verification
long_description:

short_description: Custom ANT target Postprocess hangs build (infinite loop)
long_description:
While executing target compile-preprocessed of the openide the build of 
Netbeans hangs. The code in Postprocess.replaceString(byte[] b) attempts to get 
the indexOf the string to replace however it always retrieves the same index 
and will never return -1 unless the string does not exist in the file. Hence 
causing an infinite loop during the build.

The attachment to this issue is the fixed file. I added a variable to mark the 
previous index of the search string and changed the search method to start 
from the after the previous find.

indexOf(oldString) -> indexOf(oldString pos)

short_description: Too many file handles open
long_description:
040719 and 040720. I have periodically gotten
IOException subclasses (from various code) saying
that I have too many open files. (Linux 1.5.0
b58) Looking in the Linux memory map for the java
process doesn't show any obviously incorrect open
mapped files I don't think this shows open file
handles used for streams (and I am not sure how to
trace those anyway).

At first I thought this might be a problem with
the newly integrated Ant 1.6.2 but I have also
gotten this in IDE sessions where I have not run
Ant at all so I am guessing that the problem
arose due to some unclosed streams used during
parsing or scanning. I have also observed OOMEs or
persistently full heap during routine Find Usages
calls which might be related.

short_description: Support for Interruption of Long Running RP.Tasks
long_description:
There shall be a way how to interrupt long running
tasks posted in the request processor.

The standard Java way for checking for
interruption in using Thread.interrupted() or
InterruptedException. I suggest to enhance
RP.Task.cancel() is when the task is running its
thread is sent to interrupted state and the task's
runnable can check the Thread.interrupted() value
and exit promptly.

short_description: Updates of invisible modules not offered in Plugin Manager
long_description:
It seems that available updates of modules which are not directly visible in Plugin Manager (only part of one or more
kits) are not offered to users. This is a serious problem as

1. Module publishers unaware of this fact may push updates to a module for a long time without realizing that no one is
seeing them (as I in fact have with autoproject.java).

2. Even if you are aware of the problem it is often the case that there is no single obvious kit module which is the
logical place to increment specification versions a module might be part of several kits. You could push changes to
all of these but even then it is not guaranteed that your update will be seen by all users - someone might be using a
third-party module depending on the impl module yet have none of the expected kits installed.

Auto Update should check all installed modules for updates and offer to install any updates it finds. How the update of
an impl module is presented in the UI is a secondary concern. I would suggest that if a module is to be updated which is
hidden and there is no module to be updated which is visible and which has a dependency on that module then just
display the normally hidden module as the update (possibly with some kind of annotation in the UI indicating that it
is an implementation module that will not be shown in the Installed list later).

To reproduce in a dev build:

1. Make a suite containing

impl 1.0
kit 1.0 > impl 1.0

and uncheck Show in Plugin Manager for impl.

2. Build NBMs

3. Run fresh copy of IDE. In PM disable existing UCs and add updates.xml from step #2.

4. Install kit.

5. Edit metadata of suite

impl 1.1 [new]
kit 1.0 > impl 1.0 [as before]

6. Create NBMs

7. Refresh in PM. No updates shown. [bug]

8. Edit metadata

impl 1.1 [as before]
kit 1.1 > impl 1.1 [new]

9. Create NBMs

10. Refresh in PM. kit shown as an update. Install and impl 1.1 and kit 1.1 appear in module list after restart.

short_description: new jax-ws web service client damages earlier web service from wsdl
long_description:
Created attachment 129634
snapshot copies of the projec at each step and console ouput from wizards

new jax-ws web service client damages earlier web service from wsdl

I am pretty sure this is a bug but if I am doing something wrong or if there is a workaround please let me know. I have not found any previous report in the open bugs list.

For teaching web services programming I have a web service (delegatedAddService) that is also acts a client of another web service (add3service). This was easy to create in NetBeans 6.9.1 but in NetBeans 7.2.1 when I add the reference to the add3service that wizard destroys code generated to support delegatedAddService.

It looks as if the wizard for new >> Web Service Client is overwriting the work done previously by the wizard for new >> Web Service from WSDL. 

The steps are as follows. Snapshots of the complete project and of console output are attached.

(1) Create a new NetBeans web application project (prodcom1). Do clean and build.

(2) Right mouse on the project and do new >> web service from wsdl. Use the wsdl for the delegatedAddService. The wizard runs successfully.

(3) Do clean and build. Ant runs successfully with the console output given in file output1_4.txt. A snapshot of the whole project at this point is in snap1_4. Note that generated sources have been created to support the delegatedAddService in folder build/generated-sources/jax-ws/org/example/add3service (which is derived from the target namespace given in the wsdl)

(4) Right mouse on the project and do new >> web service client. In the wizard point to a wsdl for an add3service. The wizard runs and reports success console output is in output1_5.txt. A snapshot of the complete project is in snap1_5.

When I compare these two snapshots I note that in nbproject/jax-ws.xml and nbproject/jaxws-build.xml all mention of the delegatedAddService has vanished and instead I have only references to the add3service.

(5) Do clean and build. Ant runs and reports success console output is in output1_6.txt. A snapshot of the complete project is in snap1_6.

The generated sources for delegatedAdd formerly under build/generated-sources/jax-ws/org have vanished. All the generated sources seem to be for the add3service. Obviously the war file does not deploy correctly because of missing class files.

I am using:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE 7.2.1 (Build 201210100934)
Java: 1.6.0_21 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 17.0-b17
System: Windows 7 version 6.1 running on x86 Cp1252 en_US (nb)

short_description: CSS engine might not be needed over the source document
long_description:
I assume that the CSS parsing should occur only over the rendered document not
the source document. If this assumption is correct then we could improve
performance by avoiding creation of CSS engine for both source and rendered
documents and have only with the CSS engine over the rendered document.

See attachment for the starting patch.

Note: This requires possibly larger change and also larger amount of testing.

and coming back displays the correct (original) value.

short_description: Create Tests for a package generates tests for subpackages too
long_description:
When the IDE is commanded to create tests for the
selected package it creates tests also for the
package's subpackages.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a subpackage of some package.
2. Create some testable Java source file in both
   the package and its subpackage.
3. Right-click on the package node and select
   action Tools > JUnit Tests > Create Tests.

The test are generated not only for the classes
from the package but also for classes contained in
its subpackages.

short_description: JavaEditor does not support marking an existing portion of code as guarded.
long_description:
A module can't protect a particular method from user editing operations because
the JavaEditor class does not publish functions for creating a new guarded
blocks over an existing text.
Guarded blocks may be created using OpenAPIs but those are not saved along with
the source.

short_description: Dependent JavaFX Application project gets rebuild each run and very often fails to do so because NetBeans holds the jar file
long_description:
If you put one JavaFX Application project (A1) in Libraries section of another JavaFX Application project (A2) you can notice:
1. Each time you run A2 A1 gets re-built.
2. Very often it fails to be built because its dist/A1.jar file can't be deleted. Probably because NetBeans is holding it.

This is really annoying as it fails application run very often but also increases the time to build/run the app.

perhaps additional lists for JSP and HTML could be added.

short_description: PropertyChangeListener should be a subset of ComponentListener
long_description:
This issue was found off the back of #99325.

When a component is removed from the XML model sometimes ComponentListener is notified while PropertyChangeListener is
not.  According to the document PropertyChangeListener offers a deeper level of granularity than (or superset of)
ComponentListener.  It does not state that it is a different set or even a subset of ChangeListener.

This causes problems in the syncing of FacesConfig.xml and PageFlowEditor.  I can fix MY issue caused by this dependency
and listen also to ComponentListener but if you fix this issue I will need to be notified as it will cause a regression
in my code.

Here are specifics from Petr:
If there is deleted a component (like NavigationRule or NavigationCase) then the PropertyChangeEvent and ComponentEvent
are fired. If there is a property of component deleted (like ToViewID or FromOutcome) only ComponentEvent is fired. The
ComponentEvent is VALUE_CHANGED.

short_description: PhpDoc - setting target directory inconsistency
long_description:
If I run the PhpDoc action (from a php project context action) and I set a target directory for my documentation it's stored. It's ok. But if I try to remove the stored path (because I want to re-display that selection dialog after invoking the action) I go to the project properties -> PhpDoc. There I remove that stored path notification at the bottom says me that I will be asked for a directory before next generating. I confirm that try to re-generate new documentation but without any dialog. My deleted stored path remained stored.

So there are two solutions:
- that it should not be stored
- or the notification message from project properties window should be different

I think that we should fix it by enabling an empty path (I can fix that).

short_description: Need to bullet proof TRS sample for correlation collision
long_description:
See bug 84900 and bug 84701. 

Both of those bugs are about potential test run problems. While investigating
thos bugs I realized that TRS is too fragile in area of hard coded assumptions
about correlation id matching.

I am creating this bug to address those weaknesses.

There are two different cases where TRS may fail and/or go into an infinte wait
state because of some disconnect with partner services.

1) Partner services are not reachable (i.e. partners are not deployed or offline)

2) Partner services are available but callbacks are not working as designed 


For case 1 you are correct if partners are not available the timeout logic is
not applicable. But in such case I don't think we should have to do anything
new. The process should just run to completion with failures. Yes?  I don't
think anything should hang even with our current implementation of TRS? Yes?
Please confirm. So for this case I think we do not need anything new. However
it does raise qustion concerning this original bug description which does not
make sense to me.


For case 2 callbacks are not working as designed. This is what we need the
timoeout logic to handle. Process will wait indefinitely on a receive activity
 if the callbacks are not working. This is because the process will start. the
process will call the partner service. The partner service will handle the
process's invoke. Then the process will wait for callback. If callback does not
arrive then the process will wait forever or until SE is restarted.

Callbacks can fail for two very common reasons. 

First the JEE app may be deployed but there may be problem with the JMS
resoruces and therefore the MDB may not be available to perform the callback.
That is one case. Hopefully this case is rare.

Second the JEE app may be deployed fine the JMS may be set up fine. Everything
may be fine but there is yet another weakness. This is correlation related
weakness. 

This is related to bug 84900.

The test runs for TRS send in input msg with content based correlator embedded
in message. 


	
		
						
				M839LW
			


This same M839LW is ASSUMED by the callback clients. So the
problem is very very easy to trigger. All you need to do is hack the input.xml
for TRS test cases change the value from M839LW to
HACK.  Then peform a test run. The process will effectively
hang becuase it is waiting for a callback that will never arrive. The callback
actually came but since the Partner EJB services are hard coded to send back
M839LW the SE will just drop the callback on the floor as
it should. 

This is a very vary bad state to get into for user. The problem is that now we
have one process instance waiting for a callback that will never come. If user
launches new test runs which use the same value for the UniqueID element those
test runs will fail immediately because the correlation id is in use already.
Basically the only way out is to restart the SE.

The fix for this should be two fold. First we should add the timeout logig to
the TRS process to be defensive.

Second we should modify the callback MDB to echo the value that comes in the
M839LW of the input message rather than relying on our
current assumption that it will always be M839LW. This means putting a token in
the callback message templates like %TOKEN% and
substitutiong a real time value for the %TOKEN%. 

If we do both of those things I think we can make TRS bulletproof from process
instance hangs. 

Also if we do this if we have dynamic echoing of correlation id from the EJB
partners then we can actually do one other thing to improve experience. We can
change the value of M839LW in the 4 test cases so that each
test case uses a differnt M839LW value. That way user can
actually debug > 1 test run (provided they are different test cases) at the same
time. Today even with the fixes suggested above the user would not be able to
do that because all test runs would submit the same M839LW
value and only one would be allowed to execute. However if the 4 cases use
different values in their input.xml then we can show very cool debugging of >
instance at a time. For instane user can debug HasHotel at same time as
HasVehicle etc.

short_description: GlassFish runtime error when accessing db using jdbc - missing driver
long_description:
I made this a P1 because it affects documentation and if I need to document a work around I need to do it this week. If
this won't be fixed for 6.5 please provide a work around so I can document it.

Basically if I create a Ruby on Rails project using a Posgtres database and I use the JDBC option I get this error if
I run on GlassFish (I do not get the error if I run on WEBrick):

The driver encountered an error: cannot load Java class org.postgresql.Driver

Steps to Reproduce:

Create a postgres database.

Using the Services window create a connection to to the Postgres database server.

Create a new Ruby on Rails Project

Choose bundled JRuby for the interpreter

Choose GlassFish V3 for the server

Click Next

Select Specify Database Information Directly

Select postgresql for the database adapter

Enter the database name username and password

Select Access Database Using JDBC

Click Finish

Open Project Properties. Click Java. See that it added the postgresql driver postgresql-8.3-603.jdbc3.jar

Right-click the project node and choose Generate. In the dialog box choose scaffold.

Type Book for the Model Name

Type title:string for the Attribute Pairs

Click OK

Right-click the project node and choose Migrate Database > To Current Version

Right-click the project node and choose Run. The Welcome page appears.

To save time we won't bother with the routes.rb setting and deleting the index.html file

Add books to the end of the URL like this

http://localhost:8080/RailsApplication4/books

press Enter

You get this error message:

The driver encountered an error: cannot load Java class org.postgresql.Driver


to see how it is supposed to work....

Shut the GlassFish Server

Open the Project Properties dialog box and switch to WEBrick (change the port to 3000)

Run the application.

Add books to the end of the URL like this

http://localhost:3000/books

It works no errors.

short_description: CVS output should be monospaced
long_description:
Currently CVS output e.g. the Standard Output tab
after doing a textual diff shows up in
proportional font. This looks strange and makes it
difficult to read diffs esp. unidiffs which
often depend for their readability on fixed font
spacing. It also makes the diff text look
different from the program text in the editor
which is undesirable.

short_description: Show Endpoint Statistics is not working for Scheduler BC
long_description:
JBI Manager currently uses custom extension APIs that a component may choose to support at its convenience.

For example most older BCs developed in-house (Http BC File BC JMS BC etc.) support these extensions even today. The
SEs however do not. It all depends on whether the component uses componentsl or the newer commonutil library.

See https://open-esb.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=1535

short_description: Indnetation engine must actively remove space(s) before parenthesis if Insert space before parenthesis is set to false
long_description:
> 	One of the indentation options is insert spaces before 
> paranthesis.. My issue 
> with it is: when enabled it will add spaces before all 
> paranthesis but when disabled it 
> will not move them back so I have to manually undo all those 
> annoying spaces :)
> 
> 	I'd like it to remove all spaces before paranthesis 
> unless of course they are 
> found in some sort of mathematical equation.

short_description: ActionMap is cached in BasicTextUI
long_description:
ActionMap of Editor JTextComponent is cached. By
default first open editor is JavaEditor (from
EditorWarmUpTask....). Actions of JavaKit are
created and put into ActionMap. 

Problem is that this ActionMap is cached. So if
you open i.e. XML Editor and retireves ActionMap
from its JTextComponent you get ActionMap of
JavaEditor...

The problem is not caused originally by Netbeans.
It is JDK issue. I have entered the bug in
bugparade. I will add a link if the issue will be
visible in the bugparade site.

Should be fixed by workaround.

short_description: Maximized state of frame not remembered after closing window
long_description:
[release32 apr 7] [MDI] Open a source file--the Source Editor window
takes up all of the free area but is not maximized. Maximize it.
Close the window. Open a file again--it will again not be maximized.
The maximization state should be remembered as part of the mode.

Making P3 (vs. P4) not because it is really important--only because it is easily

short_description: The implementation dependencies removal from java.hints.analyzer
long_description:
The module org.netbeans.modules.java.hints.analyzer declares implementation dependency on
org.netbeans.modules.java.hints and org.netbeans.spi.editor.hints. Since the property AutoUpdate-Show-In-Client also is
set to true for the module java.hints.analyzer it is hard to deliver java.hints.analyzer bugfixes via AUC whose code
changes are in org.netbeans.modules.java.hints or org.netbeans.spi.editor.hints. It could be mission impossible in
some cases.

Could implementation dependencies be removed (for example through friend packages)?

short_description: Cut and paste issue with Matisse and JTabbedpane
long_description:
Pasting a cutting and pasting a panel to a newly created JTabbed pane results in
the panel being hidden.

Create a new swing JFrame form
Create a JPanel and place some controls on it
Create a JTabbedPane large enough to hold the JPanel from the previous step.
Click on the JPanel in the form right click and select cut
Click the JTapped pane then right click and select paste.

Rather than creating a new tab in the JTabbed pane the JPanel will seem to
disappear.

This problem WILL NOT happen with JTabbedPanes that already contain tabs.

short_description: @Named on a class with two uppercase letters resolved to a wrong el expression in jsf editor
long_description:
On a class like this:

@Named
public class ICtest

The code completion in netbeans jsf editor view will show you

#{iCtest}

but it has to be

#{ICtest}

upper case IC

why:

...to support the occasional use of all upper-case names we check if the first two characters of the name are both upper case and if so leave it alone. So for example “FooBah” becomes “fooBah” “Z” becomes “z” “URL” becomes “URL” We provide a method Introspector.decapitalize which implements this conversion rule.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/19414709/cant-find-named-cdi-bean-with-default-name-in-el-facelet

short_description: Testability features provided by Progress Indication
long_description:
Progress Indication should provide either some hooks or at least log messages
for various events. This would be used by performance tests to get

* a list of running tasks
* a start time and an end time of a task
* initial delay of a task

A task could be identified by its name and also by a hashCode (e.g. hashCode of
the task's ProgressHandle) to distiguish between two concurrently running tasks
of the same name.

short_description: On Windows  backslash is an invalid delimiter in the package field in new from template wizard for Folders and Packages
long_description:
On Windows platforms in the New from Template
for Folders or Packages (File->New->Folder or
File->New->Package) backslashes are not valid
delimiters in the package field.  The Wizard
accepts forward slashes and should also accept
back slashes on Windows.

For example the wizard won't accept nameA\nameB
in the package field.  The error message is
Cannot create folder nameA\nameB is not a valid
name..  

The wizard will accept nameA/nameB because it
contains a forward slash.  The wizard creates the
2 folders correctly.

The wizard should accept nameA\nameB containing
a backslash for the package on Windows.  It should
treat the backslash as a delimiter like it does
the forward slash.

long_description:
Development build #200201040331 of NetBeans 3.3.1 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.4b90

Description:
============
This bug is potential settings lost. If user proceeds editing procedure of
certain connection and does not change anything the corresponding entry from
.cvspass file is deleted. Although I know this kind of workflow is unusual this
is quite strange behaviour and should be fixed as soon as possible.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Choose Versioning|CVS Connection Manager ... item of the main menu.
2. Select some CVS connection and click Edit button.
3. Do not change anything and push OK button.

short_description: Inconsistent activation/deactivation of Apply button from Editor->Code Completion->JavaScript options panel
Correct multiple resultsets
long_description:
Created attachment 135120
proposed patch v1

There is an outfall from the rework of the resultset fetching (SQLExecutionHelper.java). There are two issues fixed by the attached patch.


- I tested with informix and it bailed out because getUpdateCount was called twice. The language in http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/sql/Statement.html#getUpdateCount%28%29 was interpreted by IBM as 'getUpdateCount must not be called more than once'. The change reworks the fetching order to follow the advice given in http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/sql/Statement.html#getMoreResults%28%29

- testing derby I implemented a most simple stored procedure:

public class Test {
    public static void selectRows(ResultSet[] data1 ResultSet[] data2) throws SQLException {
        Connection conn = DriverManager.getConnection(jdbc:default:connection)
        PreparedStatement ps1 = conn.prepareStatement(select * from t1)
        data1[0] = ps1.executeQuery()

        PreparedStatement ps2 = conn.prepareStatement(select * from t2)
        data2[0] = ps2.executeQuery()

        conn.close()
    }
}

and called it ... well it failed - derby does not like the combination of asking for a scrollable cursor and the nested resultsets.

I moved the logic for determining whether scrollable resultsets are supported into the method updateScrollableSupport and there I check for the driver and the statement type.

short_description: Change of Java platform changes only javac.source not javac.target - cannot compile
long_description:
Build 200501241900 JDK1.5.0 and JDK1.4.2.

1. Start IDE with a clean userdir on JDK1.5.0.
2. Create a new J2SE project (it gets the default
JDK1.5.0 platform).
3. Open this project properties and change the
java platform to a (newly created) JDK1.4.2 platform.
4. Try to compile the project:
the javac fails with javac: invalid target
release: 1.5

Investigation in
${PROJECT}/nbproject/project.proeprties shows that
javac.source was changed to 1.4 but javac.target
is left as ${default.javac.target} (which is
probably set to 1.5 as the default platform is
1.5) and therefore it is not possible to compile
the project.

short_description: xml.tools module needs to be moved from ide cluster to xml cluster
long_description:
Currently the xml.tools module is part of nb.cluster.ide and this is build before any java modules are build. 

The fix for bug 90174 requires using retouche.
http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=90174

The code for this fix will go into xml.tools module and will require dependencies on the following java modules:
Java Source
Java Source API
Javac API wrapper

As a result after the fix the nb.cluster.ide will not compile since the java modules have not been build. The xml.tools
module needs to be moved to nb.cluster.xml for #90174 to be fixed

short_description: Cannot immediately edit SOAP location
long_description:
To edit SOAP location property:

1) Right click Add WSDL Port
2) Open the port properties choose the interface close the properties
3) Open the port properties again the location field is finally there and can be changed.

The necessity of the second step is quite unclear. Well not all of it but the necessity to close the properties window
and reopen it to make the location field visible.

short_description: Regular expressions broken in find/replace
long_description:
Encountered a couple issues using the find/replace dialog (started using shift + ctrl + H).

Most important is it does not work with regular expressions. I entered a regular expression of \n (which is hardly a regex but it also fails with $). Using the test dialog I entered test text of:

test
test
test

Entering \n would match the first 2 semicolons as expected. $ would match the last semicolon as expected (although in some editors this would match all semicolons i.e. KomodoEdit).

I click Apply in the test dialog to return to the Replace in Projects dialog where it fills in the regular expression I was just testing. 

I click Find (which was a bit of a trip when I was expecting a replace button) and it returns no results (and trust me there are definitely a number of lines that end in a semicolon followed by a newline I also pasted the testing text into the file as well). I also tested with \r\n and \r.

Somewhat related but there is also no easy way to only find/replace within selected text (again common in many editors). I think there is a way somewhere but it must not be intuitive. I did it once successfully using the quick replace toolbar somehow but I see no explicit option on it. Similarly there is apparently no explicit option in the Replace in Project dialog. I would have expected it to be the Selection option in the scope dropdown but this seems to consistently just search the entire currently focused file (regardless of highlighted selection).

Finally doing a find/replace does not add to the undo/redo stack so I cannot undo a find/replace. Which was particularly unfortunate when I accidentally did a find/replace on the entire file because it did not apply to my highlighted selection as expected. Which is now proving hard to correct because I cannot match newlines... Talk about a series of unfortunate events.

Let me know if you would like me to split these last 2 issues into separate bug reports. Also let me know if there is any other information I can provide.

short_description: Can choose invalid filesystem as target location in New wizard and not warned until finished.
long_description:
NB Bug:
Launch NB mount some read-only .zip files.

Choose File | New from the menu and create some object.
In Target Location Select the object directory to be one of the read only zip files.
Go through the rest of the wizard customize various things in the object.
When user presses Finish the wizard goes away and user is left with an error message Filesystem Invalid JAR. is read-only. User 
cannot 
return to wizard with all modificiations they did and is left to start over again. 

Better behavior would be to check for validity of the directory or filesystem for writing when user pushes next on the Target Location 
panel. 
A dialog should pop up warning them of the problem. If it's invalid choice then user should have a chance to pick again on the Target 
Location panel.

short_description: Freeze with ParentVersionError.getErrorsForDocument waiting for repo indices
long_description:
Created attachment 102655
Sequence of thread dumps

In a fairly new user dir I tried to open the properties of a POM project with pom.xml open. The IDE went to 100% CPU and heavy disk for several minutes with the UI frozen then settled into an actual deadlock.

1. Livelock: EQ is waiting for a lock on the POM since the customizer holds a lock while open. StatusProvider$StatusProviderImpl.findHints locks the POM while calculating hints reasonably enough. The problem is that ParentVersionError.getErrorsForDocument then forces update of all (local & remote) indices.

Probably the indexer should have a way of returning quickly from e.g. getVersions for repos which are not yet indexed it could *trigger* the creation of the index asynch but it should not *wait* for it to be finished. See loadIndexingContext for the logic perhaps this could take a boolean force param and return boolean success and if index  then e.g. getVersions could pass force=false and return immediately if result of loadIndexingContext is false.

Not clear if all callers of RQ methods should behave this way (return early upon missing index) would certainly be useful for fixing part of bug #191313 and in any other case where the result is just intended to be informational. TBD whether there are some use cases where it is appropriate to wait for indexing to complete.

2. Deadlock: some problem in POMModelImpl/AbstractModel with lock ordering. Seems that startTransaction both acquires a monitor on the model *and* acquires a semaphore which seems inherently prone to deadlock. Here EQ has the monitor and is waiting for the semaphore while StatusProvider thread holds the semaphore and is waiting for the monitor. Perhaps a bug in XAM/XDM.

short_description: Calling System.err.flush in NetBeans is slow
long_description:
As bug 178981 and associated attachment show calling System.err.flush() frequently is slow:
https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=92866

This is not done in the IDE frequently but when it happens it can quite negatively affect overall performance of almost any feature.

short_description: Ant docs refers to wrong ant version
long_description:
Main page for Building with Ant docs refers to Help | HelpSets | Ant 1.3
manual but it no more exists. There is ant Ant 1.4.1 manual now.

short_description: CVS Commit Text Area Does Not Grow with Dialog
long_description:
When you select commit from the CVS menu you are presented with a dialog that
contains a text area in which you can write your commit message.

This dialog is resizable but the text field will not grow vertically.  Instead
the portion of the dialog at the bottom (with the OK and Cancel buttons)
gets bigger.

Ideally the dialog should remain resizable and the text area should grow with
the dialog.

short_description: Unable to install GlassFish V2.1 to C:\Program Files (x86)\glassfish-v2.1
long_description:
-The Next button was disable at the GlassFish V2.1 Installation panel as the result I was not able to proceed with
the installation.
-I used to be able to install on the E:\Program Files (x86)\glassfish-v2.1 directory until today build

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Download the latest NB 6.7 trunk build (04/22/2009) All version on winXP jdk1.6.0_13
http://bits.netbeans.org/download/trunk/nightly/latest/
2. Start Install and proceed with the step
BUG:
    The installer stopped when it encountered an error message The installation folder contains the wrong character(\)
    Please look at the attached figure for the problem in details

short_description: MenuBar property vanish during opening form
long_description:
[nb)dev](20020304) [jdk1.4](92)

Steps to reproduce:
- open/create JFrame
- add JMenuBar
- save (close)
- reopen
-> Warning and Error dialog arise  and manu bar isn't visible in Form Designer.
-> MenuBar is moved into Other Components

P1: setMenuBar - is removed -> data lost

short_description: 6.7 trunk NBI installer fails on Mac OS X 10.5.7
long_description:
The NetBeans 6.7 development nightly build of 200906251410 (the All bundle) installation fails on Mac OS X 10.5.7 (Intel) if the NBI installer is used.

I prefer to use the NBI installer (the tgz download) instead of the default Mac OS X installer (the dmg download) because it allows to modify the IDE and 
application server locations and define the default JDK. That worked just fine over a long period of time with trunk as well as milestone and RC builds. 
However when I tried to install the last trunk build of 200906251410 the installer failed with the following message: Installation of Base IDE JavaSE ...... 
was not completed. The installation was attempted on a clean system with no ~/.nbi directory.

Judging by the size the SUNWappserver and sges-v3-prelude installed in their entirety but the NetBeans itself has not. It looks like the failure occurred 
when the installer attempted to create the Start menu shortcut for the IDE.

Here is the bottom of the NBI log if the installer is using default JDK 1.6.0_13-b03-206:

short_description: Jackpot Command Manager: Add not friendly
long_description:
I would expect the Add button to ask me for a name for the new rule file and
then add it to the list of commands (in the selected category) and perhaps
immediately open it in the editor. Instead it opens a filechooser (do you need
to have an existing rule file somewhere?) which is not consistent with the
behavior of any similar manager dialog I can think of. Should perhaps also be
called New. Or if there is a reason to add rules that are saved on disk
somewhere at least Add should open a simple dialog with radio buttons:

(*) Create new rule file
    Name:     [____________________________]
( ) Add existing rule file
    Location: [________________] [Browse...]

short_description: Can't run any command on filesystem from NetBeans 3.2.
long_description:
Development build #200206280100 of NetBeans 3.4
Windows 2000 with JDK 1.4.1 RC build #15

Description:
============
It is impossible to run any command on filesystem
imported from NetBeans 3.2 because of NPE thrown
once the command is being started. Take a look at
the attachment for details.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Launch NetBeans 3.2 IDE and mount CVS
filesystem using Built-in Client.
2. Exit IDE and launch NetBeans 3.4.
3. Import that project from NB 3.2 created in step 1.
4. Try to run any command on imported CVS
filesystem but you always get NullPointerException
instead.

short_description: Quick Find bar should be visible while Highlight Results are present
long_description:
Currently after pressing Ctrl+F and typing a search phrase with Highlight Results enabled pressing Esc will close the bar and remove the search result. However pressing the X at the right side of the bar will close the bar but leave highlights in the editor with no clear indicator in the UI where those highlights are from. The following cases are the primary issues:

* When the X is clicked in the find bar the highlighted results should be unmarked (like hitting Esc).
* When the user changes tabs while the Find bar is displayed the Find bar should be displayed in the newly selected editor window as well. If the new tab shows a window which does not support the Find bar then neither the bar nor search results should be visible in the newly selected window.

short_description: TAGLB: changes made to tld file not immediately applied to open customizer
long_description:
Description: 
If I have a tag library's tld open in the editor and I have a customizer open
for a tag or attribute I can make changes to the tld and save it and those
changes are not propagated to the customizer.

Work Around: 
After making changes to the .tld simply close and reopen customizer

Suggested Fix: 
jhoffman@netbeans.org 2001-09-17

I see three possible approaches (of course there may be others as well...).  My
suggestions are based on the fact that this isn't a very common task (having 
both the customizer and the source editor open.  The options are listed in my
preference (1 most preferable).

1. Automatically close and reopen the customizer while the user is editing the
   tld in the source editor.  As long as the customizer does not steal focus 
   away from the source editor then the flickering shouldn't be a big problem.

2. If the editor and the customizer are both open then place the tag name in
   a protected block so that it can only be edited from the customizer.  If the
   customizer is closed then the tag name becomes unprotected.

3.  (least preferable) If the editor and customizer are both open and the user
    edits the tag name in the source editor then simply close the tag
    customizer and post a short message to the status area such as:
    Tag name changed and customizer window closed  Docs will have to explain
    why this behavior occurred (i.e. to maintain consistency betw. the
    customizer and the tld).

2. 

Public Summary: 

pcarlson@netbeans.org 2002-03-20
Tested this and it works fine for taglib tag and attribute.  But it fails for
scripting variable.  I'm reopening the bug for that reason.

Evaluation: 
We ended up taking a different route: detect a name change then bring up
the customizer forthe new {tag attribute variable}  instead ofthe old.

A comment.

short_description: Jar file chooser property editor and wizard allow invalid choices
long_description:
Related to issue 12021 but in new FFJ builds (10507) the Jar Packager
wizard and Location property editor I am allowed to select an item
that is not a jar file.  Also if I enter a name without the .jar extension
the extension is not appended.  This results in an invalid state and 
attempting to compile the JAR causes an I/O access exception to occur (and
it would be nice if the exception hinted that the jar file name might not
be correctly formatted.

To reproduce:
Create a new Jar Packager > Jar Contents object. Enter a name select
contents and on the third panel Jar Location select a directory name and
click the Next button.  Then click the Finish button.  The newly created
Jar Contents file has an invalid location (just the name of the directory).  
In the case where the user selects only a directory name I would add the
name of the jar (entered on the first panel of the wizard) with the .jar
extension.  Or I would require the user to select a jar file (or enter the 
name of the target jar file) before allowing them to click the Next button.

explorer. Sources move before classes.

short_description: Switching off new window tab group behaviour breaks sliding
long_description:
Using branding to switch off the new tab groups seems to break window sliding.  The buttons in the vertical slidebar on either side are arranged horizontally rather than vertically.  This breaks the UI for any platform app that doesn't want to pick up the new window features.

Quick flick through the code suggests that org.netbeans.core.windows.view.ui.slides.SlideBar is adding the buttons without setting up the constraints properly to make the buttons vertical.  This class used to extends Box - perhaps setting the layout to BoxLayout would be better in the fallback code?

short_description: Navigator should shown also field/property types
long_description:
Currently only field/project names are shown in project navigator. There should be also types (that's the way how it's working for Java files).

For the field declared as: private String whatSoEver
--> actual: whatSoEver
--> expected: whatSoEver : String

..similar problem is in method return types and parameter types.

For the method declared as: private String destroyTheWorld(Number[] howManyTimes)
--> actual: destroyTheWorld(howManyTimes)
--> expected: destroyTheWorld(Number[] howManyTimes) : String

Maybe duplicate of issue #95927

Java: 1.6.0 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0-b105 
System: Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86 Cp1251 ru_RU (nb)

Steps to reproduce:
- Create New Anagram Game Application
- Select some fragment in code
- Right-click and select Profiling > Insert Profiling Point
- Select Load Generator. Click Next
- RESULT: Location (End) fields are enabled and empty OK is enabled. It is expected that OK is disabled when Location
(End) fields are empty and they should be disabled if no end point needs to be specified.

short_description: Ability to resolve a broken library reference in a customized manner
long_description:
Created attachment 105373
Proposed patch minus apichanges

Currently the Broken References dialog only offers a predefined list of resolutions. This is limiting. For example currently if you ship a sample project template using an exotic library which is large and otherwise unused you are also forced to include that library definition which forces you to ship that physical library. Asking the user to manually download the right JARs and define the library is impolite. Adding a New Project wizard step to define the library is a possibility but means that you would not want to remove a bundled library you used to ship for this purpose as you would break previously created samples. Automatically defining the library when a project using it is opened would bypass the usual Broken References UI which would be particularly irritating if a license must be accepted or some other user interaction is required.

The attached patch would make it possible to ship only the sample project you would provide a callback for the Broken References dialog which would somehow retrieve the JARs and define the matching library if Resolve is clicked. You can write such a callback from scratch though for purposes of review I will include two add-on patches (not proposed in this issue) providing standard implementations that make it easy to register a particular library.

The patch only handles the case of a missing library definition. Other kinds of problems such as libraries with missing or invalid volumes could be handled with separate SPIs in the same style if it turns out to be useful.

short_description: Generated .exe for platform projects does not find 64-bit JDK/JRE
long_description:
I did the following:

1) Built a .zip for a Netbeans based-platform project.
2) On a different workstation with Vista 64bit + JDK 6 Update 17 64bit: Decompressed the .zip and tried to run the .exe that executes the application.
3) Got a JDK 5.0 or newer cannot be found on your machine. dialog.

Seems that since the precompiled .exe is a 32bit executable it only reads the 32bit part of the registry therefore it can't get the path to the 64bit JRE/JDK automatically.

Remember we are talking about finalized applications an not the Netbeans IDE itself (although I guess it has the same problem) so this might be a big deal for end-users who want to run platform applications on Windows computers with 64-bit JREs (to allocate a bigger heap for example). Not all end users know they can change the .conf file to point to the proper JRE.

short_description: Deadlock when using Object Browser.
long_description:
Had browser window open one class selected tried to ctrl-click on another IDE hung. Stack attached.

JDK 1.3R 465 IE NT4.

Reproducible: click one object in the Objects pane then quickly (before it has finished constructing the list of children in the Members pane) ctrl-click another object in the Objects pane. E.g. Colo
rPicker and ColorPreview.

Maybe also repr. by clicking a package then clicking an Object in the Objects pane before package list has finished showing.

short_description: Brace completion for EL inserts two closing braces when writing an expression right before an expression
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.3 Beta 2 (Build 201211062253)
Operating System = Windows 8 version 6.2 running on x86
Java VM Vendor = 1.7.0_09
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 23.5-b02

Anywhere in a JSF page where EL is allowed: Write an expression set the cursor right before the expression and try to write another expression. When writing the opening brace NetBeans inserts two closing braces.
Graphical description (the pipe represents the cursor):
1) Write expression: #{}|
2) Set cursor right before the expression: |#{}
3) Type '#': #|#{}
4) Type '{': #{|}}#{}
As you can see there are now two closing braces (instead of one) after the cursor.
Same result with the '$' notation.

short_description: Add Java Platform Wizard: Select Platform Type missing map id
long_description:
When user chooses Tools > Java Platforms and clicks Add Platform he gets the
Add Java Platform page. If Java ME SDK has been added the platform types available are Java SE Java ME CLDC custom Java ME CLDC and Java ME CDC.

If user clicks Help on this Add Java Platform dialog the help page show is Add Java Platform Wizard: Select Platform Type containing procedural information that belongs in the userguide not in the CSH help. The information is correct but the Help should bring up a description of dialog box elements only not a procedure on how to register a Java Platform.

wizard_addplatform_choosefolder.html is the correct CSH file to map to this particular Add Java Platform dialog. However this file does not have target id assigned to it in the C:\Program Files\NetBeans Dev 201304292301\mobility\modules\docs\org-netbeans-modules-mobility-javahelp\org\netbeans\modules\mobility\project\docs\map.xml file.

Requesting a map id for 
C:\Program Files\NetBeans Dev 201304292301\mobility\modules\docs\org-netbeans-modules-mobility-javahelp\org\netbeans\modules\mobility\project\docs\ui\wizard_addplatform_choosefolder.html


Wrong help attached see in NetBeans nbms-and-javadoc-11189-on-20130624.

short_description: NullPointerException: Attempted to pass a null filename to resolveFile
long_description:
Build: NetBeans IDE 6.1 (Build 200804211638)
VM: OpenJDK Client VM 1.6.0-b09 OpenJDK Runtime Environment 1.6.0-b09
OS: Linux 2.6.24-17-generic i386

User Comments: 
Playing around with Netbeans Platform settings. I deleted a platform from the Platform Manager that my suite relied upon.

short_description: Reformatting code options
long_description:
When reformatting the code there is not an option
to remove space lines in the code so if you have
code that was incorrectly formatted with a space
between each line of code the extra lines remain.
The formatter need to have a few more options like
the ability to specify where empty lines should
and should not be.

short_description: Wrong EOL in new files created
long_description:
When I create a new file on my Windows platform (using right click->new->Java Class...) I get the wrong line endings on my new file. They appear to default to UNIX endings when I save.

I was reading the FAQ at this website: http://wiki.netbeans.org/FaqEditorEOLs

Which said For new files (constructed from templates) the editor uses platform-default line separator.

This statement appears to be false as my new files are definitely being created with UNIX line endings on a windows platform.

Therefore when I commit this file to CVS and continue working on it. If I go to diff it every line will appear modified because CVS converts the line endings for windows when it fetches the diffing copy but the file generated by netbeans is using the UNIX line endings so the whole file appears modified and its very hard to diff for real changes.

short_description: F8 has to be pressed twice to execute line
long_description:
s1s5rc4 on jdk1.4.1_02
nevada me modules emulator wtk2.0

at this line f8 has to be pressed twice to perform
command:
FakeClass fc = new FakeClass()

see attached testcase

short_description: [60cat] new watch dialog do not take action by enter
long_description:
steps to reproduce the problem.

1. debug a java application
2. when the program is in running mode* right click on watches window and select new watch
   see pic 1
3. enter a name and press enter nothing happened.
4. enter another name and then click OK bottom. see pic 2
5. in watches window you have a name consist of two last names.
   see pic 3

* this problem is run when you are in running debug mode and not else.

short_description: JSF Pages from Entity Classes generates crappy code
long_description:
Any code wizard should generate a code which user can start building on top of. Such a code should also clearly
communicate best way to achieve something. Code generated by JSF Pages from Entity Classes has several issues in this
respect:
* listdetail relationship is using very obscure (and redundant) mechanism for navigation from list to detail. Nobody
should be using such an approach and the code should be just deleted
* it generates implementation of ELResolve and Converter just to achieve above hack - these classes should be just deleted
* generated code is using reflection API (!) to achieve basic navigation -> surely not necessity for basic JSF application
* some naming choices are confusing entity.entity.method instead of entityController.entity.method

short_description: Output is not scrollable
long_description:

2 Open Runtime view and terminate the started
process => stacktrace is written in output (see
issue #47191). There is problem with output the
stacktrace does not fit in it but there is no

short_description: suspicious call hint on List.remove(int)
Regression: Cannot type space into Options/Misc/Ant Properties text area
long_description:
Regression in NB6b1 since NB6m10:

Can no longer type a space character into a property in the field

Tools/
  Options/
    Miscellaneous (icon)/
      Ant (tab)/
        Properties (textarea)

Typing a space character causes the text field to scroll instead.
VERY ANNOYING.

Space characters are required in some properties.

e.g. file names with spaces in name
e.g. to set multiple debugging jvm -D options on same line

[also textarea height is too short only two lines was much better before]

short_description: Cursor over commented URL not changed to finger when CTRL pressed until moved
long_description:
Reproduce:
1. write some commented URL like // http://blabla.com
2. put mouse cursor over it and DONT MOVE the mouse
3. press CTRL => cursor does not change to finger

However if cursor gets moved at least 1 pixel it's repainted and changed to finger.

----
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 6.9.1 (Build 201011082200)
Operating System = Windows Vista version 6.0 running on x86
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_22
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 17.1-b03

short_description: [41cat] previous search not cleared in find dialog
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200503211900 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.4.2_xx ]

In the Find dialog (from the context menu in Projects or Files not ctrl-F in editor) the previous text search is retained.  This is OK unless I clear it for a second search in which case a third search will still show the text from the first.

short_description: Debugger views - select all takes long time
long_description:
NetBeans IDE 200408271257 on java 1.5.0-rc-b63

1 Create many watches
2 Select some watch and press Ctrl+A (select all)
=> this operation is very very slow. From user
point of view it looks like IDE is frozen.

short_description: NbClipboard strong-references last hidden window (memory leak)
long_description:
There is a JDK problem workaround in NbClipboard that tracks the last
deactivated component and checks whether it is the same on WINDOW_ACTIVATED.
This causes a medium leak that keeps last used dialog in memory until next
dialog is used.
After startup it can also referenc splash screen this way (600KB) for extended
period of time.
The component could IMHO be either referenced weakly or (probably better and
easier) cleared on next WINDOW_ACTIVATED event.
Assigning to Yarda ccing Trung they know most about the code.
I can fix it myself if you aggree with the (latter) proposed solution.

short_description: Document WebLogic use case in Getting Started with RESTful WS tutorial
long_description:
WebLogic now works almost out of the box with NB to create EE5 RESTful WS.
Some points need to be documented:
1. If you are using Derby copy derbynet.jar and derbyclient.jar from NB to WL_INSTALLATION/server/lib
2. User may need to resolve problem of copying Jersey libraries to server (in Projects window UI).
