short_description: Completion of taglib uri attribute does not offer all relevant values
long_description:
1. Add a JSP 1.2-compilant tag library into WEB-INF/lib of a web application
2. Type  <%@taglib uri=   in the editor
3. Press Ctrl+Enter
4. The URIs corresponding to the tld files inside the META-INF directory of the 
taglib jars are not offered in the completion window - which they should as by 
the JSP 1.2 spec they are valid URIs for the uri attribute of the taglib 
directive.

short_description: Register instance button in missing server dialog
long_description:
It would be nice to trigger instance registration
from the Resolve Missing Server dialog.

This is particularly true for users who get an EJB
or Web Service project for the first time.  The
default Tomcat instance doesn't help them.

The user needs to Cancel the resolution Register
a useful instance complete the server resolution.

That is clunky.

and each typed symbol is appearing only after a while.

short_description: Resize does not seem to work well for Comment element.
long_description:
In a diagram create a Comment element and enter an extra-long
text.  In Modeling->Preferences->Advanced->Diagrams set
Automatically Size Elements to any of the four available choices
(Expand or Contract as Needed Expand but Never Contract Expand
Unless Manually Resized Never Expand or Contract).

Regardless of the preferences Resize Element to Contents works
in the same limited fashion as follows:
o right-click Comment select Resize Element to Contents
=> nothing semes to happen
o enlarge Comment to display the entire lengthy text
right-click Comment select Resize Element to Contents
=> Comment is snapped back to original size

short_description: [2003-11-12] Adapt form editor for the new window system
long_description:
Most of the adoption is already done on
winsys_29836 branch. There are still some problems
with the component palette. Despite that it needs
to be redesigned completely for the FCS (see issue
36125 nad issue 36126) there should be some
changes already done for the merge:
- the three control buttons on the left should be
  moved to a tool bar placed directly in the form
  designer (for each form)
- the palette buttons (beans) must be unselectable
- the palette buttons should be consistent with
  Look and Feel (no additional borders correct
  rollover presentation etc)

short_description: Performance improvements in module list scan
long_description:
This is a follow-up of issue #169040 some more performance improvements should be made. Notably:
1) Change all-universe scan to transitive-deps-only scan
2) get rid of ModuleList.getAllEntriesSoft()

See issue #169040 for details.

short_description: Go to source works incorrectly for anonymous classes
long_description:
Profiler 070321
NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200703201900)
1.6.0 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0-b105
Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86
ru_RU (nb) Cp1251

When Go To Source action is invoked from Live Results for methods or objects of
anonymous classes it ignores anonymous class number and opens surrounding class
and its methods. For example if surrounding class has the same method as
anonymous class method of surrounding class would be shown instead of the
anonymous class.

short_description: Next Cut / Paste actions form designer isn't refreshed
long_description:
[nb-dev](197)[jdk1.3.1](b24)

Steps to reproduce:
- add JPanel add JButton
- try to Cut/Paste button to panel

In Component Inspector you can see that button was copied but in designer
button stay visible on old place.

short_description: Show all dates in local time
long_description: Synergy should display all dates on page in local time based on browser settings. All administration would be still in UTC but when displayed local time should be used instead.

short_description: RESTful Web Services from Patterns using Maven
long_description:
The create RESTful Web Services from Patterns wizard does not work correctly when using Maven. The project is created but the POM file has links to unknown binaries and it adds an unknown binary repository. 

The application will deploy since it uses the javaee-web-api which includes a version of JAX-RS on GlassFish 3.1.2. As a result I marked it as a P2.

The error is only present when you select an EE 6 server: GlassFish 3+.

If you use the same wizard for GlassFish 2.1.1 and Java EE 5 it works as expected.

I have created a screencast attached logs and projects.

short_description: Unexpected debug behavior with split windows
long_description:
I'm using:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200711071200)
Java: 1.6.0 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0-b105
System: Linux version 2.6.18.8-0.5-default running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb)
Userdir: /home/mv/.netbeans/dev

I have a spec open in one window and source code in another window -
so split windows.

Behavior 1:
When debugging in the source code F4 F7 F8 work fine.
However if I switch focus to the spec file and press (accidentally)
one of those keys then switch back to the source code window none of
those keys work.

Behavior 2:

short_description: Popup Javadoc fails to display documentation for methods in StringBuffer in JDK 1.5
long_description:
041014 custom. If you make a j2seproject using JDK
1.5 and type

new StringBuffer.insert(

and get code completion for e.g.
insert(intString) the popup Javadoc is empty
except for See Also and Throws clauses. Yet
the actual Javadoc (HTML) for this method has a
full description.

In src.zip the Javadoc is given as

    /**
     * @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException
{@inheritDoc}
     * @see        #length()
     */

Note that this StringBuffer method overrides a
method in AbstractStringBuilder which has the
complete Javadoc which should be inherited.

Note also that ASB is package-private however
this doesn't seem to bother the Javadoc tool
which copies the super Javadoc anyway. The IDE's
editor should match the behavior of the Javadoc tool.

short_description: provide proxy password via NetworkSettings
long_description:
Reproducibility: Happens every time

most of the proxy settings are provided via the NetworkSettings API which is based on a NetworkSettings.ProxyCredentialsProvider implementation - either the NB default or some other provided by a particular platform application. 

unfortunatelly the ProxyCredentialsProvider.getProxyPassword(...) method does not have an equivalent in NetworkSettings and the keyring based NetworkSettings.getKeyForAuthenticationPassword() is meant to be used instead.

short_description: Invert Boolean Writes ! Before All Return Values Of All Methods
JSF 2.0 Scrum Toys Demo App does not comply with JSF spec
long_description:
Checking that demo I have seen that code does not follow JSF 2.0 spec. For example:


    


 is a composite component but JSF 2.0 spec does not mention anything about ui:param usage inside a composite component. If you try the demo it fails using MyFaces because ui:param should only be used in union with ui:include or ui:decorate. In fact in an earlier version of facelets ui:param only adds a variable into the current VariableResolver. This is a good example about how do not use JSF.

The right way to do it is use expressions like #{cc.attr.image}. The demo must be fixed.

short_description: Reset Windows triggers componentOpened for windows already open without calling componentClosed
long_description:
When using the Window / Reset Windows feature TopComponent.componentOpened is called for existing opened windows
without the corresponding componentClosed for each call to componentOpened.

This causes problems with any code that allocates resources in componentOpened and expects to clean them up in
componentClosed. The documentation refers to componentOpened being called when the TopComponent is opened for the first
time on some workspace:
http://bits.netbeans.org/dev/javadoc/org-openide-windows/org/openide/windows/TopComponent.html#componentOpened()

Expected result:
  - either componentOpened shouldn't be called at all during Reset Windows for window components already open or
  - a corresponding componentClosed should be called before componentOpened to balance the opened/closed calls.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create Netbeans RCP module suite
2. add new RCP module
3. add new Window Component to module
4. add to componentOpened():
   System.out.println(TC open)
5. add to componentClosed():
   System.out.println(TC close)
6. Run application
7. open the custom Window Component from Window menu output console shows TC open
8. choose Window / Reset Windows
9. observe TC open being printed a second time in output console without TC close

This may be the cause of issues such as Issue 105325 - NPE on project creation after Reset Windows.

(Tested on Windows XP SP3 and Vista SP1)

short_description: Inconsistent wizards for RESTful JavaScript Client
long_description:
1. Create a HTML5 project
4. In this project in New File wizard go to HTML5 -> RESTful JavaScript Client
3. Create a Java Web project
4. In this project in New File wizard go to Web Services -> RESTful JavaScript Client

You see that there are two wizards called RESTful JavaScript Client (one available in HTML5 projects one in Java Web projects) but they are totally inconsistent and each of them does something else. The HTML5 one is the new wizard added in NetBeans 7.3: http://wiki.netbeans.org/NewAndNoteworthyNB73#REST_service_consumption
The Java Web one is some old stuff from 2008 or earlier that does something completely different (see commit history for websvc.rest/src/org/netbeans/modules/websvc/rest/wizard/ClientStubsIterator.java)

We should make this consistent between the two perhaps by just deleting the old stuff and making the new stuff available in all kinds of projects.

short_description: Task.waitFinished(0) incorrect behavior.
long_description:
As described in issue #50761 Task.waitFinished(0) can return before the task has finished because wait(0) can be woken
by the notification that task is started and condition (expectedEnd <= now) is always true for milliseconds = 0.

Following patch fixes this problem:
diff -r 1b5e0e0ea023 openide.util/src/org/openide/util/Task.java
--- a/openide.util/src/org/openide/util/Task.java       Sun Mar 16 14:25:03 2008 +0100
+++ b/openide.util/src/org/openide/util/Task.java       Mon Mar 17 09:48:26 2008 +0100
@@ -1596 +15910 @@ public class Task extends Object impleme
                     if (finished) {
                         return true
                     }
+                    
+                    if (milliseconds == 0) {
+                        continue
+                    }
 
                     long now = System.currentTimeMillis()

short_description: Avoid System network proxy reloading failed! warning from NbTestCase in NB JUnit
long_description:
I'd like to enable failOnMessage(Level.WARNING) in my NbTestCase in my
platform application test but in RELEASE74 there is one warning upon
platform startup that prevents me from doing this:

INFO [org.netbeans.core.network.proxy.NetworkProxyReloader]: System
network proxy resolver: Mac
WARNING [org.netbeans.core.network.proxy.NetworkProxyReloader]: System
network proxy reloading failed! Trying fallback resolver.
INFO [org.netbeans.core.network.proxy.fallback.FallbackNetworkProxy]:
Fallback system proxy resolver: no http_proxy variable found
INFO [org.netbeans.core.network.proxy.NetworkProxyReloader]: System
network proxy reloading succeeded. Fallback provider was successful.


What seems to be happening is that NetBeans is trying to look up system
proxy settings while executing a unit test. That seems non-ideal since
tests are supposed to be stable across platforms. What's the right way to
disable the proxy server for purposes of running unit tests--or more
generally what is the right way to set NetBeans preferences in a unit
test?

short_description: Compiler/executor/debugger defaults on JavaSettings are not properly stored.
long_description:
JavaSettings has properties for the defaults for compilers/debuggers/executors but these are not properly stored across project save & restore (i.e. IDE restart). For example if the compiler defau
lt is set to Internal Javac V8 instead of the original Internal Javac it will revert to Internal Javac after a restart.

I`m not sure exactly why this is so (why it does not persist correctly). However looking at JavaSettings it is definitely wrong. This is because the actual CompilerType object (e.g.) should not be pe
rsisted rather its name should be and upon reload the compiler type should be looked up by name. In JavaSettings the actual service type is the Bean property type.

See suggested Fix on next pane.

short_description: No GUI for  security-role-mappings in sun-application.xml if rolename comes from child module
long_description:
See issue 78686.  If the user has or wants to have security-role-mappings
defined in sun-application.xml that map role-names defined in child modules of
the EAR no DConfigBean (and thus no GUI representation in the config editor) is
created for such mappings.

This is is a JSR-88 architecture limitation though there are options we could
consider to resolve this (such as not using DConfigBeans for this field for
EARs etc.)  Note that the user can enter the mappings in XML text and the
config editor will respect their existence (but not display them).

short_description: api review for a new TreeTable-like component
long_description:
the current TreeTable component (and its 'view' counterpart TreeTableView) is very buggy doesn't support drag and drop
has poor sorting capabilities and is hard to maintain. there's a new implementation of this component in contrib/ttv
(the authors are Tim Boudreau and David Strupl). i propose introducing the new implementation into netbeans 6.5 and
depracting the old TreeTableView.
the new component - called Outline/OutlineView - is compatible with TreeTableView from the data model point of view so
the transition to the new component is very easy and straightforward. i've already tried replacing TreeTableView in all
debugger windows with the new OutlineView and didn't find any major problems. other moodules currently using
TreeTableView (e.g. find usages local history etc) would benefit from the new OutlineView as well - better sorting
quick-search capabilities drag'n'drop less bugs.

currently there is a new module o.n.swing.outline which has two components ETable - JTable with extra capabilities
similar to JTable from JDK1.6 and Outline component which inherits from ETable and provides a 'table with expandable
rows'. openide.explorer then depends on this module and provides OutlineView based on Outline component. i'll attach
sources for both modules later on.

two issues have already been identified:
1. do we want to make ETable and Outline component public API? currently TreeTable component which TreeTableView is
based on is not public. on the other hand plain Outline/ETable component might be useful for platform developers...
2. rename Outline/OutlineView as the name evokes navigator-like component

short_description: JavaEE validation hints counts only with one class per file otherwise not all issues are detected
long_description:
EJBProblemContext presumes only one class per file which is obviously wrong. It should gather all classes inside the file and detect their type (sb eb mdb).

short_description: Provide support for starting goals in debug mode
long_description:
Currently all goals are being started in in 'run' mode. However for some goals a debug mode would be needed where the
ide automatically attaches the debugger to the running task. This usually happens when I click debug on a maven project
the server will then be started by netbeans an attached to the debugger.

However if you'd use an embedded server as we do in some projects using 'jetty:run' I'd need to have the server start
in debug mode and have netbeans attach to it.

short_description: NetBeans hangs with SDI on two monitors
long_description:
I use two monitors on my Mac running Mac OS X 10.4.6 with J2SE 5.0.

I changed the NetBeans Preferences | IDE Configuration | System Settings to use SDI and distributed the 
windows over two monitors. It worked fine until I quit and later restarted NetBeans. The windows titles 
kept flashing and cycling and NetBeans wouldn't respond to user input - it was hung. I tried many times 
with the same result. I reinstalled NetBeans but it did not help. I finally had to restore my hard disk from 
the previous day's backup to get NetBeans to work. 

If I hadn't backed up my system the day before it would have been a major disaster. I guess I would have 
never been able to use NetBeans again.

short_description: VSS: Remove doesn't work again on not recovered file.
long_description:
Development build #200108290100 of NetBeans 3.3 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.3.1

Description:
============
User is not allowed to answer question whether to Remove the file again if it 
was not previously recovered but added instead. Therefore s/he must use VSS app-
lication. Please resolve this issue the same way as Undo Check Out problems.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount VSS filesystem and create new file underneath. Add it to repository.
2. Remove it from repository and Add it back so that it becomes [Current].
3. Since now all attempts to do Remove should fail.

short_description: Can we have Mime types extensions that are defined by the end user
long_description:
Created attachment 146863
SQL Mime Type Resolver java source file

I do an SQL Editor Platform Application
Up until 7.2 I managed the SQL mime type through the SQLMimeResolver.java file attached together with layer.xml snippet which looks like this:


      
        
      


The interest of doing so was to have user defined extensions matching the SQL file type (Prefs.getSQLFileExtensions())

Since 8.0 The Action File / Open throws a Mime Type Exception

I removed my reference in the layer to my Java Mime Type handler in favor of the annotation based approach which defines extensions as hard coded developer chosen extensions

I was wondering if having the file extensions discovered at run time would be feasible

Thanks

short_description: Infinite loop of HTMLSyntaxParser on SGML comment
long_description:
1) open an html file
2) type: <!X -- comment --
3) type: >

-> the completion code invokes HTMLSyntaxParser which stays in an infinite loop:

AWT-EventQueue-1 prio=1 tid=0x09305468 nid=0x4f10 runnable [0x834ad000..0x834ae140]
        at org.netbeans.editor.ext.html.HTMLSyntaxSupport.getElementChain(HTMLSyntaxSupport.java:490)
        at org.netbeans.editor.ext.html.HTMLSyntaxSupport.checkCompletion(HTMLSyntaxSupport.java:912)
        at org.netbeans.modules.editor.html.HTMLCompletionProvider.getAutoQueryTypes(HTMLCompletionProvider.java:80)
        at org.netbeans.modules.editor.completion.CompletionImpl.insertUpdate(CompletionImpl.java:284)
[snip]

The problem is a regression of lexerization of the html editor module done before a year. The same problem appears in
netbeans 6.0 M8 from March of this year. Since noone reported the issue during the year I do not consider it as a
stopper for Netbeans 6.0. The final decision in on QE though. 

BTW the errorneous code will be removed from trunk soon and replaced by new clean solution.

module on Gem Manager

short_description: [40cat] print settings not saved across restart
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200410041800 ]
[ JDK VERSION : J2SE 1.4.2_03 ]

If print settings are changed in Tools / Options /
IDE Configuration / System / Print Settings they
are not saved across a restart.  Repro case:
1) start 200410041800 with fresh userdir
2) open project and print a Java source
3) change default font size to 8 pt
4) print again default font is 8 pt
5) close IDE and reopen
6) print same source default font is back to 10 pt

correct our current handler config file template

short_description: QA urgently needs code below in WizardDescriptor.java
long_description:
QA automated tests fail 1 out of 10 times on NT when first invoking the 
New Template Wizard.  This problem is not seen during manual testing
and has something to do with how ant and tonga interact with the IDE
startup.  This impact is P2 because we have trouble using QA tests
in automated test suites because their results are not reliable due
to this problem.  The code below is a workaround to the problem and
has been tested successfully.  Code consists of 4 lines added see
SSF in comment.  No existing code is modified.

        /** Setter for selected list item. 
         * @param index Index of selected item in the list.
         */
	private int lastIndex					// SSF

        public void setSelectedIndex(int index) {
            if (cellRenderer != null) {
                cellRenderer.setSelectedIndex(index)
		if (!(index == 0  && index == lastIndex)) {	// SSF
                    contentList.ensureIndexIsVisible(index)
		}						// SSF
		lastIndex = index				// SSF
                // Fix of #10787.
                // This is workaround for swing bug - BasicListUI doesn't ask 
for preferred
                // size of rendered list cell as a result of property 
selectedIndex change. 
                // It does only on certain JList property changes (e.g. 
fixedCellWidth).
                // Maybe subclassing BasicListUI could be better fix.
                contentList.setFixedCellWidth(0)
                contentList.setFixedCellWidth(-1)
            }
        }

It is likely that there is a more elegant solution to this problem.
However given time urgency we'd like to see the above fix implemented.
Below is a stack trace produced during lockup.  Thanks Steve

(org.omg.CORBA. BAD_PARAM). This however used to
work fine in FFJ 3.0.

Steps to reproduce:
1.In the Runtime tab of the Explorer right-click
the CORBA Naming Service
node
2.From the contextual menu choose Bind New
Context. The CORBA Panel dialog
box appears.
3.In the Name box enter JDK.
4.In the Kind box enter Naming.
5.In the URL boxfile:///c:\abc.txt.
6.Click OK.

short_description: Missing checkboxes on Mac OS X
long_description:
There are tiles instead of the checkboxes but they're confusing (especially when they are all off) and their borders
are indistinguishable (see screenshot)

short_description: Error parsing decltype in function arguments
Annotation to register project customizer panels
long_description: There are a bunch of these panel classes and currently you are forced to register them manually in a layer.

short_description: Ctrl+Shift+Drag/drop label onto textbox makes label render in wrong place
long_description:
I have a webuijsf:label and an h:inputText:

<webuijsf:label binding=#{changeNotifications.receiptEmailLabel} id=receiptEmailLabel
text=#{messages['reservation.receiptEmailAddress']}/>

<h:inputText binding=#{changeNotifications.txtReceiptEmail} id=txtReceiptEmail tabindex=10
validator=#{changeNotifications.txtReceiptEmail_validate} value=#{SelectedReservation.res.emailAddress}/>

In the visual designer I hold Ctrl+Shift then drag the label drop it on text box to set the labels for attribute. Now
the label is displayed to the right of the text box instead of above it.  When I switch to JSP view and come back to
visual designer it displays the label on top of the text box like I expect.

short_description: Updated file not added to Projects window
long_description:
After completing an svn update a file that was in the svn repository but not yet in my local NetBeans project was
successfully added to my local NetBeans C++ project however the file did not appear in the Projects window but it did
appear in the Files window from where it could be selected and opened in the editor window.

short_description: Add support for types added in JDBC 4.0
long_description:
... in java.sql.Types. This will also fix the
ResultSetTableModelSupportTest.testAllTypes test case which otherwise fails JDK 6.

short_description: If default browser is Netscape then there are problems opening
long_description:
If the default browser is Netscape then in the
Tools->Options the browser is set to netscape.

However if a user has Netscape 6 or greater then
when Netscape is opened when executing a Web App
then there will be an error.

Annotation: Could not access the URL through the
external browser. Check the browser
configuration.  From the Tools menu choose
Options.  In the Options window expand the IDE
Configuration node.  Then expand the Server and
External Tool Settings node followed by the Web
Browsers node. Select the external browser type
and modify the Browser Executable property if
necessary.
org.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.NbBrowserException:
DdeConnect errno >400A< when connecting to server
NETSCAPE topic WWW_Activate.
	at
org.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.NbDdeBrowserImpl.reqDdeMessage(Native
Method)
	at
org.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.NbDdeBrowserImpl.access$500(NbDdeBrowserImpl.java:53)
	at
org.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.NbDdeBrowserImpl$URLDisplayer.dispatchURL(NbDdeBrowserImpl.java:331)
	at
org.netbeans.modules.extbrowser.NbDdeBrowserImpl$URLDisplayer.run(NbDdeBrowserImpl.java:294)
[catch] at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:534)


There seems to be a workaround.
In Tools->Options set the browser to netscape6

However this workaround is unacceptable since this
change is too difficult for users and not an Out
of the box experience OOTBE

short_description: Unreachable URL for plugin download
long_description:
netbeans-trunk-nightly-201402270001-windows.exe

NetBeans Plugins are unavailable because of inaccessible URL.

For instance go to Tools > Plugins > Available Plugins. Press Check for Newest

Error is reported:
Unable to connect to the Latest Development Build because of Timeout while opening connection to http://deadlock.netbeans.org/job/nbms-and-javadoc/lastStableBuild/artifact/nbbuild/nbms/updates.xml.gz

The similar message shows after installing a pluging on Available Plugins list:
Networking problem in http://deadlock.netbeans.org/job/nbms-and-javadoc/lastStableBuild/artifact/nbbuild/nbms/extra/org-netbeans-modules-a11y.nbm

Check your proxy settings or try again later. The server may be unavailable at the moment. You may also want to make sure that your firewall is not blocking network traffic. Your cache may be out of date. Please click Check for Updates to refresh content.

At the same time Test Connection passed on Options > General tab therefore actually the proxy configuration is correct.

short_description: Command Editor vs. Edit property
long_description:
How to reproduce:
1) Mount VCS Empty filesystem
2) Invoke Customizer
3) Invoke Command Editor
4) Select some command
5) Change Exec property in the right-side
property sheet
6) ERROR - Even if you use in-place property
editor or exec property editor dialog property
value is not changed.

short_description: ClassCastException using jndi lookup with JMS BC
long_description:
Hi!

I'm on Glassfish ESB 200810140114 SUN-MQ 4.1 and sun-jms-adapter.

I'm using the JMS BC to dynamically send messages to a collection of JMS queues. I do this by setting the JMS 
BC/Outbound/Destination-property. This works fine as long as I'm using physical queue names. 

Problem is when I register the queues in jndi in Glassfish console (In Admin Object Resources using sun-jms-adapter 
as resource adapter) and update my bpel accordingly to set values like lookup://jms/my_queue into the JMS 
BC/Outbound/Destination-property. 

I then receive the following error :

JMSBC-E0747: Failed to process the message exchange with ID 270189716306033-36402-134483739795900041 and exchange 
pattern http://www.w3.org/2004/08/wsdl/in-only due to error: JMSBC-W0728:Unable to send message to JMS provider 
message exchange 270189716306033-36402-134483739795900041 end point BIMDispCA-sun-jms-
binding{BIMDispCA}casaService2DynamicOUTBOUND and operation 
{http://j2ee.netbeans.org/wsdl/BIMDispatcherBpel/Output}OutputOperation.   
java.lang.Exception: JMSBC-W0728:Unable to send message to JMS provider message exchange 270189716306033-36402-
134483739795900041 end point BIMDispCA-sun-jms-binding{BIMDispCA}casaService2DynamicOUTBOUND and operation 
{http://j2ee.netbeans.org/wsdl/BIMDispatcherBpel/Output}OutputOperation.   
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundMessageProcessor.processOneWayOutbound(OutboundMessageProcessor.java:1300)
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundMessageProcessor.execute(OutboundMessageProcessor.java:372)
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundMessageProcessor.run(OutboundMessageProcessor.java:179)
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundReceiver$Task.run(OutboundReceiver.java:214)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:885)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:907)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
Caused by: com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.jms.ChannelException: JMSBC-E0211: Failed to send to JMS message to destination 
lookup://jms/myqueue
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.jms.SendChannelJCAImpl.send(SendChannelJCAImpl.java:858)
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundMessageProcessor.sendMessageToJMS(OutboundMessageProcessor.java:1634)
        at com.sun.jbi.jmsbc.OutboundMessageProcessor.processOneWayOutbound(OutboundMessageProcessor.java:1283)
        ... 6 more
Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.stc.jmsjca.core.AdminQueue cannot be cast to com.sun.messaging.Destination
        at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.ProtocolHandler.createMessageProducer(ProtocolHandler.java:1223)
        at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.MessageProducerImpl.(MessageProducerImpl.java:110)
        at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.QueueSenderImpl.(QueueSenderImpl.java:64)
        at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.UnifiedSessionImpl.createSender(UnifiedSessionImpl.java:164)
        at com.sun.messaging.jmq.jmsclient.UnifiedSessionImpl.createProducer(UnifiedSessionImpl.java:516)

short_description: CRC for jaxws-build.xml is not maintained in the EJB project
long_description:
Build:   Sierra\520Rel\20080328-1522

With this build under EJB web service project (Web Services node) user is unable to generate and copy WSDL to a 
designated location.  Once selecting the ‘Generate and Copy WSDL’ utility from ‘Web Service’ > (right click on web 
service) and select a location no WSDL is generated under the chosen location.

To reproduce:
1)Open the provided EJB project.
2)Under the project > Web Service > (web service) right click and select ‘Generate and Copy WSDL’ option.
3)Provide a desired location for the WSDL to be generated.
4)Once the ‘Generate and Copy WSDL’ is complete check the chosen location for the WSDL file.

Note that no WSDL is generated under this location.

long_description:
Created attachment 136378
Screenshot of the editor warning

1. Clone this project from GitHub: https://github.com/tastejs/todomvc
2. Import directory architecture-examples/angularjs using HTML Project from Existing Sources wizard
3. Open index.html

=> On line 22 editor complains about invalid value of the ng-class attribute see the attached screenshot. I assume the this value is valid no?

Also one problem with the warning is that the marker of the error position (^ sign) does not seem to be in the correct place - it points to the middle of a word. Could it be because of the proportional font used?

short_description: Stack frame is emptied under certain circumstances
long_description:
As requested from forum discussion here's some information on a stack view problem.  I am debugging the rake db:create
task from inside the IDE.  At several points some reach via break point some via stepping the stack view contains
only the current frame and nothing else.  Step Out is also disabled (probably because the debugger thinks there is only
one frame).

This is with NB 6.5 trunk build circa Jun 24 08 JRuby 1.1.2 with jdbcpostgresql gem installed JDK 1.6.0_06 on Solaris
10u4.

Here is what I did:

I created a Rails project using the included JRuby runtime and using JDBC access to PostgreSQL (any db should be fine
but the session detail below is specific to JDBC).  I updated database.yml (attached) to get past issue 138294.

I have break points at the following lines:

jdbc.rake: 15 21 33 36 (from activerecord_jdbc_adapter gem 0.8.2)
jdbc_adapter.rb: 252 313 (from activerecord_jdbc_adapter gem 0.8.2)

I selected Run/Debug Rake task checked debug selected db:create and clicked .

This should stop at jdbc.rake#15.  Callstack shows two frames rake.rb#508 and jdbc.rake#15 - not sure if it's right
but it seems reasonable.

 and it stops at jdbc.rake#21.  Callstack now has three frames due to create_database method
invocation.  This is as expected.

 again and it stops at jdbc_adapter.rb#252 inside the connection method.  The stack view will only
show one frame - this one.

To me this seems incorrect.  Near as I can tell rake.rb and jdbc.rake called into this code and so those frames should
be present but they are not.  This is 100% reproducible so either I don't understand how this code works (quite
likely) or the stack at this point contains information that the debugger cannot crawl.

short_description: Growing number of ClassPath instances - leak
long_description:
Each invocation of JavaEditor.refreshAnnotations()
seems to generate new instances of
o.n.api.java.classpath.ClassPath which are hanging
around kept in memory via its SPIListener. See the
attached screenshot of OptimizeIt window. At the
bottom of the screenshot you can see the stack
trace where ClassPath instance is created. The
center of the screenshot shows the reference graph.

short_description: dist.jar ought not include spaces
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.1 Beta (Build 201109252201)
Operating System = Windows 7 version 6.1 running on x86
Java VM Vendor = 1.7.0
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 21.0-b17

This is hard to explain. And for some reason I was unable to reproduce it on an smaller project. Try to keep up with me:

Steps to reproduce:

1) Checkout this source: https://hg.java.net/hg/simple-marauroa~source-code-repository
2) Build the Marauroa Application Manager (will take some time the first time because it'll checkout two other projects.
3) Build the Simple Marauroa Client/Zone List Manager project (You get the same result if you build the whole suite but this way is faster).
4) No error.
5) Now modify this 2 files changing from Zone_Extension to Zone Extension:
a)Simple Marauroa Java\Zone Extension\nbproject\project.properties (dist.jar entry)
b)Marauroa Application Manager\Marauroa Zone Extension\nbproject\project.xml
6) notice the error:

Classpath entry Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\Marauroa Application Manager\build\cluster\modules\ext\extensions\Zone does not exist skipping
Classpath entry Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\Marauroa Application Manager\build\cluster\modules\Extension.jar does not exist skipping
Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\netbeans\harness\build.xml:174: The JARs [Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\Marauroa Application Manager\build\cluster\modules\simple-server-extension-zone.jar Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\Marauroa Application Manager\build\cluster\modules\ext\extensions\Zone Z:\Netbeans\Simple Marauroa\Marauroa Application Manager\build\cluster\modules\Extension.jar] contain no classes in the supposed public packages simple.client.extension.* simple.server.extension.* and so cannot be compiled against

I'll keep trying to figure it out tomorrow.

short_description: Support directives from Angular 1.4
long_description: ng-jq and ng-options should be supported editor should not show errors if their values are syntactically correct.

short_description: Java Free Form project scans all files then applies includes/excludes
long_description:
The high-level observation is that a Free-Form project created with a base directory that has a very large number of
files but for which includes/excludes are set to restrict it to a small number of files takes a very long time for the
Scanning projects activity.  

When creating a Free form project the default for the includes is '**' and excludes is '' i.e. index everything.  The
 source tree I want to use NetBeans with has about 13000 java source files in it but I only want to include about 200
in my project.  I tried to do this by setting the includes to only the part of the tree I want e.g. 'foo/bar/**' and
the excludes to some hidden directories related to the source control e.g. '**/.xyz_path/**'

I've tried this with several different configuration.  In the first all of the source files were symlinked to NFS
mounted files.  Scanning took between 2 and 12 hours to complete (overnight).  The netbeans process had negligible CPU
time indicating to me that most of the time was being spend loading the files over NFS.  In the second I used a mode
of the SCS that copies all of the files locally.  This took about an hour to scan.  A CPU was near 100% the entire time.
 In the third I copied only the source files I wanted into a tree of their own.  Scanning took a couple minutes.  This
leads me to believe that may files which are not included are being scanned.

short_description: MIME resolvers try to read not readable file several times
long_description:
If file object cannot be read MIME resolver should not try to read file 20 times.
See class MIMEResolverImpl.findMIMEType(FileObject fo)

short_description: OS Token dependency problem
long_description:
Say you have 3 modules in a suite:
- Test Utility
- Test Linux (depends on Test Utility module and on the org.openide.modules.os.Linux token)
- Test Windows (depends on Test Utility module and on the org.openide.modules.os.Windows token)
I increase the specification version of Test Utility module to permit download the new module via Update Center.

Running on Windows I receive this error while updating (only Test Utility module):
Missing required modules for Plugin Test Utility: requires org.openide.modules.os.Linux

This seems a bug: the module should be installed without any problem and it was so in NB5.5...

short_description: Selection/Document tabs missing in CSS Styles window for index.html from Java web project
long_description:
1. Create a HTML5 project Prj1
2. Create a Java EE 7 web project Prj2 (this will now create index.html)

=> If index.html from Prj1 is focused the CSS Styles window has 2 tabs: Selection and Document. However if index.html from Prj2 is focused it has only 1 tab. 
Next the contents of this tab (pane) is determined by the recently selected tab in index.html from Prj1 (so if you select Document when Prj1's index.html is active and then switch to Prj2's index.html it will show the Document content and same if Selection was selected).
Finally if Selection was selected then there is the button Run index.html but this is enabled for Prj1's index.html and disabled for Prj2's index.html.

long_description:
When defining a new trigger (Simple Cron or Hybrid) in the Binding WSDL Wizard the Add button (plus sign) is not 
focusable so cannot tab to it and press spacebar.

short_description: No field should be added into class if it's name is invalid Java identifier
long_description:
[1128] JDK 1.3.0-C W2k
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create new Field (popup New | Field)
2. In Name TextField type some invalid identifier (e.g. my-field)
3. Press Enter
4. You'll get The specified name is not a valid java identifier message
5. There is new Field newField inserted into class -> but no field should be
added

short_description: Exclude .DS_Store(and hidden files) in file in HTML5 Application
long_description: Hidden files show up(MacOSX) in HTML5 Application.  .git/.DS_Store/.gitignore/etc

short_description: Debugger UI redesign phase 1
long_description:
We plan to redesign the debugger UI and improve its usability and reliability. This long term effort is planned to more
releases - for 6.5 there should be a new debug view representing a debugger control center and unifying sessions
threads and call stacks (see also issue 122329) and reworked multi-thread debugging support (based on extensive
feedback received). Focus put on java debugger only should minimally affect other debuggers using debugger core API
(for 6.5).

short_description: NB 6.0 slow and broken
long_description:
AAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGGggggggggggggghhhhhhhhhhhhhhhH!

I've been trying to use NB 6.0 for more than a month and I'm giving up.  It's back to NB 5.5 for me.  Here's the issues:

* slooooooooooooooooooow.  Overall performance and responsiveness is so bad it makes using NB 6.0 unbearably painful.

* autoformatting of comments inserts extraneous blank lines.  Trying to type a one liner like
     /** This method does nothing right now.
      */
results in
    /** This method does nothing right now.
     *
     */
which might be your preferred style but it's not mine and if there's a way to turn it off I didn't find it.

* autocompletion is so slow it's useless.  Slow autocomplete was a problem in 5.5 but now it's pretty much useless.  I
 just keep typing now.  This wouldn't a big deal except sometime autocomplete kicks in and changes what I typed into
something else.  Which means I can't just think about what I'm about to type I need to keep an eye on what was just
typed to make sure it doesn't change out from under me.

* all my templates with all the license and copyright info in them disappeared when I switched from NB 5.5 to 6.0.

* new file tabs are scattered randomly hither and yon.  The old way of at least having them in the order you opened the
file was a lot better.

* moving a tab takes forever as the damn slow repaint draws (ever so slowly) orange outline after orange outline after
orange outline before finally putting the tab where you want it.  Maybe.

* picking a Swing component from the palette is both slow and unreliable.  You click on a component.  Many seconds
later you might be able to try to drop it onto your container.  Or maybe not.

* useful stuff like auto generation of property change support seems to have disappeared with no readily discoverable
way to do the same thing.

* who decided I wanted to change my syntax coloring anyway?  It's a nit but I'd like a say in the matter.

* accelerator key meaning changed dramatically from 5.5 to 6.0.  It took me a while to figure out that what used to be
fix imports is now uglify my code.  But that's not as bad as the fact that the accelerators only work sometimes. 
Will it actually fix my imports or launch the main program in the debugger?  Or do I have to use some other method? 
Suspense is good sometimes but not when you're trying to code.

Oh well that's enough for now.  I'll try 6.1 when it comes out.

short_description: Text Antialiasing default should respect -Dswing.aatext
long_description:
I think that the default value for the Text Antialiasing option should follow
the -Dswing.aatext property. When the user runs the IDE with this property she
probably want all fonts to be anti-aliased. It looks a little strange when
menus dialogs views etc. use anti-aliased fonts and the text in Editor is not
anti-aliased.

Obviously once the user sets the Text Antialiasing option in Editor the
explicitly set value should be used from that moment on. The value of the
swing.aatext property should be used otherwise.

short_description: It`s possible to edit array of String only in property editor opened by three dot (...)
long_description:
Open e.g. Global Options | RMI Settings. There are Stub formats property of type String[] under RMI Settings node. Click on this property. It looks like you can edit it but after enter is pressed
old value will preserve. You must click on ... and edit it in this editor.

short_description: Install JUnit in background if installer accept JUnit license
Rerun button disabled in OW after running tests
long_description:
The rerun button in the output window is currently disabled after running tests. This is on purpose to avoid issues 
arising from rerunning tests via this button (such as 147482 the test runner doesn't get reset correctly). Likely 
won't have time to fix for 6.5 so setting the TM to future.

short_description: Save dialog does not include diagram name from project tree on exiting ide with modified diagram
long_description:
Problem reproducible on winxp and solaris 10 sparc and should be on other
platforms too.
This dialog did not come up on a previous coco build (eg 060202) when exiting
ide with a modified diagram open. Only the Save dialog prompting to save the
project instead. In this build 2 Save dialogs comes up: 1st one for the
modified diagram 2nd for the project.

Repro steps:
- create a uml project of any type
- create a diagram of any type eg class diagram
- create and name some elements in the diagram
- do not save the diagram and select File->Exit
Result: the 1st Save dialog comes up promptint to save the diagram but the
diagram name displayed is the physical file name that includes the numbers used
by UML project repository (see attached snapshot exit-ide-modify-diagram.jpg).
This dialog did not come up from the previous builds.

This dialog should be eliminated and any modified diagrams should be saved
automatically if the Save or Save All is selected on the Save dialog for the
project(s) before IDE exits.

long_description:

Build: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200807040101)
VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 10.0-b19 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.6.0_04-b12
OS: Linux 2.6.24-19-generic amd64
User comments: context switched to the NB window -- was editing ruby with the VI plugin

short_description: CannotUndoException removes UndoableEdit from undo vector
long_description:
If a custom UndoableEdit is added to undo stack using BaseDocument.addUndoableEdit and this edits throws CannotUndoException during undo this edit is removed from undo stack and cannot be performed again.

The problem has 2 parts: 
package private indexOfNextAdd of UndoManager class is decremented regardless of success/failure of undoable edit.

UndoableEdits are not recovered from undo (their internal state is hasBeenDone).

This improvements is needed for issue 48427

short_description: Enter Master Password dialog pops behind pull/push dialog
long_description:
If a master password is set the first time the IDE is opened and a project is pushed/pulled with git it requests that you enter the master password. The problem is this dialog pops UNDER the (modal) push/pull dialog which means to access it you must close the push/pull dialog enter the password then run the push/pull operation again. Since it is modal this is the only way to do it. It is far from a high priority bug but it is quite annoying and frequently encountered.

To reproduce I am using a Kubuntu system with a master password set. BTW SVN's commit dialog handles this request properly that is the password dialog comes up before the commit window comes up.

short_description: [JMeter] Description for Ramp-Up Time is incorrect
long_description:
Profiler 1.2 070720

According to http://jakarta.apache.org/jmeter/usermanual/build-web-test-plan.html Ramp Up time is the delta between
starting of the first and the last user and if there are 5 users and rump up time of 5 seconds then the delay between
starting users would be 1 second (5 users / 5 seconds = 1 user per second).

short_description: Do not use File.getCanonicalFile (or gCPath)
Integrate Show Version Status Labels action for CVS and Subversion
long_description:
There's two menu items that enable versioning status labels. Those actions do exactly the same thing only 
for different versioning system.

Recommendation: Integrate those actions into one menu item and call it Show Versioning Status Labels.

It should be fixed for 6.0 M10. Please reassign to responsible engineer.

Josef Pavlicek is your usability contact regarding this issue.

short_description: Detect threading conflicts which prevent from method invocation to be completed.
long_description:
During evaluation of expressions where method invocation is involved it can
happen that the method execution can not be finished due to synchronization
issues. When other threads (which are suspended during expression evaluation)
hold locks which are needed by the evaluation threads the evaluation can not be
completed. In this case the debugger functionality is blocked which have
serious user impact.

We need to monitor the state of the evaluation thread and resolve the situation
when a deadlock in the evaluation process is detected.

short_description: Infinate Recursive Method Crashes IRB
long_description:
Given the following class:

class Recursive
  
  def method_missing(method)
    puts There was no #{methd} method but please try again.
  end
end

(note the spelling error #{methd})

Open IRB
> load 'main.rb'
> r = Recursive.new
> r.anything

IRB will crash. Running this from the command line smartly returns a stack level too deep error.

short_description: Clean xml/www/*/plans/features.* structure
long_description:
- Move all features.* to data/ folder.
- generate one compact www/plans/features.xml file.
- add xml to list of modules which has features.xml file.

short_description: Inconsistent formatting of blank lines before comment
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 20090113073351)
Java: 1.6.0_11 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 11.0-b16
System: Linux version 2.6.24-23-generic running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb)

The formatting of blank lines before comment depends on white chars in the empty lines. This makes the formatting look
inconsistent. 

Example (default settings):
Have a code:
public class TestClass {

    int a

    //comment
    int b
}

if there are no chars (spaces tab) in the empty line between a and b the line is kept after reformat 
it there is a white space (e.g. for spaces inserted by indentation) the empty line is removed

short_description: Clicking on element in iOS simulator when Inspect Mode is on does not select this element
long_description:
1. Create a HTML5 application (e.g. using the Initializr Responsive template)
2. Set target browser to iOS Simulator and run the app - app will be opened in Safari in the simulator
3. In CSS Styles window turn on Inspect Mode in Browser
4. Click the page in Simulator to inspect elements

=> The clicked element is not selected instead it behaves as being hovered on. I.e. there is the blue background with description in the yellow rectangle but the dotted-line rectangle around the element does not appear. Also in the IDE the element is highlighted as hovered but the selection does not change.

short_description: Do not show Test Libraries if there are no Test Sources
long_description:
A j2seproject should not show a Test Libraries
node if there are no unit tests (i.e. no existing
test source directories) it is just distracting.

short_description: No documentation for Knockout functions displayed in JavaScript code completion
long_description:
1. Create a KnockoutJS application e.g. using the must-play games list sample
2. Open models/gamelistviewmodels.js
3. Press Ctrl+Space inside a KnockoutJS function call e.g. inside 'computed' on line 12

=> Documentation window does not display any documentation.

Even a partial fix would be useful e.g. enabling the external browser icon in
the bar at the top of this window and displaying text To view documentation
for this function press the [web browser] button in the toolbar above this
text. This icon would point to some section of the Knockout documentation: http://knockoutjs.com/documentation/introduction.html

(BTW documentation already works in HTML files for Knockout attributes.)

short_description: ant-test-classpath: Using : instead of  to seperate pathes in windows Environment
long_description:
in ant-test I was trying to customize the parameters for java. I put several 
jars with full pathes to classpath. Later I found that the component used : 
to seperate pathes which mixed with the : after the driver letter. e.g. I 
was trying to have d:\myprogram\t1.jarc:\java\t2.jar as classpath. The ant-
test thought this as four parts: d \myprogram\t1.jar c \java\t2.jar.

short_description: Deadlock between FaceletsLibrarySupport and WebAppMetadataModelImpl
long_description:
This issue was reported manually by sdedic.
It already has 2 duplicates 


Build: NetBeans IDE 7.3 (Build 201302132200)
VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 17.1-b03 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.6.0_22-b04
OS: Windows 7

User Comments:
daveo17: Every time I pull a new version of a java system net bean's background scanning hangs at 99 or 100%.  Then it magically decides to finish. In the future with no code changes the background scans complete normally. No error are identified in the code.

I updated to JDK 1.7.2. I am using Windows 7 ultimate 64 bit with 8 gb ram.

I have exited and re-entered the IDE rebooted my computer and do not find a pattern.

I have waited hours for it to finish. This is wasting a lot of time. With the number of other reports of this error I am surprised at the lack of response to correct a serious issue.

Scenario:
- Open Options tab
- Select Miscellaneous category
- Activate Diff tab

Test report:
Mnemonic conflict in Options window. 2 components has same code ('I'): Internal Diff Import...

short_description: Infinite Loop in TokenListUpdater
Convert string concatenation to a message template refactoring produces incomplete result
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201511260002)
Java: 1.8.0_72 Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 25.72-b07

Steps to reproduce:
We have logger code with concatenated strings and corresponding 'Inefficient use...' warning:

logger.log(Level.INFO Converting:  + value +  (  + value.getClass() +  )  +  for:  + component)

invoke Convert string concatenation to a message template refactoring.

expected result:
logger.log(Level.INFO Converting: {0} ( {1} )  for: {2} new Object[]{value value.getClass() component})

short_description: GuardedSestion vs. Add New Line Before Brace
long_description:
This problem happens when you have a java file template that contains a simple
section with method header. The header must be written on a single line (the
method opening brace must be on the same line where the method signature is).

See attachment an example of the template.

You have to have a Add New Line Before Brace java editor option is enabled.

Now when a user creates a file from the template the code is reorganized and
the brace is moved to the new line but the guarded section is not expanded - so
it is still only one line. Therefore the brace moved outside of the guarded block.

This bug is similar to #66453.

short_description: The Print buttons are disabled when bring up help from Help button.
long_description:
To reproduce the bug:

1. Select Tools->Debugging Options in the main window.
   --> Debugging Options dialog pops up. 
2. Click Help button in the Debugging Options dialog.
   --> A Help window pops up.
3. Click Print (or Page Setup) icon in the Help window.
   --> A Print (or Page Setup) dialog pops up.
4. All buttons radio buttons text fields in the Print 
   (or Page Setup) dialog are unaccessible. 

Other dialogs with Help button also have this problem. 
e.g New Wizard (Select File->New in the main window)

Workaround: Bring up the Help Window by selecting Help in the
main window will not have this problem.

short_description: Implement necessary architecture changes
long_description:
There is a set of architecture changes that
NetBeans are asked to implement and there is also
a proposal describing the ideal solution:

http://openide.netbeans.org/proposals/arch/installation.html

In order to proceed with implementation we need to
find out order of steps how we will implement it
and a subset that would be enough for first
version. These steps are sumarized in a page:

http://openide.netbeans.org/proposals/arch/status.html

where a possible impact of these changes is analyzed. 

I am asking for a review of the installation
proposal (even it has been review many times in
past) but more importantly a review of steps
plan. Whether minimal maximal optimal solutions
are really minimal maximal and optimal whether
the selected solution really satisfies the
requirements and whether the influence on others
is correct.

short_description: EditorSupport.Editor components do not reapply modified suffix after display name change of object`s node delegate.
long_description:
I.e. if an object with a special display name for its node delegate is opened in a default EditorSupport.Editor window the modification suffix  * is applied upon modification however if the dis
play name is changed while the file is open and modified the window title becomes the new display name but without the modification suffix.

[jglick] Still not fixed in 483. I think the problem is that EditorSupport.Editor calls super(DataObject). TopComponent.NodeName attaches its own display name listener and probably clobbers whatever l
istener EditorSupport may have for this.

IMHO TC.NodeName and new TC(DataObject) should not be used at all by EditorSupport.Support (they are an ugly part of the API anyway). Note that EditorSupport.Editor.updateName already seems to update
the name correctly so using TC.NodeName is probably not even necessary just some listener needs to call EditorSupport.Editor.updateName whenever the node delegate`s display name changes (rather than
 have saveCookieL listen to DataObject.PROP_NAME).

[Dafe] I think I fixed it long time ago but I didn`t report it. Anyway it looks ok to me now....

short_description: Allow plugin to select mode for window docking
long_description:
Created attachment 164218
Proposed changes

If the configuration does not define a Mode to dock a new window into the current system chooses the last-used editor mode. If there are more editor modes available the opened editor may end up in an unsuitable position. 
The application (or plugins) should be able to select precise Mode to dock new windows into. If no plugin wants to specify the position the current default will be used.

Please review the attached diff

short_description: RFS cannot pass FS TCK tests testDefaultMimeTypeForBinaryFiles() and testToURL()
long_description:
Class org.openide.filesystems.FileObjectTestHid has 2 suspicious tests that are failed for remote FS.

The test testDefaultMimeTypeForBinaryFiles() assumes that class cannot be extended. Line:
InputStream is = getClass ().getResourceAsStream(FileObjectTestHid.class)
returns null.
Proposed fix:
InputStream is = getClass ().getResourceAsStream(getClass().getName().substring(getClass().getName().lastIndexOf('.')+1)+.class)

The test  testToURL() assumes that URI has empty user and port. Line:
URI uri2 = new URI(uri1.getScheme() uri1.getHost() path2 null)
returns wrong URI.
Proposed fix:
URI uri2 = new URI(uri1.getScheme() uri1.getUserInfo() uri1.getHost() uri1.getPort() path2 null null)

So tests should be fixed or removed from FS TCK.

short_description: Cannot pull from upstream if branch is removed by another user
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. User A creates a repository and creates branches master and dev
2. User B clones it fetching both branches and creating a new branch dev from origin/dev
3. User B switches to branch origin/master creating branch master
4. User A deletes branch dev and pushes it to remote
5. User B tries use Pull from upstream.

It will fail and there is no way of fixing except by editing git files by hand.

short_description: serious memory leak in html validator
long_description:
Extracted from the issue #143453 comment #38:

http://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=143453#c38

According the last attached memory dump it looks like problem in the HTML
validator because it eats alsmost 250 MB of ram. The problem can be in
REPORTED_RUNTIME_EXCEPTIONS map which is static and keeps anonymous inner
classes marker but IMHO such anonymous class keeps reference into the
enclosing whole instance of ValidationTransaction. 


Assigning to Marek it his code.

----------------

Petr's evaluation is correct.

fixed in web-main#c6b1d86726a9

Petre can you please review the fix? I think it must be integrated into 7.0. 

Thanks

long_description:
Created attachment 153367
IDE log and full thread dump

Consider a situation when a certain directory is very slow (for example is a broken link). Once I tried to expand such directory no other directory can be expanded. In my case it hanged for 5 minutes.

short_description: a11y a lot of useless tab stops on Customization dialog.
long_description:
There are three useful a11y items on Customization dialog (list Ok cancel) and seven tab stops.
One should press Tab four times to proceed from list to Ok button through three useless items.

short_description: Reload on save not supported in mobile browsers
long_description: not supported on both iOS and Android

short_description: Remove SystemOption usage from IDESettings
long_description: Use NbPreferences.

short_description: setFullScreenMode property is missing in Canvas based custom components
long_description:
(it was bug 6389557) 

---Decription---
setFullScreenMode property is missing in Canvas based custom components - the
users using  custom components cannot utilize all features available in the
platform. The most notable this problem is in SplashScreen and WaitScreen
components.
--------------

---Comments---
verified in trunk build 0419
--------------

---Evaluation---
This have to be solved by adding a Canvas component to the model which will
include this property as defined.
--------------

short_description: Umbrella: Web inspection issues with Chrome 37/38 Dev
long_description: This is an umbrella issue for problems with Chrome 37/Chrome 38 (both Dev - not stable). It seems like there are some changes in the websocket protocol which causes several issues in NetBeans.

short_description: Release Patch 2 issues
long_description:
When I attempt to try and upgrade the various netbeans components (all 51) to the latest version I firstly get an error
with 'could not install modules 'Groovy Refactoring' and after I choose to continue the IDE attempts to reboot itself as
per normal. From then on the ide splash screen shows for a little while and then I get a NoSuchMethodError alert box
show whenever I run netbeans.

I have attempted to reinstall from scratch 3 times and each is the same. Initially the IDE runs fine but as soon as I
upgrade the problems occur.

short_description: Allow bootclasspath classes to be on classpath (and bootclasspath to be empty)
long_description:
Created attachment 130556
Fallback to compile classpath before changing the source level

Bck2brwsr reimplements core Java classes. It moreover splits them into multiple modules. In order to get proper view of classes available on the platform it is desirable to skip classpath completely (done as enhancement 223682).

However if I do it it turns out that the java.source module switches to -source 1.3 (as it cannot find AssertionError or StringBuilder). I have them only on classpath and the java.source searches only bootclasspath or the sourcepath.

Here is a little patch that works in my case. When the bootclasspath is empty (and it is because of enhancement 223682) also search compile classpath.

short_description: Netbeans New Web Application Wizard Hangs with the message Adding Selected Frameworks
long_description:
This may well be something that got broken following the recent OSX Updates + Java Update 4 from Apple.

When trying to create a new Web Project Netbeans hangs on the Frameworks section of the New Web Application Wizard with the message Adding 
Selected Frameworks. For clarity.... NO frameworks were selected. Various combinations of options were tried but the results were the same!

This has been tested on a MacBook Pro 17 running 10.5.7 a Mac Mini running 10.5.7 and a Mac Pro running 10.5.7. 

The problem persists on ALL the above machines and is a total show stopper. We have not been able to figure out a workaround short of rebuilding our Macs 
with an old version of OSX.

short_description: Misc. reorganizations in Project API
long_description:
I would like to make some changes in some APIs in
projects/projectapi for the following reasons:

1. Reduced likelihood that an API client would
need to import a class from the SPI.

2. Better evolvability of interfaces - it is
generally not safe for clients to directly look
for things in Project.lookup. (OK to keep the same
interface for API and SPI since it is possible to
introduce new interfaces for API and/or SPI in the
future and proxy both ways.)

3. Better event firing support is definitely
needed in some cases and may plausibly be needed
in others later (use cases under consideration)
easiest to add the API now. In some cases (SPP)
the actual firing code could be deferred until
some client tries to listen.

Proposed changes:

1. Move ProjectInformation and Sources and
SourceGroup to the API package since these can be
of interest to API clients.

2. Add a method to ProjectUtils to get a Sources
object for a Project - should check Project.lookup
and fall back to SourceContainers.genericOnly.

3. Add some kind of event firing capabilities to
Sources and SourceGroup.

4. [Maybe] Add 'icon' and (code) 'name' properties
to SourceGroup to make it easier to list a bunch
of source groups as nodes e.g. in the Files tab.

5. Fix the name SourceContainers which is obsolete.

6. [Maybe] Permit changes to be fired from
SubprojectProvider.

Would of course involve adjusting all stable
netbeans.org modules to use the new APIs.

short_description: Netbinox caches should not crash product if findInstallationArea() changes
long_description:
See Oracle bug 16450627: INVALIDEXCEPTION :CANNOT START ORG.ECLIPSE.EQUINOX.COMMON  .

In the above bug JDev a product running the Netbinox platform crashes if its NB caches are corrupted. In the above case it crashed because the value of 'netbeans.dirs' was different at the time the cache was built and the time the product was ran. The system property 'osgi.install.area' which is equal to the root that every cache entry will be made relative to is computed by NB as the most common prefix of all entries of 'netbeans.dirs' the caches gave us back the wrong jar locations and JDev crashed. 

The resolution for that bug was to invalidate the caches from the JDev side. But since finding all cases where the cache should be invalidated is a such a ad-hoc error-prone process the caching mechanism should be forgiving enough and not crash the entire product. NB caching is an optimization so--ideally anyway--failure in it should never crash our product but possibly only run slower.

short_description: Root method is not instrumented unless it is selected after it has been excersised
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. I choose Run Main Project from the Run menu 
which then causes Tomcat to start.
2. Profile->Attach and Profile
3. I click the big Analyze Performance button on 
the big profile dialog box.
4. I click the Part of Application radio button
5. I click the Select... button to choose a root 
method.
6. After selecting the method I highlight it in 
the list that is in the Specify Root Methods 
dialog.
7. I click on the attach button of the big 
profile dialog box and then put in the PID for 
Tomcat and click OK.
8. The profiler attachs to Tomcat and I see the 
standard three graphs but on the bottom border 
of the NetBeans window it says: Instrumentation - 
None.  This is a bit confusing to me.  I 
selected Analyze Performance so why am I not 
analyzing CPU performance?
9. I Exercise the application so that it will hit 
the selected method.  Bottom border of the NB 
window now says: Instrumentation: CPU 5 methods 
instrumented.
10. Click the Get Current Results icon and the 
message No profiling results available yet is 
displayed.  This seems a bit odd.
11. Click Modify Profiling
12. Click Select... button to choose a root 
method.  The Specify Root Methods dialog displays 
and the method I selected is still shown in the 
list box but it is no longer highlighted.
13. So I highlight the method in the list that is 
in the Specify Root Methods dialog.
14. Click OK.
15. Exercise the app. to again hit the selected 
method.  Bottom line of window now says: 
Instrumentation: CPU 3419 methods instrumented
16. Click the Get Current Results icon and see 
the CPU performance numbers.

short_description: Missing Node actions(cut/copy/open...) from the 'more' menu in search results window
long_description:
To reproduce:

0) Launch netbeans have an open project with files containing text.
1) Select a file/folder and perform a 'Find...' or 'Find in Projects' action searching for something you know will return matches.
2) In the search results window select the node(dataobject's node delegate) for one of the files that file.
3) right-click on that node then hover over the 'More' JPopupMenuItem in the jpopup window.
4) Note that some of the menu items are missing from the 'More' pop-out menu even though they show up (and are enabled) when you right-click on the node for that same file on the Project Explorer(or Files or Favorites tabs...). The actions that are most noticeably missing are: Open Cut Copy Rename and maybe a few others (oddly the 'Delete' action still shows up even though it seems to follow the same design pattern/inheritance... as some of the ones missing).

I attempted to debug the issue and discovered that it is being caused by the actions for those classes returning false on calls to isEnabled() This should not be the case since the node/dataobjects can indeed be 'Opened' Copied ....

See: org.netbeans.modules.search.ui.MoreAction.java (line 167: 'if(!action.isEnabled()){')

The isEnabled() method is returning false because the action 'key' cannot be found in the global lookup when the Search Window has focus.

When I degugged further and got into the findAction() method in the class GeneralAction.java the call to 'global.findGlobalAction(key)' returned null.

private Action findAction() {
   Action a = global.findGlobalAction(key)
   return a == null ? fallback : a
}

I'm thinking that some property/registration is missing on the TopComponent for the Search window that causes the global action lookup to not contain keys for those actions. Please investigate and fix. 

Having the 'More' menu in the search result window is a very nice feature but I was disappointed when I could not find the 'copy' option when I wanted to copy a few files that matched my search pattern.

short_description: I18N - duplicate key in same bundle file
long_description:
The same key appears multiple times in a bundle file.  If each
messages should be different or should be used independently
then each messages should have different keys.  If the message
is used at a single place then multiple occurrences should be
unified.

This duplication means that it's not known at runtime which
message will be used.  This issue also increases translation
cost (time and effort).

short_description: Watches are not updated after creating a new object for a field of some class. (Build444)
long_description:
For example consider the following piece of code:

String [] strings = new String [10]
  for (int x=0 x<10 x++)
    strings[x] = new String (aaa)

Trace through the loop two times (i.e. two Strings are created). Add watch `strings`. Expand it.
Two subitems are expandable now.
Continue with tracing through the loop - new Strings are created but they does not appear in the tree.
There are still only two expandable subitems.

It means - update is done only first time after expanding of a watch.
The problem occurs only when a new object is created for a field with the value null.

============

short_description: Guarded blocks are not visible and guarded
long_description: Resolved for 3.4.x or earlier no new info since then -> closing.

short_description: Renaming UserType class does not update Hibernate mapping files
long_description:
In a Hibernate mapping file the type attribute for a mapped property can contain the FQCN for a class which
implements the org.hibernate.usertype.UserType interface.  However if you rename such a class it doesn't refactor the
mapping file(s) where that type is used (nor is the type hyperlinked when you Ctrl-click it).

short_description: jaxws-build.xml file is missing wsimport task
long_description:
There is a bug in Netbeans 6.7.1 when using weblogic 10.

The jaxws-build.xml file is missing the wsgen-service-compile task which generates the jaxws artifacts for weblogic.
This results in a class not found error when deploying web service

This is missing in Netbeans 6.7.1. You can work around this by adding this to the build.xml instead. It works in 6.5.1


        <webproject2:javac srcdir=${build.generated.dir}/wsgen/service
classpath=${j2ee.platform.wsimport.classpath}:${javac.classpath} destdir=${build.classes.dir}/>


The jaxws-build.xml file in Netbeans 6.5.1:


<project xmlns:xalan=http://xml.apache.org/xslt xmlns:webproject2=http://www.netbeans.org/ns/web-project/2
xmlns:jaxws=http://www.netbeans.org/ns/jax-ws/1>
    <!--
                ===================
                JAX-WS WSIMPORT SECTION
                ===================
            -->
    
        
        
        
        
        
            <classpath
path=${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar:${build.classes.dir}:${j2ee.platform.wsgen.classpath}:${javac.classpath}/>
        
    
    
        <wsgen sourcedestdir=${build.generated.dir}/wsgen/service
resourcedestdir=${build.generated.dir}/wsgen/service/resources/ destdir=${build.generated.dir}/wsgen/binaries
xendorsed=true keep=true genwsdl=true sei=com.nokia.mes.Testing>
            <classpath
path=${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar:${build.classes.dir}:${j2ee.platform.wsgen.classpath}:${javac.classpath}/>
        
    
    
        <webproject2:javac srcdir=${build.generated.dir}/wsgen/service
classpath=${j2ee.platform.wsimport.classpath}:${javac.classpath} destdir=${build.classes.dir}/>
    


and in 6.7.1:


<project xmlns:xalan=http://xml.apache.org/xslt xmlns:webproject2=http://www.netbeans.org/ns/web-project/2
xmlns:jaxws=http://www.netbeans.org/ns/jax-ws/1>
    <!--
                ===================
                JAX-WS WSIMPORT SECTION
                ===================
            -->
    
        
        
        
            <classpath
path=${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar:${build.classes.dir}:${j2ee.platform.wsgen.classpath}:${javac.classpath}/>
        
    
    
        <wsgen sourcedestdir=${build.generated.sources.dir}/jax-ws
resourcedestdir=${build.generated.sources.dir}/jax-ws/resources/ destdir=${build.generated.sources.dir}/jax-ws
verbose=true xendorsed=true keep=true genwsdl=true sei=com.nokia.mes.ws.Testing>
            <classpath
path=${java.home}/../lib/tools.jar:${build.classes.dir}:${j2ee.platform.wsgen.classpath}:${javac.classpath}/>

short_description: [36cat] Code completion exception raising when writting an empty HTML tag.
long_description:
[ BUILD # : RC1 ]
[ JDK VERSION : J2SE 1.4.2_02 ]

How to reproduce it:

1) Create a new HTML file from wizard's form.
2) Remove the entire contents.
3) Write --without -- table and press 
Enter.
   The document should look like:

table

4) Go up one line to table's start write < and 
wait for code completion to appear.
5) Press End key as though you wanted to go to 
line's end. Instead code completion will take to 
list's end.
6) Regardless of what code completion shows type
>. An execption will raise. If not then press 
Ctrl-space.

This is how the document may look:

table

with the caret after the > symbol.

short_description: Spring registration dialog is inconsistent with JSF
long_description:
1. Create a new Java web application
2. On the Frameworks panel in the wizard select Spring
3. You will see two tabs at the bottom labeled Configuration and Libraries in this order. 

This order is inconsistent with JSF where the Libraries is first. Spring should be made consistent so Libraries is first as well.

short_description: Support ability implement Rename/Move/Delete/Copy refactoring of non-java files
long_description:
It seems that the current refactoring API is designed to only support 
refactoring of Java files. However there is a need to be able to support 
refactoring of non-java files such as JSP file. For example the Creator 
product currently supports refactoring of JSF based jsp pages. The same 
functionality will need to be supported in the pack for of it.

short_description: Deprecate XMLSyntaxSupport over obsolete lexer
long_description:
The org.netbeans.modules.xml.text.syntax package uses ancient lexer which is both slow an unmaintained. This package is an API and contains reference to TokenItem etc so it cannot be really fixed.

New API should be created which uses the new lexer (or does not expose lexer types at all).

Modules in NB distro should be upgraded to use the new API the old API should move to a obsolete module which will be injected into build/runtime using module-auto-deps feature.

short_description: Throw checked exception instead of RuntimeException
long_description:
We should avoid of throwing Runtime exceptions (and its childs - 
UnexpectedExceptionError & NotImplementedException) everywhere. We should throw 
any checked exception instead so that we would be able to process it. In cases 
when we need to throw such an exception we should log it as well.

short_description: Please provide hint include header should be first include in implementation
long_description:
It would be great if IDE shows hint with fix (and inspect) in case:
- let you have a header Class.h and implementation Class.cpp
- Class.cpp has a lot of include directive one of the them is '#include Class.h'
Show hint if the 
#include Class.h
directive is not first in the include directives list.
Fix should move it on top of #include list

short_description: List of installed components is not quite clear sometimes
long_description:
Installer screen: NetBeans IDE Setup - Features Setup.

1. Unmark the checkbox NetBeans IDE 6.0
2. Expand the root tree node Runtimes
3. Mark the checkbox GlassFish v2...
4. Collapse the root tree node Runtimes

Result:
User doesn't see which components will be installed but warning message You
didn't select... with red icon will not appear below of component list.
The root tree node Runtimes should be implemented as a checkbox to show (when
a tree is collapsed) whether some components-subnodes are selected or not.

short_description: BadLocationException from DocCache thrown in console sometimes from Editor after closing file.
long_description: See attached exception. Does not seem to harm anything.

short_description: NbArtifactFixer can trigger nested project loading
long_description:
Created attachment 113624
Stack trace after multi-minute hang probably on GF sources

NbArtifactFixer loads the actual Project represented by an artifact owner only to return the location of its pom.xml. This is wasteful. The only purpose is to ensure that the POM version matches the artifact that could usually be determined more cheaply as ProjectOpenedHookImpl.registerWithSubmodules does for groupId/artifactId.
