short_description: I18N - some words in a jdbc bundle need to be translatable or marked as not to translate
long_description:
there are some values in a bundle file of org-netbeans-modules-jdbcwizard
that either should be made as separate words to be translated or marked with
#NOI18N comment to be clear not to translate since when 2 words together
with no separation it can be thought its a function/method name
and might not be translated.

LBL_DataSource=DataSource
FMT_PhysicalView_GroupName=GroupName
LBL_Col_PollRecords=PollRecords

and should this one be translated or not if not put the #NOI18N comment
LBL_SimpleTargetChooserPanelGUI_NewFilePrefix=new

please review other bundle files in this jar and others in xml or wsdl or xsl areas to make sure
all words that can be translated are written as 2 separate words if they are together as above or 
marked with #NOI18N if they might be viewed as traslatable but should not be.

short_description: IllegalStateException thrown in JavaPackageImpl.addRealPackage
long_description:
Reported by Peter Pisl (issue 48703)

1) start the IDE with the new userdir
2) create new web project - the index.jsp is
opened in the editor
3) press F6 - the Tomcat is started and the
index.jsp is displayed in the browser
4) invoke the View Servlet from context menu over
the editor -> the index_jsp.java is opened in the
editor. It's OK.
5) go back into the index.jsp and add a text.
press the F6 again - the page is recompiled and
displayed in the browser
6) go to the index_jsp.java editor and move with
scrollbar to the end and to the begin
7) shutdown the ide -> the
java.lang.IllegalStateException is thrown

on the modification status of the edited file - as it does in the main editor 
pane.

short_description: [ED-44] Hard to find javadoc for given method
long_description:
Finding	
Participant wanted to look at javadoc of a method he just used in the source code. He wanted to check 
whether it returns null. He invoked Shift-F1 which opened the javadoc tab but it just said: No 
Documentation Found.. So he tried some other shortcuts: F1 which showed basic help Ctrl-F1 did 
nothing. Then he went to the help menu: It's not clear how to find quick javadoc for given method. 
Maybe it's not set.. So he tried contextual menu on JDK node and Show Javadoc was disabled. After a 
while: Maybe I should set it somewhere.. He went to options. I don't know. I don't like it that I cannot 
see javadoc. And continues without it.

Severity	
1 participant was quite upset that he couldn't access javadoc and he didn't know why and couldn't find 
where to set it

Recommendation	
Every place that shows up javadoc should tell the user where to set it if it's not found. In this case if the 
javadoc tab explained that to the user he could have found it. Also the Show Javadoc menu item 
should be enabled even if javadoc is not set and open up a dialog that would tell the user how to setup 
javadoc.

short_description: Wizards should support informational error messages
long_description:
Today wizards support only red error messages and warning messages. According to document
http://wiki.netbeans.org/InformationIcons there is also need to support error messages in normal (usually black) color
with info icon (see document for details).
Please implement such support.
This support is required by Issue 137076.
Thanks!

short_description: Set up default build target when creating java project
long_description:
The java project created from NFT wizard should
always set some build target as a default one so
that it won't complain when user builds it. If
there is only Compiled Classes b.t. then it should
be the default b.t. but in case of additional
build steps like packaging etc. it might make
sense to have some of these steps as a default
b.t. (perhaps the last one).

short_description: Provide a fast-and-dirty parser for class/interface inheritance hierarchy
long_description:
It would be useful to have a very fast parser for Java 
files which would not parse the whole file but only 
enough to determine the class name its superclass and 
superinterfaces. This partial data about classes could 
also be stored in the MDR.

Such a parser could then be used in the FileObject 
recognition process. So a module could register a 
dataloader that accepts Java classes which extend class 
java.applet.Applet or classes that implement interface 
javax.servlet.Servlet and provide functionality specific 
to these files.

short_description: Adding two beans to the same palette category in sequence in a multiuser install messes up the palette names.
long_description:
Add one bean to a palette category say Beans in a multiuser install. (E.g. Tools -> Add to Palette...) The category is now named Beans [Local] (as a display name) since the folder on disk is now l
ocally present in nbuser. Fine. Now add a second bean and choose Beans [Local] from the list. A new palette category physically named Beans [Local] is created and the bean added to it. So now the p
alette displays Beans [Local] as well as Beans [Local] [Local]!

See ComponentPalette.java line 272 for a possible offender. The display name will include the [Local] suffix. You could use getName to simply omit this suffix and skip the display name or use both ge
tName and getDisplayName and use one for adding the bean the second for showing to the user.

[jglick later] This will be more important after localized file names because this problem may take effect on the Swing (Other) tab as well as any tab in a localized installation.

short_description: JSF 2.2 Composite components ignored when are inside Taglib
long_description:
Created attachment 151978
Proyect with the smallest possible test case

According to Jsf 2.2 specification you can add composite components to your taglibs but Netbeans complains about not found the component and when you run the web app it works well.

With an example provided from https://jsflive.wordpress.com/2013/04/06/jsf22-cc-taglib/ i created and added a composite component to my taglib:
(test.taglib) With 2 components one composite:

    
        decorated
        ui/decorated.xhtml
    
    
        compositeTest
        
            ui/compositeTest.xhtml
        
    

Then when i try to use in a view the autocomplete can get me the decorated component but netbeans complains about The component library http://test.org/jsf/ui does not contain component compositeTest if you ignore the error and run the app the everything work as spected.
Attached a simple test case created with NB 8.0.2 and Glassfish tested in ubuntu you can see how the editor mark an error but if you run the app the two components are rendered fine.

short_description: Provide easier way to create a Lookup over an SFS folder
long_description:
Currently the procedure for creating a lookup over a system filesystem folder is
a bit compicated since people often need to create registries of objects:

try {
new FolderLookup
(DataFolder.findFolder(Repository.getDefault().getDefaultFileSystem().getRoot().getFileObject(com/foo/bar))).getLookup()
} catch (DataObjectNotFoundException donfe) {
  //do something
}

I'm attaching a patch which adds the method Lookups.forPath(String path).  It
defines an SPI interface which is implemented in DataSystems using FolderLookup.

Benefits:
 - It's much more intuitive and simple
 - Nobody is directly depending on either the System Filesystem or
DataSystems/FolderLookup - could be replaced if desired

Objections?

BTW I'm having some problems getting the unit test working - using MockServices
seems to get me a Lookup that some part of core someone tries to load can't use:
 java.lang.ClassCastException: org.openide.util.Lookup$DefLookup cannot be cast
to org.netbeans.core.startup.MainLookup
        at
org.netbeans.core.startup.MainLookup.moduleClassLoadersUp(MainLookup.java:86)
        at
org.netbeans.core.startup.MainLookup.systemClassLoaderChanged(MainLookup.java:79)

Otherwise I believe it should work - all very straightforward.

short_description: Add a11y support to WizardDescriptor
long_description:
From a discussion with the a11y team:

WizardDescriptor:
http://ui.netbeans.org/docs/wizards_styleguide/wizard.html
    An array of innerPanes are passed to WizardDescriptor and each innerPane
should have accessibleDescription related to content of innerPane.  This means
each WizardDescriptor.Panel's  return from getComponent() will be used to set
the description.

    In addition the open ide core support will be responsible for concatenating
the step titles to the a11y description of the component.  That way the
component could have a description which is used if it is shown in a gui
somewhere not in the context of a wizard and if it is put in a wizard the step
title will automatically be added to the beginning of the description.

short_description: Incorrect sun-resources.xml configuration for IBM AS/400 back-end
long_description:
Using the popular jt400 JDBC driver for IBM's midrange iSeries AS/400 database yields incorrect default configuration
properties in Netbeans 6.0 Beta 2.

The correct datasource-classname attribute for the jdbc-connection-pool tag is:

datasource-classname=com.ibm.as400.access.AS400JDBCDataSource

The incorrect default which is read from the driver while creating a connection in Netbeans is
com.ibm.as400.access.AS400JDBCDriver and will fail when deployed to Glassfish v2 as a connection pool with an error
stating that it cannot be converted to a javax.sql.DataSource.

Also an additional serverName property is necessary to complete the connection:



While the serverName may not be a possibility which is understandable the correct DataSource class should be read
from the driver at the very least.

short_description: POST and PUT requests should be used according to Container REST Pattern
long_description:
- Create JEE6 Web Project
- Generate RESTful web service from db.
- There will be Stateless Facade beans with create() and edit() methods.
According to Container patter http://developer.mindtouch.com/en/kb/REST/REST_Patterns/Container_Pattern PUT request should be used for resource 
replacing and POST request should be used for resource creation.
It means that create() and edit() methods should be annotated by @POST and  
@PUT respectively.

short_description: Project save is trying to serialize default file system
Refactoring packages to use different case results in package already exists in refactor dialog
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.2 Beta (Build 201205031832)
Operating System = Windows 7 version 6.1 running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.7.0_05
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 23.1-b03

It should be possible on windows to refactor a package (or class??) to have a name that differs only in case.

While the OS does not distinguish between names the JVM does.

To reproduce create a package. Click the name and press CTRL-R. Type the existing name with different capitalization.

Workaround: Create a package. Click the name and press CTRL-R. Rename to some arbitrary name. Click the new package and press CTRL-R. Rename to the desired name.

short_description: Diagram documentation lost on upgrade 6.1 to 6.5
long_description:
After migrating UML diagrams (class state sequence activity) from 6.1 to 6.5 documentation present on diagram level
is lost.

This is possibly due to the fact that in 6.1 those documentations were kept in the .etlp files whereas in 6.5 they are
part of the .etd file.

Documentation of single elements of a diagram like an invocation in an activity diagram appears to be unaffected by this.

short_description: AutoUpdate Client and Module Manager usability improvements
long_description: UI changes of AutoUpdate wizard and Module Manager.

short_description: wrong event sent by ProxyClassPathImplementation.DelegatesListener
long_description:
Hello it seems the event sent in
ProxyClassPathImplementation.DelegatesListener.propertyChange is tagged with
a wrong source object (the listener itself instead of the
ProxyClassPathImplementation object). It leads ClassPath not to be able
to detect and propagate changes to its own listeners (ClassPath.SPIListener
verifies that the source *is* the same ClassPathImplementation passed in
ClassPath constructor).

The fix is trivial (ProxyClassPathImplementation line 98):

-            PropertyChangeEvent event = new PropertyChangeEvent (this
evt.getPropertyName()nullnull)
+            PropertyChangeEvent event = new PropertyChangeEvent
(ProxyClassPathImplementation.this evt.getPropertyName()nullnull)

Best regards.
Eric.

short_description: JavaDoc incomplete in Mobility
long_description:
In Mobility Module the generated JavaDoc was incomplete. For example in Java ME Project all package.html and overview.html was ignored in the generated JavaDoc. In the standard Java Module (for example Java SE Projekt) is no problem the generated JavaDoc was complete with package- and overview-descriptions.

After resolving this issue a good idea were to get more settings for JavaDoc in Mobility Projects like Java SE Projekts.

short_description: NB3.4 does not recognize JSP files if the freestyle browser is installed
long_description:
See posts below. I have asked them to state
whether they did an import settings or not. We
need to follow up on these.
http://www.netbeans.org/servlets/ReadMsg?msgId=365306&listName=nbusers

Normally I would ask QA to follow up on this but

short_description: Error on Mercurial adding a large quantity of files BY Windows XP Command line limit?
long_description:
I was using mercurial (plugin in NB6.7) to manage my project (a lage quantity of source files) when I submit the 
source folder it reply me an exception said Can't find Mercurial ... yet the mercurial has already been installed 
and if I only submit several files it's OK.

So I decompiled the org-netbeans-modules-mercurial.jar and found that in util.HgCommand the doAdd method (Line: 
1876) didn't analyze the OS type and just made a whole command line and sent to exec and the exec sent to execEnv 
till a processBuilder handled this command line.

And then I think that I understand why submitting a large quantity of files may lead to an error only because the 
command line of Windows XP has limit of 8191 charactors. See: http://support.microsoft.com/kb/830473

So who will deal with this matter then? Or maybe someone can permit me to fix this issue?

short_description: Possible endless loop in WeakListenersImpl.ProxyListener()
long_description:
Created attachment 141552
proposed patch

In the constructor of WeakListenersImpl.ProxyListener there is an unsynchronized access to a static WeakHashMap. WeakHashMap itself is not threadsafe and must be wrapped in a synchronized container to prevent data structure corruption. The corruption has the effect of a tight loop and thus blocks the Thread. Not a deadlock but bad nonetheless.
Multi-threaded calls to

public static  T create(Class lType Class apiType T l Object source)

can lead to said corruption and block the caller Thread. The attached patch wraps the WeakHashMap in a synchronized Map and thus fixes this defect.

short_description: Project Properties > NetBeans Platform setting doesn't stick
long_description:
Using a recent dev build with NB-8.0.2 as a registered NB platform nb802.

Summary: change NBPlatform to nb802 close properties open properties
         NBPlatform still says default

Open a platfrom app module suite and many of its modules. This app behaves OK with 8.0.2. But runs into refactoring issues with dev/8.1 about openide.
(The platform app builds into its own cluster in case this might be part of
the issue)

Steps I took
- open project properties on module suite
- for NetBeansPlatform select nb802 in combo box
Observe
    there's a ! message:
        Module metawb in A MetaphysicalWorkbench depends
        on module guava in metaphysicalworkbench but this is excluded.
    Fix this by checking under Platform Modules
    the box metaphysicalworkbench which is my app-module-suite.
    FYI guava is a wrapper-module.

    Now there's the ! message:
        Module JavaFX wrapper in platform requests the token
        org.openide.modules.jre.JavaFX but there are no known providers.
    which I ignore
- click OK and close the dialog

- open project properties on module suite 
Observe
    The NetBeans Platform still says Default


Workaround
    Close the IDE manually edit the suite's platform properties
         metaphysical.workbench/nbproject/platform.properties
    and change nbplatform.active=default to
        nbplatform.active=nb802

    Restart IDE and things seem to be OK so far

short_description: IDE crashes when attempting to open for edit more than one jsp
long_description:
Hi

This is a show-stopper for me - I can open a single jsp for edit in the IDE but if I try and open a second jsp the
whole IDE application freezes - this occurs every time. One a related note if I open a single jsp and then click on a
second (without double-clicking to open) the IDE pauses and the Navigator pane freezes displaying please wait....
Sometime after 10 seconds the IDE becomes responsive again (but no detail is ever displayed within the navigator pane)
and I can click on other items. Other times the IDE briefly becomes responsive and the red error icon is displayed in
the bottom-right corner indicating a IllegalArgumentException has occurred but after I hover over the icon the IDE
locks up completely.

More detailed environment Info:
PC info
Fujitsu Siemens v5505 Laptop - 2.4Ghz Core 2 Duo 2Mb RAM Windows Vista (latest updates but no Service Pack 1)
NetBeans 6.1 Full bundle with all latest recommended IDE updates as of today
Java JDK 6 update 6 (32-bit)

Project Info
JEE 5 Web App using Spring (MVC) and Hibernate the jsps I am trying to access are located in a folder named jsp

Save All doesn't save tasklist
long_description:
The usertasks tasklist no longer auto saves. If I hit Save All in the toolbar
it doesn't work - the tasklist stays unsaved. This means that the IDE still
knows there are unsaved files. If I try to bring up the Project Properties it
keeps telling me I should save my work first. I have to manually bring up the
tasklist window make it active and hit the Save button there before I can proceed.

short_description: Output window does not re-minimize
long_description:
I minimized my output window.  

When using Netbeans 6.5 the output window restores itself when I do a build of my JavaEE project.  It then
're-minimizes' itself when I click in the Java editor window.

When using Netbeans 6.7M2 the output window does restore itself when I do a build.  However it stays restored when I
click in the Java editor window.  I have to click the Output 'tab' at the bottom of the IDE twice in order to get the
output window to minimize again.

Note the output window does have the correct controls on it one control to pin the window and one to close it.

short_description: Can't open right click menu on java file
long_description:
In the FFJ builds the persistence module adds an action directly to the java
data loader's menu.  Right clicking on the colorpicker/ColorPreview java file in
the build from 11/16 is fine but doing the same thing from an evening build on
11/19 causes a NPE.  The stack trace is attached but the interesting line is at
org.openide.util.actions.CookieAction.enable(CookieAction.java:102) which has
the code listener.setNodes(activatedNodes)

CookieAction.java changed on 11/19 and the cvs commit message for that revision
(1.19) mentions cleanup of listener handling so I suspect the persistence
module has exposed a case where listener is not properly initialized after the
cleanup.

short_description: Overflow checks of installed module null info hangs the IDE from closing
long_description:
When a series of nbm modules installed from disk using update center if one or more times the following INFO message
occurs the module that caused this INFO message is not installed properly and the an attempt to close the ide after
that results in hanging the IDE.
Message in the server.log

INFO [org.netbeans.modules.autoupdate.services.InstallSupportImpl]: Overflow checks of installed module null

How to reproduce -

Download the nbm files from https://open-esb.dev.java.net/Components.html  for each Binding Component ( sipftp
uddijdbc ldap xmpp) and try to install them from disk using the update center and close the IDE and IDE will hang
from closing.

short_description: MergedCPImpl should not ask for SFBQ result when source CP is added
long_description:
Currently when J2SEProject is opened it registers boot source and compile
classpaths into GlobalPathRegistry. MergedClassPathImplementation listens to
this adding change and then updates its entries and tries to attach SFBQListener
to each classpath.

This is wrong in case of SOURCE classpath - it does not pass root of any binary
so all the SFBQ implementations have to be queried. This causes expensive init
of J2EE SFBQ that evaluates plugins and j2ee platform.

Also it might be usefull to ensure that the implementations will be orderer and
j2se project/libs/platform will be queried first. It might work that way now but
it is not guaranteed.

short_description: How to run test...
long_description:
I used to be used to one shortcut: Ctrl-Shift+F6
that started my test when I was in the test file
and also when I was in the source file (which has
test associated). This does not work anymore. I
need to use different shortcut if I am in test and
another if I am in the source file. This doubles
amount of brain power I need to use when using the
IDE. Was that really necessary change?  I do not
care about the other shortcut but could the
Ctrl+Shitf+F6 be enabled in both cases? 


David Konecny napsal(a):
> I guess you talk about NetBeans project? 
> then it is my yesterday's change. synch 
> with J2SE project. see issue 43678

I see. I do not know how strange it to invoke a
test for a test but it was a bit simpler. Would
not it be possible to change the action name to
say Run Test ClassTest.java or just Run
ClassTest.java if test is selected then the
reason for the bug would be gone as well and my
problems with shortcuts would be gone as well.

short_description: [perf] Refactoring features demand much more memory than in competitive IDE
long_description:
The following numbers present a comparison of
memory demands of refactoring in our refactoring
build (040513) and in IDEA 4.0.3 on W2K with JDK
1.4.2_04. The numbers aa/bb represent the status
of heap after the action finished and garbage
collection was invoked several times.

1) JDK sources parsed after a new project creation:
IDEA: 16/31MB
ours: 40/77MB

2) project (jEdit) parsed after project open:
IDEA: 21/55MB
ours: 43/80MB

3) IDE started with a project open (jEdit):
IDEA: 26/50MB
ours: 30/60MB

4) platform change from 1.4.2_04 to 1.5.0-beta2:
IDEA: 28/62MB
ours: 47/91MB

5) Find Usages of a class name (jEdit):
IDEA: 37/99MB
ours: 161/254MB
(does not work with mx<=128MB at all!)

6) Rename of a class (jEdit):
IDEA: 50/105MB
ours: 154/254MB
(does not work with mx<=128MB at all!)

short_description: EXC_TemplateFailed displayed in dialog box after failed creation of object from template
long_description:
Observed in boston 1158. I tried to make a template something failed internally
(this using an experimental module so that is fine) and the IDE displayed a
message box with the text: EXC_TemplateFailed. Looking at the code in
NewNewAction it displays the bundle key instead of value!

Also in the trunk (Nov 20) NewTemplateAction should use ErrorManager.annotate
when displaying this message so as to preserve the stack trace from the
IOException which could be quite important.

short_description: [69cat] Usage Statistics window
long_description:
The following statement is present in the Usage Statistics window:

We will never reverse-engineer the collected data to find specific details about your projects.

The problem with this statement is that it implies that the collected data 'can' be reverse-engineered.

I'm not sure that this is the case that sensitive data is sent and can be reverse-engineered.

Clarification here is important as confidential projects cannot risk exposing sensitive data.

I would say something like the following if it is accurate: 

We will not and cannot reverse-engineer the collected data as specific details about your projects is never collected.

Thanks.

short_description: JAXB class regeneration and clean/build different
long_description:
In NB 6.5 RC1 using Sun JDK 1.6.0_07 I created a JAXB binding with the wizard using the attached schema. After
unmarshalling the attached XML file using the attached java source I expect the size of the list of Es to be 3. This is
the case when the JAXB classes are freshly created. After hitting clean and build however the list size is 0 (zero)!
After refreshing the schema in the project JAXB bindings node and regenerating the java code unmarshalling works
correctly again.

The only difference between the 4 generated classes is the different order of createA and createAttString in
ObjectFactory.java.

It makes no difference if I include the JAXB 2.1 library in the project settings or not.

short_description: With Rails projects the path of image is incorrect in the visual editor

public/application/stylecheets/project.css
public/application/stylecheets/img/my-image.gif

The result is '../img/my-image.gif' instead of 'img/my-image.gif'.

I don't know if it's related to Rails project.

it looks like the project folder *is* getting renamed.

Is this a cnd or netbeans issue? If netbeans make sure its unchanged in trunk
builds before reassigning.

short_description: Disconnect from remote host causes hang of IDE and GNOME desktop
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:
- add a remote host and set as default
- create a project
- build it
- open Services tab
- select the remote host under C/C++ Development Hosts node
- call Disconnect
Result: Empty Warning window appears and 5-10 sec later it displays A java.net.ConnectException has occured.....
After that nothing can be done neither with IDE nor with GNOME desktop as input focus gets stuck on the Warning window.

short_description: GdbDebugger.getExtension() would fail in remote debugging
long_description:
This is due to a change in http://hg.netbeans.org/main/rev/26f7dbe1f5f2 which made the getExtension()
method into a static method and switched from using the platform field to Utilities.getOperatingSystem().
I'm only making it a P4 because (currently) getExtension() is only called for local debugging and
it works for local debugging. But if it were used in remote debugging it would fail! IMHO this makes
it a dangerous change because the method could be used in remote development in the future.

The problem is that Utilities.getOperatingSystem() reflects the host the IDE is running on. In the
case of remote development platform may specify a different PlatformType than U.getOS().

For instance if you run netbeans on a Mac and remote debug on Solaris getOS() returns MacOSX and
you get a .dylib response from getExtension(). But since the remote host is Solaris you really
want .so (which you'd get with the non-static version of the method).

The difference between platform and Utilities.getOperatingSystem() is subtle. In some cases you do
want the local value in others you want the remote.

short_description: undo problems in properties editor exceptions and erratic behavior
long_description:
This is probably a jVi only problem (but not necessarily).

PropertiesEditorSupport does
        UndoRedoStampFlagManager extends UndoRedo.Manager
and returns one for createUndoRedoManager.

jVi's use of the UndoableEdits BEGIN/END_COMMIT_GROUP end up becoming edits in an UndoRedoStampFlagManager (rather than being used for control). There's a bug with that which happens since these edits are singletons which hold state depending on how they are used. They are intended to be innocuous as edits.

These edits always return true for isSignificant() but that's not enough to make them reusable the fix is to also have these control edits always return true for canUndo/canRedo in CloneableEditorSupport$UndoGroupManager$CommitGroupEdit.

I've added this fix to the patch for bug Bug 199568.

=== example exception
javax.swing.undo.CannotUndoException
	at javax.swing.undo.AbstractUndoableEdit.undo
           (AbstractUndoableEdit.java:93)
	at javax.swing.undo.UndoManager.undoTo(UndoManager.java:320)
	at javax.swing.undo.UndoManager.undo(UndoManager.java:398)
	at org.openide.awt.UndoRedo$Manager.undo(UndoRedo.java:184)
	at org.netbeans.modules.properties
           .PropertiesEditorSupport$UndoRedoStampFlagManager
           .undo(PropertiesEditorSupport.java:1351)
[catch] at org.openide.actions.UndoAction.performAction(UndoAction.java:185)

short_description: Need better feedback when JPDA debugger cannot connect
long_description:
When the socket transport fails to initialize
(i.e. connect fails) right now it comes up with
a cryptic error message. It will be a good idea to
put up a dialog box that mentions the name of the
host it is trying to look up and advise the user
to make sure the host name is correct and they can
ping it. This typically happens on various flavors
of Linux but it is a general problem.

short_description: Copy/Paste retains old clipboard data
long_description:
dev build 200610231800

I'm not sure whether you can fix this or not because quite often I get problems
copying the clipboard from my local machine and pasting into Netbeans open in a
remote machine via VNC. There used to be a bug a while back whereby you had to:

1) Copy
2) Switch focus to Netbeans
3) Try pasting. The old clipboard value gets pasted
4) Switch focus to non-Netbeans app
5) Switch focus back to Netbeans
6) Try pasting. The new clipboard value gets pasted

   I am seeing this exact same problem when I use VNC but not when I use
Netbeans locally. I am using UltraVNC 1.02. I think this might be a bug
triggered by the unexpected behavior of VNC.

short_description: Corrupted content in hg.netbeans.org
long_description:
When trying to fetch NB from hg repository I get the following message:


Mercurial Fetch
---------------
INFO: Running Fetch for C:\nb\main
ERROR Command failed:
Command: [hg fetch -v --config extensions.fetch= --config ui.merge=internal:merge --repository C:\nb\main http://hg.netbeans.org/main/]
Output: [pulling from http://hg.netbeans.org/main/ searching for changes adding changesets adding manifests adding file changes added 136 changesets with 240 changes to 225 files abort: case-folding collision between maven.osgi/src/org/netbeans/modules/maven/osgi/templates/activator.java.template and maven.osgi/src/org/netbeans/modules/maven/osgi/templates/Activator.java.template]
INFO: End of Mercurial Fetch


This collision makes it impossible to build NB on Windows any more.

short_description: ClassCastException: com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree$JCAnnotation cannot be cast to com.sun.tools.javac.tree.JCTree$JCTypeAnnotation
Code completion is including other properties and methods not related to the variable.
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.0 Beta (Build 201011152355)
Operating System = Linux version 2.6.37-8-generic running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_22
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 17.1-b03

See an image of the problem here: http://i.imgur.com/kn1xn.png

Netbeans is including a lot of stuff from the Zend Framework which is stored in another directory. 

The $user variable belongs to a class which does not extend any Zend classes. I do use Zend_ACL in a few of its methods. However Zend_ACL is stored in a property ($acl) of the class and should not be a problem.

short_description: User should be warned if build script is manually changed
long_description:
After a building a web app that has web services
in it then adding another new web service the
wscompile target for the new web service is not in
build-impl.xml.
1. Create a web project
2. Add 2 web services to it.
3. Build. Builds fine. So far so good.
4. Add another web service.
4. Build. Note that the wscompile for the new web
service is not in the build-impl.xml although the
entry for the new web service is in project.xml.
Looks like the xsl script is not rerun when the
project.xml changes.

short_description: ClassCastException when using java6 TrayIcon
long_description:
When the mouse enters the tray icon (java6) which was created by my Rich Client Application the following exception occurs:

*********** Exception occurred ************ at 12:45 AM on Oct 14 2007
java.lang.ClassCastException: java.awt.TrayIcon cannot be cast to java.awt.Component
       at
org.netbeans.core.output2.ui.CloseButtonTabbedPane$CloseButtonListener.eventDispatched(CloseButtonTabbedPane.java:387)
       at java.awt.Toolkit$SelectiveAWTEventListener.eventDispatched(Toolkit.java:2360)
       at java.awt.Toolkit$ToolkitEventMulticaster.eventDispatched(Toolkit.java:2252)
       at java.awt.Toolkit.notifyAWTEventListeners(Toolkit.java:2210)
       at java.awt.TrayIcon.dispatchEvent(TrayIcon.java:689)
       at java.awt.EventQueue.dispatchEvent(EventQueue.java:604)
[catch] at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpOneEventForFilters(EventDispatchThread.java:273)
       at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForFilter(EventDispatchThread.java:183)
       at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEventsForHierarchy(EventDispatchThread.java:173)
       at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:168)
       at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.pumpEvents(EventDispatchThread.java:160)
       at java.awt.EventDispatchThread.run(EventDispatchThread.java:121) 

Reason: Component c = (Component) e.getSource()
In java6 e.getSource() can return a java.awt.TrayIcon which is no java.awt.Component

Fix: add line
if ( !(e.getSource() instanceof Component)) return

There may be more errors like this (e.g. org.netbeans.core.output.TabHandlePopupListener
org.netbeans.progress.module.ui.StatusLineComponent). Probably the whole code base should be searched for
addAWTEventListener().

short_description: [67cat] Add hints to Junit test generation
long_description:
It would be useful to:

1) Display a hint next to the class definition if (a) Junit is enabled for the project and (b) there is no unit test for the class
   \_ Clicking the hint next to the class should give the option to generate a unit test for the class

2) Display a hint next to each method in the class if (a) there is a unit test for the class and (b) there no corresponding unit test method 
   \_ Clicking the hint next to the method should give the option to generate a unit test for the method

These hints should have a setting next to the rest of the hints to allow them to be toggled on and off.

short_description: Changing the Java element format for some kind of element to an illegal pattern throws exceptions on console and stops showing Java element nodes completely.
long_description:
Set e.g. constructor format to something weird maybe unbalanced braces or somesuch. Now explore some nodes--anything with constructors will fail to show any element nodes at all.

ClassElementNode constructor sets the element format and this fails with IllegalArgumentException. Probably it should work like:

- Java element settings should prevent the user from choosing a bad format to begin with with a standard property setter exception

- ElementNode.setElementFormat should be declared to throw IllegalArgumentException

- various element node constructors should catch this print it and continue without stopping the constructor

User Comments:

short_description: Stale ForkedJavaOverride.Copier threads
long_description:
I took a thread dump of the IDE today (081117) and noticed four threads that looked like this:

org.apache.tools.ant.module.bridge.impl.ForkedJavaOverride daemon prio=10 tid=0x09b4f800 nid=0x3b95 in Object.wait()
[0xb1bfd000..0xb1bfe0b0]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)
	at java.lang.Object.wait(Object.java:485)
	at org.netbeans.core.output2.NbIO$IOReader.read(NbIO.java:354)
	- locked  (a java.lang.StringBuffer)
	at org.openide.util.io.ReaderInputStream.read(ReaderInputStream.java:87)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.module.run.TargetExecutor$2.read(TargetExecutor.java:459)
	at java.io.FilterInputStream.read(FilterInputStream.java:66)
	at org.apache.tools.ant.module.bridge.impl.ForkedJavaOverride$Copier.run(ForkedJavaOverride.java:202)
	at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Task.run(RequestProcessor.java:573)
	at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Processor.run(RequestProcessor.java:1005)

No Ant process was running at the time (or recently).

Note that Ant execution uses the ExecutionEngine which automatically kills off threads in the same thread group. This
does not apply to RequestProcessor which explicitly creates threads in the top-level thread group.

Using RP for Copier.flusher is probably OK since it cannot survive long. But there is no reason that I can see to use
RP for in/out/errTask. Just create new Thread's for these. They should all be killed when the Ant process ends.

short_description: Turn on new view hierarchy (supporting line wrapping and non-printable chars showing)
long_description:
The line wrapping mode can be controlled by Tools->Options->Editor->Formatting->Line Wrap and it's Off by default.
Also the non-printable characters visibility can be set by menu View->Show Non-printable Characters.

If there is any serious error encountered the old view hierarchy can still be used by adding the following into netbeans.conf:

-J-Dorg.netbeans.editor.linewrap=false

short_description: EditableProperties.putProperty(String new String[0]) results in ugly formatting
long_description:
040616. If I make a new j2seproject its
project.properties contains

# ...
jar.compress=false
javac.classpath=\

javac.debug=true
# ...

but for aesthetic reasons would prefer

# ...
jar.compress=false
javac.classpath=
javac.debug=true
# ...

It's true that adding an entry will then have to
modify the line with the key thus:

# ...
jar.compress=false
javac.classpath=\      <-- APPEARS in DIFF
    val1
javac.debug=true
# ...

but this is true anyway of the last line whenever
you add a new entry:

# ...
jar.compress=false
javac.classpath=\
    val1:\            <-- APPEARS in DIFF
    val2
javac.debug=true
# ...

so I think that doesn't matter too much.

short_description: NbBundleProcessor not handled well by java.source
long_description:
The annotation processor for @NbBundle.Messages generates one Bundle.java file from many java files being present in the same package. These files moreover often reference methods of the generate Bundle.java files.

Currently the editor has huge troubles to provide reasonable code completion and error badges status. Many of the problems seem to come from a the fact that the processor is invoked incrementally just on the edited file and the generated Bundle.java code is then different than it would be if clean/build was invoked.

short_description: unable to clear subversion proxy settings
long_description:
Last week I was behind a firewall/proxy server so I set the proxies for subversion in the Subversion-
>Checkout panel.

Today I'm no longer behind the firewall but was unable to update my project. Even though I cleared the 
proxies (by selecting No Proxy - direct connection in the Proxy Configuration panel) subversion insists 
on using my old proxy settings.

I can't find a way in the NB GUI to clear the proxies.

I had to comment out the proxy lines in ~/.netbeans/5.5/config/svn/config/servers in order to get the 
subversion plugin to update the project without going through proxies.

short_description: Tomcat's conf directory isn't created
long_description:
If jsp modules are in user modules directory (this is the case of installing 
modules via autoupdate) then it causes that system/tomcat/conf directory isn't 
created and exceptions are thrown with every execution.

Probably due to this bug there are problems with deployment descriptor. Some 
properties are read-only on contain NoSuchMethodError or NoClassDefFoundError in 
value place.

If I use fix from Milan Kuchtiak then all above problems disappear.

short_description: Do not use old Java source hierarchy
long_description:
Currently JUnit module creates tests using classes
in org.openide.src. This works through the bridge
to Java data stored in MDR and is slow and should
be avoided. In fact new file is parsed 7-9x before
it is generated. Although it has a progress
indication tis action should be much faster than
3-4 seconds for a simple bean with one
setter/getter pair.

short_description: Same embedded browser reused for webapp and non-webapp uses
long_description:
Analogous to bug 208576.
1. Create a new HTML5 application project.
2. Set the browser to embedded webview
3. Run the project - html page will be open in an embedded web browser window
4. In a Java class display code completion so that the documentation window appears and press the Show documentation in external web browser button

Same window (tab) as was used in step 3 will be reused it should use a separate one.

David I am not sure if this worked before your recent changes or not (Denis might know).

short_description: JAR files incorrectly excluded from WAR content
long_description:
Tricky bug - to recreate:

1.  Create a new web project named PackageTest with default settings
2.  Right-click PackageTest in the Projects pane select Properties 
3.  In the Project Properties window select Packaging
4.  Add 2 jar files (e.g. jar1.jar and jar2.jar) to WAR content
5.  Clean and build project PackageTest
6.  Run command jar -tf PackageTest.war - both jar files included correctly
7.  IMPORTANT - close and reopen Netbeans
8.  In project PackageTest navigate back to Project Properties-->Packaging
9.  Remove file jar2.jar from WAR contentadd file jar3.jar (jar1.jar remains) 
10. Clean and build project PackageTest
11. Run jar -tf PackageTest.war -only jar3.jar is included (jar1.jar missing)
12. In Project Properties-->Packaging jar1.jar and jar3.jar are both listed

The only way to get jar1.jar back into the actual WAR file is to delete and 
re-add the file in the WAR content window of the Netbeans IDE then clean and 
rebuild.  Once this is done all subsequent adds removals etc. of files in 
the WAR content window are handled correctly - until Netbeans is closed and 
relaunched which enables the bug to occur again.

short_description: SemiTipes are visible as types of items in cc window
Navigator confuses class/instance methods of same name
long_description:
class Foo
  def self.bar
    'class method'
  end
  
  def bar
    'instance method'
  end
end

When viewing this class in the Navigator it properly identifies the class method bar and instance method bar.
When Show Class Methods and Variables is toggled off the Navigator removes the instance method entry.
When switching buffers it re-generates the method list correctly but from there if one re-enables the option the
Navigator contains two entries for the instance method.

short_description: CallbackSystemAction's weak PropertyChangeListener instances are kept attached to actions
long_description:
CallbackSystemAction's innerclass DelegateAction attaches weak
PropertyChangeListener to the associated action. When the DelegateAction is
disposed the weak listener is kept attached. I am adding finalizer to the
DelegateAction which detaches the weak listener.

The fix is verified by the introduced test added to CallbackSystemActionTest
class. If I run the test on the original CallbackSystemAction without the
finalizer the listener is verified kept attached. With the fix the test
verifies that the listener goes away.

short_description: Incorrect exposed method by exposing method with unknown classes
Wrong classname used when deploying with IBM DB2 drivers
long_description:
I added the IBM DB2 driver opened a connection and built a simple app that
used the data.  When I deployed the app deployment failed:

Classname is wrong or classpath is not set for: com.ibm.db2.jdbc.DB2DataSource

This is the DatasourceClassname from the new connection pool.  Based on the
driver jar file it should be: com.ibm.db2.jcc.DB2DataSource

short_description: Useless warning when removing files
long_description:
Development build #200503242007 of NetBeans 4.1
Windows XP JDK 1.5.0_02 build #09

Description:
============
When removing files user has to read and confirm that he is aware that local
files will be deleted permanently. This is useless warning since CVS|Remove
action is not visible on [Local] files anymore. I admit it has the logic for
folders though.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Register already existing CVS working directory in Versioning Manager.
2. Right click some [Local] file. There is no CVS|Remove action in the popup.
3. Invoke CVS|Remove on some [Up-to-date] file.
4. You will have to confirm the following question:

Are you sure you want to remove the ... file? Local files will be deleted
permanently.

5. The second sentence is obviously wasting of memory CPU cycles and user's time.

short_description: VCS popup diff window too small
long_description:
Attached is an image showing a super small diff window.  It only contains a '}' plus a few blank lines so (1) the
window could and should have displayed full size w/o scrollbars and (2) due to small size of scroll bars and lots of
white space in diff it was difficult to scroll to the location where the non-blank portion was.

Seems like there ought be a minimum size for the diff window regardless of width & line count of actual diff.

short_description: Correct all button in Auto Comment Tool
long_description:
Auto Comment tool could have button [Correct all] which would correct all
correctable javadoc errors in currently displayed nodes. User then would not
need to go through all nodes and scan if they are auto correctable or not.

short_description: Routing Alogrithm for links
long_description:
Original Bug Filed Against OSLO:
Create a project with 2 pages each with button component.
Using pageNavigation link  page1 button to page2 and
page2 button to page1. The pageNavigation links are messed up
they go through the page which does  not look good. User need
to move the page or click on some part of page to get better
page navigation links.

David Kaspers Response:
I talked to David Kasper about this. Unfortunately the routing algorithm does
not seem to be working well. We need to wait for new version of Graph library to
see if these problems are solved.

short_description: Breakpoint print text  substitutions not documented
long_description:
In the breakpoints window various text messages can be printed out when the program 
stops/pauses/suspends.  These have terms which are substituted at run time with current 
values (e.g. {classname}).  The set of all possible values should be documented so folks can 
create their own.

short_description: Maven: Downloading ... processes cannot be canceled
long_description:
Participant thought he could not continue in task because he was waiting for
Download Javadoc process even though he did not initiate it and did not need
it at the moment. 

This process can take a long time so we need to provide a mean to cancel it.

The same for Downloading Sources.

short_description: SaveAsAction bugs
long_description:
Hello:

I found 2 related SaveAsAction bugs:

1.  When attempting to perform a SaveAsAction on a file being edited in the editor and the FileObject lives in the 
MemoryFileSystem the file chooser dialog fails to display the name of the file because FileUtil.toFile(fo) always 
returns null (in SaveAsAction.getNewFileName).  This is due to different filesystems and MemoryFileSystem has no 
underlying File object.  When the chooser dialog is displayed the default path looks desireable (i.e. 
user.home)...However just need the name to the file name text area.

2.  When performing a SaveAsAction on a modified file being edited in the editor and the user does not change the name 
of the file nothing happens when the user chooses save in the dialog.  Therefore either the file needs to be 
updated as a save action OR the chooser dialog save button should be disabled if user doesn't pick a new name.  
This is confusing behavior.

Please fix these ASAP if possible.

Best Regards

Bradley

short_description: Wrong indentation of comments within method body
Specify forkmode for junit in a property
long_description:
The default execution of junit tests is to create a fork for every test class. This creates a lot of overhead and is 
not needed in my case. 
You can add the forkmode option once to the junit execution line in ant:
<junit dir=${basedir} errorproperty=tests.failed failureproperty=tests.failed fork=true showoutput=true 
forkmode=once>
Unfortunately the build-impl.xml will be regenerated and the change will be lost.
A solution to this would be that this is an option in the project properties file so it can be correctly generated.

short_description: Add automatic macro support to JSP template
long_description:
It would be useful to be able to insert automatic macros into a JSP template or
ant non-java template for that matter.  These would would use the existing
process common to java sources.

For example:

<%
/**
 * __NAME__.jsp
 * Created on __DATE__ __TIME_
 * Author: __USER__
 */
%>



JSP Page



--%>
 --%>

short_description: PVCS: Changing repository causes problems
long_description:
NB 200408021800 jkd1.5.0 b57.

There is problem with changing settings in
existing PVCS versioned directory. 

1. Register PVCS versioned directory with existing
repository and working directory. 
2. In this directory create new project.
3. Now with the use of Versioning mananger edit
this registered directory. Setup another existing
Project database:  with another working directory.

NOTE: After this steps user is not able to invoke
Cunstomizer. Exceptions is raised.


Even if the working directory is not editable it's
changed in Versioning tab of the explorer. There
are to possibilities how to get rid of this problem:
1. Project database  will not be editable.
2. Working directory field will change with
project database.

short_description: Unable to annotate project node in Projects view
long_description:
I have found that VersioningAnnotationProvider.annotateNameHtml is called for a project node in the Files view but is
not called for a project node in the Projects view.

The reason for this seems to be in ProjectsRootNode$BadgingNode.getHtmlDisplayName.

For the Projects view fold is null and so annotateNameHtml is not called. For the Files view fold is not null and
annotateNameHtml is called.

short_description: Port: Address already in use
long_description:

- create remote project
- run it
- stop execution
- restart IDE
- do clean and build
Result: Build is successful but Port: Address already in use and lots of error getting message: Error 0 messages
appear in Output window. This can frustrate a user.

short_description: Performance Problems with the Module
long_description:
There are two points within the Bug Submission
Module where the performance is quite slow.
The first is the initial activation of the module.
After Selecting the Submit Bug menu option
there is a noticeable period of time till the
Wizard appears.
The second is the tenth panel (counting from zero
in the UI spec). on clicking Next there again is
a noticeable period of time till the next Panel of
the Wizard appears.

short_description: Replace PasswordManager with Keyring API
long_description: I just noticed org.netbeans.modules.nativeexecution.api.util.PasswordManager via Encrypter (due to warnings during compilation about sun.misc.BASE64Decoder). short_description: Oracle XE db connection causes the IDE to become extremely slow after a while
long_description:
Created attachment 114178
jstack thread dump

I'm trying to follow the tutorial Creating a Database Driven Application With PHP Lesson 1b: Creating Oracle Database Tables.

When I connect to the DB after a few queries the IDE starts to become unresponsive for 20-30 seconds per time this happens especially when I alter the DB structure (i.e. create or alter a trigger).

I attach a thread dump I took while the IDE was unresponsive and two snapshots I took while it was extremely slow.

Thanks

Paolo

short_description: provide branding support for ContentPanel
long_description:
S1S Nevada version requires a customized non-html
rendered welcome screen.

Please provide branding support for the ContentPanel.

The following is a recommended solution from Jesse
Glick:

JComponent panel =
(JComponent)Class.forName(NbBundle.getMessage(WelcomeComponent.class
CLASS_content_panel)).newInstance()

where
modules/welcome.jar!/org/netbeans/modules/welcome/Bundle.properties
 lists

CLASS_content_panel=org.netbeans.modules.welcome.ContentPanel

and
modules/locale/welcome_f4j.jar!/org/netbeans/modules/welcome/Bundle_f4j.properties
would list e.g.:

CLASS_content_panel=org.netbeans.modules.welcome.S1SContentPanel

short_description: Code template applies also after code completion
long_description:
I am strong user of code template feature. I map this feature to  from the first version with this feature. I update Netbeans regularly and followed problem comes with version 7.4.
I understand that code template on  is not default but still possible. I will be very happy if you fix followed bug.

How to reproduce:
SETUP:
- Properties / Editor / Code Templates: Choose Expand template on SPACE
- Be sure that there is followed template in the list:
Abbreviation: le
Expanded text: ${no-indent}length

SIMULATION:
- Open / create any java class.
- Place followed code into any method body:
    String str = str
    if (str.
- write: le
- choose: length() - It can be choose automatically because it is only one possibility for le
- Your code looks like
    String str = str
    if (str.length()
- Write  (Because you want to continue with something like == ...)
- And your code looks now like:
    String str = str
    if (str.lengthlength
- It is because code template was applied even after code completion. And I feel that this is wrong behavior.

solve it of course.

short_description: Provide attachment by PID on Windows
long_description:
On Unix one can attach JFluid to a running JVM 
by just specifying the JVM's PID and startup 
directory. On Windows this can't be done (the 
only method is to press Ctrl+Break in the JVM's 
console window). Thus there is no way to attach 
to JVMs running e.g. certain app servers or IDEs 
that don't provide a console window.

short_description: Non-thread-safe class NbSheet$SheetNodesListener is used by more than one NB platform-threads concurrently.
long_description:
Created attachment 106929
stack trace of exception

NetBeans 6.8 (potential for 7.0 too becausebut the critical source part haven't changed)
JDK 1.6.0_07

Observed behavior:
------------------
During deletion of many instances of class Node an ConcurrentModificationException can happen if concurrently the property sheet window is open.
It depends on the Node implementation (timing behavior) how often the exception happens. I saw it two times with standard file nodes (part of NB standard file system browser) and many times with our NB module.

I checked the source source of NbSheet$SheetNodesListener and it is not thread-safe.


Steps to reproduce:
-------------------
- start NB
- open File Browser window
- open Property Sheet window
- select about 500 files
- delete the files by popup menue Delete
- sometime the exception in attachment ex.txt happens


Results of thread analyze:
--------------------------
- I downloaded the source code of NB6.8
- I changed the source code of SheetNodesListener in order to insert a trace mechanism (see attachment path.txt)
- In case of exception I see that thread Module-Action and AWT-EventQueue-1 thread concurrently access the class SheetNodesListener (see attachment result.txt)

short_description: node in Explorer describes itself in property sheet
long_description:
Netbeans is not very good about informing the user the type of items shown in 
the Explorer (all you really have to go on is the icon).  This particularly a 
problem for new users who don't know our icons and will become even more of an 
issue with the proposed icon badging as users may wonder things like what does 
it mean when the icon has a green arrow or a red star on it?)  And it is better 
not to use tooltips for this information as tooltips are usually more 
irritating than helpful I would hate to run my cursor over the explorer if 
every row had a tooltip defined!  Instead I see that the status line is not 
often used by Netbeans. So I would suggest that the description of the selected 
type could be displayed on the status line. This might possibly be done by the 
system invoking an optional method on the node instance to get a description of 
the node suitable for showing the user (e.g. getUserTypeName()) and then 
displaying that text on the status line.  Text examples might be: Java Class 
Executable Java Class EJB Java Applet Java Class with Merge Error 
etc. (each Node type would be responsible for constructing its text).

short_description: Rewrite repository files cache synchronization
long_description:
This concerns mostly classes o.n.m.c.repository.util.RepositoryCacheMap and
o.n.m.c.repository.disk.SimpleRepositoryHelperCacheImpl that uses the former one. The idea of RepositoryCacheMap is to
provide a cache for open files. This speeds up repository access a lot. But synchronization-related responsibilities
spread between these classes which is incorrect. This should be rewritten in such a way that RepositoryCacheMap is
responsible for synchronization using an abstract factory pattern. The existing code is error prone.

short_description: Class View does not refresh project libraries
long_description:
Now class view shows libraries a project uses (e.g. /usr/include) inside this project (in a separate Libraries folder).

The issue is that once this folder content is shown it is not updated.

For example create a C project expand its Libraries folder then add a C++ file to it you won't see new C++ libraries added. They will be shown only after you reopen the project.

short_description: Focused cell reset to [00] in dataview after cell edit
long_description:
Hey

last week @work I had to edit some data in our databases and was annoyed by the fact that I could not just use my keyboard efficiently:

1. I selected the relevant data
2. I opened the first column to edit by clicking on it
3. I wanted to change the following values in the same column by pressing enter to go to the next row same column.

This would be the normal behaviour of a JTable but the focus return to cell at [00] after editing a cell. This can be tracked back to:

JXTableRowHeader.CountingTableModel#setCount

That method is invoked via JXTableRowHeader#tableModelListener on every change to the underlying table.

setCount now propagates that event as a TableModelEvent to all listeners.

This causes JTable#sortedTableChanged to be called. That determines that the whole table changed (no row indices are provided in the call described above) and this causes JTable to clear the selection. The selectionModel of the headerTable and the mainTable are connected (JXTableRowHeader -> construtor -> headerTable.setSelectionModel).

The fix just makes sure that in setCount the update and event generation are only done if the count really differs.

short_description: waste of memory in subversion.client.parser.

For example profiler shows that in project chromium:

- 25520 equals strings true.
- 21280 equals strings file.
- 193 equal string 2009-10-22T20:02:37.997393Z
...
All strings belong to subversion.client.parser.EntriesCache
Do subversion need to keep all entries in memory?
If needs consider optimization of data structure:
- do not keep equals strings
- replace use primitive Java types for storing boolean and timestamps.
All size of subversion.client.parser.EntriesCache in project chromium is 34Mb.

short_description: NB based application won’t start properly with POSIX-compliant shell
long_description:
The nbexec script bundled with the RubyNetBenas nightly builds from http://deadlock.netbeans.org/hudson/job/macpkg/ do not work if you have a 
POSIX-compliant bash installed. POSIX (/bin/sh) echo does not allow -n as a parameter and it is used in this part of nbexec:
  readClusters() {
    if [ -x /usr/ucb/echo ] then
      echo=/usr/ucb/echo
    else
      echo=echo
    fi
    sep=
    while read X do
      if [ $X \!=  ] then
        $echo -n $sep
        $echo -n $progdir/../$X
        sep=:
      fi
    done
  }
  clusters=`(cat $progdir/../etc/nbrubyide.clusters echo) | readClusters`

For the legacy echo behavior you may do one of the following:
* switch to /bin/bash
* set the legacy mode using env COMMAND_MODE=legacy sh 
* use the platform-independent printf(1)

Some future version of Mac OS X will likely be fully POSIX-compliant.

short_description: org.netbeans.core.beaninfo.editors.DataFolderPanel only lets you create package in first filesystem
long_description:
Originaly submitted to bugtraq as #4389297

If you choose anything but the first filesystem in the list and then
start typing in the Package field the Target Location list selects the first
filesystem automatically.

Work around:
Unmount all but the filesystem you want then re-invoke the wizard choose the
remaining filesystem and type in the new package name.  Or create the new
package outside of the wizard then invoke the wizard and select the package.

Possible fix:
Allow the user to select any appropriate mounted filesystem.  When entering a
new package name retain the selected filesystem.

short_description: Flow Designer should show transitions caused by items in a form.
long_description:
The Flow Designer should display transitions caused by commands assigned to
items  of a form and not just the ones caused by the commands assigned to the form.

I attached a very simple sample MIDP project which has a form (helloForm) with a
button (sayHelloStringItem) which when selected displays an alert
(sayHelloAlert) saying Hello world!

As you can see in the attached screenshot the flow designer shows the alert
separated from everything else and gives no clue that the alert is displayed
when the button in the form is selected.

I'm using Netbeans 4.1 with the Mobility Pack.
If you add a screen command to the form to do exactly the same thing then you
will see that the flow designer will show the corresponding transition.

short_description: ! ProjectDataObject.getCookie(CompilerCookie.Compile) instanceof CompilerCookie.Compile
long_description:
Pretty self-explanatory. ProjectDataObject's getCookie method (or
PSupport.getCompilerCookie) ignores the actual passed-in cookie class and
returns something which only implements CompilerCookie. This violates the
contract of getCookie that the returned result if non-null be assignable to the
requested class.

short_description: Running single simple unit test in debug takes 6+ seconds
long_description:
Created attachment 162000
debug-unit-test-in6sec-1.nps

Hello

I'm using NB built from recent sources (i.e. latest dev one) and Gradle plugin to integrate my Gradle projects into Netbeans.

It appears that execution of single simple (int i = 1 + 1) unit test takes 6..7+ seconds in IDE. 
Running the same without debug finishes in __less than 1sec__ - initialization of debugger takes ~6 seconds ... that's ahhh bad :(

I guess additional important note is that I have 30 modules opened simultaneously and each of them has 10-20 dependencies loaded from local gradle/maven repositories.

After debugging and self-profiling of NetBeans I noticed that NB excessively refreshes all dependencies and for some reason tries to load them and  as project. According to selfprofiler - verification of if dependency is project or not takes really much time and is invoked by netbeans really excessively.

For example - org.netbeans.modules.ide.ergonomics.fod.FeatureInfo.isProject() mentioned in hotspots takes 2.7 sec or 50% all time (BTW - i just have no idea what functionality ide.ergonomics.fod may add to NetBeans can it be disabled somehow?).

Here is one of the sub-trees from self profiler (loadProject() occurs in other substrees/threads too - and probably they wait on each other)

	org.netbeans.modules.debugger.jpda.projectsui.MainProjectManager.getMainProject ()
	  org.netbeans.modules.parsing.spi.indexing.support.QuerySupport.findDependentRoots ()
		org.netbeans.modules.java.project.ProjectSourceForBinaryQuery.findSourceRoots ()
		   org.netbeans.modules.projectapi.SimpleFileOwnerQueryImplementation.getOwner ()
			  org.netbeans.modules.projectapi.nb.NbProjectManager.findProject ()
				 org.netbeans.modules.projectapi.nb.NbProjectManager.createProject ()
					 (... here it tries to load all kinds of supported projects ...)
					 org.netbeans.modules.ide.ergonomics.fod.FeatureProjectFactory.loadProject () - 807ms
					 org.netbeans.modules.project.ui.convertor.ProjectConvertorFactory.loadProject () - 557ms
					 org.netbeans.modules.project.ant.AntBasedProjectFactorySingleton.loadProject () - 347ms
					 org.netbeans.modules.groovy.grailsproject.GrailsProjectFactory.loadProject () - 118 ms
					 org.netbeans.modules.maven.NbMavenProjectFactory.loadProject () - 30ms
					 org.netbeans.gradle.project.NbGradleProjectFactory.loadProject () - 10ms


    Major reason of the slowdown here (as far as I understand) is that ...
    - out of few Projects explicitly created by Gradle plugin (30 projects) ...
    - Netbeans generates source root entry for each JAR dependency and its parent paths plus each sub-folder in each project

    I've logged what NB is doing - it looks like following

      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.gradle/gradle-base-services-groovy/2.13/e1fc0f8d0bb9f9ab3eff1fea7c6060c297c2de4
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.gradle/gradle-base-services-groovy/2.13
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.gradle/gradle-base-services-groovy
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1/org.gradle
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2/files-2.1
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches/modules-2
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle/caches
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.gradle
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-util/8.1.14.v20131031
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository/org/eclipse/jetty/jetty-util
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository/org/eclipse/jetty
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository/org/eclipse
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository/org
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2/repository
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Users/User/.m2
      ...
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/controls/admin
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/controls
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/controls/demo
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/pages/admin
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site/src/site-main/site-main-demo/src/main/webapp/WEB-INF/pages
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp/site
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit/MainApp
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client/DevGit
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj/Client
      RepositoryUpdater.worker: NbProjectManager.createProject  C:/Prj
      ...
	  
	In total it is about 800 directories. Each of them is fed into each of 5 Project*Factory'ies - so ... one cycle of RepositoryUpdater.worker takes rather long.
	Note: NbGradleProjectFactory consumes only 10ms - that is because major set of folder are cut off by that check. I thinks it has sense to make better-performing isProject() verification for other projects factories too

			public boolean isProject(FileObject projectDirectory) {
				String path = projectDirectory.getPath()
				
				if (path.contains(.gradle/caches) || path.contains(.m2/repository))

	OK and that is not the end ... it appears that clicking/switching between window causes rescanning of that huge number of 'fake' sources roots in other threads:

		Editor Parsing Loop (20160910-b14d1f3f39a0)
		Refresh Editor Context
		org.netbeans.modules.java.hints.declarative.DeclarativeHintRegistry

	... and finally when it comes to running a unit test - all this has contention with debugger threads which also scan source roots 
	
		Debugger attach listener-thread-3
		Debugger operator thread

	=========
    QUESTION: Why all these threads are doing same thing (NbProjectManager.createProject())	in parallel? 
	          Can it be done in some really worker thread? And others just consume status from worker thread?
	=========
		
One more thing there are some absolutely dumb source roots - point to folders I never opened in last 2-3 month and they are not mentioned in any of the currently open projects.
These 2 source roots come from thread named org.openide.text Editor Initialization

	org.openide.text Editor Initialization: NbProjectManager.createProject  D:/test/project/code/filter-dataset/src/main/java/test/filter/dataset
	

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

short_description: Regex search gets stuck looking forward
long_description:
The editor gets stuck with finding a simple regular expression ^.*$

I want this to select every line. But on repeated find in down direction e.g. on a Java package statement often only the first occurrence is found. Backwards is ok.

How to reproduce:

- Menu|File|New Project|Samles|Java|Anagram Game|Finish
- Open StaticWordLibrary.java
- Locate cursor at top of file
- Search: ^.*$ with checks in Regular Expression Highlight Results Wrap Around
- Press Next until the cursor jumps back to the top

Expected result: The cursor should go down each time until the end of the file at line 178

Actual result: The cursor starts again at the top after it hits line 28
This also applies to replace.

It looks like the editor gives up at the first line that does not match. Previous works.

short_description: Button for module move is disabled
long_description:
[#200111121441jdk1.4]
1.Run IDE and start the UC wizard
2.Connect to the UC server
3.Press Refresh List button
4.Press Add all (>> button)
5.Double click single module so this module will move to the left
6.Click the module on the left and the add button will be disabled although it 
should be possible to move the module to the right by this button too

This is only the jdk1.4 issue.

short_description: Project name not formatted properly in package.json file
long_description:
If you have package.json that does not contain e.g. name or scripts->start and make changes in project properties that would cause inserting either one of these 2 properties to the JSON file it is inserted with wrong indentation. 

Thank you

short_description: Path to CVS executable cannot contain space
long_description:
From the Version menu select CVS CVS global 
init.  The dialog allows you the select a path 
for the cvs executable.  If the path you select 
contains a space the first portion of the path 
upto the space is ignored.  e.g.  

c:\program files\cvs1.20\bin\cvs.exe 

turns into 

files\cvs1.20\bin\cvs.exe

short_description: [50cat] Icon size and look for similar items differ a bit
long_description:
I know this is VERY (!) picky but 

1) the size of the icons in the project view for similar items differ a bit
(e.g. their width is different)

2)the color choice differs from type to type (e.g. softer colors for Java
classes and harder colors for property files.)

(see attached images)

short_description: Incorrect wording in scp remote option
long_description:
Now it reads scp (using scp for copying file to remote host)

First using file is incorrect grammatically should be files.
Next it isn't clear to user (especially for Windows user).

It should be changed to somethin more brief and clear for example
Secure Copy

short_description: Wrong semantic coloring
[41cat] Refactoring comments not working
long_description:
[ JDK VERSION : 1.5.0_02 ]

The refactoring dialog has a checkbox for 
comments. 
When I select comments the comments are not 
changed.

short_description: Versioning labels alternating on Projects sidebar and Editor Tabs
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 6.9 (Build 201006101454)
Operating System = Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_16
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.2-b01

Since the upgrade from 6.8 i'm experiencing that the version labels (and the icons and coloring) of new and modified entries are alternating in the open JavaSE project. They disappear and appear again regularly 4-5 times per minute. I'm using subversion for versioning with the bundled subversion client for windows modul installed.

short_description: Incorrect autocomplete with diamond notation in the case of interface implementation
long_description:
When I have the following variable:

HashMap> results = new HashMap()

I try to add a new element... for example:

        results.put(null new LinkedList())

After I type LinkedList the IDE suggests LinkedList() ... however after selecting this option it is replaced with LinkedList() ... which is immediately marked as an error (cannot be derived by the compiler).

Diamond notation should not be automatically inserted in the case of using a particular implementation of an interface (and possibly inheritance)

short_description: @import inside media query marked as error
Project tree doesn't get refreshed after deleting Output.xml file
long_description:
Project tree doesn't get refreshed after deleting Output.xml file. Double-click
the Output.xml file will get an Error dialog and a Warning dialog.

Build: NB 5.5 Dev 200606150200

Steps to reproduce it:

1. Create a SynchronousSample project
2. In the Projects window expand SynchronousSampleApplication -> Test -> TestCase0.
3. Select Output.xml node right-click select Delete item from the context menu.
4. After confirming the delete action I do not get any error message. But the
Output.xml file is still listed in the project tree.
5. Double-click the Output.xml file will get an Error dialog and a Warning message:

Error:
Cannot load
MasterFileObject@aa42a2[$PATH/SynchronousSampleApplication/test/TestCase0/Output.xml]

Warning:
The document could not be loaded.

In the message.log file found FileNotFoundException. Please check the attached
FileNotFound.txt for more detail.

short_description: Java Freeform does not allow source level == 1.8
long_description:
Created attachment 131378
An example project.

There is no way to specify source level 1.8 for a Java freeform project as the most recent schema for compilation-unit mandates 1.3 1.4 1.5 1.6 or 1.7. See e.g. the attached project - the Java file in it requires source level 1.8 but specifying the source level in project.xml will cause validation failures during project opening:
Error in project.xml: The value '1.8' of element 'source-level' is not valid.

Allowing source level 1.8 will probably require a new schema version.

short_description: CommandLine CVS loosing reference to cvs
long_description:
I have several file systems mounted as cvs with external client. When i setup 
the filesystems (and view properties) I have not specified the location of 
cvs but rather allowed netbeans to locate cvs.exe via the commandline thus 
the location is in my nt path.

This works fine and dandy on 1 machine however i have my netbeans install dir 
my netbeans env dir and source dir on a portable hard drive that i take between 
work and home. On both systems i have the drive mounted as the same drive 
letter.

The problem is that if i setup the filesystems on my work box cvs operations 
work just fine. But when i unplug the drive and go home and launch netbenas 
the cvs operations fail with this error:

Command Refresh failed.
Check the full output of the command on the Runtime tab in Explorer. The error 
output follows:
'cvs' is not recognized as an internal or external command
operable program or batch file.


Now I know that cvs is in my path because when i open a new command window and 
type cvs it comes up with the list of commands (ie it ran it).

To further debug the problem at home i unmounted the filesystems and mounted 
new ones. Then they work just fine. But when i move to my work box i get the 
same error as above.

short_description: Bad wording and buttons in Remove Server Instance
long_description:
The dialog that pops up on server instance > Remove says Do you really want to
remove the Sun Java System Application Server?

Perhaps the wording should indicate that the instance will actually be only
unregistered from the IDE rather then removed e.g.

Do you really want to remove the Sun Java System Application Server from the IDE?

or

Do you really want to unregister the Sun Java System Application Server?

Also it should have Yes / No buttons instead of OK / Cancel.

short_description: Unable to change Domains folder for appserver if you want use the same location
long_description:
Build 200504171930

1.Start IDE with new userdir
2.Go to Runtime tab
3.Add appserver 
4.Click on appserver's node in Runtime tab and open Properties
5.ERROR
It's impossible to change appserver's Domains folder and Instance namenot even
in Tools/Server wizard.It's impossible even if you remove the server instance
and try to add the new one with the same locationyou are only allowed to add
the one you just removed.Since J2EE manager's goneI see a big problem in this.
