short_description: Add don't implement annotation hint
long_description:
Hello
I'm using NB 5.5 Dev 200609062200 and I have a problem with the quick fix feature.
I'm throwing in:

public class GenValue implements GeneratedValue {
}

After that NB offers to me to implement all abstract methods.
And it does that for me. The problem is that it reports that GenValue is not
abstract and does not override abstract method  generator() in
javax.persistence.GeneratedValue. I implement that one and after that
it reports the same thing about strategy() so on. It should be done
automatically by quick fix.

Just to offer a comparison Eclipse implements all those methods but it reports
that The annotation type GeneratedValue should not be used as a superinterface
for GenValue and underlines GeneratedValue with yellow.

Regards

short_description: API to retrieve a specific action by ID
long_description:
Given a known

@ActionID(category=Constants.CATEGORY id=Constants.ID) ...

it is often useful to load that Action for some sort of programmatic presentation. Currently you need to do

FileUtil.getConfigObject(Actions/ + Constants.CATEGORY + / + Constants.ID.replace('.' '-') + .instance Action.class)

which is awkward. This should rather be a utility method in Actions.

short_description: UnsupportedOperationException occurs closing visualweb Component Error Window
long_description:

a Component Error window opens in place of the Editor.

This Component Error window can open when Java DB is not running and a visualweb
JSF component has a binding to a Java DB rowset.  Since Java DB is down
binding fails.

short_description: Can't step through JNI C++ code
long_description:
I have three projects that are used together.  One is a JInkTest is a java application JInk is a library with native
methods and JInkJNI implements the native code in C++.  JInkJNI is crashing right now and I'd like to be able to
single step through it with the debugger.  I can use the debugger on standalone C++ projects fine.  There just seems to
be a problem when I launch JInkTest and JInkJNI gets invoked indirectly.

Can I single step through my JNI code?  Is this a configuration issue?

short_description: Different translations for indentation rules
long_description:
There exists different translations for indentation-rules. Sometimes it's 
named Einrückungsregeln sometimes Einrückungsmechanimus The first choice is 
much more often used then the second one so the proposal is to use: 
...regel(n)

Affected files:
translatedfiles\src\html\editor\src\org\netbeans\modules\editor\html\Bundle_de.properties
Lines: 18 19 22

translatedfiles\src\web\jspsyntax\src\org\netbeans\modules\web\core\syntax\Bundle_de.properties
Lines: 267 268

translatedfiles\src\xml\text-
edit\src\org\netbeans\modules\xml\text\resources\Bundle_de.properties
Line: 22

short_description: Target all-web/ddapi doesn't declare build-schema2beans/anttask dependency
long_description:
The web/ddapi build script uses the
schema2beans/anttask jar but the target in
nbbbuild (all-web/ddapi) doesn't declare the
dependency on build-schema2beans/anttask target.
Thus it is working accidentally only.

Please apply the patch.

short_description: Add Exclude Libraries option to Archive tab of web module
long_description:
Update Archive tab of the web module to include
an Exclude Libraries option. This is necessary
to allow removal of tag library JARs that may be
needed during development (i.e. with Tomcat) but
are already present on the target deployment
server and should not be packaged as part of the
web module.

short_description: Generate @Override annotation for entity class methods
long_description:
Since we're generating Java SE 5 classes anyway we might as well generate
@Override annotations for equals hashCode and whatever other methods make sense.

We should look at this for New Entity New Entity from DB and the JSF generated
classes.

short_description: Do not ship unused disabled autoload modules
long_description:
Currently the trunk build includes three autoload
modules which are disabled because no one is using
them which is dumb there is no reason to ship
something the user does not need. Attaching a
patch which removes them all from the stable build
config (and puts them on stable/alpha AU in case
anyone wants to download them).

Modules:

- schema2beans (dev portion not runtime portion)
- Servlet API 2.3
- Apache Regexp

Mostly messy because the schema2beans build
infrastructure was in poor condition (should have
been reviewed by buildmasters long ago) and did
not permit schema2beans.jar to be included in the
build independently of schema2beansdev.jar. So
most of the patch is actually fixing that problem
then just nbbuild/build.properties is responsible
for excluding the three modules.

Clean build with commit validation passes with the
patch as well as schema2beans unit tests.

short_description: Views of attached Mercurial diffs lose original information
long_description:
Consider bug #203477 comment #17 and discussion in #20. The BZ page links to [1] which Martin and I consider unreadable. You might click Raw Unified to go to [2] thinking you are seeing the original attachment but you are not for example the last hunk is labeled

--- /dev/null	Thu Jan 01 00:00:00 1970 +0000
+++ d687683b8aa7	Mon Nov 21 11:35:59 2011 +0100

with no mention of a file name which is clearly bogus. (Seems it is confused by Mercurial's diff format and I am guessing it would be just as confused by Git's.) You need to rather click View to just see the original diff as uploaded [3].

Regression from recent BZ upgrade the previous version would just show the originally uploaded file as text/plain which was fine.


[1] http://netbeans.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=113360&action=diff
[2] http://bugzilla-attachments-203477.netbeans.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=113360&action=diff&collapsed=&context=patch&format=raw&headers=1
[3] http://bugzilla-attachments-203477.netbeans.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=113360

short_description: do not use -y option if gems 0.9.4.5 beta is installed
long_description:
-y is the default in the new release of gems the NetBeans gem output includes INFO lines telling you that -y is no
longer necessary.

(beta gems announcement follows)

RubyGems 0.9.4.5 is a beta release for the upcoming 0.9.5 which adds
several new features and fixes several bugs.

To upgrade to the beta:

  gem update --system --source http://segment7.net/

To file bugs:

  http://rubyforge.org/tracker/?func=add&group_id=126&atid=575

When filing a bug `gem env` output will be helpful in diagnosing the
issue.

If you find a bug where RubyGems crashes please provide debug
output.  You can do that with `gem --debug the_command`.  For example:

$ gem --debug unknown_command
Exception `RuntimeError' at [...]/rubygems/command_manager.rb:114 -
Unknown command unknown_command
ERROR:  While executing gem ... (RuntimeError)
    Unknown command unknown_command
        [...]/rubygems/command_manager.rb:114:in `find_command'
        [...]/rubygems/command_manager.rb:103:in `process_args'
        [...]/rubygems/command_manager.rb:74:in `run'
        [...]/rubygems/gem_runner.rb:39:in `run'
        /usr/local/bin/gem:22

== Changes

Select new features include:

* Automatic installation of platform gems
* New bandwidth and memory friendlier index file format
* Offline mode (--no-update-sources)
* Bulk update threshold can be specified (-B --bulk-threshold)
* New `gem fetch` command
* `gem` now has really verbose output when you specify -v
* Ruby 1.9 compatible

Other changes include:

* Time::today is deprecated and will be removed at a future date
* `gem install --include-dependencies` (-y) is now deprecated since it
  is the default use --ignore-dependencies to turn off automatic
  dependency installation
* Multi-version diamond dependencies only are installed once
* Processing a YAML bulk index update takes less memory
* `gem install -i` makes sure all depenencies are installed
* `gem update --system` reinstalls into the prefix it was originally
  installed in
* `gem update --system` respects --no-rdoc and --no-ri flags
* HTTP basic authentication support for proxies
* Gem::Specification#platforms should no longer be a String use
  Gem::Platform::CURRENT when building binary gems instead
* `gem env` has more diagnostic information
* require 'rubygems' loads less code
* sources.gem is gone RubyGems now uses built-in defaults
* `gem install --source` will no longer add --source by default use
  `gem sources --add` to make it a permanent extra source
* `gem query` (list) no longer prints details by default
* Exact gem names are matched in various places
* mkrf extensions are now supported
* A gem can depend on a specific RubyGems version
* `gem_server` is now `gem server`
* `gemlock` is now `gem lock`
* `gem_mirror` is now `gem mirror`
* `gemwhich` is now `gem which`
* `gemri` is no longer included with RubyGems
* `index_gem_repository.rb` is now `gem generate_index`
* `gem` performs more validation of parameters
* Custom rdoc styles are now supported
* Gem indexer no longer removes quick index during index creation
* Kernel#require only rescues a LoadError for the file being required
  now
* `gem dependencies` can now display some information for remote gems

Notes and issues:

* Old gem scripts (gem_mirror gem_server gemlock gemri gemwhich
  index_gem_repository.rb) are not cleaned up
* There still appears to be a bug related to bulk updates of YAML
  indexes

== Special Thanks

* Daniel Berger for win32 testing of early betas
* Luis Lavena for help with win32 platforms
* Tom Copeland for help testing and releasing the new indexer
* Wilson Bilkovich for the new index format
* To the rest of the RubyGems bug reporters and patch contributors

The full set of changes including contributors is included in the
ChangeLog.

== Platforms

RubyGems now automatically handles platform gems.  This means that
`gem install` will no longer prompt for gem selection.  RubyGems uses
Ruby's built-in configuration to match the running ruby's platform to
choose the correct gem to install.  The automatically chosen platform
may be overridden with the --platform option.

The dependency fetch install outdated specification uninstall
and update commands all respond to --platform.

For more information see `gem help platforms`

== Thanks

Keep those gems coming!

-- Jim & Chad & Eric (for the RubyGems team)

short_description: Use the object's default action (Open/Edit/View)
long_description:
Make the Open File implementation such that it takes an object's preferred
actions into account.

The current implementation prefers action Open over Edit unless a line
number is specified. But for example the properties node prefers action Edit
over Open.
The result is that for properties files different action is performed when a
file is open by double-clicking on the corresponding node (Edit) and when a file
is open using the Open File feature (Open).

short_description: Hints not relevant for the configured Java platform/sources format version are displayed
long_description:
Java hints are displayed also in case they are not relevant for the configured Java platform version.

E.g. Can Use Diamond is wrongly displayed also when the project is configured to use JDK 1.6 platform/sources format Convert to Lambda or Member Reference is wrongly displayed for JDK 1.6 and JDK 1.7 etc.

Tested with both native NB and Maven projects.

A workaround is to disable such hints (globally or per-project) but it's not too comfortable.

short_description: Installer fails on FreeBSD 6-STABLE
long_description:
I cannot install the Netbeans-5.5 Enterprise Pack Preview on FreeBSD 6-STABLE. 
Downloading and installing the Linux distribution of the Netbeans-5.5 IDE Beta
itself went smoothly (as it usually does with Linux packages on FreeBSD).  But
the Enterprise Pack preview refuses to accept that the Diablo Java VM available at

      http://www.freebsdfoundation.org/downloads/java.shtml

with a version string output of

   freebsd$ java -version
   java version 1.5.0
   Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment Standard Edition (build diablo-1.5.0-b00)   
  Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build diablo-1.5.0_06-b00 mixed mode)

is a JDK 1.5.0 Update 1.0 or newer Java VM.  I think the version parsing
information in the installer is a bit confused but I can't seem to find a way
to bypass it.

The same problem occurs with a locally built 1.5.0 from SCSL source through the
FreeeBSD ports mechanism.

short_description: Generate Code... hashCode generates bad code
long_description:
Using:

Product Version: NetBeans IDE 6.0 M10 (build 200706281431)
Java: 1.5.0_12 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.5.0_12-b04
System: Linux version 2.6.9-55.0.6.ELsmp running on i386 UTF-8 en_US (nb) 

Observed Behavior:

Summary:
Using the Generate Code... feature to create equals and hashCode the generated hashCode will not compile.

What the code generates:

To generate a hashCode for the following fields: 

    private String name
    private Date date

results in the following:

    public int hashCode() {
        int hash = 5
        hash = 59 * hash + this.name != null ? this.name.hashCode() : 0
        hash = 59 * hash + this.date != null ? this.date.hashCode() : 0
        return hash
    }

which causes the following compile-time error:

Compiling 1 source file to /home/lorin/NetBeans Projects/IBS Portal Packages/build/classes
Test.java:42: operator + cannot be applied to intjava.util.Date
        hash = 59 * hash + this.date != null ? this.date.hashCode() : 0
1 error

The code should read:

    public int hashCode() {
        int hash = 5
        hash = 59 * hash + (this.name != null ? this.name.hashCode() : 0)
        hash = 59 * hash + (this.date != null ? this.date.hashCode() : 0)
        return hash
    }

which properly compiles.

short_description: I18N - message is used as message with/without mnemonic key
long_description:
1. Select [Tools] > [Server Manager]
2. Click [Bundled Tomcat (5.5.7)]

At this point the [Server Manager] window has the following three tabs
that have one label.

tab              label
Classes          Classes  (mnemonic key is 'C')
Sources          Sources  (mnemonic key is 'S')
Javadocs         Javadocs (mnemonic key is 'J')

These messages are defined in the following file.

tomcatint/tomcat5/src/org/netbeans/modules/tomcat5/ide/Bundle.properties
TXT_Classes=Classes
TXT_Sources=Sources
TXT_Javadoc=Javadocs
MNE_Classes=C
MNE_Sources=S
MNE_Javadoc=J

However one message are used as two messages one is tab's label without
mnemonic key and another is label with mnemonic key.
When the above messages are translated into Japanese ja messages are as follows
and ja tab's label is displayed with mnemonic key.
Please see the attached snapshots.

TXT_Classes=Japanese_Classes(C)
TXT_Sources=Japanese_Sources(S)
TXT_Javadoc=Javanese_Javadocs(J)

To fix this problem please add tab's labels without mnemonic key.
For example:

TXT_tab_Classes=Classes
TXT_tab_Sources=Sources
TXT_tab_Javadoc=Javadocs
TXT_Classes=Classes
TXT_Sources=Sources
TXT_Javadoc=Javadocs
MNE_Classes=C
MNE_Sources=S
MNE_Javadoc=J

short_description: jdk1.1 javac does not support @ operator for compiling from filelist
long_description:
When more than 10 files are being compiled on
Windows Netbeans generates temp file containing
list of files to be compiled.  This is however not
support prior to jdk1.2beta4.  This also relates
to javadoc from jdk1.1.

Netbeans/Forte should check which jdk version is
the external compiler before compiling using the @
operator.  This issue exists in all versions but
most affected are Windows users because the
treshold value in Unix is apparently different and
files are passed as arguments.

short_description: Exception converting anonymous to inner when anonymous class contains an anonymous class
long_description:
Invoking refactoring Convert Anonymous to Inner on the SubcontentPanel subclass in the following code throws the exception below.

package roadtrip
import org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget
import org.apache.wicket.markup.html.panel.Panel
import roadtrip.data.ImageEntry
public class ContentPanel extends Panel {
    ContentPanel(String id) {
        //This class exists only because we will replace its content via
        //Ajax requests and Ajax requests don't work on children of pages
        //only panels and such.
        super(id)
        SubcontentPanel pnl = new SubcontentPanel(subcontent) {
            protected void onClick(AjaxRequestTarget target ImageEntry entry) {
                final SubcontentPanel sp = this
                System.err.println(replace with big image)
                target.addComponent(this)
                SingleImagePanel nue = new SingleImagePanel(subcontent entry this) {
                    protected void onEvent(AjaxRequestTarget target ImageEntry entry SingleImagePanel p) {
                        System.err.println(Restore image table)
                        target.addComponent(this)
                        ContentPanel.this.addOrReplace(sp)
                    }
                }
                ContentPanel.this.addOrReplace(nue)
            }
        }
        add(pnl)
        setOutputMarkupId(true)
    }
}

short_description: Internal Javadoc executor is enabled on JDK 1.4

Documentation | Javadoc Executors.

short_description: A ProjectObject stored in a setting with a broken link can never materialize DataObject
long_description:
Consider the following scenario:
1. ProjectObject is obtained for some directory
(say bttemp which is created in the process of a
build) and stored in a setting.
2. clean is performed (bttemp is removed)
3. IDE shutdown
4. IDE restart 
5. obtain ProjectObject from #1 via setting.
getOriginal() == null.
6. run the build to create bttemp
7. ProjectObject.getOriginal() is still null even
though bttemp has been created.

short_description: Ctrl-F6 (Test File) does not work from the tested classes for TestNG tests in NB module projects
long_description:
[recent trunk custom build]

I have a module suite (tested with a standalone module as well) and I have created a TestNG test in it: for an existing class (d.NewClass) in the source directory I used Tools/Create Tests chose TestNG as the framework but left the proposed name: d.NewClassNGTest. The test is created and can be run using Test File/Ctrl-F6 while the test is opened in the editor. But when the tested class is opened in the editor the Test File action is disabled. For JUnit tests this action works in the tested class and this makes using the TestNG tests very hard.

short_description: Tooltips for highlights
long_description:
In many situations highlights are provided to signal a problem to a user eg. an error or warning in the code use of
deprecated API etc. Presently modules have no easy way how to provide a tooltip for the areas marked with those highlights.

It would be beneficial if modules could simply add tooltip text to the highlight itself and if the editor infrastructure
could show that text when a user hovers their mouse over the highlighted text. For module this should be the easiest
way because they already have all they need in place for creating the highlight and they know what the highlight means.

Please see the UI spec for details:
http://ui.netbeans.org/docs/ui/editor_fonts_colors/Editor_fonts_and_colors.htm

short_description: Mention/describe Show Documentation
long_description:
Jari wrote:

I have a general question regarding the (great!) RDoc preview feature: That feature seems to currently not be
documented in NetBeans the main reason I know about it is from one of Tor's screencast.

However there are numerous rendering bugs in that feature I've filed a couple of reports on the subject and there
might be more.

Is this a feature that should be considered supported (and documented) in NetBeans? Or not? 

Tor wrote:

Yes the feature is supported and hopefully documented. It's not specific toRDoc Preview - it's the generic Show
Documentation action. It works not only inside a comment - placing the caret on ANY method or class etc. and invoking
the keyboard shortcut for show documentation (or accessing it from the Source menu) should show its corresponding
documentation. 

Jari wrote:

Yes I would most probably have noticed it there [Getting Started Guide]. But on pages like:
http://wiki.netbeans.org/RubyShortcuts
currently state:
Show documentation for the method class or field under the caret. (Doesn't always work given Ruby's dynamic nature.)

This gives (at least me) the impression that it doesn't work for comments. And as I previously said - comments is
currently were it seems to work the best.

Note from Chris: We should try to explain what Doesn't always work means.

short_description: Global variabl is not declared hint is shown for anonym literal object definition.
[umbrella] Main menu UI cleanup for 6.0 M10
long_description:
This is an umbrella issue for main menu cleanup targeting 6.0 M10.

See the URL field for the main menu UI spec.

short_description: Support wildcard char in keyboard shortcuts to indicate Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getMenuAcceleratorMask() should be used
long_description:
A couple small changes are required to provide good user 
experience on the mac.  One of the major problems is that our 
keybindings are unnatural to mac users.  The two major issues 
are:

 - Issue 26854 - Ctrl is used as the default accelerator key.  It 
should be Command and
 - Issue 46807 - Cannot delete with the keyboard in explorer 
etc.  DeleteAction is bound to the Delete key.  Mac keyboards do 
not have a Delete key.
 - Issue 46808 - Command-G should be Find Next not F3 (this 
causes particular pain on mac laptops where F3 is consumed by 
the OS and Fn-F3 must be pressed for this commonly used 
action)

Changes needed to fix these issues:
 - Support a hidden attribute on keybinding files in the system.  
This will allow us to selectively bind a keystroke i.e. 


...



 - Support explicit keybindings.  The patch attached to issue 
26854 extends keybinding files to allow them to prepend X- to 
their filename and modifies the conversion methods in Utilities 
and the shortcuts editor to understand it.  What this does:  

    - It allows the shortcuts editor to work - new shortcuts
       entered by the user are marked as explicit so if the user
       enters the shortcut Ctrl-[ it won't get blindly remapped to 
       Command-[.

    - It allows modules to register shortcuts that should use
       Ctrl even on the mac.  For example in issue 46808
       Command-G should be Find-Next not F3 to fit the 
       mac guidelines and be consistent with other mac apps.
       By making it an explicit mapping GotoAction can still
       be bound to Ctrl-G on the mac.


A patch for issue 26854 is available on that issue  I will attach 
the patch to support the hidden attribute here.

Please please let's try to get this in for promo D.

short_description: support SS CC GNU compatibility mode
long_description:
Yes. You will see the -I options pointing to the default header file directories. For example:

-I/usr/include/c++/4.1.2/i586-suse-linux/
-I/prod/include/cc
-I/usr/include
-I/usr/lib/gcc/i586-suse-linux/4.1.2/include/

For linux we also add as shown by -xdryrun
  -include /prod/include/CC/gnu/builtins.h
so this header is included in all compilations.

---
Steve Clamage


On 11/11/09 09:37 Thomas Preisler wrote:
> Thanks. This is just what we needed.
>
> We get the include header files list (used by our code model) by running this command:
>
> CC -xdryrun -E
>
> and parsing the output. Question: will
>
> CC -compat=g -xdryrun -E
>
> correctly reflect where it gets the headers in GNU compatibility mode?
>
> --thomas
>
> Steve Clamage wrote:
>> The plan is to provide g++ binary compatibility at the shared-library level on Linux only. The compiler option is -compat=g. Example of use:
>>
>> % CC -compat=g f1.cc f2.cc -o myprog
>>
>> The -compat=g option causes the compiler to use the library header files from the g++ installation along with the g++ runtime libraries.  The version of g++ supported is the one that comes with the supported version of Linux where you run Sun Studio. Another example:
>>
>> % g++ hello.cc
>> % ldd a.out
>>         linux-gate.so.1 =>  (0xffffe000)
>>         libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 (0xb7e80000)
>>         libm.so.6 => /lib/libm.so.6 (0xb7e5b000)
>>         libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/libgcc_s.so.1 (0xb7e50000)
>>         libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xb7d24000)
>>         /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0xb7f7c000)
>> % CC -compat=g hello.cc
>> % ldd a.out
>>         linux-gate.so.1 =>  (0xffffe000)
>>         libstdc++.so.6 => /usr/lib/libstdc++.so.6 (0xb7ef9000)
>>         libCrunG3.so.1 => /net/cafelinux2/export/home/5.11/bin/lib/rtlibs/libCrunG3.so.1 (0xb7eef000)
>>         libm.so.6 => /lib/libm.so.6 (0xb7eca000)
>>         libc.so.6 => /lib/libc.so.6 (0xb7d9e000)
>>         libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/libgcc_s.so.1 (0xb7d7b000)
>>         /lib/ld-linux.so.2 (0xb7fde000)
>>
>> Notice that CC links the same runtime libraries as g++ along with libCrunG3.so.1 for some interfaces unique to Sun C++.
>>
>> Compatibility at the shared-library level means that you can link shared libraries built with g++ into programs built with Sun Studio. Linking individual g++ .o files or files from g++ archives is not expected to work.
>>
>> Support for g++ source-code extensions is ongoing. We support some extensions now and will support more time and resources permitting.
>>
>> The cc and CC drivers will also acquire support for some gcc/g++ command-line options. I don't have any details right now.

short_description: gdb watchpoints not available in netbeans
long_description:
Although rarely needed for debug sessions GDB has long supported the notion of watching a location in memory and firing
a breakpoint when it changes. A netbeans watch is very different. This is a crucial mechanism that should be exposed
by the ide. Even Visual Studio version 6 (circa 1998) has this.

I suppose you could claim that while it is a feature of gdb it is not a feature of netbeans and downgrade to P2.

short_description: Option Add Jersey library is ignored when RESTful webservice is created for JEE5
long_description:
- Create Web Project with JEE5 support .
- Create RESTful webservice from pattern.
- On the wizard final stage there will be dialog with question to add Jersey library to the project classpath.
- Uncheck this option.
As result Jersey library will be added into project classpath anyway.

This is true only for JEE5 profile.
JEE6 profile works fine.

* Define a New Connection using the above driver to an existing Derby instance

Apparently it is trying to start the local Derby instance which fails because
no local instance is defined.

short_description: Attaching to JVM takes very long time when there are more breakpoints set
long_description:
[jdk1.5.0 linux FC2]
I have realized that the time to connect to a VM (I am using JPDA & socked
connection) varies based on the amount of existing breakpoints set in the code.

On my linux box the debugger connect in about 1 second when there is only one
one breakpoint. Each next breakpoint adds next ~1second. So when there is about
20 existing breakpoints when attaching to the JVM the connect time is unbearably
slow.

short_description: CSS comments syntax colour highlighting problem
long_description:
According to the CSS 1 specs on w3c.org A declaration consists of a property a colon (:) and a value. Around each of these there may be whitespace.

However unless the declarations are written in the form property: value the syntax colouring doesn't recognize them.  i.e. font-size: 16px will highlight the font-size: in blue but font-size:16px and font-size : 16px both leave it in the default black.

short_description: Network Monitor window doesn't gain focus when opened
long_description:
Environment:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201312260002)
Java: 1.8.0-ea Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 25.0-b61
Runtime: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.8.0-ea-b119
System: Mac OS X version 10.9.1 running on x86_64 UTF-8 en_US (nb)


When opening windows in NetBeans the pattern is:
a) window opened if window not already opened. Put focus on window
b) put focus on window if window opened already.
c) do nothing if window already opened and has focus

The current issue has to do with case a) only

Steps to reproduce
1. Make sure the Network Monitor window is not opened
2. From the menu go to Window > Web > Network Monitor

Expected results:
Network Monitor window opened
Network Monitor window has focus

Actual results:
good: The Network Monitor opened
not good: Network Monitor window doesn't have focus

long_description: JAXB Wizard: Implement Re-generate action

short_description: Environment.find don't give a chance to setup proper exec compiler or debug defaults
long_description:
If there is default Lookup returned then ExecSupport and 
CompilerSupport getXXXType methods return non null value in case there is not 
saved any service type. So JavaSettings and JavaNode don't use to proper methods 
for obtaining defaults of service types.

short_description: String.format warns that GregorianCalendar is Invalid Value Type but accepts Calendar
long_description:
This code produces no warnings:

	GregorianCalendar cal = new GregorianCalendar( )
	Calendar c = cal
	String str = String.format( %tY %<tm %<td c )

but this code warns Invalid value type `GregorianCalendar' for format specifier `%tY' parameter 1 (repeated for each field)

	GregorianCalendar cal = new GregorianCalendar( )
	String str = String.format( %tY %<tm %<td cal )

It runs fine so I'm pretty sure this is a spurious warning from MalformedFormatString. The oracle docs even contain an example of this usage (third example on this page: http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/Formatter.html)

short_description: Tooltips are not shown in tree column of Outline view.
long_description:
Tooltips were introduced as a fix of issue #186672 but this fix was broken for the tree column only by two changes - issue #187814 and issue #183322.

To reproduce - start debugger session let it stop on some breakpoint in Variables/Watches window try to invoke a tooltip. No tooltip appears in the tree column (Name) tooltips are displayed correctly in other columns.

long_description:

When user creates WSDL for HTTP BC the URL generated is not complete it

the URL.

Build details:
Netbeans  :200706180000
Glassfish :B54-rc
JBI       :070708
HTTP BC   :070707

short_description: Improve the compiler output and output window behavior
long_description:
User problem:
-----------------------------------
Output window is very hard to use it typically is
scrolled outside of the useful data and does not
provide valuable information specifically for
compilation errors.
Also problematic is the fact that each process
execution opens a new output window the user then
typically ends up with large number of opened
outputs which he has to manually close.

User need:
-----------------------------------
The output window needs to display as much
information as possible in a way that is valuable
to the user.

Product requirement:
-----------------------------------
Improve the compiler output and output window
behavior. Also improve the opening/closing
behavior of output windows for multiple process
executions.

NetBeans 6.5.1 had processed this manifest.mf correctly but new NetBeans 6.7 RC2 ignores it.

short_description: PaintApp does not correctly handle actions
long_description:
The PaintApp sample seems to go out of its way to avoid using the standard
action enablement infrastructure apparently just so that only document windows
and not tool windows will count in the selection. But this is unnecessary.
You can simply register an instance of ContextGlobalProvider in default lookup
(above the usual one from openide/windows) which e.g. only pays attention to
selections coming from TopComponent's in the editor mode. That would permit
the custom SaveCanvasAction to be deleted - just add a SaveCookie to the
activated node for PaintTopComponent. Could just as easily add PrintCookie etc.

BTW PaintTopComponent.save() is apparently unused and could be deleted. Or the
save button could call this instead of saveAs().

org.netbeans.modules.java.JavaNode@701425-obj->
org.netbeans.modules.java.JavaDataObject@ed6301

What is interresting is that the navigators' activatedNodes never change. The
real displayed node is referenced through NavigatorController and the
activatedNodes are set only once from:
org.openide.windows.TopComponent.setActivatedNodes(TopComponent.java:296)
org.netbeans.modules.navigator.NavigatorController.updateContext(NavigatorController.java:275)

long_description: ClassesListControllerUI is held in memory via JProgressBar. This looks like Mac OS X problem.

short_description: Improper color used for XML Value in XML editor
long_description:
Currently the color values for XML Value is (2550255) -- fushia on white
background
SGML Declaration (2552000) -- yellow on white background

The XML value color (fushia) is unreadable in an error situation
since the error annotation line is a deep orange. The default for this color 
should be changed to the color used for the Java String Literal a darker 
maroon (15307)

These colors are defined in the Options window 
under Editing > Editor Settings > XML Editor then clicking the 
Fonts & Colors property editor.

short_description: Use suspended progress when running Ant builds
long_description:
See issue #58513 and issue #63332 for background. Can now use issue #63586 to
change Ant module UI so that

1. OW is not shown by default - overridable in settings.

2. Progress displayed per running Ant process. Initially in indeterminate mode.
Switches to sleeping mode if nothing happens for a while and back to
indeterminate mode if something happens (an Ant event).

short_description: After umounting webmodule with JSP in project IDE mounts many filesystems in loop
long_description:
[010628]

To reproduce:
1. Convert filesystem into webmodule
2. Add some jar into WEB-INF/lib (not mandatory)
3. Create JSP in webmodule
4. Add this JSP to project (Tools | Add to Project)
5. Unmount webmodule
6. Click on filesystem node in explorer and select Customize from popup menu. 
Look what is happening.

Now WEB-INF/classes and jars from WEB-IN/lib are repeatedly mounted and some are 
umnounted in infinitive loop number of mounted filesystem increases and IDE 
loads 100% CPU. After a while tens of new filesystems are mounted.

short_description: closing tag is not automatically suggested
long_description:
From issue 168187:

In 6.5 when closing a  tag with the '>' symbol the auto-completer would immediately give me a pop-up showing
'' as an option. As would other HTML tags that have corresponding closing tags. This doesn't occur anymore. Maybe
that was an intended change but I liked that feature.

short_description: [JMeter] Renaming of JMeter Plan through properties doesn't work properly
long_description:
Profiler 1.2 070720
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200707201200) 
Java: 1.6.0 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0-b105 System: 
Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86 Cp1251 ru_RU (nb)

Steps to reproduce:
- Create new JMeter plan
- Open its properties
- Edit name edit some other property
- Close properties
- RESULT: Two JMeter plans are shown in tree with both names: before rename and after. This is 30% reproducible.

short_description: Show project name in projects window title when file list is scrolled down
long_description:
Created attachment 136379
HTML navigator

Within NB 7.3 HTML update Netbeans started to show active html node opening tag if it does not fit in view port.


Please see HTML navigator navigator attachment to see what exactly I have in mind. This feature is very useful when you have to maintain old and ugly code with random code indents... 

I bet you know you did a great work created adding this feature :)

it would be great to have similar feature when project name is visible in/on projects tab title. In cases I have to work with 5 projects made on the same CMS its gets difficult not to start fixing wrong code. And I bent I'm not the only one.

Even better addition would be if it would be possible to add some sort of drop down with list of projects (and/or favorite folders) to fast scroll to any project.

short_description: Constants are class/module insensitive
long_description:
They do not know about their parrent:

  module Colors
    RED   = #FF0000
    GREEN = #00FF00
    BLUE  = #0000FF
  end

  module Shapes
    CIRCLE = circle
  end

  puts Shapes::|

Offer {RED|GREEN|BLUE|CIRCLE}. Should offer just CIRCLE.

short_description: Typing a start of the scripting element character < within a jsp file does not display a comment scripting element <%--
long_description: Typing a start of the scripting element character '<' within a jsp file does not display a comment scripting element <%--

short_description: Property Ant Home does not have a specific editor
long_description:
The property Ant Home for Options | Building | Ant
Settings has not a specific editor that open the
file browser to be able to select the directory or
file where ant is located.

Would be friendler and not so difficult because
it's not necessary to develop a new property editor.

short_description: NPE from FileScanner
long_description:
Hi Netbeans Experts

I am using nb5 solaris 10 sparc jdk 5.0.6/5.0.4.  I keep getting this
NPE shortly after opening a project.  This doesn't seem to happen with
nb4.1.  Unfortunately after I migrated my project to nb 5.0 I can no
longer go back to 4.1

One symptom is it doesn't show any method name autocomplate for JDK
classes.  For instance after I type

System.

I expect to see a popup window with entries like out but all I see is
class

After I type this is a string followed by a dot I expect to see a list
of methods like indexOf trim... but all I see are methods only from
java.lang.Object

I searched in netbeans.org website and couldn't find anything similar.
Any help is greatly appreciated.

The next thing I will try is to reinstall nb.  But I'm not sure if this
will make any difference.  My log attached.

*********** Exception occurred ************ at 9:32 PM on Mar 15 2006
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at
org.netbeans.modules.javacore.scanning.FileScanner.removeFromRepository(FileScanner.java:194)
        at
org.netbeans.modules.javacore.scanning.FileScanner.scan(FileScanner.java:179)
[catch] at

        at

org.netbeans.modules.javacore.JMManager$2.run(JMManager.java:769)

org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Task.run(RequestProcessor.java:493)
        at
org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Processor.run(RequestProcessor.java:926)

short_description: Error in move up and move down
long_description:
Hi

1>add 2 tasks 
2>Select 2nd task and click Move up. It had no effect
3>Now Move up is replaced by Move down which doesnt make sense for 2nd task
as it is the last task. Basically what nb is doing is enabling one at a time
So i clicked on move up it automatically disabled move up and enabled move down
w/o taking any context into account like the task number/position

So there are 2 bugs here
a> Move operation did not have effect.
b> Enabling of tasks is not correct

-Swaroop belur

short_description: Edits from IDE to XEmacs not saved in undo list
long_description:
[dev sep 29] Open a Java source in XEmacs. Make some edits in XEmacs
and then press Ctrl-_ to undo. The changes are properly undone. Now
make some changes using the IDE's Explorer e.g. change the name of
some method in the Property Sheet. The changes are made in XEmacs. But
Ctrl-_ does not work they were not put in the undo list I guess. I
believe (but am not sure) that this functionality worked in the
'emacs' module. Probably an important bug since user data could be lost
via careless operations in the Explorer.

short_description: Open required projects submenu too long (out of screen)
long_description:
Open required projects submenu with many subprojects too long - out of screen

In a project with many subprojects the menu is too long (unable to display and select lasts items). Multiple columns in menu should be used here.

short_description: adding new Workspace in Project Settings added workspace (good in MW) has no subitems after expand its node in Project Settings
long_description: Priority is changed to P4 (normal).

short_description: HTML formating doesn't format line without a tag in some cases.
long_description:
Have this code:



    
        
					This text keeps getting indented with each auto-format.
        
        
            This text stays put.
					But this line does not because of the leading newline.
        
    


The tabs are probably important before the lines without an html tag. After formatting the lines are not moved.

short_description: Web Service code is not formatted
long_description:
Product Version         = NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201008200001) (#0559343619de)
  Operating System        = Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86
  Java VM Vendor        = 1.6.0_20 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 16.3-b01 Sun Microsystems Inc.


Steps to reproduce:

- Create Web Application
- Create Web Service
- Go to Design view
- Add operation
  Name: operation
  Return type: int
  Parameter Name: i Type int
  Parameter Name: j Type int

Go to Source
---------------------------------------
    @WebMethod(operationName = add)
    public int add(@WebParam(name = i)
    int i @WebParam(name = j)
    int j) {
        //TODO write your implementation code here:
        return 0
    }
---------------------------------------

The method code is not formatted

short_description: Dummy button doesn't work
long_description: See summary for details.

short_description: Exception report will not transfer to Bugzilla
long_description:
I filed an exception from NetBeans this morning [1] and it did not automatically transfer to Bugzilla. I clicked the Enter button and it thought about it for a while indicating In transfer but it never happened.

Exception Report:

[1] http://statistics.netbeans.org/analytics/detail.do?id=202947

short_description: [Maven] Test Restful Web Services opens URL before project has been deployed
long_description:
- Create Maven Web project.
- Create RESTful WS.
- Invoke Test RESTful Web Services action.
The result is:
- test client files are generated
- project's deployment is started
- REST Client URL is opened in the browser

The last two actions works simultaneously. Open in browser action 
should be invoked after deployment has finished. Otherwise browser could open
non existed resource.

short_description: Uninstaller and info about user's directory
long_description:
On uninstaller's Summary Panel should be info
about user's directory e.g.
The uninstaller has not removed your IDE user
directory. If you install another version of this
IDE you can use the Import Settings Wizard to
import your old settings into the newer IDE
installation.

short_description: ServiceType.displayName should default first on display name from BeanDescriptor and only then to the class name.
long_description: This would eliminate the need to override displayName for many people.

short_description: Refresh with incomplete issue data
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Open some issue (assume that it is issue 20).
2. Click on '...' button next to 'Depends on' field.
3. Type the ID of the issue (e.g. 20 in our case).

short_description: UI would be much improved with a GoBack operation (inverse of Go to)
long_description:
The source editor has a Go to Declaration menuitem which can move your 
current location within the source file.  That's great.  Similarly some types 
support their own Goto operation (for example EJBs with an EJB Module have a Go 
To Referenced EJB action) hopefully there will be many more such navigation 
aids added to Netbeans in the future.
But these navigation features all suffer from a common problem: Once the user 
gets to the new location they often want to then come back to where they were 
but there is no Back functionality in Netbeans.  Such functionality if it 
existed would function very much like the Back (and Forward) buttons in a web 
browser (browser tracks you as you navigate).
One possible way to implement this in Netbeans would be to require that any 
Netbeans action that moves the user to a new location (another example would be 
clicking on a different tab in the source editor window) would need to first 
register the current location with TopManager (or whoever) topmanager could 
then maintain an ordered list of locations and it would consult that list when 
the user presses the Back (or Forward) button.
The Back functionality would be particularly useful for navigation within the 
Source Editor window.

short_description: NullPointerException at com.sun.source.util.TreePath.
ALL: Remounting of a filesystem with different profile is not possible.
long_description:
Development build of NetBeans 3.3 #200110100100 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.3.1

Description:
============
If user makes a mistake and mounts some filesystem using one profile then s/he 
is not able to remount it with different profile. It is possible if wrong file-
system is unmounted after correct one is mounted. This is very serious and might
be pretty annoying.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Launch the IDE with fresh brand new user directory.
2. Mount for instance PVCS filesystem and after it's done unmount it back.
3. Then try to mount CVS filesystem but you will see that PVCS filesystem from
   previous step will appear in the explorer instead.

I would propose to change the behavior and ignore filters if they do not work for gdb so that the BP worked in any case.

short_description: Encoding queries don't check file validity
long_description:
From nbdev:

	From: 	  Marian.Petras@Sun.COM
	Subject: 	Re: [nbdev] FileEncodingQuery exception
	Date: 	May 17 2007 1:29:43 PM PDT
	To: 	  nbdev@netbeans.org

The immediate cause of the problem is that DataObject.getNodeDelegate() is called on an invalid 
object. According to documentation of DataObject.isValid() object can become invalid when it is 
deleted its files are deleted or dispose() is called. Nobody should call getNodeDelegate() on an invalid 
DataObject so everybody should check the DataObject's validity before asking for a node delegate.

The problem is that nobody checks the validity in the example you describe which is a bug (in my 
opinion). The check should be performed somewhere and the only question is where:
   - in DataObjectEncodingQueryImplementation.getEncoding()
     before asking for a DataObject's lookup?
   - in DataObject.getLookup() before asking for a node delegate?

I suggest that you file a bug report against openide/data systems and wait for resolution.

Marian


Tor Norbye wrote:

doing this as part of one-time indexing (similar to the Java module) and it needs to access the 
Documents (as opposed to just reading the bytes off the disk) because it's using lots of BaseDocument 
functions to iterate the contents (to extract comment sections etc.).

referenced bug number (#17020) but I can't tell what the issue is. Does anyone know what the issue

short_description: [40cat] Bad Grammar in New Project Wizard
long_description:
[ JDK VERSION : J2SE 1.4.2_04 ]

The descriptions for the Project choices have some bad grammar do not match the choices do not follow NB GUI text guidelines and are phrased inconsistently.

The text for Java Application says

The Empty Java Project creates a new J2SE project and let's specify it's main class.

Should be lets you not let's. Should be its not it's. Also Project should not be capitalized and new is redundant (that is you don't create something that is old or is already created)

Might I suggest

Choose Java Application to create a J2SE project for which there are no existing source files. The wizard will create a main class for you using a name that you specify.

Also

The Empty Java Library creates a new J2SE project without main class

I suggest

Choose Java Class Library to create a J2SE project without a main class.

Also


The Existing Java Project creates a new J2SE project from existing classes


I suggest (note With is capitalized per the guidelines and the text is ambiguous as to whether the existing classes are copied to a new project dir)

Choose Java Project With Existing Sources to create a J2SE project for existing Java files.

Also

The J2SE Ant Project creates a new project which uses your existing Ant build script and maps its target to IDE targets etc.

Choose Java Project With Existing Ant Script to create a project that uses an existing Ant build script and that maps that script's targets to the IDE's targets and so forth.

short_description: Wizard requires User Name if Server connection method is used.
long_description:
Development build #200110170100 of NetBeans 3.3 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.3.1

Description:
============
It is not possible to mount CVS filesystem using :server: connection method thr-
ough CVS wizard because it doesn't enable Next > button if User Name is not 
specified. Please disable this textfield. The workaround is to use Generic VCS 
wizard.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Invoke Versioning|Mount Version Control|CVS item from the main menu.
2. Setup some working directory and push Next > button once or twice to get to
   Connection Method panel.
3. Select Server option and fill out Server Name and Repository fields.
4. You will see that Next > button will be disabled.

short_description: Should avoid man2html
long_description: man2html works differently on Windows causing some problems in current implementation. Should avoid man2html all together and write own html generator based on man output. Not requiring users to install man2html on any platform is to prefer.

short_description: FacesConfigModel.getManagedBean(String) performance problem
long_description:
The FacesConfigModel.getManagedBean() method is a source of one of the runtime performance problems during page open. 
There is a significant amount of computation done in this method and the results are not cached by insync or by the jsf
api module.  There are hundreds of invocations of this method when during page open when there are components on the
page so caching results could provide a performance improvement.

The root cause of the performance problem here appears to be the lookup created for the ModelSource instance in
org.netbeans.modules.xml.retriever.catalog.Utilities.createModelSource() which opens the document every time the lookup
is invoked.

short_description: Popup Javadoc not found for MultiDataObject.addSecondaryEntry
long_description:
[dev jul 08]

1. Create build with
-Dmodules=editorjavaclassfilejava/apijavadoc
and start on fresh userdir.

2. Mount nb_all/openide/src sources (plain local
filesystem). Wait for background parser DB update
to finish (watch CPU activity).

3. Create a new Java source and open it in the
editor. Type

new DataFolder

and Alt-Sh-I to import
org.openide.loaders.DataFolder. Type

new DataFolder().add

and scroll to

void addSecondaryEntry(MultiDataObject.Entry fe)

No Javadoc is displayed though the source code
has Javadoc.

Inner class problem? The header for the popup that
would show Javadoc  (above Javadoc not found...)
shows

protected final void
addSecondaryEntry(org.openide.loaders.MultiDataObject$Entry
fe)

Same for removeSecondaryEntry. Other methods seem
fine.

P.S.:

If you have apisupport/apidocs also enabled so
that the prebuilt OpenAPIs.jc[bs] is there it
seems that the package-private
MultiDataObject.removeFile(FileObject) is also
listed though I have no idea why. Probably a
separate bug. Neither of OpenAPIs.jc[bs] mentions
this method (I searched in binary and it was
built with public + protected levels) so it must
have been picked up by the automatic scan.

horizontal scroll bar.

short_description: Deadlock on shutdown if a property editor showing
long_description:
Fully reproducable.  With new property sheet impl...

Open Tools | Options | Debugging and Executing |
Debugger Execution
Select the Library Path property in the property sheet
Shut down the IDE.  The main window no longer
paints and
shutdown never happens.

The trigger seems to be:
org.netbeans.core.execution.beaninfo.editors.NbClassPathEditor
-
something during shutdown triggers a repaint of
the property
sheet.  This tries to fetch all of the module
jars at the
same time the window system is writing its XML
out.  See line
270 of org.netbeans.core.windows.PersistenceManager:

// FIXME There shouldn't be used this kind of hack.
// wait for all deferred tasks and for task saving
winsys
while
(DeferredPerformer.getDefault().isProcessing() ||
!isWriteFinished()) {
                    Thread.currentThread().sleep(200)
                }

If org.openide.LifecycleManager were enhanced so
that I could
listen for a shutdown event (or fetch some kind of
state flag)
I could avoid the repaint.  But probably the
underlying problem
should be fixed either in the way the classpath
editor retrieves
values from getTags() (some caching or something)
or the 
window system's behavior on shutdown.  Adding
Peter Zavadsky to
cc to see if the current window system work will
clear this
problem.

library project.
5. Probably some more actions.

short_description: NSME (JMIUtils.getExactClass(String)) from JavaHintsProvider$CastParamHintCreator.createHint
long_description:
org.netbeans.modules.java.hints/1 [1.3.0.1.1.3 1 200506082117]
org.netbeans.modules.java.editor/1 [1.1 050616]
org.netbeans.modules.java.editor.lib/1 [1.1 050616]

Looks like Java Hints was using some classes from the editor which were for some
reason public (though they should not be! or only for friends):

            
                org.netbeans.modules.editor.java
            

Thus java/editor just broke its API by deleting a method so it needs to declare
a new major release version to ensure that old clients are quietly disabled.

short_description: Missing part of output log during CVS operation
long_description:
[dev-200512132030 JDK 1.5.0_06]

Steps to reproduce:
1) Slide down the output window
2) Invoke CVS operation e.g. update (the operation should last longer)
3) Hover the mouse over the Output button to open Output window
4) View the running output from CVS operation
5) Hover mouse over editor to close the OW
6) Let the CVS operation finish
7) Hover the mouse over the Output button to see OW
Only the output logged from the point when you closed the output is logged it
means that user is not able to see full output from CVS operation.

short_description: Global keybindings are doubled in kit spec. keybs.
long_description:
steps to reproduce:
1. Set Global Keybindings (beep -> C-N)
2. Set Plain Keybindings (beep - > C-B)
3. Restart IDE
4. Plain Keybindings for beep action now contains C-N(gray from global KB) C-N(for plain kit) and C-B(setted before)

short_description: Create Faces Config API to support the faces-config files for a project
long_description:
The FacesConfig API will be generic to Netbeans and allow indirect modification
of the faces-config files in any given project.  This API will have the ability
to accept listeners in order to sync registered listeners with modification to
faces configuration files.

Here are some of the requirements that have been setup.
   1. Ability to Edit the Faces Configuration File
   2. Knowing the to and from view ids for any given case.
   3. Syncing changes between XML Editor and Page Flow Editor
   4. Know where rules come from.
   5. Get all Nav-Rule All Managed Beans
   6. JSFEditor API to plug in new views for the Multiview. 

For minutes around this issue please go to:
http://wiki.netbeans.org/wiki/view/PageFlowMinutes20070118

short_description: Minor buglet in SQL CREATE with multi-column primary key
long_description:
New SQL editor is a vast improvement on the older one many thanks.

One small buglet - view data for a table select a row and choose Show SQL for CREATE - if the table has a multi-column
primary key the resulting SQL has the comma in the wrong place -

CREATE TABLE TMAP_DOMAINS (REGION_ID NUMBER NOT NULL DOMAIN_NUMBER NUMBER NOT NULL GEOMETRY STRUCT PRIMARY KEY
(DOMAIN_NUMBERREGION_ID ))

should be:
CREATE TABLE TMAP_DOMAINS (REGION_ID NUMBER NOT NULL DOMAIN_NUMBER NUMBER NOT NULL GEOMETRY STRUCT PRIMARY KEY
(DOMAIN_NUMBER REGION_ID))

short_description: NB 5 memory leak
long_description:
We're running NB 5 on Solaris 9 machines.   It's just the plain-jane Netbeans
IDE.   We use it for editing compiling and running.  We have 8 or 10 small
files open at a time.

Multiple times during the day the drop down menus go blanks and and we have to
save all of our files exit and restart netbeans.  All the startup options for
netbeans are at their defaults.

I had hoped that upgrading from netbeans 4 to netbeans 5 would have fixed this
problem but it hasn't.  Got any solutions?

-- Will

short_description: NullPointerException at org.netbeans.modules.languages.parser.Parser.read
long_description:
Build: NetBeans IDE 6.0 RC1 (Build 200711131200)
VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0_02-b06
OS: Windows Vista 6.0 x86

User Comments: 
Previous submitted as a guest. I am now registered and have more info.

This error occurs on startup of NetBeans when automatically reloading a document that was open when NetBeans was previously shutdown. The document has a custom editor create using an NBS file. The error only occurs if you have a NAVIGATOR block defined in the NBS file. It does no matter whether the NAVIGATOR uses custom methods or just property strings. The error still occurs. The problem goes away if the NAVIGATOR block is removed.

short_description: NetigsoModule.getManifest null after restart contrary to super Javadoc
long_description:
Created attachment 117428
Log file

See 252401263ef7 for diagnostic patch. I run NB with a custom --userdir and --cachedir. In the current dev build every time I try to start the IDE I get an error that halts startup while the splash screen is still showing:

java.lang.IllegalStateException: Were trying to install a module that had never been checked: Netigso: .../ide/modules/com-jcraft-jsch.jar
	at org.netbeans.ModuleManager.enable(ModuleManager.java:1078)

The workaround is to delete *.dat from the cachedir and try again.

short_description: Better documentation required for form and projects
long_description:
The current documentation of changes in form
editor related to projects is poor. This is mostly
the case in the area of working with custom beans.

I've just scanned the docs and found:

- Adding components to palette is described just
in beans/adding.html. No link to it from GUI
desing pages.

- The palette manager is not described - just
briefly mentioned in beans/adding.html.

- Possibility to add components to palette
directly from project explorer is not described.
Just gui/components/adding.html describes a way
To add a bean using the Files window to form
(not to palette).

- No help how to make the components (and forms
that already use them) from 3.6 work in 4.0
(migration guide?).


We should also do a complete review of the docs
for GUI designing but for now these are the most
important problems. Let us know if you need some
help explanation etc. Thanks.

short_description: Debugger.JPDA.ant JPDAStart.java - Remote Debugging no longer works - Wrong IP is bound
long_description:
When you start a new debug session the socket used to bind to HostName:Port. So a remote machine was able to connect to the system and be debugged.  Now however the socket binds to 127.0.0.1:port.  127.0.0.1 is loopback that means NO machine outside of the machine you are using can connect to the debug port!

To test this debug an application and once the Debugger Console says Listening on {PORT}  run a net stat like application to notice that the socket is now on 127.0.0.1 instead of its previous ip of HostName:{port}.

You can also view this by debugging an ant task from ant and you will find the variable {jpda.address} also is now set to loop back incorrectly.

long_description:

short_description: SQL statements returning resultdset are executed twice
long_description:
When I execute this statement in NetBeans

    select put_message(concat('dummy ' now()))

it is actually executed twice thus causing duplication of rows in target table.

Full SQL for this use-case is following (PostgreSQL):
>>----------------------------------------

    CREATE TABLE dummy_messages ( 
      dm_id                serial
      dm_text              varchar(250)
      dm_created           timestamp
     )

    CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION put_message(IN m_text varchar)
        RETURNS int LANGUAGE plpgsql AS $$
    DECLARE
        msg_id int
    BEGIN
        insert into dummy_messages(dm_text dm_created)
            values (m_text now())
            returning dm_id into msg_id
        return msg_id
    END $$

    select put_message(concat('dummy ' now()))

    -- select * from dummy_messages

<<----------------------------------------
(Note: $$ will work unless patch from these issues is applied. 
    https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=257457
    https://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=257363
Alternately 'setup' SQL script can be executed in pgAdmin
)

Second execution occurs because of this code:

  package org.netbeans.modules.db.dataview.output

  class SQLExecutionHelper {
        class Loader implements Runnable Cancellable {
            ...
            @Override
            public void run() {
                    ...
                    // If total count was not retrieved using scrollable cursors
                    // compute it now.
                    if (!useScrollableCursors && dataView.getPageContexts().size() > 0) {
                        getTotalCount(isSelect sql stmt dataView.getPageContext(0))
                    }

    private void getTotalCount(boolean isSelect ...) {
        ...
        // SELECT COUNT(*) FROM (sqlquery) alias
        ResultSet cntResultSet = null
        try {
            cntResultSet = stmt.executeQuery(
                    SQLStatementGenerator.getCountAsSubQuery(sql))
            setTotalCount(cntResultSet pageContext)


... which indeed executes statement twice just to get count of rows.

Call stack:
SQLStatementExecution
    at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeWithFlags(PgStatement.java:458)
    at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeQuery(PgStatement.java:374)
    at org.netbeans.modules.db.dataview.output.SQLExecutionHelper.getTotalCount(SQLExecutionHelper.java:909)
    at org.netbeans.modules.db.dataview.output.SQLExecutionHelper.access$900(SQLExecutionHelper.java:84)
    at org.netbeans.modules.db.dataview.output.SQLExecutionHelper$1Loader.run(SQLExecutionHelper.java:182)
    at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
    at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Task.run(RequestProcessor.java:1443)
    at org.netbeans.modules.openide.util.GlobalLookup.execute(GlobalLookup.java:68)
    at org.openide.util.lookup.Lookups.executeWith(Lookups.java:303)
    at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Processor.run(RequestProcessor.java:2058)


I think that the only 'right' way for generic runner of SQL code (the one having no exact knowledge of what is happening server side) to get number of rows in resultset is - read it until the end (most probably with some safe limit) and display number of the fetched rows.

Setting priority to P2 because
- issue causes unwanted hidden destructive affect on data
- there is no workaround

short_description: automatically generated division operator (operator/) multiplies instead of divides.
long_description:
Created attachment 151437
a screen shot of the generated code.

Basically the bug is that the automatically generated `C operator/(const C& c) const` method delegates to `C& operator*()` instead of `C& operator/()`. 

If you need more details at this point here they are.

To reproduce this bug start netbeans and create a new project by going to file->new. select c/c++ from the left categories box and then pick c/c++ application from the right projects box. In the next window pick a name for the project and then hit the finish button.

Now that you have created a project go to File->New File. Select c++ from the left categories box and then pick c++ header file from the right File Types box. Then press the next button give the file any name and press the Finish button.

Add the following code the file:

class C {
    
private:
    int x
}

It is important that your class have a member (this is why we have the int x line above).
Now click your mouse so that your cursor is anywhere between the curly brackets and click on Source->Insert code.... A context menu will open at the location of your cursor. Click on Arithmetic Operators.... A window will appear. In that window click the checkbox next to operator/(const C& right) const : C. Then press the Generate button.

short_description: SQL: Request for new SQL Editor Comment and Uncomment buttons
long_description:
Case Study: In the toolbar of the Java source editor there are two buttons than allow for the addition and removal of comments (i.e. Comment and Uncomment).  Essentially '//' is added or removed to the beginning of the focused line respective to the button pressed.  This is a nice feature.

It would be nice to have the save feature for the SQL Editor as it currently does not exist.  The only difference is that in place of '//' the character that would be used would be '#'.

Thanks.

short_description: Enable clang coloured output by default
long_description:
Created attachment 135982
Screenshot of clang coloured output.

Clang is able to produce nicely coloured output when errors occur. This is enabled by default when executing on the command line but does not appear when building inside Netbeans (tested on a new C++ project).

You can explicitly enable this using the -fcolor-diagnostics command line flag. This will generate some nice-looking output in the Output window. See the attached screenshot.

It would be nice if Netbeans could enable this by default for C++ projects using clang.

short_description: NullPointerException when debugging
long_description:

the debugger hangs with the following in the debugger console:

    compile-single:
The error icon flashes indicating that an error has occurred:

The following appears to be the pertinent section in the messages.log file.

Error in JAR file C:\KillerApp\bin\StuffIDidntWrite.jar: error in opening zip file
*********** Exception occurred ************ at 10:16 AM on Feb 27 2006
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.netbeans.modules.debugger.jpda.ant.JPDAStart.fileToURL(JPDAStart.java:425)
	at
org.netbeans.modules.debugger.jpda.ant.JPDAStart.convertToSourcePath(JPDAStart.java:376)

org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Processor.run(RequestProcessor.java:926)

I rebuilt the bad .jar and now I can debug.

I suggest that NB provide an error message to the user letting them know a
specific element on the classpath has issues and the debugger should not hang
when encountering this situation.  IMO NB should give the user the option to
continue while excluding the problem file(s) from the classpath.

short_description: synchronization problem in sunstudio collector
long_description:
This problem never appeared yet but still there is a possibility that it may happen.
Currently initialization of sunstudio collector (prepare experiment directory and initialization of er_print session)
performed asynchroniously. The point of synchronization is at the moment of notification that dlight target was started.
On this notification we are waiting for completion of init task. BUT in case when target has been substituted with the
collect it starts (as it is a target) and *only then* it notifies listeners (itself as well). So if experiment
directory is not prepared yet collect may fail...

short_description: Changes to NbPreferences occasionally not saved due to a sync problem
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 20110711-19a9d9a0205b)
Operating System = Linux version 2.6.37.6-0.5-desktop running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_26
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 20.1-b02

Since the fix for #198665 our tests (in versioning) started failing occasionally. After a long digging and debugging NbPreferences' code i came across a probable cause. If i understand correctly modifying prefs comes in the following steps:
1) value is stored in memory in a map of properties
2) an async task is run after 200 ms that takes the map and persists it on disk in a preferences file
3) at the end of the async task FS fires a fileChanged event that results in calling NbPreferences.stateChanged method that empties the whole property map kept in memory

Now what happens when someone calls NbPreferences.put(...) right between 2) and 3)? Unless i am mistaken the change is not stored and instead dropped into a black hole. I'll attaching a test demonstrating the problem (but it's an artificial one).
Hard to say if this may affect something other than unit tests but you should definitely at least know about this.

============

Substitution option is used. It is not propagated
to execution strings of both CHECKOUT_CMD commands.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount CVS filesystem using Command-line Client.
2. Create new file with keyword $Revision$ in its
source.
3. Add it and Commit two revisions in a row.

down CTRL key and choose CVS|Diff Graphical...
action.
5. Setup 1.1 as Revision or Tag 1 1.2 as
Revision or Tag 2 and choose -kb value of
Keyword Substitution option.
6. Push OK button. You will see that revision
1.1 contains  $Revision: 1.1 $ text although it is
not true.

short_description: Unable to create Web Services / [Secure] Calculator sample projects
long_description:
In NetBeans 6.5 on Mac OSX 10.5.6 I'm unable to create a Sample Application project for Calculator or Sample Calculator. 

Steps to reproduce:

1) EITHER: 
   a) Open New Project wizard 
   b) Select Samples
   c) Select Web Services
   OR
   a) In the Start Page Select Welcome to Netbeans IDE
   b) Select Web Services under the Try a Sample Project quadrant
2) Select Calculator
3) Select Next
4) Ensure you have a valid location in the Project Location field

The Finish button remains disabled. 

This bug also occurs for the Secure Calculator sample but does not occur for the other Sample Web Services (i.e. the
Finish button become enabled in those cases).

I've checked file permissions folder permissions etc.

Sorry if this doesn't contain everything first time i've submitted a bug.

short_description: form_tag hint is not correct
long_description:
On Mac OS X Netbeans 6.7.1 which comes with rails 2.3.2:

form_tag in hints ruby/rhtml in preferences is set to:

ft    $(1 default=update} %>

the correct form should be:

ft    $(1 default=update} do %>

Notice the equal sign disappears (this one is needed) and maybe a do at the end could be useful.

short_description: annotation/dd provider does not set required ejb-name field before sending create event for bean.
long_description:
Run NetBeans w/ console.
Create an EJB module JavaEE5 server = glassfish.
Add a session bean.
Note message in console Invalid DDBean - no ejb-name field. or something like
that.

This is because when the create event was sent for
/ejb-jar/enterprise-beans/session the ejb-name field was not initialized and
the SJSAS plugin expects that all required subfields of a bound field exist when
the create event for the bound field is sent.  (By bound field I mean a DDBean
that has a DConfigBean bound to it.  See annotation provider requirements on the
CdpJ2ee wiki for a list of bound fields.)

This behavior actually shows up with the annotated form of virtually all named
beans (session beans and message driven in particular though.)

short_description: Usability problems of Show All Change Paths option
long_description:
Created attachment 116474
All change paths shown in spite of unchecked option.

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201203071105)
Java: 1.6.0_31 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 20.6-b01
System: Linux version 3.0.0-12-generic running on i386 UTF-8 cs_CZ (nb)
User directory: /home/cesilko/.netbeans/dev
Cache directory: /home/cesilko/.cache/netbeans/dev

Description:
============
Firstly Show All Change Paths option does not display/hide all affected files on Diff tab as it only works on Summary tab. Secondly if user clicks Show all files link to see all files and then changes his mind the Show All Change Paths option does no longer work. See attached screenshot.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Open some Mercurial versioned project.
2. Select some file which was changed in the past together with few more files in one commit/push/etc.
3. Right click it and choose History > Show History from its popup menu.
4. Click Search Mercurial History > link from the History toolbar.
5. Switch to Diff tab and expand some revision node. Although you don't have Show All Change Paths option checked you will see more entries except the desired file.
6. Switch back to Summary tab and expand some revision.
7. Click Show all files link to see all files changed in this revision.
8. Now check and then uncheck Show All Change Paths option. All changed files are still visible.

short_description: FileObjects: Expose the actual filename
long_description:
There doesnt seem to be a way to view the physical filename of an object from 
within the IDE as the underlying file is abstracted away by the data object 
API. Typically because of the strict ObjectTypeFile Extension association 
the real name is guessable as ObjectName.extension. But I think this can 
sometimes be a confusing and is a little too abstract: a way to see the 
actual filename would be nice (for users mainly but also programmers writing 
higher level modules too). 

An example is new users who may type eg.: MyDocument.html into the wizard and 
not realize the file is called MyDocument.html.html. Could there be a read-
only filename property for file objects?

short_description: Migrate JSF web application written using NB on to Visual Web Pack
long_description:
Original status: 1-Dispatched Suggested Status: NEW

Original Target Release: shortfin_dev Suggested Target Milestone : 5.5


Original submitter: charyk

Description:
It would be very attractive for this group of customers if we can come up with
some kind of guide to migrate  JSF web application written using NB on to Shortfin.

Sample Project attached.

See Also  : http://bt2ws.central.sun.com/CrPrint?id=6468503

Evaluation:
> Since we are close to the point where we can migrate Leopard project to Shortfin
> successfully  achieving the same for NB web project may be relatively simple.
> Not for the TP may be for FCS all I'm requesting is manual steps.
> 
> To me this is a bug that we may not have thought through...? 

These 2 kinds of migration are complete different. Since it is not the ShortFin
target though we had already thought about it it has very low chance we will
implement it.

Evaluation (Entry 2):
In the process of determining the project architecture for Shortfin the
nb-creator-pack tiger team identified a number of NetBeans web project use cases
that simply did not map to the Visual Web Pack due to the application model and
constraints imposed by the VWP. The issues are rather complex and must be
resolved before considering support for NB web project migration to VWP
projects. It is much more than just documenting a manual procedure.

short_description: UML2MOF tagged values are not forwarded to MOF
long_description:
Tagged values from the UML model are not forwarded 
correctly into the MOF model. This is because for 
example Poseidon generates something like:

<UML:TaggedValue xmi.id = 'a53'
    isSpecification = 'false'
    dataValue = 'edu.stanford.smi.protegex.xmi'>
    
        
    


<UML:TagDefinition xmi.id = 'a54' 
    isSpecification = 'false' 
    tagType = 'javax.jmi.packagePrefix'>
      
        
          
            <UML:MultiplicityRange xmi.id = 'a245' 
                lower = '1' upper = '1'/>
          
        
      
    

which is not handled by the mapTags method in Transformer 
(which expects every tag to have a name). Apparently MOF 
either allows taggedValues to have a name or a type.

If have attached a new version of Transformer.java where 
I modified the mapTags method (including a new helper 
method) that works well for my system. Now I get the 
packagePrefix and other tags correctly in the MOF.

short_description: Competing CSS editors when using NB 5.5 & VWP
long_description:
I posted the following message on the nbusers mailing list:

I opened the resources/stylesheet.css that VWP created for my project
and the editor is ignoring my Font & Color preferences that I have
configured (which worked just fine prior to VWP).

Even stranger looking at Advanced Options under the Editor Settings
category I now have *2* entries entitled CSS Editor and the
available settings are *very* different.


I then received the following reply (from David Botterill @ Sun):

You are seeing a the affect of having two CSS Editor modules in NetBeans 
at the same time.  With VWP installed the VWP CSS Editor is taking 
precedence.  We are working on issues like this to consolidate features 
like this and provide the best functionality in a single instance. 

To answer your radar question please submit an issue on IssueZilla 
http://www.netbeans.org/issues/enter_bug.cgi?component=visualweb telling 
us what you want to see in a CSS Editor.



What I would like to see in a CSS editor is the following:

1. My font and color choices used.
2. Autocomplete capability on attribute names and values.
3. Use of the Creator/VWP wizard optional (which it appears to be now).
4. Ability from within the editor to have a context menu choice of Create CSS
entry when focused on a style=... attribute within a JSP.
5. Have refactoring choices that would allow me to merge all or part of a
selected CSS class into another (parent) class and create a new class as a copy
of a selected class (possibly with a dialogue asking for the new class name).
