To reproduce:

1) Create a web module
2) Add standard and jstl tag libraries 
3) Edit the property sheet for web.xml by adding a context param 
   (you can choose default) or 

set Param Name to javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.sql.password
and
set Param Value to PUBLIC

4) Install external Tomcat 4.0.2
5) Export a war file for this web module to the webapps directory of external
Tomcat
6) Start tomcat (./catalina run)

Result:
PARSE error at line 1 column 1
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The markup in the document preceding the root
element must be well-formed.
PARSE error at line 1 column 1
org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The markup in the document preceding the root
element must be well-formed.

The web module cannot be installed properly.

short_description: Profiling SJSAS 8.1 PE doesn't work on Windows if spaces in path
long_description:
The server fails to start on Windows if Profiler libraries (NetBeans install 
dir) contain spaces in path which is by default - C:\Program Files\netbeans-
5.0beta2\profiler1\...

The reason is that incorrectly formatted (containing extra quotes) -agentpath 
argument is passed to domain.xml. It seems that patch provided by the Profiler 
team to fix this problem wasn't implemented (Ludo knows more).

Steps to reproduce:

1/ Install NB beta2 into default location - C:\Program Files\netbeans-5.0beta2
2/ Use bundled SJSAS8.1PE or register external server
3/ Create new webproject (TomcatServletExample) setup it to run on SJSAS8.1PE
4/ Try to Profile Main Project (any profiling mode Monitoring imposes no extra 
overhead) or start the server in profiling mode from Runtime tab. In both cases 
the server fails to start but the plugin still waits for the server to start 
up. The only way how to get from this state is to restart NB.

If NB installed in C:\netbeans-5.0beta2 profiling SJSAS8.1PE works fine.

short_description: Non-localized SMALL_ICON attribute on core project actions causes branding issues
long_description:
This is a follow up to bug #210973 as per Jesse Glick's suggestion.

The code in org.netbeans.modules.project.ui.actions.Actions sets up a non-localized SMALL_ICON attribute on many of the standard project actions alongside iconBase.  Prior to fix of #210973 this causes branding issues in menus.  This may still cause issues elsewhere if the SMALL_ICON attribute is used.  Is there a reason this is not localized?

PVCS: Unable to Add All Source Packages from within Projects window

Build 200504031800

To reproduce:
- register a PVCS-controlled directory and create a new Java Application
TheApp in it
- switch to Projects window
- select Source Packages node in the tree and invoke PVCS|Add All context
menu command on it
- in Add - src dialog provide a Workfiles description and check Add all
subdirectories check box. Push OK.
The following message appears in stdout:
...[Error]
The project could not be loaded: //TheApp.

This happens because IDE doesn't automatically create TheApp project in a
project database before trying to create src one. 
The same sequence of actions in VSS doesn't cause any problem.

Workaround: invoke PVCS|Create Project first on TheApp node from within
Files window.

short_description: Support annotations for creation of layer entries
long_description:
I am playing with using annotation processors to generate XML layer entries at build time.

There are two major issues:

1. Where should the processors live?

1a. Issue #147393 (building on the earlier patch #6e9ef144f2cb) assumes that the processor is right inside the module
JAR file.

1b. An alternative would be to keep processors in separate JARs.

1a is simpler to use since you do not need any special javac options (you only need to ensure you are running a
269-compliant compiler) so it should work best with CoS and Maven builds. 1b minimizes module JAR size and dependencies.

For now I am going with 1a. It means that we will need to have libs.javacapi in the platform so long as support JDK 5.
In the longer term when we can assume JDK 6 the special compiler trick can be removed and the runtime dependencies
will be minimal (a module supplying an annotation processor will just need to depend on org.openide.modules or whatever
contains the base class for layer-generating processors).

2. How should the generated layer be placed? It needs to be created somewhere in build/classes/ but then what?

2a. Hack  to define OpenIDE-Module-Layer if not already present and if present to merge the
generated layer into the source layer when packing the JAR.

2b. Modify the module system (NbInstaller ExternalUtil ModuleLayeredFileSystem apisupport's LayerUtils) to look for
and load META-INF/generated-layer.xml if present in addition to any regular declared layer if present.

For now I am going with 2b. 2a would be a bit easier to implement but adds complexity to the build system and will
likely cause problems for CoS and Maven. In the long run I would also like to discourage OpenIDE-Module-Layer and
instead recommend source layers be conventionally stored as META-INF/layer.xml - again easing CoS and potentially
simplifying other things by removing an unnecessary variable (the resource path of the layer).

short_description: Reformat Code of tag file template works strange.
long_description:
Pre-E2 dev build #200501120000 of NetBeans 4.1
Windows XP JDK 1.5 build #64

Description:
============
Reformat Code action on tag file sometimes works
strange way if it contains table definition. The
same fails on HTML if the structure is similar to
the one used below.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Create new sample web project.
2. Create new tag file from template underneath.
3. Delete lines 17 and 32 to uncomment the example
4. Right click editor area click Reformat Code.
5. Note that line 22 was incorrectly indented.

short_description: Empty label for anonymous classes in logical view of 'find usages'
long_description: One small bug in UI for 'find usages': if you switch to logical view you can see nodes with empty label in a tree if element usage is inside of some anonymous class. Annotating them with something like 'anonymous Runnable' would be more appropriate.

short_description: IllegalStateException: Can not create file 'bb0ac802//com/oracle/avatar/js/init.js' parent = null
long_description:
Build: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 20140625-ae357844bdbb)
VM: Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 25.20-b17 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.8.0_20-ea-b17
OS: Linux

User Comments:

short_description: uninstaller fails in bundled jdk on RHAS4.0
long_description:
Bundle: jdk-6u1-nb-5_5
Tested build: mlfcs/200612070100_1
Locale: en pt_BR

Uninstaller fails on RHAS4.0 with the bundled jdk (6u1). It just happen on RH
Solaris and Windows version works well.

The uninstaller starts and after ~2sec prints 'Verifying JVM.' and finish.

I tried to run the uninstaller with another java version (jdk1.5.0_11) and it
works well.

Step to reproduce:
 - run ./jdk-6u1-nb-5_5-linux-ml.bin
 - export JAVA_HOME=$HOME/jdk1.6.0_01
 - cd netbeans-5.5/_uninstaller
 - run ./uninstaller

See the attached output of 'sh -x ./uninstaller 2>log'

short_description: 38s wasted while expanding 51 files
long_description:
While investigating issue 144131 adding numerous logging lines running profiler in various possible and impossible 
configurations Nigel managed to capture profiling snapshot:

http://www.netbeans.org/nonav/issues/showattachment.cgi/69382/nb_mk2.nps

It shows that in spite of JsfJavaDataLoader.findPrimaryFile is being called ~160x it manages to generate ~1200 
queries for various non-existent files. As Petr Nejedlý explains this is very costly:

> In a more general view it seems that the biggest problem in this setup is that NFS is particularly slow when
> looking for nonexistent files (a thing that both versioning and jsf loader use widely). This is understandable - 
> if the (OS) user look for an explicitly named file that is not in local NFS cache the server needs to be 
> consulted (every time). Query for >1500 nonexistent files -> >1500 network round trips which can be at least 
> few milliseconds each.
> We should revisit the is-there-such-a-file pattern as I fear it is used much more in the IDE.

We need to avoid it and get the number of touches bellow 200 in this particular case.

short_description: (Inner) class names are not properly updated
long_description:
if outer class' name is changed using OpenAPIs inner class names (their fully
qualified parts) are not properly updated until reparse. If accessed immediately
after the change the classes will yield old names.
The same holds in the case that whole DataObject is rename()d class names are
updated after a reparse.
Check memory representation too.

short_description: executable Java files do not use executable icon anymore
long_description:

past builds (the last one I can find it in is Build 499) executable Java files
had a little green triangle/arrow added to the source-node icon.

short_description: Erros encontrados no test case Internationalizing a GUI Form in netBeans 5.0
long_description:

5.0 identifiquei alguns erros de tradução que seguem abaixo:

 1º
 Propriedades de um objeto (ex.: jButton) 
   --> text 
     --> Botão Advanced
   No check box onde esta Gera código pré-inicialização minha sugestão é 
                          Gerar código pré-inicialização 
   No check box onde esta Gera código pós-inicialização minha sugestão é 
                          Gerar código pós-inicialização 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 2º
 Propriedades de um objeto (ex.: jButton) 
   --> na item mnemonicos botão [...]
     --> List Item : Select Mode
    No item do list. 
       Form Connection minha sugestão é traduzir para Formulário de Conexão.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3º
   Propriedades de um objeto (como botão) propriedades > text > [...] 
    Selecione Modo > Pacote de Recursos  (Resource Bundle) > Formatar

     No jTextArea Argumentos:
    No item {sourceFileName} está como : .. .(O nome do arquivo que pesquisada à
procura do literal string)
    minha sugestão é: . ..(O nome do arquivo que é pesquisado pela literal string)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4º / 5º
   Propriedades de um objeto (como botão) propriedades > foreground > [...] 
   Na aba Paleta de Sistema
   No nome da cor Texto da Informação minha sugestão é Texto Informativo
   e no texto Realce Alto do Controle ( no inglês é Control Lt Highlight)
   minha sugestão é Realce leve de controle pois lt neste é referente a ligth.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  6º
   Propriedades de um objeto (como botão) Eventos > actionPerformed > [...] 
   Na tela que abrir pressionar o botão Adicionar.
   Na tela apresentada do manipulador o label esta como Novo Nome do Manipulador
   minha sugestão é mudar para Nome do Novo Manipulador

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7º
   
   Ao criar novo arquivo de bundle o comentario do novo arquivo criado esta 
   em inglês sugiro traduzir para Arquivo de propriedades Pacote de Recursos
exemplo

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8º
   
   Ao criar novo projeto de exemplo GUI Form Example em Novo Projeto ->
Exemplos -> Geral ->
    Exemplos. Quando o projeto é criado o netBeans abre o arquivo Readme.txt da
aplicação
    e o mesmo esta em inglês.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9º
   No Assistente de Internacionalização clique com botão esquerdo em cima de
uma package
  escolher Ferramentas --> Internacionalização -> Assistente de Internacionalização 
   No 2º passo (Selecionar Recursos para Fontes) na descrição do processo esta. 
... .Clique em Selecionar Todos para marcar um bundle de recursos para todos os
arquivos.
  Para manter o padrão sugiro mudar para ..... .Clique em Selecionar Todos para
marcar um 
pacote de recursos para todos os arquivos. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  10º
    clique com botão esquerdo do mouse em cima de um fonte Java escolher
Ferramentas ->
  Internacionalização -> Internacionalizar
    No nome da Janela esta Inte&rnacionalizar mudar para Internacionalizar

short_description: Generated deadline expr has wrong format
long_description:
The generated by mapper deadline expression has wrong format:
e.g.:
1971-01-01T04:01:1.0 +03:00

Steps to reproduce: 
1. create Synchronous Sample and open Synchronous.bpel
2. add wait activity
3. from the property editor change Alarm Type onto Until
4. select the wait activity and switch to the bpel mapper
5. Choose from Bpel Mapper Palette Date & Time/Deadline Literal
6. press ok and join deadline literal with deadline node in the right tree
7. and go to the source see deadline expression has format as described before


By the bpel spec 8.3.2. Deadline Expressions:
These are expressions that conform to the XPath 1.0 Expr production where the evaluation
results in values that are of the XML Schema types dateTime or date.

Accordingly to the http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime 
and http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#formatdetails
  the datetime format is:
 [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm]
more detailed description is here http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/#dateTime-lexical-representation

i.e. white space before time zone is not allowed.

Another issue with date time format is: 
'Z' character is not allowed by Deadline expression editor but 
it's valid by the spec and has the same meaning as +00:00 -00:00





But the correct format from spec:
Here is white space which should be by the spec:

short_description: Exceptions thrown on incorrect Transport Settings
long_description:
I was testing the module to see what would happen with incorrect transport settings:
When I was supposed to get the dialog that asks me wether to try to re-send check my SMTP 
settings or save the report I got the ErrorManager instead. This then caused a problem for I
could not get back to the original bug report and save it. In addition to this when I do click on 
OK to have the ErrorManager generate a bug report the whole thing disappears and the 
submit bug icon is greyed out and the only thing I can do to get it back is restart the IDE. 
I re-started the IDE without the ErrorManager initialized and I indeed got an exception rather 
than the normal dialog. I reinstalled all the modules but to no avail. Nothing I tried would get 
the options dialog to appear.

Steps to recreate:
 1: Start bugsubmission module
 2: Edit the transport values to the smtp settings. Set the mail server to error and select this 
transport to be the first in the list to use.
 3: Tryt sending a report.

short_description: Output Window filter not reapplied when completely new output occurs
long_description:
The Output window's filter... menu option (which works great BTW) does not get reapplied when an output tab is replaced
with new output.

This can be reproduced by:
Running a java program from the IDE.
Select Output Window->Output Tab->Filter... to filter the text somehow.
Running the java program again.

The text is initially filtered correctly when the filter is applied.
On the second run the text is not filtered at all.  However the filter... menu option is still checked as selected.

To get the filter to apply correctly to the second set of output one has to turn off the filter then turn it back on.

Either the filter should be applied to the second set of output automatically.  Or the GUI should be fixed to reset the
state of the Filter... menu item.

short_description: Paste should check for virtual files (was Regression: Renaming files conflicts with NCheckout files)
long_description:
3.4 stabilization build

This issue has been reported before but I don't
know if it was ever resolved (can't find the old
issue)

Basic idea:

1) Commit in FileX.java
2) Delete FileX.java
3) Status of FileX.java changes to NCheckout
4) Copy/paste FileX.java from another directory
(through Netbeans)
5) File will be pasted as FileX_1.java because of
conflict with virtual file File_X.java which
doesn't really exist

    Expected behavior: Copy/paste should
overwrite nonexistant FileX.java

short_description: Change order of servers in the Add Server wizard
long_description:
1. Go to Tools -> Server Manager
2. Click Add Server...
3. You will see Tomcat 5 as the first choice.
Since Tomcat is already a part of the IDE this is
probably not the most common use case. Usually
the user will want to add Sun Appserver. Thus Sun
Appserver should be selected by default.

short_description: Breakpoint appears tied only to source file name not actual file
long_description:
I have two versions of an app as separate projects -- one under development and one frozen at a working state in the
past. When I switch from running one to the other the breakpoints persist and refer to the same source files in the
other project but at inappropriate lines.  It appears that the breakpoints are tied simply to the name of the source
code file and not to the actual instance of that file as it might exist in more than one project.  

The breakpoint symbol (the pink square) however does NOT appear in the other file after switching. So it looks like
the display mechanism is correctly keyed to the actual file but the actual breakpoint mechanism is keyed only to the
name of the file. 

Another complication (or symptom) is that the breakpoint panel just shows the name of the source file not the fully
qualified name (including path and/or project).  In fact this seems to be a deficiency in other places in NB. For
example I can find no way to determine the project to which a source file in the editor belongs. Again when I have
multiple versions of the same app as different projects this is a significant problem. I ought to be able at least to
right-click the tab and ask which project the file is in.

I imagine this could get really bad if a lot of source files in different projects are named the same for example
main.rb! So I've tentatively put this at P2 -- really ought to be fixed.  I bet it's the underlying cause of other
observations of breakpoint problems.

short_description: Allow modules to enhance the Utilities.translate
long_description:
There is a place in OpenIDE which references classes from different modules -
Utilities.translate. It translates package names of old classes into new onces
so deserialization of old settings continues to work even after repackaging.

It might be nice to enhance the Utility to easily allow modules to add their
classes there. For example each module could provide a file

META-INF/translate.txt

and this utility method would read them and convert into new package names. 

Another task is to rewrite the method to use regular expressions (probably from
JDK1.4) so the checking is linear to the length of the package name and does not
slow down with the number of packages that need to be translated.

short_description: Label of Maven Home path in Options
long_description:
This is a very minor issue but for consistency with Ant it could be changed.

The path to Maven in Options/Misc/Maven is called External Maven Home but in 6.10 with maven3 integration we have changed the default value of this option to point to the bundled full Maven installation. The same approach we already had with Ant. The option label should be changed to Maven Home now.

really freed is also valuable.

short_description: [MDI] Null ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - after minimizing & switching workspaces
long_description:
[Main trunk build #106]

try e.g. after first start of the IDE:

1. Change to MDI mode (in Main Window menu choose Project | Settings ... |
Workspaces -> [User Interface] to One Window MDI
2. Then in [Explorer] - expand /examples/texteditor then rightClick on Ted
and choose 
3. Minimize [Editor] internal-frame by clicking minimize-button (causing bug
#9151)
4. Switch to [Editing] workspace
5. Switch back to [GUI Editing] workspace

-> You can see that there is minimized internal frame (Source Editor [Ted])
but also opened editor (in it's normal shape - as it was before minimization!)
-> So it means you have two instances of source editor there
-> Try to e.g. minimize the opened Editor frame or expand the minimized one (by
doubleClick on it) and there will be an exception fired (attached).
-> After this frames are badly redrawn. Opened frame (that one in normal size)
is inactive.
-> You can paint it out by another window actually - just move over it - and it
will dissappear completely )
... and switch to another workspace and back to restore it somehow. But after
such step there is something strange with minimization icon on the frame - IMHO
it should be smaller - e.g. to compare to the rest of opened internal frames
(the present icon is bigger - like the case when you have maximized frame -
then you have such an icon for make it smaller (normal sized)).

short_description: miscellaneous Mac OS X related issues
long_description: This is a umbrella issue covering miscellaneous Mac OS X related issues.

short_description: Subversion undo popup text covered by horizontal scroll bar.
long_description:
Created attachment 110738
Screenshot of subversion undo popup with horizontal scrollbar.

I noticed that when the line is too long the undo popup text is covered by the horizontal scroll bar. Additionally the popup is wider than the IDE width (but I'm not sure this can be considered a defect).

I attach a screenshot.

short_description: Import Project throws NullPointerException in Request Proccessor  II.
long_description:
This is a new bug of #7541
[1125CE]
jdk1.3.0-fcs
linux 2.2.12
=================

Problem is that during import older project is SOMETIMES !!! displayed warning
dialog Exception Occured In Request Processor.
Its details are attached...

It seems that no users data are affected. Only thing (which I thing is realy
BAD) is that user become UNSURE and AFRAID of his/her data !!!!!

There must be some hiden  dependences why somtimes it occures and sometimes not.
I always do it on clear just unpacked build. (Today it occures on 1125CE build.
I repeated 3 times :have a new fresh clear and unpacked same build 1125CE and
only once I was successfull with reproduction).


Step to reproduce:
-------------------
1. unpack a fresh build (1125CE)
2. run IDE
3. dismiss all dialogs (wellcame screen autoupdate)
4. imediately go to Project -> Import Project
5. I always use Test Project from build 1118CE.
	so I go to the folder:
	..../1118CE/system/Project/Test Project and
	choose xml file
6. Save current project? Yes
7. From dialog choose Project to open choose just imported Test Project

and that is.
The warning dialog Exception Occured In Request Processor
should appear before poin #7. (or imediately after #7)


What I have in Test Project?:
-------------------------------
mounted many CVS FS (lokal & pserver types)
mounted hidden JAR FS
mounted normal FS
mounted javadoc (as a ZIP and as a normal FS)

open diferent type files from various FS in Editor and From editor.
open some webpage in ICEbrowser
open Project Settings
open Global Options

In some files there was also setted breakpoints as I remember but it seems they
arn't transfered well.

1. start latest dev build with clean userdir

behaviour is often reproducible but depends on
the time between modification and press of F9.

Related problem is that if you modify the class
name in editor the file is renamed in explorer
but backround parser annotates the class
definition with error Class ColoraaaPreview is
public should be declared in a file name
ColoraaaPreview.java what according to tab and
explorer it is (it was done automatically). Saving
file does not remove this error.

short_description: [67cat] No support for NB issuezilla
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200904030200 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.6.0 ]

Missing issuezilla support should be handled as defect as it'd
perfectly complement to the exception reporting window - and would
make it a lot easier to report bugs. And I do see as a serious issue
that NB does not support its own bugtracking system.

short_description: ability to define name and add metadata to snapshots
long_description:
After creating a snapshot it would be nice to associate some metadata with it.  That could be used to record things like
the conditions under which the snapshot was created.  Maybe one distinguished metatdata field like name and another
free form field.  The name could be used as the tool tip for the snapshot's tab.

short_description: Missing 'ide' module missing from NB 6.1 source ZIP causes build failure
long_description:
I downloaded the NB 6.1 source ZIP from the Web site:

   http://download.netbeans.org/netbeans/6.1/final/zip/netbeans-6.1-200805300101-src.zip

I unpacked it and ran the 'build-nozip' target using the basic cluster.  It failed in the final stages because it could
not copy launchers from the 'ide' module.  I investigated and found that no 'ide' directory exists in the ZIP file
although this directory does exist in a trunk checkout from the Mercurial repository.  

This bug makes it impossible to build a copy of the source downloaded from the Web site.  There are times when I need to
build a copy of the source but do not have (and cannot install) Mercurial.  I understand you probably cannot
retroactively fix the bug for 6.1 but I am filing the issue so that it can be fixed for future release builds.

short_description: Replace OutputWindow with terminal
long_description:

http://www.netbeans.org/www-nbdev/msg07977.html
it should be incorporated into NB.

host them in module core - core/libsrc/org/netbeans/lib/terminalemulator so they
can remain standalone from the rest of the project.

short_description: Source Editor string missing in editor title bar
long_description:
Filing on behalf of TeamWare QA:

When a file is loaded into the editor the title bar is supposed to read:

Source Editor [filename]

However in the 1002 build of NB 3.3 the Source Editor string does not always
appear.This is a regression from NB 3.2.1. This may sound trivial but it has a
significant impact on a number of TeamWare automated tests that depend on the
existance of the Source Editor string. 

The priority is set relatively high due to Krakatoa schedule constraints.

short_description: content size is too large in navigator bar when user editing a structured file.
long_description:
Created attachment 114377
too large content in navigator bar

when user opened a jsp file and editing it the content displayed in navigator bar at upper to the editor is too large.

plz see screen below:

short_description: Typo in subversion Bundle.properties
long_description:
This bundle has several typos in the EN (original) bundle.
Several occurences (98 100 112) of 'Expresion' where it should be 'Expression'.
At least one occurence (102) of 'containig' where it should be 'containing'.

Numbers in brackets are the key numbers as they appear in CTI.

short_description: Blank gray bar sometimes displayed at top of Projects window
long_description:
In recent dev builds oftentimes the Projects window shows a blank gray area at the top above any project root node
that might be open. Not sure if reproducible and can go away with a simple window refresh. I am guessing this is
related to recent asynchronous Nodes changes.

short_description: I18N - Custom Platform wizard shouldn't allow to enter characters that can malform the xml
long_description:
User can use any character as Platform/Device Name in Custom Platform wizard. It
can cause problems when reading the xml of the platform.


It's more usability issue than serious bug. It is corner case with easy
workaround - edit the xml and rename.

short_description: Sliding effects
long_description:
In order to finish or forget implementation of
sliding effects we kindly request additional info
from HIE which gives at least following info:

- use them or forget them? In this case we can
remove prepared code.

- requested speed of effects in milliseconds
possibly 

- a way how to quickly disable effect after user
got familiar with purpose of sliding windows

- must be more lighweight then current proposal in 
http://ui.netbeans.org/docs/ui/sliding/index.html
Current proposal is unfortunately not
implementable if effect should be highspeed (<200ms)

- should effects appear only when operation was
invoked from mouse or also when action was invoked
by a shortcut?

short_description: Please provide option to clear the search history.
long_description:
I never use this functionality before it is slow.
I tried yesterday and search a Hibernate in maven repository.

I started  NetBeans today and I found the cursor was focused on the search text field. 
And the history was displayed.
I clicked the search icon tried to find an action to clear the history but I can not find it.
The worst is that the history displayed every time the cursor was focused.

short_description: Adding msys/1.0/bin path should be acceptible through IDE for MinGW users
long_description:
Since Current path were replaced by basedir windows-user could not include msys/1.0/bin directory in the netbeans
settings if (s)he uses only MinGW compiler collection. Besides make utility the directory contains other  unix-commands
that  necessary to build project(mkdir rm and so on...). So now user can not include MinGW/bin  directory to the path
variable and just add MinGW collection with MinGW/bin basedir through Build Tools tab (s)he can even add make command
from msys/1.0/bin folder but (s)he still could not build/clean any sample project because mkdir which is placed in
msys/1.0/bin still not visible to IDE. And user should make workaround: close IDE add to the path variable msys/1.0/bin
directory open IDE again.

short_description: Function is not marked as private
Testing RESTful WebService fails when clicking Test Resource Uri from witin NetBeans
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.0.1 (Build 201107282000)
Operating System = Mac OS X version 10.6.8 running on x86_64
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_26
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 20.1-b02-384
GlassFish Server Open Source Edition 3.1.1

I have a very simple web application created with Netbeans 7.0.1 which includes only a RESTful Webservice.

Here is the web.xml:



    
    
        ServletAdaptor
        com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.ServletContainer
        1
    
    
        ServletAdaptor
        /*
    
    
        30
        
            SESSIONID
        
    



Here is the glassfish-web.xml:




  /service
  
  
    
      Keep a copy of the generated servlet class' java code.
    
  


As you can see the context-root is /service. From web.xml you can see that everything at /service/* will match the Jersey REST servlet. Now here is the REST service implemented:

package my.package

import javax.ws.rs.GET
import javax.ws.rs.Path
import javax.ws.rs.Produces
import javax.ws.rs.core.MediaType

@Path(/test/helloworld)
public class HelloWorld {
    
    @GET
    @Produces(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN)
    public String getMessage() {

        return Hello World
    }
    
}

When I deploy the project to my locally installed Glassfish 3.1.1 and the hit http://localhost:8080/service/test/helloworld in my browser everything is executed as expected what means that I can see my Hello World message.

Now changing to NetBeans I open in my project the node RESTful Web Services make a right-click on HelloWorld and choose Test Resource Uri from the context menu. After that a warning dialog shows up with the following message:

Unable to open resource url:
http://localhost:8080/service//test/helloworld
Make sure the project has been deployed successfully and the server is running.

If I choose @Path(test/helloworld) in my HelloWorld class I still get the same warning (even the resource url stays http://localhost:8080/service//test/helloworld).

Conclusion: Testing seems not to work if choosing Test Resource Uri. Seems to be a bug.


Cheers Nabi

short_description: [scala] Broken grammar for case expressions
long_description: Currently expressions such as case -1 cause a parser error at the minus symbol. It should be supported by the grammar

short_description: Incorrect formatting of {@code Foo} in javadoc
long_description:
Also applies to {@literal}

The visual formatting makes  appear as an HTML tag which it is not.

short_description: Dictionary should have a disable switch
long_description:
I think spell-checking is a new feature... or it has changed. I would expect to find either a preference (under Tools-->Options) or a project property or a per-file setting that would allow me to turn off the spell checker. As it is it complains about the spelling of jargon in the C++ comments and worse yet it thinks my python scripts are full of spelling errors. This is a nice feature for UI code but very distracting for other code.

Please add some disable switches!!

long_description: When adding a file to a full remote project location should be consistent with local projects. Now it have a very long line that includes host name and is totally unusable. Besides full path for new file is shown incorrectly.

short_description: Build/Packageing --> Add Project fails with NullPointerException on OK in a J2ee project properties dialog.
long_description:
I have a j2ee project with an ejb component
project and a web component project. So far so
good. Now I need code that will be passed between
both of these so I create a Java Class Library
project for that. I  then go to the Project
properties of my j2ee project click on
Packaging under Build in the category list on
the left side. That gives me the option to add a
Jar/Foler Library or Project to the ear
file. I click on Add Project and then selects
my Java Class Library project. The
dist/ClassLib.jar is added nicely to the list. 
I then press the OK button on the window and
get a NullPointerException. When I bring up the
j2ee project properties window again the library
is not added. 

This is reproducable both with the latest qbuild
(20050217) and the latest dev (20050220).

I had no idea what subcomponent to choose for
this. I was looking for a j2ee-project but there
 were ony an ejb-project available and the other
alternatives weren't much better so I simply
choosed application having no clue as to what is
meant by application in this case. Sorry if it
is wrong.

short_description: ClassNotFoundException after updating Equinox to 3.7.1
long_description:

Profiling data

I have a large C++ project which outputs a .dll. The build and run steps are .bat files (both finish under 2-3 seconds).

However there's a big pause between the build and run steps (1.nps) and after the run step (2.nps). CPU usage is either very low or very high during these pauses (this behavior is random).

short_description: [2004-05-06] Separate and standardize GUI initialization (UIDefaults usage) in core
long_description:
I am proposing to separate some code currently in the window 
system into a standalone library.  What I want to accomplish is 
the following:

 - Currently UI initialization in core is messy - custom font sizes 
are handled in one place theme support is handled differently 
and so forth.  For clarity and readability it would be better to do 
this in one place

 - Provide a proper place to provide custom UI delegate 
implementations (such as toolbar UIs - currently this is quite 
messy except on Aqua where the UI is already provided in this 
way).  Swing offers a mechanism for handling custom UI 
delegates we should use it.  Note this does *not* apply to any UI 
that would need to reference specific classes.

 - Provide a place for installing custom colors and fonts which 
are used by NetBeans components

 - Provide a way to guarantee that commonly used values from 
UIDefaults (such as the control color) etc. are really there even 
if they are not supplied by the look and feel directly.  Currently 
in many places in NetBeans code you can see things like:

Font f = UIManager.getFont (controlFont)
if (f == null) {
   f = UIManager.getFont (Label.font)
}
if (f == null) {
  f = UIManager.getFont (Tree.font)
}
if (f == null) {
  f = new Font (Dialog Font.PLAIN 11)
}

This sort of thing is pretty unreadable and unnecessary.  It 
would be better for core to simply guarantee values for 
commonly used things so code in other parts of the codebase 
can be as straightforward as possible.

 - Which brings us to the reason for separating this - if 
components of NetBeans are used in a standalone application 
but they are written to expect non-null values for things like 
controlFont from UIManager they can do that simply by calling 
an initialization method in a class in this library

I will attach a diff with details of the changes in the near future.

As a public API (if you can even call it such) this module will 
offer a single main method that can be called to initialize its 
contributions to UIDefaults.  Since this module will be part of 
core it's questionable if that qualifies as API - I leave that up to 
you.

The NetBeans-specific UIManager keys which it puts into 
UIDefaults can be construed as a friend API possibly.  The UI 
delegate implementations it puts into UIDefaults will simply be 
alternate NetBeans-specific implementations of UI delegate 
classes provided by the JDK (such as our custom toolbar grips 
for draggable toolbars things like that).

short_description: JPyhon engine creates files in {ide.home}/lib/ext
long_description:
the JPython engine creates cachedir under {ide.home}/lib/ext and puts its
caches there.  This is a bad place for data files.  I've looked inside the
source code of JPython (PySystemState.java) the client code can override the
default location by defining system property {python.cachedir}.  We should do
something like

System.getProperties().put(python.cachedir
System.getProperty(netbeans.user) + /system/jpythoncachedir)

during IDE startup

short_description: Navigator panel content state not preserved when switching files
long_description:
If one switches between html files editor tabs the CSL navigator content is switched (see also bug #215660) but its state (expansions selected element) is not preserved. After each file switch the navigator content is created from scratch. 

The navigator won't even set the selected node according to the caret position. One has to change the caret position to get the synchronization done.

This issue IMO lies at the bug/enhancement boundary but should be addressed in any case especially if we want the properties editor for html elements to be usable.

bundled with GF3.1 server :
jackson-core-asl.jar
jackson-jaxrs.jar
jackson-mapper-asl.jar
jersey-client.jar
jersey-core.jar
jersey-gf-server.jar
jersey-json.jar
jersey-multipart.jar
jettison.jar
mimepull.jar

This behavior differs from behavior for GF3.0 target server.
Project classpath contains restlib_gfv3 library in case of GF3.0.
The latter library contains J2EE server bundled jars.

short_description: Illegal threading behavior in Installer.closing
long_description:
welcome.Installer makes unfounded assumptions about which thread it is invoked on. When run in http://wiki.netbeans.org/NetBeansInOSGi#Demo you get many stack traces starting with:

Jul 29 2011 2:16:42 PM org.netbeans.core.windows.WindowManagerImpl warnIfNotInEDT
WARNING: null
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Problem in some module which uses Window System: Window System API is required to be called from AWT thread only see http://core.netbeans.org/proposals/threading/
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.WindowManagerImpl.warnIfNotInEDT(WindowManagerImpl.java:1686)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.WindowManagerImpl.topComponentID(WindowManagerImpl.java:1367)
	at org.openide.windows.WindowManager.findTopComponentID(WindowManager.java:529)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.model.TopComponentSubModel.getID(TopComponentSubModel.java:370)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.model.TopComponentSubModel.containsTopComponent(TopComponentSubModel.java:266)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.model.DefaultModeModel.containsTopComponent(DefaultModeModel.java:348)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.model.DefaultModel.containsModeTopComponent(DefaultModel.java:905)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.Central.containsModeTopComponent(Central.java:1517)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.ModeImpl.containsTopComponent(ModeImpl.java:431)
	at org.netbeans.core.windows.WindowManagerImpl.isEditorTopComponent(WindowManagerImpl.java:1393)
	at org.netbeans.modules.welcome.Installer.closing(Installer.java:56)
	at org.netbeans.core.osgi.OSGiLifecycleManager.exit(OSGiLifecycleManager.java:93)
	at org.netbeans.core.actions.SystemExit.run(SystemExit.java:89)
	at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Task.run(RequestProcessor.java:1424)
	at org.openide.util.RequestProcessor$Processor.run(RequestProcessor.java:1968)

WelcomeOptions and related code is a weird design anyway hacks around normal winsys persistence presumably causing things like bug #195744. Better would be to make it behave like a normal persist-when-open singleton TC. Optionally also tell the user how to reopen it when first (acc. to NbPreferences key) closed. I can supply a patch if you agree.

short_description: YAML editor should be integrated into base IDE
long_description:
The YAML editor is only present as part of the Ruby pack. However YAML is a general purpose file format (I am using it
on a 100% Java project) and therefore it should be in the NetBeans install as a stand-alone editor (together with an
option to Create New YAML File).

short_description: There are two Rename actions for CSL languages
long_description:
If a language has instant rename action then the CSL generate Rename action with shotcut CTRL+R into the context menu. And when the language implements regular refactoring then there is also Rename action with CTRL+R in context menu under Refactoring sub menu. 

There should be only one Rename action in the UI which should call the instant rename and if the instant rename false then call the regular rename refactoring action.

short_description: Line breakpoint->Print text does not print my variable if Suspend Debugging is OFF
long_description:
In Add Breakpoint dialog I specified my own variables in Print Text line. The 
variables are correctly displayed only in case the Suspend Debugging is set. 
If it is not set (means I do not want to stop at breakpoint just dump the value 
of variable into Output Window) I always get that value of variable is null.

Hey Debugger Guys!
I must say this is really cool feature!! If I did not discover this small bug I 
would run to nbusers to tell it everybody because it does not seems to be well 
known feature does it? I think lot of us do debug programs with some 
System.out.println here and there. And this feature makes this debugging 
technique extremely comfortable - I can use it now without any change in my 
code without any recompilling. And what's more I can change my debugging 
messages during runtime what saves my time!! because otherwise I have to stop 
program change my System.out.println compile it start it reproduce some 
situation.

I think there are a few things which should be improved to made the working with 
Print Text more comfortable like:
* in dialog Add Breakpoint the Print Text should be larger or better 
multiline
* in Debugger Window->Variables right mouse click on any variable offer me 
Create Fixed Watch and there might be also something like Create 
Non-Suspending Line Breakpoint with the value of this variable in Print Text
* what might be also useful is to print variable.toString() to the output 
window. This is what I often print in my System.out.println().
* to dump all class variables of given variable into Output Window
* and probably much more

short_description: [50cat] Extract method breaks inner class
Show hint after `}` what does it belong to
long_description:
In Java it's usual to have } as a single character at a line.

If it's too far from the matching bracket one can easily get lost.

Many dev's tend to write hints like this:

    class Foo {
        ...
    }// class Foo

It would be awesome if NetBeans shown a hint like this probably with some minimum limit how many lines from the starting brackets it has to be.

This would be also cool for nested conditions cycles
And for cycles and labels it could also appear after `break` and `continue`

Thanks for considering.

short_description: List of unresolved Data Sources will be updated only for the first time
long_description:
New bug has been filed due to the last (2007 Jul 12) John Baker's comment in
http://www.netbeans.org/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=106884

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200707110000) 
Java: 1.6.0_01 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0_01-b06 
System: Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86 Cp1251 ru_RU (nb)

1. Connect to Derby DB Travel (jdbc:derby://localhost:1527/travel) and 
   Oracle DB Travel (jdbc:oracle:thin:@jbrave-pc1.sfbay.sun.com:1521/ora10g 
   user_name/passw: travel/travel).
2. Create new VWP project.
3. DnD any Derby DB table on Design View.
   DnD any Oracle DB table on Design View.
4. Disconnect Derby and Oracle DB connections.
   Delete Derby and Oracle DB connections.
5. In the window Projects use popup menu item Resolve Datasource Problem for created project.
   In the appeared dialog select the list item TRAVEL_Oracle and click Add Connection...
6. In the dialog New DB Connection click OK (check that all text fields contain correct info).

Result:
- the item TRAVEL_Oracle will be removed from the list of unresolved Data Sources.

7. Repeat steps #5 6 for the unresolved Data Source TRAVEL_ApacheDerby

Result:
- the item TRAVEL_ApacheDerby will be removed from the list of unresolved Data Sources and the list will be empty.

8. Repeat steps #4 5 6 7 once again.

Result:
- the list of unresolved Data Sources will still contain both items TRAVEL_ApacheDerby and TRAVEL_Oracle.

short_description: Dev-rev for schema aware code completion (xml/schema/completion)
long_description:
In an effort to move a new set of XML/Schema related tools to base NB build
infrastructure we need to undergo dev-rev for Schema aware code completion module.

Source for this module can be found here
http://www.netbeans.org/source/browse/xml/schema/completion/.

This module is currently a part of Netbeans Enterprise Pack and helps in code
completion in an instance documents based on schema. The modules implements
Editor Code Completion APIs. There are two use-cases it caters to:

a) Documents that explicitly declare the conformance to a schema.
Reads the schema creates an AXIOM model and uses that model to find completion
items at a given context.

b) Documents that do not explicitly declare the conformance to a schema.
Documents like WSDL build.xml do not declare the conformance to a schema. For
such cases the module provides a spi package. The consumers need to implement a
CompletionModelProvider and pass in Schemas that can be queried for completion.

The second use-case can be used to replace existing CC on XML documents based on
DTDs.

Feel free to add yourself to the CC list.

short_description: I18N - Convert to text a Japanese file name results in unstable errors
long_description:
1.  Prepare 2 text file in English file names and 2 text files in Japanese file
names eg
   file1
   file2
   JAPANESE1  (in double byte characters in real life)
   JAPANESE2  (in double byte characters in real life)
   
   the files do not have extensions.  Save them to a single directory.
2. From IDE mount the directory and expand the directory name in Explorer.
   Then you will see the file list in above order.
3. Right click each file name and select Convert to text and reply OK to
   confirmation dialog then you will see the icons for the files have been 
   changed to represent text file.
4. If you try Convert to text for a Japanese name file then you might see
   some unusual result intermittently.
   Result 1 - The file could not be converted and the icon remains in white.
   Result 2 - The file and other files with text icons also changed to white
icons.
   Result 3 - Yes!  The file is converted.  But after restart IDE you will see
              all files in the directory remain in white icon again.


This problem occurs if the directory has files with non-asccii chracters (e.g. 
Japanese characters etc).  This never occurs with English (asccii) name only 
directories.

On both Win 2000 and Solaris.

short_description: //-comment in the last line makes problems
long_description:
If I have a php-file with a //-comment in the last line (*) and try to format it (with ALT + SHIFT + F) Netbeans depends for between 10 and 60 sek. After that the file is not formatted!

If I try to autocomplete a class/function (with STRG + SPACEBAR) depends for ca. 10 sek and then the letters that I typed are missing.
I can autocomplete namespace.

If I delete the //-comment all works fine.

(*) for example:
[code]
<?php
$var = 'value'
// <-- last Line!
[/code]

PS: I hope I have done everything right - this is my first report.

short_description: Modified file cannot be saved.
long_description:
Projects build 20030417000.
1. Open a Java class in the editor (use HelloWorld
from the Sample Project).
2. Wait until it is parsed (the class content
combo us grayed (disabled)).
3. Modify the file at the very beggining (before
the package statement).
4. The file cannot be saved until the caret is
moved inside the class code (between public class
HelloWorld { and }) and the content combo is
enabled. Cannot be saved means that Ctrl-S
shortcut and context menu Save item are
disabled. The save can be performed as Save all
from Project menu.

(Not sure whether this is projects java openide
or editor bug assigning to project for evaluation.)

short_description: allow window system customizations on TopComponent level
long_description:
issue #136636 introduced window-system-wide customizations allowing e.g. turning 'sliding' of windows off.
however in many cases there's need to enable/disable some window system features on topcomponent level. i propose
introducing of a set of boolean client properties which would enable/disable the following features for particular
topcomponent:

- disable closing - topcomponent won't have close button in its title bar and 'close window' action in its popup and in
main window will be disabled
- disable sliding - topcomponent won't have minimize button and 'minimize action' will be disabled. topcomponents docked
in sliding modes (slided-out by default) won't have 'pin' button and their 'minimizer action' will be disabled.
- disable dragging - it won't be possible to drag and drop topcomponent to a different location
- disable undocking - topcomponent's 'undock window' action will be disabled topcomponents floating by default will
have their 'dock window' action disabled
- disable maximization - it won't be possible to maximize the topcomponent by doubleclicking its header and their
'maximize action' will be disabled

short_description: [i18n] Unable to launch IDE in a folder with non-ascii characters
long_description:
Created attachment 128472
NB IDE launch error when in a folder with non-ascii characters

My organisation is developing a RCP application and during testing we've encountered an issue with trying to launch the application when it is installed into a folder containing non-ascii characters. 

When you execute the exe file you get the message: Cannot find 'platform*' folder!

Our app is installed using izPack and Java 7 (our installation doesn't work with Java 6 due to the JRE bug http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=4947220 which is fixed in J7 - I've seen reference to JRE bugs in previously logged issues here around this in bugzilla).


To disprove that the problem is with our RCP application I tried installing NB IDE into the same folder but it didn't work (I've logged this bug: http://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=222846).

Thereafter I installed NB IDE into a valid folder location and copied the installation over to the folder containing the non-ascii characters. Upon launching I get message that the netbeans.clusters file cannot be read - see attachment.

Conclusion: is that NB cannot be installed or launched from a folder contained non-ascii characters.

short_description: Please remove static icons and bundles from BeanInfos
long_description:
There are *BeanInfo classes which uses static images and even static
bundles. This is considered a memory leak in this context.

For loading images use org.openide.util.Utilities.loadImage directly
in getImage without any caching (Utilities will do SoftCaching for you).

The sources to modify which I know of:
JavaCvsFileSystemBeanInfo.java
JavaCvsSettingsBeanInfo.java
NbJavaCvsFileSystemBeanInfo.java

short_description: Provide property editor for JFormattedTextField's format
long_description:
The GUI designer doesn't allow easy customization of JFormattedTextField by 
now. JFormattedTextField is an important component used for editing and 
validation of some formatted data. The property editor for its format will 
allow the most important customization of JFormattedTextField component.

short_description: Merge on Windows is broken
long_description:
I have looked at the merge behavior on Windows. It is currently not possible to use the internal Resolve Conflict tool. 

Unofficial Batteries Included Windows release of Hg
--------------------------------------------------------
I have added support so if the unofficial batteries included release: http://qct.sourceforge.net/Mercurial-BI.html is
used it will work out of the box. In its \Mercurial.ini they have added:
[ui]
merge = C:\Program Files\Mercurial\hgmerge.exe

hgmerge.exe is shipped with this release.

Official Windows release of Hg
-------------------------------
If the official release is used: http://mercurial.berkwood.com/ then the user needs to modify the <Mercurial Install
Dir>\Mercurial.ini to include some other external Merge tool such as kdiff3 as it is not shipped with any on Windows:
[ui]
merge = C:\Program Files\Mercurial\kdiff3.cmd

Obtainable from:
http://kdiff3.sourceforge.net/

Info on other merge tools:
http://www.selenic.com/mercurial/wiki/index.cgi/MergeProgram

This all needs to be release noted.

short_description: Handling of typed semi colon when one already exists
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.3 (Build 201306052037)
Operating System = Linux version 3.2.0-52-generic running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.7.0_25
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 23.25-b01

The Java editor will recognize when I type a closing parentheses that is already in the text and not duplicate that paren.  This same type of replacement logic should be applied to existing statement termination semi-colons.

1) Start with this line:
 JLabel fred = new JLabel(fred)

2) Position the cursors immediately before the closing paren

3) Type comma space ctrl + space to get list of suggestions

4) Press enter on the first suggestion which adds another int argument

5) Type a number to replace whatever value is auto-suggested

6) Type a close paren.   The editor recognizes that this matches the existing paren and does not duplicate it.  This is good.

7) Type a semi colon.  The editor does not recognize that this typed semi-colon matches the existing semi colon and duplicates it so the result is:
JLabel fred = new JLabel(fred 3)

The closing paren and the semi colon should be treated in a consistent manner.  (This happens to me frequently.)

short_description: usability issue in call graph
long_description:
Ported from CR 6995972

In call graph several usability issues :

 1. Bring up context menu of a function there is 

  	 Expand callees
  	 Expand callers

     These actions should be toggleable that means when callees are  shown
     context menu should be Hide callees and same for callers.

    Some time user just want to see callees onlt or callers only  or both.

2. Arrows for callees/callers should have different colors.

3. Should have a option to display function args too.

4. Go to Declaration should be Go to Implementation it actually goes to
   source which is useful. It's just the naming of menu item is not correct.

5. Graph should be arranged that callers are in left hand side of THE function callees are in right hand
   side of THE function.

short_description: ManifestSection.createInstance should handle SharedClassObject
long_description:
ManifestSection.createInstance currently uses Beans.instantiate to create all
objects. For subclasses of SharedClassObject (options actions loaders) this is
incorrect: one module may use the correct .findObject(...true) call in its
startup code and then a module containing the object in its manifest may be
restored at which point two instances of the class will be created. This breaks
object identity. So the method must be modified to use findObject where
appropriate.

short_description: DocumentLine.Set.getLines grotesquely slow for large files
long_description:
I feel like I'm dreaming because I can't imagine
how no one else could have noticed this. Am I the
only one?

In a current trunk (or refactoring) build using
JDK 1.4 or 1.5 opening a large Java source - e.g.
JComponent.java - is so slow as to be ridiculous.
Takes *several minutes* during which the IDE is
frozen.

Thread dumps and OptimizeIt show that
o.n.m.debugger.projects.ContextProviderImpl.getCurrentLineNumber
is calling DocumentLine.Set.getLines - probably
just once or at least just once in the ~15-second
snapshot I took in OI - and this is calling
DocumentLine.equals thousands of times. I don't
know how slow each call to DL.equals is.

Inspection of DocumentLine source code showed that
its hash code is based only on the hash code of
its CloneableEditorSupport shared with all other
lines in the same document yet its equals method
checks the line number. This means that the
WeakHashMap Line.Set.lines has all the lines in
*one bucket* and so retrieving any line (done in
L.S.rL) is linear in the number of lines. Since
each line is registered I guess that means the
time is *quadratic* in the number of lines.

I can't see any recent changes in this package so
I have to assume that this method has always been
stupidly slow for large files. Why would it only
be noticeable now? Well maybe no one was calling
it until the debugger started to fairly recently
(May 3 I think)?

(BTW the debugger's usage of the Line.Set after it
gets it is highly suspect - it seems to be
iterating every line in a linear search looking
for a given one which is ridiculous. Maybe this
block could be deleted. Certainly it could be made
O(lg n) rather than O(n).)

Fixing the hash code to incorporate the line
number as equals does speeds things up by a
couple orders of magnitude or so - down to a few
seconds for JComponent. (Still much too slow but
probably for other reasons.)

However I am nervous about this since I am not
sure if the line number could change during the
object lifetime and what will happen if it does.
Whatever the solution something has to be done
quickly.

I will attach a representative thread dump excerpt
showing the call sequence and a patch which seems
to fix things.

BTW the patch also removes the long-obsolete
support for markError etc. which has not been used
in a long time (since Annotation was added) and
just wastes space (12 bytes per line in fields)
and involves adding extra listeners that will
never do anything but slow things down.

short_description: Hard to cancel update code completion task on inappropriate filesystem
long_description:
[35 RC1] I had just mounted a large filesystem
that was not a classpath root but contained a lot
of Java sources (NB source tree in fact). Parser
database started running so I turned off
capabilities and it was cancelled - good.

I wanted to make sure there was not a half-built
database in place. So (with the mount point
selected) I went to the Tools menu but instead of
selecting Code Completion Database Manager I
accidentally selected Update Code Completions.

At that point I had a hard time cancelling the
action. NB immediately began looking for and
finding Java sources all of which were in the
wrong package location. For each one it would
pop up an *individual* message dialog indicating
that it was in the wrong package. Since these were
modal it was impossible to get to Tools -> Code
Completion Database Manager to cancel the update -
the main window was always blocked and a new
dialog appeared as soon as the old one was closed!
I finally managed to close the main window right
between one dialog being closed and another
reopened - my window manager has a keystroke to
close a window so I just held it down. Then I got
an End Tasks dialog which was fortunately modal
and I could give focus to. After restarting all
was OK.

The dialog notifying you of an inappropriate
package name should IMHO do one of:

(1) Let you click Don't show me this message
again for this update.

(2) Show a scrollable JList of problem files and
add to them as they come in then be nonmodal.

(3) In addition to OK have a Cancel button that
would cancel the update.

short_description: CopyFiles task doesn't find all tlds inside jar META-INF
long_description:
According to JSP 2.0 spec (JSP.7.3.4):

When examining a JAR file only resources under /META-INF or a subdirectory are considered.

org.netbeans.modules.java.j2seproject.copylibstask.CopyFiles.java

Replacing the line:
  fs.setIncludes(META-INF/*.tld META-INF/tlds/*.tld)

With:
  fs.setIncludes(META-INF/**/*.tld)

in the method containsTLD will fix this bug.

Discovered by using tiles-jsp-2.0.6.jar in a war module in a J2EE project (the tld is included in META-INF/tld not META-INF/tlds inside the jar)

short_description: Wrong project selected after project creation (if two projects with the same name exist)
long_description:
There should be a possibility to select and expand
the node of a newly created project. In the
current implementation the project is only opened
and set as main but it is not selected. Instead
nodes corresponding to file objects returned by
InstantiatingIterator.instantiate() are selected
(therefore also expanding the project node).

short_description: NPE in org.netbeans.editor.ext.html.parser.SyntaxElement.Tag.toString()

in HtmlGSFParser).

short_description: Boolean code flipper
long_description:
Sometimes I decide to flip the logic of a boolean variable.  For example I may want to rename isDisabled to isEnabled.  I think it would be a neat feature to 
automatically search the code for usages of that boolean then carefully flip the logic... adding or removing a '!' where necessary.  Maybe this could be 
integrated into the rename feature as an option when it detects you're renaming a boolean?

In general I think it's always best to name booleans in the positive sense but even I sometimes forget and need to fix it later.

I would
like to have a better what's new document.

In NB 3.3.1 I found no many lines about Annotations.
Annotation is one of the big news in NB 3.3.1.

Annotations (aka Glyphs) Annotations is a method to highlight a part of
text of the document. The text is highlighted either by special background
color or by putting an icon on the gutter or both.

It's a little light for explaination don't you ?

It will be useful for someone that want to have more informations.

founded no explanation about that. No idea what it means.

short_description: yet another case where viewmodel doesn't honor isLeaf()
long_description:
This is a variationon IZ 99042 so read up on that first.
The symptoms described here happen with the fix for 99042 in place.
I'm just recording the symptom here so that I can get back to debugging it
at a later time.

The appended class TestView demonstrates the failure by simulating
watches.
Follow the example in TestViews comment to set it up inside a
TopComponent.
Make sure to reload the module in order to reset each scenario.

When the testcases comes up press the 'up' button.
This simulates the current stack frame changing so that Node a
is no longer in scope. 'up' will set the children to null and
set the node value to ERROR.
Note that isLeaf will return true only if the node is empty.
It is insensitive to the existence of children.
The visual result is that the turner goes away.

Now press the down button.
This simulates returning to the previous frame where 'a' had a good
definition. Note that isLeaf() now returns false yet the turner is not
appearing.
It is clear from playing with the code (uncomment the re-adding
of the child in getDownAction() or never remove the children in
getUpAction()) that the removal of the children on up makes the turner 
disappear.

short_description: CVS's Diff command doesn't work properly because doesn't highlight some differencies with colors.
long_description:
Discovered on: CE/IE Build 1084 on Windows 2000 with JDK1.3
==============

Description:
============
If there are differencies between local revision and head revision in the
repository Diff command doesn't work correctly. These different lines are not
highlighted by colors in comparing dialog.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount some existing CVS filesystem.
2. Under this create some new file e.g. Test.java add it and commit it into
the repository.
3. Mount another CVS filesystem with the same repository and Check-out its
contents.
4. Make some changes to Test.java file and commit it into the repository.
5. In the first CVS filesystem perform Refresh command on the root node. The
status of Test.java file should be [Needs Checkout].
6. If you perform Diff command on this file comparing dialog will be opened
but none of changes made to this file in step 4. won't be highlighted by color
lines.

short_description: create project with the name of another just removed project throws IllegalArgumentException
long_description:
If user removes existing project on the 2nd step of 'New Project' wizard invoked
to create new project and creates new with the same name as just removed
attached exception will rise:
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Already a project in
MasterFileObject@fe2479[C:/Documents and Settings/avk/JavaApplication1]

steps to reproduce:

- create General Java Application with the name JavaApplication1.
- close JavaApplication1 opened in IDE
- start 'New Project' wizard again.
- select 'General | Java Application' project
- on the step '2. Name And Location' open external file browser and remove
JavaApplication1.
- In 'Project Name' textfield type JavaApplication1.
- Click Finish.

short_description: Can't copy file to an existing directory.
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 200901210201)
Java: 1.5.0_16 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.5.0_16-133
System: Mac OS X version 10.5.5 running on i386 MacRoman en_US (nb)
Userdir: /Applications/NetBeans/NetBeans Dev 200901210201.app/Contents/Resources/user

Steps:
1. Open version controlled project.
2. Select file of the project and invoke Subversion | Copy To action.
3. Select repository to an existing folder in the repository. 
4. Enter all necessary fields and push Copy.

Error dialog shows that file already exists.

If file is placed into new folder then it works as expected.

short_description: ActionMap cached in BasicTextUI
long_description:
It looks like the problem already described in
editor module: - issue #45487

How to reproduce:

1. Start NB initialy with no editors open
2. open java file
3. look at Edit and View menu - there are editor
actions that depends on ActionMap retrieved via
Utilities.actionsGlobalContext ().lookup
(ActionMap.class)
Items Edit/Go2Source go2Declaration go2Superimpl
are enabled as well as View/Show Line Numbers and
View/Show Editor Toolbar
4. open form file to init MultiView
5. switch between Code and Design mode and ensure
that editor actions Edit and View menu are
properly enabled/disabled.
6. open xml file
7. note that Edit/Go2* actions are enabled. It
looks like they come from cached ActionMap of
JavaKit JEditorPane

It is the same using the opposite direction:

1. Start NB initialy with no editors open
2. open xml
3. look at Edit and View menu - 
Items Edit/Go2Source go2Declaration go2Superimpl
are disabled and View/Show Line Numbers and
View/Show Editor Toolbar are enabled - this is OK
4. open form file to init MultiView
5. switch between Code and Design mode and ensure
that editor actions Edit and View menu are
properly enabled/disabled. Note that the problem
appears here Edit/Go2* actions are disabled (They
take ActionMap from XMLKit instead of JavaKit
probably)
6. open java file
7. the same Edit/Go2* actions are disabled.

The problem doesn't occur until the MultiView is
open. Actions in Edit and View are sensitive to
context. Since MulliView is open caching starts.

short_description: Editing JSP consumes processor in some contexts
long_description:
Build 200502271900

1) Have fresh userdir
2) Create new Web Project
3) Edit index.jsp
4) Type at line 14:
   
(unfinished Java comment)
5) Place cursor at the end of this modified line 14
6) Hold any key for a while
7) ERROR:
It takes 100% of my processor.

Notice:
- Doing the same thing at line 37 (last JSP line)
takes only 52% of processor.
- Same case without  text takes 42% of processor

short_description: Parser error in trailing types
Add CMP Relationship: Role name can be optional + other minor bugs and enhancements
long_description:
Current implementation requires the user to fill in at least one role name
however should be OPTINAL.

There are also several minor bugs / enhancements on this dialog:

* Due to mnemonics update it is necessary to change the tab traversal.
* Validation messages should be positive and terminated with a full-stop.

I've updated the spec to reflect these enhancements:
http://j2ee.netbeans.org/nonav/docs/EJBmoduleEditor.html

short_description: No simple way to run our validation tests
long_description:
Guys from time to time I'd like to run all our validation tests on my computer and also on core commit server and as 
far as I know there is no way to do it. The trunk build does:

# standard NetBeans unit and UI validation tests
ant -f nbbuild/build.xml commit-validation
# Init application server for tests
sh -x `dirname $0`/initAppserver.sh
# visualweb UI validation tests
sh -x `dirname $0`/run-vw-sanity.sh
# SOA (BPEL XSLT) and XML UI validation tests
ant -f 
xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-enterprise -Dxtest.instance.name=Enterprise 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true runtests
# CND UI validation tests
ant -f xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-cnd -Dxtest.instance.name=CND 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true runtests
# Profiler UI validation tests
ant -f 
xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-profiler -Dxtest.instance.name=Profiler 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true runtests
# J2EE UI validation tests
ant -f xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-j2ee -Dxtest.instance.name=J2EE 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true -Dxtest.userdata|
com.sun.aas.installRoot=/hudson/workdir/jobs/trunk/testappsrv/glassfish runtests
# Mobility UI validation tests
ant -f 
xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-mobility -Dxtest.instance.name=Mobility 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true -Dwtk.dir=/hudson runtests
# UML UI validation tests
ant -f xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-uml -Dxtest.instance.name=UML 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true runtests
# Ruby UI validation tests
ant -f xtest/instance/build.xml -Djdkhome=$JDK_TESTS -Dxtest.config=commit-validation-ruby -Dxtest.instance.name=Ruby 
tests -Dxtest.no.cleanresults=true runtests
echo TESTS STARTED: $TESTS_STARTED
echo TESTS FINISHED: `date`

which is quite complex. Why can we just modify ant commit-validation to do all of these? Imho the task shall check if 
proper configuration (ruby cnd etc.) is built and if so run these tests automatically. 



Btw. I would also welcome if we generated the junit XML results as part of every xtest run without need to execute 
some separate target.

short_description: FinSubTypesTest has JDK 1.4 dependencies
long_description:
The
org.netbeans.jmi.javamodel.usages.FindSubTypesTest
contains assumptions about what the subtypes are
for various java.util Collections classes.  These
assumptions are not identical in Java 5 so the
test fails when run on that JDK.  I recommend that
a test class be used instead so that its subtype
closure can remain constant across Java versions.

short_description: Invalid icon value! Probably malformed url or unknown resource. if you use icons on a JLabel or JButton from a jar in the class path.
long_description:
It happens in 4.0 Beta 1 build 200408191352.

Steps to reproduce:

I create resources directory somewhere on the C: 
drive which will be the project directory for 
image resources.
Then Create new Project name images in the 
resource directory.
Then in images project right click on src new 
> package
package name is yourprojname\resources\images

Here I must leave the IDE and in the Windows 
explorer:
copy all picture files into that directory
YOu put one gif into that: the New16.gif (serves 
as an icon on a Jbutton or JLabel.
Back to IDE Project tab
Build project (of images)
And I get a beautiful images.jar in the dist 
subdirectory

Then in he main project I add this jar(from the 
images dist):
mainProject right click Properties then  add 
the jar to compiling Sources and to running 
project.

 Let's suppose you want a JLablel  which has the 
New16.gif picture.
Create a Jpanel a Jlabel on that which I 
rename to New. Right click on the New Jlabel 
Properties.
At the icon select the ... 
Now we have a beautiful jar file (added above to 
the Compiling sources of the project) which is 
in the Class path so the idea is to try with 
Classpath. Click on Select File and really you 
see the beautiful jar select the new16.gif from 
that
and you have in the name  
yourprojname/resources/images/New16.gif 

Click OK and BANG you get:
Invalid icon value! Probably malformed url or 
unknown resource.

The same happens if you try by URL.

 Strange enough is that you can circumvent it 
(at least partially) within the Graohical form 
design editor: 

You select No picture (null) and if you put in 
the pre-Initialization code the followings:
java.net.URL iurl = 
Class.class.getResourceyourprojname/resources/ima
ges/New16.gif)
javax.swing.ImageIcon iicon = new 
javax.swing.ImageIcon(iurl) 
jLabel1.setIcon(iicon)

then it works EXCELLENT... but only in the 
running program. 

But unfortunately you do not see any picture on 
the label (or button) in the form design mode 
(well you had to select No picture...) which 
means it is difficult to use the form editor to 
put images from a jar file.

short_description: Decide on fate of web.jsf12ri
long_description:
#8ff1683c7cc4 removed the visualweb cluster which had the effect of turning off the web.jsf12ri module since it was an
autoload only used by modules in that cluster. (To avoid shipping a disabled autoload I also moved the module to the
visualweb cluster in #670e0679da5c.)

This module did however bundle a j2se-type library jsf12 containing the RI. It is not clear whether this library
needed to be shipped with the IDE notably prior to any recent change it would not have been present unless visualweb
functionality were enabled.

web.jsf/src/org/netbeans/modules/web/jsf/wizards/JSFConfigurationPanelVisual

does seem to expect it to be there (select jsf 1.2 which is budnled [sic]) though it also deals with the case that
the library is absent.

Maybe nothing is wrong but filing this for evaluation. If the library really should be present in the IDE (even without
visualweb) probably you want to move the module back to the enterprise cluster make it a regular module (not
autoload) and make it a dep of web.kit or similar so Plugin Manager can deal with it.

short_description: URLs in issue comments not linked

short_description: Several slow remote directoies make entire remote FS slow
long_description:
Consider a situation that some directories on remote host are slow (for examples they are links to some slow /net/* places).

In this case the entire remote FS becomes very slow even when it accesses fast files.

The reason is fs_server threading model. It now has a fixed number of threads (4 by default) and a common request queue. When each of these 4 threads get a request related with slow directory fast files can't be served as well.

short_description: Variables View seems to freeze GUI Thread
long_description:
I'm debugging an EJB running in GlassFish which works pretty well with one exception:

For persistence I'm using hibernate. Opening the Variables view and scrolling to the properties of an entity bean
containing lazy and yet unloaded relations leads to hibernate initializing theses relations. While loading the
variables list stops scrolling for a short time. This slows down browsing through the variables but as loading a
relation is rather quick it's not a huge problem.

When doing the same thing with a detached entity the Variables view shows Exception occured in target VM: failed to
lazily initialize... for that property which is fine by itself.
But unfortunately this seems to take some seconds for each of these properties and again scrolling is blocked while a
property's value is retrieved. So in these situations it's extremely slow to use the variables view.

Thanks

Norb

short_description: Hint recomputed even if not changing the document
long_description:
Editor hints are recomputed unnecessarily in the following scenarios:

(1) Each time I move cursor within the line where a hint is displayed the hint
icon disappears and then appears again after I stop moving the cursor. The icon
should stay displayed until I make a change or until I move cursor out of the line.

(2) Repetitively moving cursor to a certain line makes the hint icon appear on
that line with the same delay several hundreds of milliseconds as the first
time I go to the line. I guess the hint is computed again and again each time.
It should be cached for the line until a modification is made in the code.

short_description: WizardDescriptor incorrectly caches panel
long_description:
When a WizardDescriptor is closed it does not clear the current panel. Then 
if the W.D. instance is used again for another wizard invocation the saved 
current panel is used for comparison and is called to store its settings. 
That can corrupt settings of the (new) wizard being displayed.

I don't know if it is wise to null the current variable after OK_OPTION or 
CANCEL_OPTION was selected to closed the dialog. The exact wizard can be 
reopened (as it is done e.g. in TemplateWizard) and if the current panel was 
lost it can behave differently. It may be sufficient to reinitialize current 
folder at addNotify() call.
Using events the WizDescriptor listens on its impossible to force reset of 
the `current' variable AFAIK.
