http://wiki.netbeans.org/attach/JEE6Integration/java-ee-6-ui-review.pdf

BTW rather than Insert shouln't the action be called Insert Code (with Ctrl+I shortcut) to be consistent with
other files e.g. Java?

short_description: CVS: Never ending loop when commit fails on folder.
long_description:
Forte for Java 3.0 CE FCS (Build #010817) on Windows 98 with JDK 1.3.1

Description:
============
If there is any problem during commit of certain file invoked originally on fol-
der then user gets into never ending loop of dialogs for specification of change
description. It should stop the process once it finds out that commit failed.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount CVS filesystem using Command-line Client and use :local: connection.
2. Change externally the filename of some archive in the repository e.g. from
   /test/B_File.javav to /test/Hello.javav
3. Change working copy of /test/B_File.java so that it is [Locally Modified].
4. Now invoke CVS|Commit on test folder and try to commit B_File.java.
5. You won't be successfull no matter how hard you try.

short_description: test-single doesn't copy resources to classpath
long_description:
Same problem as #64987 described for java projects.

On trying to run a single unit test (with shift-f6 while editing the test case)
immediately after doing a clean on the project I get errors due to some
resources used by the test (XML files for the test's input and expected output
and a .properties file with some server settings) not being found.  A full test
of the project (alt-f6) works.

This is because -do-compile-test contains a copy task for all the non-*.java
files in the source folder but -do-compile-test-single does not this means the
resources are not found in the classpath when the test runs.  Since there is no
way to know exactly which files are needed by any particular test the same copy
task needs to be included in the -do-compile-test-single target also.

This has already been raised and fixed for j2seproject in #64987 but I was
advised there to raise a separate issue for web projects.

short_description: Use build.sysclasspath=ignore
long_description:
For some reason I cannot imagine nbbuild/build.xml includes the line:



but it is commented out! Setting it to ignore is very valuable as it enforces
good practices in declaring your classpath when compiling. It also permits the
build to work smoothly inside the IDE (or in other unexpected situations).
Currently (after a few fixes) the build should work in this mode. Please turn it
on and leave it on.

short_description: Use FileEncodingQuery
long_description:
The JSP data object should provide or at least use FileEncodingQuery to read
store in correct encoding. 
The best solution is not to overide loadStreamToKit and saveKitToStream and
provide implementation of the FileEncodingQueryImplementation which detects an
encoding inside the JSP file when available. This allows not only editor but all
other features like search and other which works directly on FileObject level to
read the file in the correct encoding.

The minimal change for NB 6.0 should be to use FEQ in case when no encoding has
been found in the loadFromStreamToKit or saveFromKitToStream. (When no encoding
is inside the HTML file the project encoding should be used.)

short_description: IDE froze in editor.settings.storage.Utils.load
long_description:
090202 JDK 6. My internet connection went down momentarily and the IDE froze. I had recently done a refactoring
(Ctrl-M) but at the time was only trying to navigate using arrow keys in the Projects tab.

From the stack trace I managed to grab just before the IDE unfroze it is clear that you are loading some DTD from the
network. You must use an EntityResolver for any DTDs which you expect might be declared in an XML document you are
parsing _even if_ you do not enable validation. EntityCatalog.getDefault() is fine but it means you have forgotten to
add some DTD to the NB catalog using the layer syntax.

short_description: incorrect indentation
long_description:
While looking at org.netbeans.modules.javascript.editing.JsFormatter for inspiration on how to implement indentation I
noticed a case not handled very well. Add following test to JsFormatterTest and you will see it passes but have a look
where the cursor is placed:

insertNewline(
    if (true) {\n +
        for (var a in b)\n +
                foo()^
    if (true) {\n +
        for (var a in b)\n +
                foo()\n +
            ^ null
    )

The caret should be aligned with for but it is not because of non-standard indentation of foo(). If I come across a
fix I will attach a patch here but so far I do not understand the code so well.

short_description: Comments not working when scroll past initial /*
long_description:
Started a comment with /*. After inserting folowing code went grey. I
was commenting out a couple of pages of code so scrolled down. When the /*
disappeared off the top of the screen it went back to colored code.
Scrolling the /* back again made it grey.

short_description: [41cat] Can't not always see member of the current class when more than one class in the source file
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200502222100 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.5.0 ]

Yesterday I created two classes in the same Java
file. and the source appeared in the Source Editor.
one class is public another one is
package-default (I mean nothing).
The package-default one appears in first position
and the public one in second position.
Today I launched NetBeans. The source editor
display the opened file.
But the navigator display only the members of the
package default class.
Even if I set the text cursor in the public class
I continue to see member of the package-default class.
When I close the source and reopen it everything
appears correctly/
When I cut the source of a class navigator is
well updated. Members are not any more visible.
When I paste the same code navigator is not
updated. Members are not anew visible. I am
obliged to close the source and reopen it to see
the navigator displays correctly the members.

P.S I also filled an issue in the past concerning
the fact that sometimes I see two times the
inherited methods. Seems it's not yet resolved in
the Beta release.

Vincent

short_description: Retriever does not handle HTTP redirect
long_description:
[nb5.5 rc1]

   In case that submited URL of WSDL is just redirect to some other URL with
WSDL which uses relative imports then downloading of imported files fails.

Example:
Following URL -
https://testgateway.pcslab.com/ParlayX2Web/services/TerminalLocation?wsdl - is
redirected to
https://testgateway.pcslab.com/ParlayX2Web/services/TerminalLocation/wsdl/parlayx_terminal_location_service_2_0.wsdl.
This WSDL imports parlayx_terminal_location_interface_2_0.wsdl which is located
at
https://testgateway.pcslab.com/ParlayX2Web/services/TerminalLocation/wsdl/parlayx_terminal_location_interface_2_0.wsdl
but retriever is trying to download file
https://testgateway.pcslab.com/ParlayX2Web/services/parlayx_terminal_location_interface_2_0.wsdl

short_description: problems with code formatting and comments put in the wrong place
nbm.needs.restart=true flag need to be removed
long_description:
As part of overall IDE ergonomics improvements as outlined here : http://wiki.netbeans.org/FitnessForever this flag in
spring.beans module was found to be problematic. Because of this flag the IDE needs to be restarted when the
spring.beans module has been installed/upgraded. 
The original commit message that sets this flag is here :

changeset:   65868:e663c01db728
user:        Andrei Badea 
date:        Mon Feb 04 19:47:50 2008 +0100
summary:     nbm.needs.restart=true because we are overriding XMLDataObject for
Spring config files 

This commit change was done to overcome the problem related to DataLoader API not being able to delegate to the actual
spring module dataloader when the spring configuration file needs to be recognized in the IDE and be able to support
custom file icon and enable CC.

Now that the DataLoader API does this delegation effectively this flag is un-necessary. Removing the flag will adhere
to the overall efforts towards IDE ergonomics as outlined in the wiki : http://wiki.netbeans.org/FitnessForever

short_description: Show Documentation does not work properly in EL
long_description: Should use ElementJavadoc for getting javadocs of elements in ELCodeCompletionHandler#document (rather than the currently used CompilationInfo.getElements().getDocComment()).

short_description: After turning off Highlight Caret Row last highlighted caret row remains highlighted.
long_description: Set Editor Settings | Highlight Caret Row to True.  Move the caret around in the editor.  Set it to false.  Remains highlighted.

short_description: no autocompletition for c:forEach
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201109060600)
Operating System = Windows XP version 5.1 running on x86
Java VM Vendor = 1.7.0
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 21.0-b17

Let's assume your writing a loop within a facelets page. You keyed in the first line and after the > Netbeans inserts the closing tag automatically. Next you type #{}

       #{}  <----- this is your last input


At this point autocomplete opens and offers you topic. And if you've choosen topic you'll see the methods etc. Everythings is quite fine.

No delete the lines above and use forEach to build up the loop.


       #{}  <----- this is your last input


NB offers no automatic autocompletion. Nor at this point neither after inserting topic. manually. After pressing {Ctrl}{Space} it offers the wrong content for autocompletion.
And due to a JSF design problem forEach is the more important loop statement. (see http://blog.mueller-bruehl.de/en/programming/jsf-insert-a-variable-count-od-files/. Switch to German version for an explanating comment)

folders which have hundreds of thouthends of files.

short_description: Fast import in PHP messes up by d()
long_description:
Im using netbeans mainly for php so i dont know if this happens also on other platforms.

The Kint debugger uses a single char function called d($someVar) to debug variables.

Whenever I perform a quick import it replaces all function calls with DatePeriod($someVar) this is really annoying.

This happens always even if there are no new imports to make.
The undo-action doesnt work either after it replaced everything so you have to do it manually.

short_description: Visual Web Components in NB 6.0.1 cannot be used in Portlet environment
long_description:
Transferred from the woodstock to vwp for investigation.  The Woodstock issue can be found here: 
https://woodstock.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=1168

It is not clear that this is a Woodstock bug as all references made by the submitter refer to NB6.0 vs 6.1.  There was
an effort to add portlet support into NB 6.1 so it would be good for the VWP team to review this issue as there haven't
been any changes to the Woodstock components that should affect portlets in NB6.1.

Bug Details:
============
Visual JSF components are not displayed properly in Portlet environment when
there are multiple jsf portlets in the same portal page. This was working with
NetBeans 6.0 but is not working with NetBeans 6.1 Beta.

Steps to reproduce :
1. Install NetBeans 6.1 Beta
2. Install Portal Pack plugins from http://portalpack.netbeans.org/nb6/download.html
       - Download portal pack 2.0 Beta 3 zip file and install all nbms inside
that zip.
       - Download visual portlet builder nbm and install it.

3. Start NetBeans 6.1
4. Create a Web Application
5. On the web application Right Click > New > Visual Web JSF Portlet Page
6. Design your portlet application and create a war
7. Deploy the war on Portlet Container RC2 which is available at
https://portlet-container.dev.java.net/public/Download.html
8. Verify the deployed portlet at http://localhost:[port]/portletdriver/ is
displayed properly
9. Create/Deploy another portlet web application using step 4-7 
10. Now go to the same url http://localhost:[port]/portletdriver/ 
You will notice that first portlet is not displayed properly. Only the second
one is displayed properly.

Note: If the same steps are repeated on NetBeans 6.0 both the portlets are
visible and behave properly. This is a stopper for us as visual web components
in NB 6.1 cannot be used as portlets.

------- Additional comments from camucci Tue Apr 8 17:37:29 +0000 2008 -------

I am trying to reproduce your test steps and have a few questions.

1. Were there any exceptions thrown in the Glassfish/Portlet Container or
NetBeans Logs that can help us further debug this issue for you?  Please send
any log details relevant to this issue.

2. What did you select for Frameworks when creating this project?   Did you
select both Portlet Support and Visual Web Java Server Faces?  If you chose
Portlet Support did you accept all the defaults? 

3. I could not locate any specific instructions on how to deploy to the Portlet
Container RC2 can you please provide specific instructions if any.


------- Additional comments from ranjansatya Tue Apr 8 18:52:40 +0000 2008 -------

Please find my responses for your questions

1. Were there any exceptions thrown in the Glassfish/Portlet Container or
NetBeans Logs that can help us further debug this issue for you?  Please send
any log details relevant to this issue.
Ans: I didn't find any exception in Glassfish/NetBeans log specific to woodstock.

2. What did you select for Frameworks when creating this project?   Did you
select both Portlet Support and Visual Web Java Server Faces?  If you chose
Portlet Support did you accept all the defaults? 

Ans: You don't need to select any framework. Just create a simple web app and
then create visual portlet inside your webapp. While creating a Visual Web JSF
Portlet page the visual web framework is added automatically.

3. I could not locate any specific instructions on how to deploy to the Portlet
Container RC2 can you please provide specific instructions if any.

Ans: The steps to install Portlet Container on Glassfish can be found at
https://portlet-container.dev.java.net/public/Download.html
After installing Portlet Container restart your glassfish server.
-Then hit http://localhost:port/portletdriver/ to see the portlet container page.
-You can see a admin tab in the portlet container page. Go to admin tab. There
is an option to deploy a war file.

Alternately
- You can configure a portlet container instance inside NB.
To configure Portlet Container in NB
    1. Go to Tools > Servers
    2. Add Portlet Container 2.0 instance
- Then select your project's runtime as Portlet Container 2.0 instance.
- Right click on the project and select Undeploy and Deploy
-

Marking as invalid. This is not a woodstock bug.

------- Additional comments from camucci Wed Apr 9 12:41:35 +0000 2008 -------

Filed https://glassfish.dev.java.net/issues/show_bug.cgi?id=4702

------- Additional comments from ranjansatya Wed Apr 9 12:50:26 +0000 2008 -------

Sometimes after you deploy the portlet if you click on the portlets tab you see
this exception. This is because portlet is getting deployed. This exception is
not related to this bug and it happens only once during portlet deployment. Now
you can tail the logs and do the following :

1. Remove any portlet window by clicking 'X'.
2. Now you will see that the other portlet is showing content.
3. Now click on Admin tab. Then under Modify portlet window section make the
portlet channel that you have removed in [1] as visible.
4. Now go Portlets tab. Now you will see that both the portlet are not showing
content properly.

In all of the above steps you won't be able to see any exception.
If you do all these steps with NetBeans 6.0 everything works fine as expected.
Hence we think it's a regression and should be fixed in NetBeans 6.1

------- Additional comments from ranjansatya Wed Apr 9 12:54:27 +0000 2008 -------

As explained above this works with NetBeans 6.0 with the same glassfish and PC
version but not in NetBeans 6.1 Beta. Hence reopening this bug.

short_description: Modify UI responsiveness tests to be run on remote filesystems
Project created from one machine cannot be used in another machine
long_description:
First created a Visual Web Application project in one machine (OpenSuse 10.2)
with two pages. Page1.jsp with a Drop Down List with default settings Page2.jsp
with a   Drop Down List and a Table both use the default settings. Do a build
and the project layout looks like project_view1.png. Now copy the whole dcfg
project to another machine (OpenSuse 10.2 or Oracle Unbreakable Linux 4) open
the project in Netbeans 5.5 IDE you will got two error message like those shown
in error1.png and error2.png. Click on Page1.jsp Page2.jsp or do a build will
get error1.png type error. Now do a build and you will see the project
structure as shown in project_view2.png. Where duplicated web-inf and meta-inf
(all lower cases) folders were created. Please note that IDE project folders in
two machine are the same. i.e. Both machines have the same directory structures:
/home/jonathan/local/ide/netbeans-5.5/... /home/jonathan/project/netbenas/dcfg/...

short_description: LowPerformance took 3414 ms.
long_description:
Build: NetBeans IDE 7.0 Beta (Build 201011152355)
VM: OpenJDK Client VM 19.0-b09 OpenJDK Runtime Environment 1.6.0_20-b20
OS: Linux

User Comments:
monkey1016: I was editing the PHP options at the time and it looked like it was scanning projects at the same time

short_description: Servers without graphics
long_description:
It should be possible to configure test servers to start correctly on machines
without available graphics environment.
For example some unit tests do not use graphics environment.

To configure machine without GE set:

nographics = true

in /local/conf/common.properties

The value of the property should be visualized in all servers list (e.g. by some
icon).

short_description: 0716: allow stateful injection in servlet against ejb 3.0 persitence spec
long_description:
NB 6.0 200707161200 & jdk 1.6 u1:

sorry may be not the good subcomponent (selected code).

was able to create an enterprise project (java ee 5): with ejb-project (session bean statefull) and with web-project
having servlet that calls @EJB statefull.

Verify action over the ear project ==>>>  Verifier gives the Warning message:
A Stateful session bean can not be injected into a servlet. Please refer to EJB 3.0 Persistence API Specification
section #5.2 for further information.

Is it possible to add a small check for the session bean type before doing the injection in the servlet ?
Is it possible to change the type of the already created session bean from statefull to stateless and do refactoring
to have the change every where ?

short_description: Exception during the first startup when uninstalling modules
long_description:
(using build 111 SDI)

An exception is thrown if a certain modules are uninstalled during the first
startup.

To reproduce:

1. Start a fresh copy of NetBeans.
2. In the setup wizard disable the following modules (in the same order):

    - Ant (1.5)
    - Auto Update (1.5)
    - Applet (1.5)
    - Resource Bundles (1.5)
      Internationalization (1.5)  -  removed automatically
      Resource Bundle Syntax Coloring (1.5)  -  removed automatically
    - General Online Help (1.5)
    - JSP (1.1.5)
      JSP Syntax Coloring (1.1.5) -  removed automatically
      JSP Wizard (1.1.5) -  removed automatically

After the removal of JSP and its related modules an exception is thrown and an
error message is displayed - see attachments.

short_description: Using JXTaskPaneContainer from SwingX prevents forms from being saved
long_description:
Created attachment 128799
Excerpt from messages.log

Tested using NetBeans 7.3B2 tested using SwingX 1.6.4.

At any time after a JXTaskPaneContainer is added to a GUI Builder form:
-If you try to save the form with Ctrl+S or a similar gesture:
--The status bar at the bottom of the IDE window claims the form is saved.
--The file name in the tab for the form is still bold implying that the form is not saved.
--Looking at the file on the drive the form was not saved contrary to the message in the status bar.
-If you choose to close the form you are prompted if you want to save.
--If you choose to save the form when prompted an exception is displayed.
--The discard and cancel buttons of the save form prompt work as expected.

Reproduction steps:
-Create a new form.
-Drag a JXTaskPaneContainer into the form.
-Try to save the form.

Expected behavior: At the least the status bar shouldn't claim the form was saved when it wasn't. Preferably an error message would appear when NetBeans couldn't save the form for whatever reason at any time. Ideally NetBeans would properly save the form.

messages.log excerpts attached.

short_description: Implement adding JSF framework in New JSF Managed bean
long_description:
Implement adding JSF framework in New JSF Managed Bean in case it is not present:

David Konecny wrote:
> Sounds like performance optimization. Presence of a framework in a project is always checked dynamically and so it should be as cheap and quick as 
possible. Let's leave it as is for now and if faces-config becomes optional we can check for presence of something else as I illustrated below.
> -D
>
>
> Alexey Butenko wrote:
>> Petr David
>>
>> I've checked the code and found that JSFConfigUtilities.hasJsfFramework is checking faces-config.xml and javax.faces.CONFIG_FILES
>> parameter in web.xml and not searching Faces servlet in DD. So probably it should be rewritten as suggested below.
>>
>> Thanks
>> Alexey
>>
>> David Konecny wrote:
>>> At the moment it is done (I think) by searching for Faces servlet in the deployment descriptor. Ideally what we should do is to just create merged web 
deployment descriptor model from project's classpath and look for Faces servlet there. The result will be the same but difference is that performance wise 
it might be slower. Once we know that Faces servlet is registered via annotation/fragment we should update our algorithm.
>>>
>>> If performance of detection of JSF in a project is a problem then we could optimize it: we will know which fragment/class holds the information about 
Faces servlet and instead of searching merged model we could just check classpath directly for presence of javax.faces.FacesServlet class with an 
annotation or for fragment file with certain content.
>>>
>>> I don't see any problem here.
>>> -David
>>>
>>>
>>> Petr Jiricka wrote:
>>>> One thing I thought about when filing this report: when we change things so faces-config is not generated by default and when Faces servlet 
declaration is not needed in web.xml will there be a way to find out that JSF framework was added to the project? How do we currenly recognize that a 
project contains JSF?

the class and close to hide the mark.

- Create a web-app project with existing sources. Specify the folder for the classes but don't specify the lib folder
for the web-app.
- The project shows lots of red marks
- Add the jars for the web-app

OBSERVED BEHAVIOUR:
- The red marks are still there

EXPECTED BEHAVIOUR:
- The red marks disappear

so Java EE project/infrastructure can't notify server plugin to reload the application.

short_description: Use Encryption API vs. scrambling algorithm.
long_description:
Text in the Connect to Database Dialog Box help screen reads:

Actually I did look at the saved 'scambled' password and it looks encrypted to me.  Was the code updated and not the documentation?

short_description: Document why VCS FS must be retained
long_description:
As there is a long-term goal to abandon VCS FS it
would be nice to document and track what is
currently blocking this effort.

At least two issues were mentioned on the review:

FileObject.lock() can result in visual asking
whether a readonly file should be checked out and
made read-write (e.g. for Visual SourceSafe)

VCS FS is sensitive to ongoing update running
which could overwrite the files on the disk
however if those files would be opened in the
editor and possibly modified there would be a
potential dataloss. The changes made in the file
by the VCS update would be overwritten by the
editor when the file would be saved.

short_description: Opened icon of PackageViewChildren$PackageNode is annotated twice
long_description:
[recent sources]

PackageViewChildren$PackageNode.getOpenedIcon gets an icon using getMyOpenIcon and then annotates this icon (using
FileSystem annotators). But the icon returned from getMyOpenIcon is already annotated by the annotators. So the icon is
annotated twice. If the icon is augmented with a tooltip during the annotation process the text of the tooltip is
duplicated which looks really strange. It seems to me that the most appropriate fix would be to call getMyIcon
instead of getIcon in getMyOpenIcon. See attached patch.

short_description: source error in online help
long_description:

1. enterprise/j2ee-platform/docs/j2ee-platform/org/netbeans/modules/j2ee/platform/docs/webservice/build/about_build_ws.html

(JAX-RPC support is intended for legacy systems only.

* The right bracket is missing.

short_description: Stack traces not being made links with colored output plugin installed
long_description:
The Colored plugin that adds colorizing escape sequences to stack traces is keeping NetBeans from seeing the stack traces to local files that could be links.  It 
is also not linking to source even though the source is installed for Rails.

short_description: No code completion comes up after hitting dot while using multicursor
long_description:
Created attachment 162386
MultiCursor CodeCompletion Problem with dot

As you can see in my screen capture I want to hit . after document while I select all occurencies with the new multi cursor feature. When I hit dot nothing happens. When I only set one cursor after document and hit . everything is fine. It happens in JS files and Java so I think this is a common problem with the multi cursor feature. And in my opinion this is a very big problem.


Regards

Chris

short_description: Should be no Skip button if only one update center
long_description:
Currently there is only one update center for 4.0 when the 
automatic update check happens you get a dialog with Cancel 
and Skip buttons.  If there is only one update center both 
buttons do the same thing - this is confusing.

short_description: Possibly blocking access to internet in CPExtender.getRepoURLs() ?
long_description:
This method stores URL objects in a HashSet which is dangerous as it causes access to internet possibly leading to performance problems (especially when waiting for network timeout).

See also this blog: http://michaelscharf.blogspot.com/2006/11/javaneturlequals-and-hashcode-make.html

short_description: [40cat] NPE when attempting to search javadoc
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200410181800 ]
[ JDK VERSION : J2SE 1.5.0 ]

I get the attached NPE when doing the following
(occurs the first time these steps are performed
after the IDE is started):

1.  Shift + F1 in the editor (nothing selected)
2.  Type in a search criteria (I used String). Hit
Enter.
3.  Nothing happened so I then hit the 'find'
button and that's when the NPE occurred.

On subsequent attempts pressing 'enter' performs
the search quickly and the 'find' button changes
to 'stop'.

short_description: [65cat] Unable to navigate to source in dependent project
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 200807240010 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.5.* ]

I am using the latest build (200807240010) and I have noticed that
when choosing to Go to Source on an element that belongs to a
dependent project Netbeans will not navigate. I am testing on
Windows XP/Mac OS X 10.4.

Another NetCat user has verified this issue on Mac OS X with the
following steps:

-create Java>Java Application project aaa package aaa in it and
class
AAA in this package
-create some method (e.g. public static viod
printAAA(){System.out.println(AAA)})
-create Java>Java Application project bbb
-set bbb depending on aaa
-in Main method of bbb type aaa.AAA.printAAA()
-invoke Go to Source action on this ...printAAA()
Nothing happens only in status line there is written Cannot open
(missing source?)

short_description: Show correct message when copying files to a remote host
long_description:
Now when project files are being copied to the remote host
the Validating build system window still hangs on the screen
until copying is done.

This is incorrect. User should be notified that project files are being upload to the remote host.

Java DB Grab Recreate table Schema
long_description:
Created attachment 137198
Java DB Table Recreate Bug

Summary:
Can't Grab and re-Create the DB Structure of a table

How to Replicate it:
Create a DB (follow https://netbeans.org/kb/docs/ide/java-db.html)
Grab a Table Structure
Try to recreate a Table: but the option is Disabled

short_description: Add option to collapse HTML tags by default or not
long_description:
Ever since Facelets 1.1.x was supported by NetBeans there has existed some annoying behaviour by NetBeans. Whenever you choose Tools -> Options -> Editor -> General and select Collapse By Default: Javadoc Comments all tags in XHTML files will be collapsed when such a file is opened in the editor. Whenever the Javadoc Comments option is not selected the tags will not collpase when an XHTML file is opened.

Please make sure the tags do NOT collapse when the Javadoc Comments option is selected. Perhaps this next question needs to be in another issue but can you please make sure that it is possible to select whether XHTML tags and comments should be collapsed by default or not?

Thanks in advance!

short_description: Factor out DesignTime API refs from Designer
long_description:
The DesignTime API is JSF specific (MarkupDesignBean) and its purpose is for
the JSF components to provide the designtime behavior. 
The Designer is not (shouldn't be) JSF specific so it doesn't need to contain
this API directly.

long_description:

=> UI becomes frozen

Note: I used hard link in path to tomcat. If I use absolute path then everything works

short_description: Project's source code browser has two-color background
long_description:
Created attachment 90550
source code browser - background

See e.g. netbeans.org> projects>web-content>source code>NBSystem Subversion
the readme on this page (displayed in the source code browser) has two different background colors - see screenshot.

The blue color should be not present in the background.

short_description: API review: Added lucen library
long_description:
Currently there are two copies of the lucene library in the IDE one used by
java/source second used by ruby. The goal of this change is to create an API
wrapper for this library to allow other modules to depend on it and reduce the
number of copies of lucene to one.

short_description: Template Manager allows renaming with duplicate names
long_description:
Hope code/favourites is the correct place for this that appears to be where other
Template Manager issues have been created.

I'm using NB 6.1 under Sun's JDK 1.6.0_02 on Windows XP.

Following the instructions on http://blogs.sun.com/geertjan/date/20071126 I was trying 
to set up a license file for a project.  I copied the existing apache license with the
Duplicate button which resulted in a new entry license-apache20_1.txt.  I started to
Rename this deleting the _1 then switched to another app (I had the project.properties
open in Notepad) to see what I'd named the project.license setting.  On switching back
I found the editing of the filename had stopped when it lost focus which was how I
discovered you can rename templates with duplicate names as I now had 2 separate
license-apache20.txt entries.

This in itself wasn't a problem however when I again tried to Rename one of them to
match my value the second one disappeared from the list completely!  It seems like
although there are two entries because they have the same name it they're a single
one when I make further changes?

short_description: Default platform reports canonical bootclasspath roots
long_description:
During debugging of CachingArchiveProvider I've discovered hat while classpath entries for which CachingArchives are to be created use canonical paths the JavPlatform's install folders use paths that were not cannonicalized.

Because of this differency ct.sym is not always properly used instead of rt.jar (project uses default platform the default platform provides cannonical bcp entries each entry is then tested whether it resides underneath a report JDK install folder which gives false).

According to offline discussion the default platform BCP should be de-cannonicalized (path prefixes replaced for install folder) if the reported jar locations are outside of the JDK root dir.

Setup on my machine is:

/space/jdk_{java_version} -- real install folders 
/space/jdk/{678} -- symlinks to the newest patch for the appropriate JDK release. 

I usually setup Platforms using the symlinked dirs and even NetBeans runs using symlinked JDK path.

short_description: Problem creating secondary File entry
long_description:
Using kit 010803

This problem affects Webmodules and Jar Packager.
See issue 14088 and BugTraq bug 4486894.
Jar archives containing jar-jarContent files or WAR archives containing
jar-jarContent files are affected.

Here are the steps to reproduce (same as the
second set of steps for issue 14088)

Every file/directory must be created fresh using FFJ
(directories are created at the root)
Also fresh installation must be used (new ffjuser30 directory)
These steps have been verified on Windows 2000.  Nearly
identical steps were followed on Win NT.

First see attached word document for filesystem structure
setup in the Explorer.

1) Unmount sampledir filesystem (no filesystems should be mounted to
begin)
2) Create new fs1
at root (c:\fs1)
3) Create new pkg1
under fs1 
4) Create new class in pkg1 named MyClass
5) Compile pkg1
6) Create new jarContent myjar1
containing pkg1
7) Compile myjar1

8) Create new fs2
at root (c:\fs2)
9) Create pkg2
under fs2
10) Copy myjar1 to pkg2
11) Create new jarContent myjar2 containing pkg2
12) For myjar2 set File Filter to all files
13) Compile myjar2

14) Create new jarContent myjar11 in fs1 containing pkg1 and compile
myjar11
15) Delete myjar1 from pkg2
16) Copy myjar11 to pkg2
17) Compile myjar2

18) Create new jarContent myjar111 in fs1 containing pkg1 and compile
myjar111
19) Delete myjar11 from pkg2
20) Copy myjar111 to pkg2
21) Compile myjar2

22) From a command prompt type:  jar tvf myjar2.jar

Result:

myjar111.jar is missing from myjar2 archive:

G:\fs2>jar tvf myjar2.jar
     2 Fri Aug 03 18:31:02 PDT 2001 META-INF/MANIFEST.MF
  1022 Fri Aug 03 18:31:02 PDT 2001 pkg2/myjar111.jarContent

short_description: Allow declaration target to be chosen by the user
long_description:
We have several issues around Go To Declaration that it sometimes doesn't jump where you expect.

This is a general problem in Ruby since if you ask to go to say the class TestCase it can be defined in many places
- so which one should we show?

I've been thinking for a while that it should really ask the user.  I was a bit reluctant to attempt this for NetBeans
6.0 since I thought this was a new thing in NetBeans. However I discovered that Netbeans already does something very
similar if you try to Go To Superclass for a class which implements a method that is defined in multiple interfaces. It
pops up a dialog asking you to choose which superclass to jump to. That's the precedent I needed.

I've implemented this but it's disabled for now. You can enable it by running with the very latest build and this flag:

-J-Druby.show_all_decls=true

Try jumping to a class like TestCase or a method like chomp or ...

Obviously when there is only one match it will jump to the declaration without asking.  In the dialog I include
matches that are marked with :nodoc: (which typically means they are implementation classes or methods so probably not
an interesting go to target). However if all but one match is nodoc I just jump to the non-nodoc'ed class.

I also sort the list such that  you first see the best match (in bold) then all the documented classes at the very
end the nodoc'ed classes and the rest in the middle (sorted by filename). The best match is one I've picked based on
heuristics. That's the one I would just jump to until now - and which isn't always right.

(You can also make it just jump to the best match by running with another flag.)

short_description: VCS group can't be corrected file by file.
long_description:
Sun ONE Studio 4 update 1 Community Edition -
build #020802
Solaris 5.8 with JDK 1.4.1 RC build #18

Description:
============
Most of VCS group verification dialogs ignore the
user if s/he wants to correct only particular
files. Always all files with some problem are
processed and corrected. Users then may easily get
confused.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount CVS client using Built-in Client and
create 2 new files.
2. Select both [Local] files and Add to VCS
Group| them.
3. Invoke Versioning|VCS Groups action from
popup menu.
4. Invoke Verify on  node.
5. Check Add Files to Repository checkbox.
6. Select Add Selected Files Only option and
select only one file.
7. Press Correct Group button. Note that both
files were added.

Note: The same goes for [Needs Patch] files.
=====

short_description: Implementing a Web service client for an enterprise EJB module porject fails with error
long_description:
Netbeans build: netbeans-trunk-nightly-200707030000-full.zip

Trying to implement a web service client for an enterprise EJB module project fails with the following error.

wsimport-init:
wsimport-client-check-TwoWay:
wsimport-client-TwoWay:
Consider using / so that wsimport won't do unnecessary compilation
parsing WSDL...
[ERROR] in message TwoWayMsg part TwoWayPart must specify a element attribute
  line 19 of
file:/C:/workbench/IntergrationProjs/EjbToBpel/EJBModule1/src/conf/xml-resources/web-service-references/TwoWay/wsdl/TwoWay.wsdl
BUILD SUCCESSFUL (total time: 4 seconds)

The WSDL has a message defined on a schema type as follows
    
        
    

The binding for the interface using this message is marked as style=rpc as follows.
        

This seems to be a valid scenario and should be supported for SOA composite applications JavaEE interaction scenarios.

The wsdl file is attached for reference and testing.

Steps to reproduce:
1. import the attached wsdl or store it in local folder.
2. create an enterprise EJB module project.
3. right click the EJB module project and select the option web service client from the Web Service category.
4. on the wizard select the local file for the WSDL file selection
5. point to the wsdl file in the local directory enter a package name and click finish
6. observe the error dialog

The jpeg file of the error dialog is attached.

short_description: Saving to a samba-mounted drive is very slow
long_description:
It takes several _minutes_ to save changed class diagram. If the project files are located on a local hard drive no problem at all saves are fast.

The problem occurs under both Java 1.5 and 1.6 x64 versions of Java runtime

short_description: Automatic #include bug when code completing before existing includes
long_description:
Created attachment 123116
Before code completion with existing #include after insert location

If you try to use code completion (Ctrl+Space) on a token who's declaring file needs to be included and other #includes exist in the current file after the current line those includes get garbled and the new include line is inserted after it is needed.

The attached before and after pics are before and after Ctrl+Space Enter.

Note that even if the include was not garbled the new one would be after using exit() for the first time producing an error (or warning) on compilation.

If the include filenames change the place where the new #include ... gets inserted within the existing #include ... line changes. (For instance screenshots show the new line getting injected before the .h of the existing #include. I have also seen it inserted before the e of include.

long_description:
JPopupMenuOperator.pushMenu() should fail if menu
item is disabled.

not found.

 JFrameOperator frame = new JFrameOperator(Source
Editor [)
 frame.clickForPopup()
 new JPopupMenuOperator().pushMenu(XXXX |)

In this case test passes but it should fail
because Copy item is disabled.

Editor [)
 frame.clickForPopup()
 new JPopupMenuOperator().pushMenu(Copy |)

short_description: Marking item as modified does not work for two following changes
long_description:
Consider situation:

class A {
   void changeName() {
   }

   void changePar(int a) {
   }
}

Consider API user will change the name of first method to newName and name of
parameter in second method to newParameter.

Current ListMatcher mechanism will return for features collection:

{delete} changeName method
{modify} modify changePar(int a) to newName() method.
{insert} insert changePar(int newParameter) method.

That is definitely wrong. More results are acceptable based on weights measuring:
{modify} changeName() method -> newName() method
{modify} changePar(int a) method -> changePar(int newParameter)

or remove both method and add the new ones if mesuring will say it is not
modification but removal and insertation

or combination of first and second solution. One is changed and second modified
and vice versa.

ListMatcher has to be extended to take measurement facility for elements
provided by user and tested again for more complex items.

[ BUILD # : 200511171900 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.5.0_04 ]

Steps to reproduce:

1. File->New Project (or Ctrl-Shift-N)
2. General->Java Application [Next>]
3. Enter 'import' as Project Name. Leave out everything untouched (the defaults are fine) [Finish]

6. Enter a new package name in New Name field e.g. anotherpkg
7. Upon pressing Enter the statement 'package anothername' is filled in but the erroneous 'package import' will remain.

short_description: Insufficient memory arguments specified at server startup resulting in PermGen errors
long_description:
The IDE starts the server with particular memory arguments. Namely this is what I see in the server output:
JAVA Memory arguments: -Xms512m -Xmx512m -XX:MaxPermSize=128m

However the README.txt document recommends higher memory arguments for Mac:
   Mac
    $ export USER_MEM_ARGS=-Xmx1024m -XX:PermSize=256m
    $ . $MW_HOME/wlserver/server/bin/setWLSEnv.sh 

I am getting PermGen errors because of this discrepancy. The IDE should follow the recommendation from the README document and set the arguments accordingly.

short_description: Source/target level should always be explicit in a j2seproject
long_description:
It seems it would be better if a j2seproject
always kept in project.properties its desired
source and target levels to avoid a possible
source of errors when running builds without
build.properties. The source level (and probably
target level) of a project is really intrinsic to
the project and should not be sensitive to the
build environment even if the selection of a
physical JDK to build and run against might have
to passed in from the environment.

Suggest that we modify these values in
project.properties only in response to the user
explicitly changing the platform in the project
customizer and at no other time.

I.e. a user running the IDE on JDK 1.5 would
always have 1.5 source level as the initial
setting for new projects. If the user changed the
explicit platform to be a 1.4 JDK
project.properties would be changed to use 1.4
source and target levels.

Needs to be analyzed with a full set of use cases
to be sure that the behavior would be rational in
all circumstances.

May no longer be feasible for D but we can think
about it for E.

short_description: CMake configuration appears not to correctly map paths with Remote build
long_description:
Background:

I have a remote build configuration to a Linux server where my home folder is mounted in:
  /Volumes/user
on Mac OS X and corresponds to 
  /mnt/...../user/home
on the Linux server.

I have set up the path mapping settings accordingly:
 Local path
  /Volumes/user
 Remote path
  /mnt/...../user/home

Steps to Reproduce:

Start with a CMake project.
1. Create new project from existing sources point NetBeans at /Volumes/user/project
2. Let NetBeans automatically set up CMake or choose a custom configuration with a separate build folder (result is the same).
3. NetBeans attempts to configure CMake from the local path location rather than translating it to the remote path.

Sample error message:
Make Error: The source directory /Volumes/user/Development/project does not exist.
Specify --help for usage or press the help button on the CMake GUI.

Expected result:
Paths are transparently mapped when CMake is launched.

Workarounds:
Attempted to manually edit the properties of CMakeLists.txt to set the build path to the correct path for the remote machine.  However NetBeans apparently checks this path and will not configure.

To go further: is this bar visible and has width 0? Can we make it hidden by
default?

short_description: Children of ContextSystemOption in options can be deleted
long_description:
E.g. Project Settings | Java Settings | Synchronization options canDestroy(). In
fact deleting the node does nothing but it should not even be enabled.

To disable it probably it will be necessary to turn off canDestroy() using a
FilterNode in org.netbeans.core.ControlPanelNode.

But it is strange that deleting it does nothing--since this is a BeanChildren
perhaps there is also a bug in BeanChildren pertaining to destroying children
(it ought to remove the child from the bean context).

short_description: Update API javadoc pages for 6.5
long_description:
Someone from platform team needs to update javadoc for 6.5. There used some items in checklist but the checklist is 
gone as far as I can tell (there is a broken link at http://platform.netbeans.org/guidelines/index.html)

But looking into the history:
http://web.archive.org/web/20080115182217/http://www.netbeans.org/community/guidelines/checklist.html
I can see at least these tasks:

nbbuild/build.properties (daily-alpha-nbms and javadoc module configurations). javadoc shall contain only modules that 
provide at least one stable or official api and are included in the release

nbbuild/javadoctools/export2html.xsl (change the HTML header part to talk about appropriate version and possibly say 
that all apis are available at the dev URL: http://www.netbeans.org/download/dev/javadoc/) 

nbbuild/build.properties (needs to contain proper information about the date of previous version so in trunk version 
update the values of previous.version properties to match the date of creating the branch)

- Give focus to project window.

it.

short_description: Editor falsely applies error badges in source code.
long_description:
In my maven projects I have a library dependency coded in groovy and compiled with the maven-eclipse-compiler plugin. I have some Java code in a separate project that uses this compiled dependency. My Java project compiles and runs correctly but the Java source editor falsely applies error badges to three of my Java source files all of them indicating errors in the usage of my groovy project APIs despite the fact that the code does compile and run correctly.

I believe these falsely reported errors are due to the groovy netbeans plugin using version 1.6.4 of the groovy-all.jar library whereas my groovy project is being compiled against version 1.8.4 of the same library. I cannot use the 1.6.4 version of groovy-all because the groovy-eclipse-compiler will not compile to versions of the groovy API older than 1.7. When I attempt to do so it causes ClassNotFoundErrors at runtime.

It would be preferable if the groovy plugin would use the same version of groovy-all that is declared in my project POMs. If this is not possible it would be nice to have a way to configure the groovy plugin to use a specific version of the groovy API that I specify.

Below is my related POM configuration for the groovy-eclipse-compiler plugin:

  
    src/main/groovy
    src/test/groovy
    
      
        org.apache.maven.plugins
        maven-compiler-plugin
        2.3.2
        
          groovy-eclipse-compiler
        
        
          
            org.codehaus.groovy
            groovy-eclipse-compiler
            2.6.0-01
          
          
            org.codehaus.groovy
            groovy-eclipse-batch
            1.8.4-01
          
        
      
    
  

  
    
      org.codehaus.groovy
      groovy-all
      1.8.4
    
  



Below are the related errors appearing in my IDE log:

WARNING [org.netbeans.modules.java.source.tasklist.IncorrectErrorBadges]: Incorrect error badges detected file=C:\workspaces\projects\java-stack\modules\starter\trunk\starter\src\main\java\org\lds\stack\starter\ui\StackStarterFrame.java.
WARNING [org.netbeans.modules.java.source.tasklist.IncorrectErrorBadges]: Going to recompute root=C:\workspaces\projects\java-stack\modules\starter\trunk\starter\src\main\java files in error=[file:/C:/workspaces/projects/java-stack/modules/starter/trunk/starter/src/main/java/org/lds/stack/starter/ui/StackStarter.java file:/C:/workspaces/projects/java-stack/modules/starter/trunk/starter/src/main/java/org/lds/stack/starter/ui/StackStarterFrame.java file:/C:/workspaces/projects/java-stack/modules/starter/trunk/starter/src/main/java/org/lds/stack/starter/ui/Step2ProjectConfiguration.java].

short_description: Debug toolbar sized incorrectly on Solaris 11 JDK 6u3 Nimbus theme
long_description:
While testing NB6.0 in Solaris Express Developers Edition (build snv_77) with java 1.6.0_03 several GTK+ compatibility
issues were encountered.
The first one is error messages in console while running IDE:
(:19201): Gtk-WARNING **: Attempting to add a widget with type
GtkButton to a GtkComboBoxEntry (need an instance of GtkEntry or of a
subclass)

(:19201): Gtk-CRITICAL **: file gtkwidget.c: line 3236:
assertion `GTK_WIDGET_ANCHORED (widget) || GTK_IS_INVISIBLE (widget)' failed

(:19201): Gtk-CRITICAL **: file gtkstyle.c: line 5879:
assertion `style->depth == gdk_drawable_get_depth (window)' failed

(:19201): Gtk-CRITICAL **: file gtkstyle.c: line 5879:
assertion `style->depth == gdk_drawable_get_depth (window)' failed

The second is a corrupted debugger toolbar after performing the following scenario:
- Run NB with a fresh user dir
- create a java application
- Push 'Run|Step Into' menu item
- Press Finish button on toolbar
- Click on toolbar and call context menu. Select 'Small Toolbar Icons' menu item
- Push 'Run|Step Into' menu item again
==> 'Debug' toolbar appears but It's twice as big as 'Build' toolbar
- Press Finish button on toolbar
- Click on toolbar and call context menu. Deselect 'Small Toolbar Icons' menu item
- Push 'Run|Step Into' menu item again
==> 'Debug' toolbar appears but It's once again twice as big as 'Build' toolbar


All these do not happen if you start NB with java 1.5 or using option --laf javax.swing.plaf.metal.MetalLookAndFeel

short_description: [multiview] Problems with undo-redo
long_description:
If getUndoRedo() is implemented differently for multiple MultiViewElements the
undo-redo doesn't work reliably. 

Scenario :

In first MVElement() we return null in getUndoRedo() method
In second MVElement() we return UndoRedo object retrieved from the editor support.

If you open the first MVElement undo-redo is not working - this is correct.
If you open the second MVElement - the undo-redo is not working as well which
is bad.

After you switch to another top component and back to MVTopComponent the
undo-redo starts to work surprisingly.

See also the issue 57600.
We solved that by defining common UndoRedo for all MVElements.

action on the model when the Java classpath scan has finished. The method is the
equivalent of the JavaSource.runWhenScanFinished() introduced in issue 101787.

short_description: Wrong global variable
Split extexecution to have a base API with minimal dependencies
long_description:
Some other projects both Oracle and non-Oracle has requested a External Execution API that would have a really minimal (and small in size) dependencies.

This change introduce the extexecution.base for now on execution_split and later on server_split branch of jet-main. It only depends on org.openide.util.base and org.openide.util.lookup. The base API provides all the important machinery not related to the IDE.

The change is fully source and binary compatible. Old APIs are deprecated but still usable.

The change also incorporates some minor improvements from stalled issue #232434.

I plan to rewrite the clients to new methods before it will eventually get merged to default branch. In future deprecated methods and classes may be removed though it is not planned for now.

short_description: [2004-03-31] Need to be able to veto user press of Next or Finish button in Wizard step
long_description:
There are times when a wizard step contains data that 
cannot be validated during isValid() because they are too 
time consuming (for example verify that a UDDI registry 
key entered by user exists in external registry or that a 
URL is valid).  These should be validated when the user 
moves to the Next step or Finishes.  But if there is a 
validation error at that point we need to be able to veto 
the Next / Finish button press and keep the user in the 
current step.  Thus this validation that needs to occur 
on step exit (only on Next/Finish -- don't want it to run 
on Back/Cancel) must be code that runs within the current 
step panel.
Currently to do this type of validation we have to 
validate these items on entry into the next step and if a 
validation error occurs we have to give the user a 
message that tells them about the validation error and 
tell them to Press the Back button -- that makes for an 
awkward interface and worse yet if they have pressed 
Finish then we can't even do this and the user has to 
restart the wizard!
See also items 15267 and 11694.

short_description: Hints sometimes continue to appear after problem is corrected
long_description:
See attached screen shot.  I have forced the file to be reparsed several times
by making changes and saving it.  The hint in the screen shot continues to
appear even though it is visible that the file is correct (semantic
highlighting is showing that it is already referring to a field of the name the
hint is suggesting and you can see the field defined at the top of the file).

short_description: NbProjectOperation has bad error reporting swallows much information
long_description:
[trunk Oct 30]

NbProjectOperation catches all sorts of exceptions and dumps their stack traces
with netbeans.debug.exceptions on. Unfortunately many of the most important
exceptions are caught earlier by projects module which correctly accumulates
them using NbErrorManager.notify when the container exception is dumped to
stderr all of these are lost! Should use NbErrorManager consistently so that
other things can be debugged more easily. See attached stack trace as an example
of its current useless output (I don't know exactly what caused the exception
of course that being the point).

short_description: Slight changes in rendered ascent (chars moving up/down when typing)
long_description:
Dev build 101104.
For certain fonts when typing e.g. 'i' then 'f' the characters appear to move slightlly up/down. For Monospaced font I was only able to reproduce it for size=12 on Mac OS X 10.5.8.

short_description: Stuck at provide a valid application server installation
long_description:
When I try to register a new server under the Servers icon in the servers view seen by invoking the Tools > Servers menu
I get a dialog box which refuses to proceed past the first page. The error message is 'Provide a valid Application
Server Installation Location for Sun Java System Application Server'. I do specify a valid installation directory for
the Sun Java System Application Server. It also fails on trying to register a server for Sun Java System Web Server. It
does however work fine for glassfish v2 ur2. I have installed all the appropriate server plugins. Attached are
pictures showing the dialog boxes...

short_description: Diff to previous Revision from annotations not working
long_description:
Steps to reproduce:

 - open source file under SVN version control
 - Team > Show Annotations
 - right click revision in annotation
 - select Diff to previous Revision 
 - graphical view off diff is empty (when it should not)
 - textual view of diff just shows empty diff  (when it should not):

# This patch file was generated by NetBeans IDE

+++ 12114

short_description: Patch for: Code completion does not recognize double single quote inserts one too many
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201308022300)
Java: 1.7.0_25 Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 23.25-b01
Runtime: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.7.0_25-b15

I have an SQL file and edit it in Netbeans:

COL_IP_RANGE        VARCHAR(255)    NOT NULL DEFAULT ###

Cursor is placed at ### and I type two single quotes  ''
Expected result: Two single quotes
Actual result: Three single quotes and Netbeans marks everything after the line as an error.

short_description: Opening New File dialog for first time is slow
long_description:
[nb_dev](200407141800) [jdk1.5.0](beta3 - b58) on
out lab
machines:
---------------------
                   Linux RH9   JDS2  Sol9   W2K   WXP
 1st usage 	1753 	1924 	2029 	1500 	1760
Subsequent usage 	747 	955 	641 	551 	631
---------------------

Test case:
- run IDE
-  Push main menu File|New File...
EXPECTED RESULT: New File dialog is opened within
1000ms.

----

If I measure the same dialog on my faster notebook
/ RH Linux 9/Gnome/JDK1.5.0(beta3) it takes  ~
1618 ms .

short_description: selected template should be scrolled to visible
long_description:
When using New from the main File menu the last choice (used in NFT) is
selected but the tree selection is not scrolled to visible

short_description: Global maven goal definitions fails to save properties with empty values.
long_description:
As an example the following goal execution is valid:

mvn dependency:resolve -DincludeClassifiers=

The empty value in this case tells the dependency plugin to resolve all artifacts (which is very useful for executing on a large project hierarchy rather than individually resolving artifacts on a project by project basis).

However when defining this execution in the Global Maven Goal definitions dialog it fails to save the includeClassifiers property presumably because it has no value. An empty property value is a valid use case and should be supported.

short_description: ToggleBreakpoint is usually ineffective
long_description:
Shift-F8 in xemacs is supposed to behave like Shift-F8 in the built-in
editor i.e. it should map to Toggle Breakpoint.  It usually does
nothing but generates a message in the terminal window where you started
netbeans:  Warning: Action  trying anyway.

short_description: Wrong title for DB Configuration Panel in New Rails Project Wizard
long_description:
The title of the new database configuration panel in the new Rails project wizard should be New Ruby on Rails 
Application similarly as for the other panels in the wizard. Now it is inconsistent and complicates the help topic 
organization.

short_description: A proposal to change the text of default license
long_description:
The default license at projectui/src/org/netbeans/modules/project/ui/resources/license-default.txt says:
To change this template choose Tools | Templates
and open the template in the editor.

After issue #226773 was implemented it's preferred to set up project license. Therefore I'm proposing to change the text to:

To change this license header choose License Headers in Project Properties.
To change this template file choose Tools | Templates
and open the template in the editor.

Any comments/suggestions?

short_description: PHPUnit 3.5 not recognised
long_description:
I'm currently testing PHPUnit 3.5.0RC1 and netbeans integration stopped working since the upgrade. The error message reports that the version is too old and suggests to upgrade to 3.4. 

My guess is that beta or rc tags are breaking the version parser but of course that's just a guess I haven't checked the actual code.

short_description: Text selection copies from the Editor do not appear to be reflected in the rest of the IDE`s clipboard.
long_description:
This needs to be better confirmed. But I believe that the problem is with CoronaClipboard: convertors are not run on the Transferable when there is a change made in the system clipboard. For example
 if you copy a node the Explorer uses CoronaClipboard.setContents() which runs the convertors. But if in the Editor you select a string and Copy it which uses the system clipboard it appears that
 the CoronaClipboard either does not notice the change at all or for some other reason never runs the convertors.


This is a problem because it is impossible to write a convertor which converts string selections from the Editor to something else (like node pastes etc.)--the convertor is not run at this time.

To test insert into e.g. ExClipboard.convert a test print--it will be run after copying/cutting from the Explorer but not from the Editor.

short_description: endif endswitch .... are not highlighted
long_description: When user use alternative syntax then the tags if end endif are not highlighted as braces.

short_description: Parameter guessing within initializer expression may select the variable being initialized
[Dark Theme][dark nimbus] Unreadable text-like icons
long_description:
There are several text-like icons in the IDE (e.g. an image of a letter) which are almost unreadable. After a discussion with Petr Somol we propose following solution:

Create a whitelist of specific text-like icons which are hard to read and apply dark metal inverting algorithm on them.

short_description: Thread contextual menu issues
long_description:
In the contextual menu for threads:
Switch to Thread should be Make Current
with a divider underneath it.


Possibly the Go to source should be placed beneath suspend/resume but that isn't very 
important.

short_description: [freeform] Web freeform project does create project.xml with absolute paths
long_description:
Java freeform project creates something like this
in the beginning of the file:

 <property
name=project.location>/local/arena/appdev
 <property
name=ant.script>${project.location}/build.xml

and then all paths are relativized to
project.location. Web project should do the same.
The 'relativization method' is
FreeformProjectGenerator.relativizeLocation(...)

short_description: options always expanded
long_description:
Netbeans version: CVS of 05/28/2002

The options in Tools/Options are always expanded.
Even if I close
the nodes and reopen Tools/Options later on they
remain expanded.

short_description: Threads tab and Debugging view inconsistency
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 080609)
Java: 1.6.0_01 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 1.6.0_01-b06
System: SunOS version 5.11 running on x86 ISO646-US en (nb)

TEST PROJECT: MemoryView

1. Toggle line breapoints on lines 39 and 59 of DeadlockTest.java
2. Start debugging by Debug File action on the file
3. Thread1 is set as current (in bold) in both Threads tab and Debugging view (or maybe Thread2 but these two views are
consistent at the beginning)
4. In Threads tab select the other thread (Thread0) and invoke Make current
5. The following can happen: Thread0 is changed to bold only in Debugging View (not in Thread tab) or both threads are
displayed in bold in Debugging view. 

Anyway it is not hard to make these two views (Threads tab and Debugging view) inconsistent when switching between
threads often. 

What I recognize is that if you switch in Debugging view the appropriate changes are made to Threads tab but not always
vice versa.

short_description: The panel that appears on Profile is not intuitively indicating the exclusiveness of the tasks
long_description:
The Select Task dialog that appears when the user 
clicks Profile or Attach and Profile does not 
visually indicate clearly enough that the user is 
asked to select one of the options - a radio 
button-like approach would be a better 
indication.

short_description: Editor dead slow when entire code is selected and use tab to align code.
long_description:
To reproduce the bug do the following steps:

1. Open a File which has 1000 lines of code.
2. Select all (CTRL + a).
3. Try to use TAB to align the code. 

Then editor response is horrible slow.

short_description: Form parser problem
long_description:
The form parser doesn't allow internal markup
tags to have attributes.  Internal markup is
any markup with a  tag which isn't part
of the form.  For instance table tags etc.
The parser contains a somewhat exhaustive
list of tags which may appear in this fashion.
However the grammar production which recognises
(and ignores) the internal markup does not
allow for the tags to have attributes.

Thus the following makes it die:

short_description: zero-sized file gives servlet error
long_description:
The URL above gives a servlet error.  I checked and found the file is actually
0 bytes.  Of course it would be nice if SourceCast handled this better (I filed
a seperate issue about that) but in the meantime could someone pls fix the
file ?  If it really should have no content at least an empty
 would probably avoid this error.

Thanks.

short_description: Sort matching classes in Java Fast Open dialog
long_description:
I have a lot of parser databases active (dozens in
fact) including all of the JRE plus many NetBeans
modules and other projects quite a lot of classes
in total. If I want to use Fast Open to open a
class named e.g. org.netbeans.core.modules.Util
it can be quite painful. The list scrolls far
down. Many of them are classes named Util* but not
Util which appear at the end but even still the
first couple of scroll buffer frames are all
classes named exactly Util in various packages -
it is a popular class name. It can be difficult to
search through these looking for the one I want
since they seem to be randomly sorted - probably
the sort order reflects something like mount
order but this is not helpful.

Attaching a patch which simply sorts all entries
in the list. First by simple class name then by
package name. Certainly makes it quicker to find
my desired Util.java.

It attempts to also honor the Code Completion
Natural Sort setting though I don't know enough
about the editor to be sure I did this the best way.


Even better perhaps would be to display simple
class names first in the completion list then
package names e.g. (just showing some entries):

-------------------------------------------------
Util (com.sun.tools.corba.se.idl)
Util (javax.rmi.CORBA)
Util (org.netbeans.core.filesystems)
Util (org.netbeans.core.modules)
Util (org.netbeans.core.perftool)
UtilConvert (org.netbeans.modules.properties)
Utilities (javax.swing.text)
Utilities (org.netbeans.modules.java.environment)
Utilities (org.openide.util)
-------------------------------------------------

This should be possible with a simple patch to
JCCellRenderer.drawClass (can supply upon request).

short_description: Form Editor module does not clean up bean JARs it mounted
long_description:
[release32 apr 6] If you within a single IDE session install the Form Editor
then uninstall it and then restart the IDE--you get an exception during project
load. The problem is that the Form Editor mounts the JAR file for e.g.
TimerBean.jar and does not unmount it when the module is uninstalled. Normally
this would not be a big deal but now the filesystem is of type
GlobalJarFileSystem which means that after restart the class cannot be loaded
and the filesystem cannot be remounted. So the project manager displays an
exception. Form Editor should unmount all its GJFSs when uninstalled as e.g.
Ant module already does.

short_description: Support custom JavaEE server libraries
long_description:
Some servers (Weblogic for instance) have own deployment process for libraries like JSF. This include the application itself (server specific deployment descriptor) as well as server (deployment of the library).

We should design API to support this usecase.

short_description: The value '1.8' of element 'source-level' throws exception for schema versions < 4.
long_description:
A freeform project can't use source level 1.8. The source level can be selected but an exception is thrown when project.xml is saved. Apparently some XML validation fails because the value 1.8 is not valid in the source level tag.

You can then use source level 1.8 until you close and reopen the project since the value 1.8 can't be saved.

You can't get around it by manually edit project.xml since NetBeans will then refuse to open the project.

short_description: NPE when user wants to create a new java file (interface ...)
long_description:
Build 040426 (non-official refactoring build)
The attached exception is thrown when user invokes
New->Java Class action from the context menu.

short_description: ClassCastException while trying to rename package name. The package was not renamed.
long_description: log in attachment.

short_description: NullPointerException: The constructorName parameter cannot be null
long_description:
When I try to generate entity classes from database the following error occurs. 
NullPointerException: The constructorName parameter cannot be null 

After this some of my generated classes are empty. 
I'm using NetBeans 8.0 Patch 2 
The daily build version gives me the same results.

short_description: Prevent NPE when removing LocalTerminalAction from the /Terminal/Actions folder
cppunit tests dont complete in test results window if new line written to standard out
Document Build Projects on Classpath and Folder on classpath
long_description:
Project properties | Libraries | Build Projects on
Classpath (checkbox)

1) There's no any explanation of this checkbox in
online help and it is not clear from the label
what this checkbox should do.

2) There's also missing Folder entry description
which confuses users. Folder entry on classpath is
used only for getting *.class files.

short_description: sample zip files need to be created from scratch
long_description:
Need to update the build script for the identity sample module to create the sample zip files from scratch instead of
updating the existing ones.  The reason is that if the sample code structure changes the zip files can contain
inconsistent state.

short_description: ETable keeps old sorted columns when new model is set
long_description:
The ETable (and therefor the Outline) does not reset its sorted columns when a new model is being set.
This means that it still thinks that columns that aren't used anymore are still sorted.
The most clear symptom of this problem is that the numbers in the headers showing the sort rank are wrong but it will
lead to other problems as well.

This can probably be fixed by calling ETableColumnModel.clearSortedColumns() from ETable.setModel(). I didn't test doing
that in ETable itself but that's the workaround for this bug I use.

short_description: Glassfish v3 missing when add a server to the Servers node
long_description:
Trying out 6.8 Milestone 1 on the Mac the first think I did was to go to the Add Server Instance dialog to add a GlassFish v3 instance only to find that v1 and 
v2 were the only choices. Creating a Java EE application started the appropriate modules and did the trick but that felt a bit like jumping thru hoops.

Starting the proper Java EE modules when bringing up the Add Server Instance sounds like a good fix (IMHO of course).

short_description: DialogDisplayer.Trivial does not dispose() on Esc key
long_description:
The full impl in core/windows does dispose() on
pressing Esc key while the Trivial impl calls
just setVisible(false) which is not enough as it
does neither free associated resources nor call
any window listener.
It should be consistent with full impl if possible
anyway.

short_description: Permit folder ordering using numeric sort
long_description:
Using relative ordering attributes has proven to be cumbersome when the number
of modules contributing to a folder is large. It should be possible to use
numeric ordering as a simpler alternative.

short_description: Factor out Batik refs from the designer
long_description:
The designer shouldn't be dependent on specific CSS engine implementation. There
should be some commong API which would be used.

short_description: AWT thread blocked for 29049 ms.
long_description:
Build: NetBeans IDE 6.8 (Build 200912041610)
VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 16.0-b13 Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.6.0_18-b07
OS: Windows Vista
Maximum slowness yet reported was 29049 ms average is 22412

short_description: Unable to resolve identifier path although code compiles allright
Windows launcher should require JDK 6
long_description:
Currently o.n.bootstrap/launcher/windows/platformlauncher.cpp specifies

const char *PlatformLauncher::REQ_JAVA_VERSION = 1.5

I guess this should be 1.6 now.

short_description: OpenESB:  generating XML document from XSD with no 'elementFormDefault=qualified' productes qualified elements
long_description:
Take the INV.xsd below with delimiters and all as set there. Notice that the 
xsd:schema tag does not have the elementFormDefault=qualified attribute.
Use the INV.xml instance document below. Try to test encoding. Get exception 
(com.sun.encoder.EncoderException). Now add the elementFormDefault=qualified 
attribute to the xsd:schema tag. Test with the same instance document - it 
works.

The XML is _generated_ from the xsd using the generate XML option on the xsd 
right-clickable menu. If the default is to generate an instance document 
with qualified elements then the encoder should assume that default. If 
default is no qualified then whatever generates instance documents should 
generate them unqualified. 


<xsd:schema 
    xmlns:xsd=http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema 
    xmlns:tns=http://MCZ01:14000//xsdINV 
    targetNamespace=http://MCZ01:14000//xsdINV xmlns:enc=urn:com.sun:encoder
    >
    
        
            <enc:encoding name=Custom Encoding namespace=urn:com.sun:encoder-
custom-1.0 style=customencoder-1.0/>
        
    
    
        
            <urn:top 
xmlns:urn=urn:com.sun:encoder>true<urn:nodeProperties 
xmlns:urn=urn:com.sun:encoder-custom-
1.0>group<urn:delimit
er>normal10<urn:optionalMo
de>nevernever<urn:by
tes>|<ur
n:kind>repeat10nev
ernever<u
rn:constant>~<
urn:delimiter>normal10<urn

short_description: Add new project type - Xslt Project
long_description:
Allow user to create new Xslt Project Type.
Xslt project should be placed in SOA category.

After the creating new Xslt Project the default xsltmap.xml file should be
generated.

For xslt project Xslt Wsdl and Schema file templates should be available.

Next actions should be available for the project:
   New
   Build and Clean
   Clean
   Set Main
   Open required projects
   Close project 
   Rename project
   Move project
   Copy project
   Delete project
   Find 
   Populate Catalog
   Properties

Cross-project XML References should supported 
Common xml project customizer UI should be used

After the succesfull project building procedure the deployable JBI module jar
archive should be created.

short_description: grails projects don't respect global formatting in .gsp files
long_description:
The global formatting options (set through Preferences>Editor>Formatting All Languages) aren't respected even if Use global options is set in the Formatting page of the project properties.  The only way to format correctly is to select Use project specific settings and specify the formatting options on a per-project basis.

Even worse if you try to format your file (using control-shift-f) it won't format correctly.  Then if you try to undo the format the IDE will throw an exception and leave your file in some terribly butchered state.  Oh! the horror!

short_description: bracket completion: adding brackets after if statement when code is not formatted
long_description:
build: 
Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 2009-05-04_15-03-52 )
Java: 1.6.0_14-ea Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.0-b12

description: 
if code is not formatted the pressing enter adds ending bracket even if there is one already. 

steps to reproduce: 
1. consider this code: 
if (isset($_POST['ic_input'])) {
$company = new Company()
$testIc = $company->testIc($ic) 
}
2. press enter after if statement opening bracket 
result: one more bracket is added. the code below if is not considered as a body of the statement and it seperated.
Moreover you get one redundant bracket. 
expected result: just empty line will be added between code and statement. brackets won't change. 

workaround: format code and then it suddenly works as expected

short_description: OOME when need to index larger amount of sources
long_description:
To reproduce it's enough to create a new Ruby project with default platform (just click through the New Project
wizard). Then watch the memory consumption during indexing. It stills grows eats about few hundreds of MBs. After
indexing is done those hundreds of MBs are released. Problem is when user has a lot of core libraries (often the case in
Ruby) the OOME is thrown.

short_description: Lookup sometimes returns instances in incorrect order
long_description:
[recent sources]

(Meta-Inf Services) Lookup sometimes returns instances in incorrect order.
Happens if an implementation class is looked-up in the Lookup. Please see the
attached module (test case) - try to start it. The IDE should start and finish
itself in a while printing FAILED into the console. Please note that if you
comment out the highlighted line in org.yourorghere.lookuptest.Installer the
test passes (prints PASSED into the console).

The test depends on org.netbeans.modules.versioning.VersioningAnnotationProvider
(which is registered through META-INF and does not specify a position). The
test adds org.yourorghere.lookuptest.ErrorAnnotator with position 50 (so it
should be before VersioningAnnotationProvider).

Please let me know if you need more info.
