short_description: Remove early notification dialogs
long_description:
If the user does not have Hg installed or if he has an unsupported version then a dialog pops up even if the user does
not want to work with Hg. This is OK for an update center module but inacceptable when Hg is in the standard build.
Please fix ASAP. For example in Subversion the error dialog is shown the first time a user tries to invoke an svn action.

short_description: Improper colors used for HTML Attribute Value and SGML Declaration in HTML Editor
long_description:
Currently the color values for HTML Attribute Value and SGML Declaration are:
HTML Attribute Value (2550255) -- fushia on white background
SGML Declaration (2552000) -- yellow on white background

The HTML Attribute value color (fushia) is unreadable in an error situation
since the error annotation line is a deep orange. The default for this color 
should be changed to the color used for the Java String Literal a darker 
maroon (15307)

The SGML Declaration color is unreadable under normal circumstances.  The 
default should be changed to a darker color (19114633).

These colors are defined in the Options window 
under Editing > Editor Settings > HTML Editor then clicking the 
Fonts & Colors property editor.

short_description: Show script for insert does not always reflect data for selected row.
long_description:
Using the 'show script for insert' feature does not always reflect data of selected row.

The problem can be reproduced by first retrieving data from some table selecting the top (#1) row from the table right click and select 'Show script for insert'. The data returned will correctly reflect the selected row.

Now click one of the column headers to force a different sort of the data and repeat the row selection process and 'Show script for insert'.  For the top row of the table the data displayed will be the same as before rather than the newly sorted data.

I have not checked the code but it seems likely that there needs to be a call to convertRowIndexToModel(someTable.getSelectedRow()) to ensure the correct row of the table model data is used.

db

short_description: Improve the way profiler status is reported
long_description:
Currently the profiler status is displayed 
periodically (every 1200ms) in IDE status line 
making the status line pretty much unusable for 
anything else.

Also the status would better be presented in a 
more structured way. The current thinking is to 
create part of the profiler COntrol Panel 
dedicated to a status/info about the profiled 
application and profiler/instrumentation state. 
Something like:

Profiling: 
Remote host: 
Profiling: Entire Application CPU Profiling
Instrumentation: 4500 classes instrumented
Estimated Overhead: ... (percents estimation)
... etc.

short_description: [performance]Long time to display Generic VCS customizer when trying to mount new GVCS
long_description:
There are several VCS profiles bundled with GVCS.
They are ALL parsed and turned into tree representation before the Configuration
dialog is displayed. All this happens in AWT-Event-Queue and take about 3
seconds (blocking).
It could be possible to parse only one profile and have another mechanism for
retrieving display names of other profiles.

short_description: maven properties and profiles not inherited for goals
long_description:
I want to report two issues which are closely related and quite similar.

One is the problem that I cannot set global property for maven.
Properties can be set in the pom.xml inherited from the master pom.xml or the setting.xml or by passing to maven.

I have problem with the last option. When I want to run a specific goal I can set the property for each goal but I
cannot set a generic property to run with all goals. Although I think this can be worked around at the
Tools-->Options-->Misc-->Maven global option but because there are maven properties which often change in our project
this would be handy to set it somewhere more comfortable space.

This is also problem for the generic life cycles. Netbeans use the clean the install and the clean install targets but
if I want to set a property for all I have to modify all three settings.

The second issue is quite similar but it relates to profiles. The profile problem has the same problems as mentioned
above with the properties. But next to this it also have a defect. In the pop up tools menu I can select which profiles
I want to have active. This works well with standard life cycles but if I define a custom goal it doesn't pass this
selection to the goal when running it.

This problem occurred when we had defined profiles which filters our configuration files differently. I had lot of
issue debugging it as I was thinking the profiles are called as they were selected in the pop up menu.

It would be really good if the selected profiles were passed to the custom goals as well.

short_description: JDK1.1 debugger doesn't work.
long_description:
Try to debug file with associated JDK1.1 debugger type.
Java virtual machine will write unrecognized option -nojit to the console.

My system is Solaris JDK1.3 wanted JDK1.1 is 1.1.8

Workaround:
To remove -nojit option from command line replace {debugOptions} with
it's contents for your situation and remove -nojit. In my case it was
only -debug. After this replace debuger goes well.

short_description: Code completion not showing class in different source package folder
long_description:
I created a project with existing code that is spread in several directories.  
The source is from the Spring Rich Client open source project.  I'm trying to
navigate from one file to another but when I clicked in the file name holding
CTRL I received the message 'Cannot open element
org.springframework.richclient.application.ApplicationLauncher.'

Then I tried to locate the file using the code completion feature but I
realized that the code completion can only find one of several packages inside
org.springframework.richclient.  The one it can find is the one where my
current class is inside.

Opening manually the class that the code completion can't find it shows all the
packages inside org.springframework.richclient.  I'm going to attach some
screenshots for better understanding of what I'm trying to explain.

short_description: Rename refactor can break code when new name shadows existing name
PERFORMANCE: very slow switching between Tomcat server instances after JSP compilation
long_description:
Bug exists in FFJ EE EA RC-1 build (v.4.0-EA (Build 020301_1)) 
with JDK1.4.

After compilation of some number of JSPs switching between Tomcat 
server becomes very slow and loads 100% of CPU.
Thus on P4 1.8 GHz machine it takes approximately 30 seconds 
to switch between two server instances !!!

How to reproduce:

1. Unjar jsp-tests.war file from /webapps file
2. Mount this web module
3. Call Compile All on the jsp directory
4. Try to switch between two target Tomcat server instances for this web module
when  finished and notice that now this operation takes a lot of time and 
loads 100% of CPU.

short_description: SIM properties hard to edit
long_description:
The SIM utility transports have properties which save their
configuration.  These may be customized using the SIM's own dialog.
However they are also accessible
via the IDE's tools|options item.

Due to the way that some of the options are represented it is hard
to correctly configure the SIM using this second
method.

short_description: Data Source References is red even there is no any data source usage in the project
long_description: Data Source References is red even there is no any data source usage in the project. Attach the project and screenshot.

short_description: SVG/JSR-226 Support
long_description:
Back at the 3GSM gathering much earlier this year Sun demonstrated a version of
NetBeans with support for SVG Tiny 1.1 and JSR-226 which was very very sexy.
Seeing as the first JSR-226 phones are hitting the market that there is
currently no platform that supports that JSR directly with the ability to view
the SVG at the same time (which is a killer feature) and that NetBeans has been
supporting it months ahead of its time I would really like to see it released!

short_description: BackTraces and subtree views use invocations column for sampled snapshots
long_description: The proper name for this column should be Samples for sampled snapshots.

short_description: designer does not show transparent background-color for 1.4 project
long_description:
Original status: 5-Cause Known Suggested Status: NEW


Original submitter: krystyna

Description:
1.4 project
 
1. set the page style property background-color to fuschia via dropdown
2. drop a textfield and set the components background-color by manually 
   entering in transparent
>Preview browser show that the textfield is transparent as does runtime but
textfield component still shows white background in designer.

Evaluation:
I tried firefox and it does show the white color as well like in the designer.
Is it IE only could you please try? Thanks.

Evaluation (Entry 2):
Shortfin 1103_4

My Solaris Firefox1.0.4 at runtime shows all fuschia e.g. while designer shows
white background for the textfield.  

My Windows XP IE6.0 at runtime shows all fuschia e.g. while designer shows white
background for the textfield.

Evaluation (Entry 3):
OK I now found out that the problem is experienced with 1.4 project only.
In 1.5 there is no transparency reflected nor in designer nor at runtime
(probably the background-colo property in the sheet is set as important).

In sum the problem is that the transparent value is probably not implemented in
the designer. Investigating.

Evaluation (Entry 4):
Yes it seems that the transparent background color is not reflected in the
provided components (JComponents used in FormComponentBox).

short_description: DataShadow's to disk files no longer work w/o mounted filesystems
long_description:
If you copy a (disk) file and paste it (into some
folder) as a link (DataShadow) you will just
get an exception and the link will be broken. DS
tries to store the original file by filesystem
name and path which of course does not work now
since there are no mounted disk filesystems. It
needs to use a URL (e.g.) instead.

Links to files on the system filesystem still work.

short_description: Project Customizer should allow disabling of OK buttton on invalid data

org.netbeans.spi.project.ui.support.ProjectCustomizer.createCustomizerDialog(.....)

 has to expose some API to disable the 'OK' button.


 Use Case:
   For my project customizer I want to disable the 'OK' button if the user has
entered invalid values in some of the fields. And enable the 'OK' button only if
the user has entered valid values. But currently there is no API to disable the
OK button.

Java: 1.6.0_14 Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM 14.0-b15
System: Windows Vista version 6.0 running on x86 Cp1250 cs_CZ (nb)

Many operations with breakpoints while debugging netbeans cause creation of phantom breakpoints - these breakpoints
are visible in editor but invisible in breakpoints view. Once present the only way to get rid of them is to start again
with clean userdir. They can be created via clicking on annotation (to delete existing breakpoint) or by moving line
breakpoint to different line via its properties.

Steps: Debug netbeans -> place line breakpoint in some java file -> edit its properties -> change line to some other
line -> breakpoint is moved but the original one stays as phantom

see screenshot

short_description: Extremely slow project scanning
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 7.0 (Build 201104080000)
Operating System = Linux version 2.6.35-30-generic running on amd64
Java VM Vendor = 1.6.0_24
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 19.1-b02

I have a project MMCommon that is used by almost all of my other NB projects.  Whenever I do refactoring in classes within MMCommon the project scanning that goes on takes a long long long time - sometimes 3 minutes or more.  During this time the pop up help for methods etc is not available when I need it the most. 

During the project scanning I see this message repeatedly in the IDE log:

INFO [org.netbeans.api.java.source.ElementHandle]: Cannot resolve: ElementHandle[kind=CLASS sigs=com.csc.mm.MMTabbedPane$2 ]
WARNING [org.netbeans.modules.j2ee.metadata.model.api.support.annotation.PersistentObjectManager]: typesAdded: type ElementHandle[kind=CLASS sigs=com.csc.mm.MMTabbedPane$2 ] has dissapeared

com.csc.mm.MMTabbedPane is a class in the MMCommon project.  I don't know what the messages mean or if they are causing or contributing to the slow scanning.

short_description: 10 seconds (40%) startup time regression caused by new welcome module
long_description:
Copied and pasted from a message I posted on nbdev

From: Trung Duc Tran 
Subject: [nbdev] PERF: _huge_ startup time
regression - blame ui/welcome module?
To: nbdev@netbeans.org
Date: Tue 04 Jun 2002 15:16:17 +0200

I am back after two week vacation anxious to try
out the latest and
greatest features in the IDE and suddenly noticed
that the startup is
way too long.  I did some quick measurentments

Config:
    Pentium III 500 MHz 256 MB RAM
    Linux 2.4.18 glibc 2.2.5
    JDK 1.4.0 NB built from today's CVS

Startup time:
    35 seconds

This is almost as bad as in NB 3.2 times.  After
looking around a little
bit I disabled the new welcome module and did the
measurements again.
Now it's ony 25 seconds more or less what I would
expect.

It looks like the new welcome screen adds 10 more
seconds to the startup
time it's 40% regression which virtually negates
all the hard work we
did for startup time in the previous release cycle.

With all due respect to the usefulness of the new
welcome module I don't
think it can justify the additional 40% of startup
time especially when
it claims to help improve the out-of-the-box
experience.  Long startup
time definitely does not contribute to good user
experience.

The owner(s) of ui/welcome module please do
something about it
otherwise I vote to remove it from the standard
distribution because in
current state it does not qualify for our
performance criteria.

Thanks for your attention

    -- Trung

short_description: If the type of an anotation contains ~ then it doesn't work correctly
openidex/l10n.list does not correspond to source files
long_description:
The current l10n.list of openidex is as follows.

# cat openidex/l10n.list
openidex/src/org/openidex/projects/Bundle.properties  <-- not exist
openidex/src/org/openidex/search/Bundle.properties
openidex/src/org/openidex/util/Bundle.properties      <-- not exist
openidex/src/org/openidex/Bundle.properties

However two properties files have already been obsoleted and
one properties file is missing. I think l10n.list should have
the following entries.

# cat openidex/l10n.list
openidex/src/org/openidex/search/Bundle.properties
openidex/src/org/openidex/Bundle.properties
openidex/src/org/openidex/nodes/looks/Bundle.properties  <-- need

Also if the following file needs to be localized
openidex/src/org/openidex/resources/mf-layer.xml
it should be added to l10n.list.

We need to localize missing file so please fix this ASAP in 'orion_fcs'.

short_description: Support HTTP URLs for Javadoc

directly parse the URL returned by

real http filesystem anyway - it just parses
index.html.

short_description: Clearcase no longer working after connection loss with server
long_description:
There is an issue with Clearcase when it looses its connection to the server while Netbeans is running:

Our Clearcase servers are shutdown during the night for backup and maintenance purposes. If we leave our Netbeans also
running the whole night the next morning when we try to check out anything we get an error message shown in the first
attached screenshot (error_1.png). If we retry we got this other message shown in the second screenshot (error_2.png).
This leaves the repository in strange state as you can see in the last attachment (error_3.png). From this very time
you can no longer work with the file since it claims that the file is already checked out by someone (which is
yourself). Updating doesn't fix this. The only solution is to do an update view in the Clearcase explorer which
restores everything.

I don't know if something can be done on the Netbeans side to improve this situation. I hope so.

short_description: Shared Entity Manager Factory and Entity Manager
long_description:
Currently each JPA controller class has its own Entity Manager Factory and creates a new Entity Manager for each method. This adds a burden of initialization of the persistence provider validation etc... for each call.

I suggest using a singleton pattern to share Entity Manager Factory and Entity Manager accross the controllers.

This can be added to the wizard the same way the exceptions package is added.

short_description: Lost keyboard focus in Explorer after opening menu
long_description:
[dev sep 23 but has been true for a long time] Perhaps this is
already reported but I am reporting it to try to bring some pressure
to get it fixed. In MDI mode (at least for me: Linux + Enlightenment
JDK 1.3.1 but also observed on Windows) if you have keyboard focus
on the Explorer (thick border on nodes) then select a main menu item
via keyboard shortcut after the menu is closed the Explorer will
still be selected (active border) but the selected node will have the
thin border and the Explorer has no keyboard focus (arrow keys etc.).
There are other serious keyboard focus bugs I encounter when using the
keyboard with the IDE but this is the most serious as it occurs all
the time and necessitates constant mouse clicking to give focus back
to the Explorer.

FYI other serious bugs observed in MDI with the keyboard but
complicated to reproduce include: after virtual desktop or window
focus switch with keyboard sometimes the last-selected (editor)
window is now unselected according to title bar but still has keyboard
focus and clicking on it selects it but makes it lose keyboard focus
permanently and must be closed and reopened sometimes the Explorer is
selected and has the thick border but is unresponsive to keyboard
events and that tab must be closed and reopened to work sometimes
after Enlightenment desktop switch the Editor window is still
activated but has no cursor and no keyboard focus until clicked on
sometimes random keyboard shortcuts such as Ctrl-2 or Ctrl-3 or
Shirt-F10 do not work for a while until some different window is
clicked on and then they are fine.

short_description: A11Y problems in Browse Folders dialog
Wrong filter in Add Existing Items from Folder... window
long_description:
NetBeans 6.5 and Sun Studio based on NB6.5 has wrong filter.

Scenario:
- Create project
- Call context menu in Projects tab and select Add Existing Items from Folder... menu item
- Select largest filter
- Copy and paste it into any text editor
.cpp .cc .c++ .cxx .C .mm .c .i .m .h .H .hpp .hxx .SUNWCCh .tcc .exh .inc .f .F .f90 .F90 .f95 .F95 .f03 .F03 .for .il
.mod.gif .jpg .png .htm .html .xml .txt .mk Makefile makefile

You can see wrong .mod.gif extension

short_description: Difficult to set a Groovy class as main class in a j2seproject
long_description:
20081028. After making a j2seproject and adding an empty *.groovy class to it I press F6 - and am greeted with a dialog
to select a main class with no entries.

If I add a class definition with a public static void main(String[]) method to it I can select the Groovy class as
main and then delete the method afterwards.

This is silly because I can have a Groovy class containing just e.g.

---%<---
println hello
---%<---

and run it. Ideally I could set any Groovy class as main if it had any statements in it outside of a class definition.

short_description: Refactor error message not cleared
long_description:
Right click on a variable var in a class:

class Test{
int var
}

Do refactor->Encapsulate Fields

Change the function name getVar to getVar2

An error is shown in the button and the Next
button is disabled.

I am not sure this is the right behavior or not
(because it seems not a recommended action but
not wrong).  Anyway change getVar2 back to getVar
but the error message still shown and the Next
button is still disabled.

(build 11/02/2004)

short_description: Per project annotations
long_description:
Product Version: NetBeans IDE 8.1 (Build 201510222201)
Updates: Updates available to version NetBeans 8.1 Patch 1
Java: 1.8.0_77 OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM 25.77-b03
Runtime: OpenJDK Runtime Environment 1.8.0_77-b03
System: Linux version 4.4.7-300.fc23.x86_64 running on amd64 UTF-8 en_US (nb)

Current state:
As a part of the current build I'm able to define globally PHP Annotations in the NetBeans Options and such annotations are offered in the code completion of the editor. That's great.

Improvement request:
What would be even more useful would be possibility to define annotations per PHP project. Every our private project can have different set of annotations which are strictly bound to it. I.e. older projects (on different branch) don't define all annotation processors as the newest one (trunk) or one project is aimed at different features (i.e. localization).

Thanks in advance at least for considering that.

short_description: InstanceContent.remove throws ClassCastException when removing not added instance
long_description:
[recent sources]

It seems that the InstanceContent (sometimes?) throws ClassCastException when
removing instance that was not previously added to the Content. See attached diff.

Not sure if it is valid or not to remove such an instance - but it would make
sense to me if the exception would be more descriptive (eg.
IllegalStateException explaining that the instance was not registered in the
context etc.).

Feel free to close this issue if you consider the current to be correct (for any
reason).

long_description: NA

short_description: Remove setProjectName from NbTopManager.WindowSystem
long_description:
Window system should be isolated from project concepts so this method here is
wrong. It was used to set main window title from projects/projectui - use of
WindowManager.getD.getMainWindow().setTitle() is sufficient API here.

short_description: TableView does not show popup menu on a selected read only cell.
long_description: A selected cell allways uses an inplace editor without checking if the cell is read only. In case of read only cells this inplace editor prevents the popup menu to become visible.

short_description: Fastjavac does not compile valid source file
long_description:
I have a class which compiles fine with the
External Compilation compiler.

However when switching to fastjavac I get a
compiler error Class xxx not found in type
declaration or input on an import line:

Here is the sourcecode which does not compile with
fastjavac but with javac.

import javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec

public class MyCipher
{
  private static final byte[] KEY_DATA = null
  private static final SecretKeySpec KEY = 
      new SecretKeySpec(KEY_DATA DES)
}

The error message is as follows:


MyCipher.java [1:1] Class SecretKeySpec not found
in type declaration or import.
import javax.crypto.spec.SecretKeySpec
                         ^
MyCipher.java [6:1] Class SecretKeySpec not found
in type declaration or import.
  private static final SecretKeySpec KEY = new
SecretKeySpec(KEY_DATA DES)
                       ^
2 errors
Errors compiling MyCipher [Local].

It looks like fastjavac does not include the
standard 1.4.1 libraries during compilation.

short_description: Nbi properties sometimes lost during xmldom conversion
long_description:
NbiProperties.get(set)Property can result (and result indead) in properties lack.
e.g when running overall build procedure on windows system the tomcat installation.location property is changed to 
the value of installation.location.macosx (${ProgramFiles}/...).
As the consequnce the NPE on Macosx occur.
The good thing is that entire registry.xml in (/registry/registry.xml) contains correct values.
The bad thing is that generated bundles contain registries with wrong ones..

short_description: ClassCastException at org.netbeans.modules.java.j2seproject.classpath.ClassPathSupport$Item.getLibrary()
long_description:
dev build 200503211900

This makes it impossible to add a library to the classpath.

short_description: add java.io.File FileUtil.normalizeFile(java.io.File) method
long_description:
The implementation will do:

- on Windows call getCanonicalFile to avoid lots
of evil problems with e.g. filename case and 8.3
syntax.

- on Unix or Unix-like systems use new
File(f.toURI().normalize()) which takes care of
. and .. path components and absolutizes the
path but does not traverse symlinks.

This method will have to be used consistently in
all code base in order to prevent issues like 25953.

short_description: Git/HG/SVN-Diff-view: Files in outline view seem to be unsorted and column 'path' is missing
long_description:
[ BUILD # : 201212050001 ]
[ JDK VERSION : 1.7.0_09 ]

* open a GIT/HG/SVN project with many changed similar-named files per revision
(f.e. many manifest.mf/pom.xml changed in *different* paths)
* open diff view and expand such a revision

ACTUAL: Files seem to be unsorted and duplicated. Files cannot be distinguished
because the path is missing.  - see screenshot

EXPECTED: 
* column 'path' should be available
* files should be sorted asc by name

I think the issue exists  in all SCM-Diff views (GIT/HG/SVN).

short_description: symfony script detection doesn't work with svn versions
long_description:
if using svn version of symfony detection of launch script doesn't work because the version format is  1.2.x-DEV. if i 
remove -DEV from version it works as expected.

if any more info is needed i will gladly help.

short_description: Failed to Deploy when Using XSD and WSDL built from External
long_description:
Build: \\thumper\50builds\gfesb\v2.1\gfesbv21\nightly\20090424-1054

When the XSD and WSDL were created using an external source (from http://amazon.com/../../somefile.xsd
The project fails to deploy on a simple Request/Reply service using the XSD and WSDL using external locations.

To test this scenario:

1)Create a new XSLT project.
2)Create a new XSD file using the external XSD file web.
3)Create a new WSDL file using the external WSDL file from web.
4)Create a simple XSL file.
5)Create a XSLT Service with Req/Reply that uses the above WSDL and XSL files.

Note that the project is built ok.  

However it fails to deploy with ‘Found an invalid address URI’ error.

(see attached project and description file)

short_description: super keyword is not interpreted by evaluator
long_description: super keyword is not recognized by the new evaluator algorithm.

short_description: Method controller with render should not have the hint Missing view
long_description:
When a controller use the method render (for rendering json for instance) the hint about the missing view should not be
activated.

For this I think the change is on line 126 of ruby.hints/src/org/netbeans/modules/ruby/hints/RailsViews.java :

            if (method.startsWith(redirect_) || method.equals(render)) { // NOI18N

short_description: ALL: Two minor problems with profiles management.
long_description:
Development build of NetBeans 3.3 #200111270100 on Windows 2000 with JDK 1.4b87

Description:
============
Remove button deletes proper XML file physically but wizard still thinks it 
exists and offers it in the combo box. (Bug A) Sometimes it also throws excep-
tion. Take a look at the attachment. The link to additional profiles on the web 
is not blue and underlined when using JDK 1.4. (Bug B)

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Launch IDE using latest build of JDK 1.4.
2. Invoke Versioning|Mount Version Control|Generic VCS menu item.
3. Select Empty ... profile and then click Save As button.
4. Setup myProfile as File Name My Profile as Profile Label. Push OK.
5. Push Remove button and confirm your operation. Although the XML file was
   deleted selected profile is still My Profile. (Bug A)
6. Take a look at the link in the botton of the customizer. It's neither blue
   nor underlined. (Bug B)

short_description: The Find Selection button should unselect the Regular expression option else risk regex syntax errors
long_description:
Product Version = NetBeans IDE 8.0.2 (Build 201411181905)
Operating System = Mac OS X version 10.10.2 running on x86_64
Java VM Vendor = 1.8.0_05
Runtime = Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 25.5-b02

I first do a regular expression search.  Then later highlight some text in the editor and press the Find Selection button.  That search may temporarily hang and later report a regular expression syntax error.  For example if I select log( which I hope you can agree might be a common search selection within the editor.  In this case the syntax error is an unclosed group caused by the open parenthesis. 

To be fail-safe I think that any time the Find Selection button is pressed the search should revert to non-regex mode.

short_description: JSF generator produces errorneous code on EJBs based on Oracle 9i database
long_description:
Following Geertjan's example on how to create a crud application in NB5.5 with
the Enterprise pack on

http://blogs.sun.com/roller/page/geertjan?entry=the_best_feature_of_the

I used the New -> Entity Classes from Database... feature to generate EJB beans.
For this I used the HR scheme in Oracle 9i using the classes14.jar database driver.

Next I used New -> JSF Pages from Entity Class... to generate a crud
application. The code for most of the controller and converter classes have
errors in them that are like this one

String param = request.getParameter(departmentId)
java.math.BigDecimal id = (java.math.BigDecimal)param

Obviously a String cannot be cast to a BigDecimal like that. When I replace all
these lines by

String param = request.getParameter(departmentId)
java.math.BigDecimal id = new java.math.BigDecimal(param)

the app runs without problems.

Because method use sequential search in list.
(Example: uts from OpenSolaris contains 5000 elements in list)
Rewrite class to improve performance.

short_description: Extensible tools settings UI
long_description:
As tools may require their specialized settings to
be merged with the base ones provided by the java
module core implementation (or other
language/technology core support) the UI should
be able to adapt and accept those settings. Define
the protocol and extensibility patterns for
seamless integration of the custom UI.

short_description: Options: Fonts & Colors: Versioning: Highlighting List Width Changes
long_description:
1. Whilst using Nimbus or Dark Nimbus L&F goto Options>>Fonts&Colors>>Versioning and if it opens on Subversion of GIT which has a blank list the field is wide. 
2. Switch to Mercurial and the width collapses to smaller width... or it may not. 
3. If it does not collapse click on the last item of the list and it will collapse.

See screenshots.

Product Version: NetBeans IDE Dev (Build 201307152300)
Java: 1.7.0_25 Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 23.25-b01
Runtime: Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 1.7.0_25-b16
System: Windows 7 version 6.1 running on amd64 Cp1252 en_US (nb)

short_description: Synchronize  (methods in your class and implemented interface) doesn`t work well
long_description:
Suppose you have everything setted well (You have allowed synchronization and Synchronization Mode is: confirm all changes)
If you have a class where you want implement some interface the dialog which should appear to ask you for changes won`t appear (70%) and during compilation you`ll get an error about missing methods.


And if the dialog appears and you refuse changes or add just some method of all later you don`t have a possibility to bring up athis dialog again.

Simply if you explicitly say in Explorer on a class (popupMenu->Tools->Synchrize) nothing happens.

Sometimes helps restart of IDE BUT.....

[Svata] I can`t reproduce that. I tried the most common situations (e.g. changing signature of a method implementing new interface or removing a method then manually synchronize) but everything seem
s to be OK for build 804/JDK 1.2.2/Linux. Please include exact steps (and attached pieces of code) to reproduce.


[Svata] Actually the described behaviour _really_ occurs when attributes of source text elements are changed using property sheets/UI dialogs. If changed in the source code it works fine.

short_description: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException after adding a custom J2ME platform.
long_description:
IDE hangs on java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Coordinate out of bounds!

Steps to reproduce:

1) install netbeans 6.1 final
2) Add a blackberry 4.3.0 JME platform as described here: http://www.netbeans.org/kb/55/blackberry.html
3) Close and openthe IDE again gives an java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Coordinate out of bounds! and never
recovers and doesn't allow sending of the report from within the IDE.

short_description: Bkpt is not set correctly in external editor (via shift+F8)
long_description:
With editor set to either xemacs or vim load a
program into the debugger.  In editor window via
Shift-F8 set a bkpt on e.g. line 12.  The bkpt
is actually set on line 13 instead.  Moreover
sometimes both lines are highlighted which is
rather confusing.

short_description: can't exclude 'build' folder from Projects tab
long_description:
my typical scenario:
- all generated files are located in 'build' folder
- exclude 'build' folder from Projects tab
==> in NB 7.3 I can't exclude this folder

simple test case:
- unpack QLife
- call New Project wizard
- Select C/C++ category and C/C++ Project with Existing Sources project type
- Press Next
- Select folder with sources
- Select Custom mode
- Press Next
- Switch on 'Run Configure Script in Subfolder' checkbox
- Press Next 4 times
- Press Finish
==> ok
- Call context menu on project and select Properties
- Set '^(nbproject|build)$' in Ignored Folders Pattern text field
- Press OK
- Rebuild project
- Check Project tab
==> 'build' folder exist
- Restart IDE
==> 'build' folder has 'Failed to load project' icon

short_description: Shortcuts of uninstalled modules cause number of Warnings after start IDE
long_description:
[pilsen](010810)[jdk1.3.1](rc1)

Steps to reproduce:
- type shortcuts for actions ( Form Projects ....)
- uninstall appropriate module
- restart IDE

Now you obtain number of Warnings ( abaout actions for example :
org.netbeans.modules.form.actions.EditFormActions .
The same warnings arise after push OK on Keyboard Shortcuts window.

Number of warnings is equal to number of changed shortcuts.

short_description: JAR node does not refresh its view when the JAR changes on disk
long_description:

2. Expand the jar file. 
3. Change something in the project (add file).
4. Rebuild the project.

The jar file will not show the new file although
the jar file was modified on disk.

(I tested with web project and war file.)

short_description: Total application freeze when jumping to search results
long_description:
When I try to jump to a specific search result (by double-clicking it) the application freezes completely and can only be terminated via the task manager.
This happens in both the normal Find as well as the Find Usages features of the IDE.
It doesn't matter if the file which contains the search result is already open or not.
It seems to me that the application tries to open the respective file since the application's window title changes but afterwards nothing happens and all application windows remain unresponsive to all commands issued afterwards. NetBeans reports back to Windows though since no not responding message pops up no matter how long the freezed application remains open.

short_description: Run File does not work as it should in a JavaFX project
long_description:
There are 2 issues:
1) doing a Run Project is required for Run File to work
2) for classes with a main method that do not extend javafx.application.Application it's impossible to do Run File

A concrete scenario:
1) create a new JavaFX project
--> Run File on the created Application class doesn't work until after a Run Project is done
2) rename the created Application class (using Refactor -> Rename...)
--> Run File is broken & doesn't work until after a Run Project is done
3) add a new class X which extends javafx.application.Application
--> Run File on class X doesn't work until after a Run Project is done
4) add a new class Y which doesn't extend javafx.application.Application but has a main method
--> it's impossible to do Run File on class Y

Serevr: Sun Java....
Name: 82onGFdefdom

Register Local Domain

Domain Folder: /foo/gf/domains/domain1

This completes the wizard.... It should not.  It probably needs to squak on the

short_description: DataObject registration in the DataObjectPool is done on partially constructed DataObjects
long_description:
While developing regression tests a condition which is not thread safe
under multiple CPU machines has been encountered many times in regression
testing. The general problem is that creation of a DataObject is not performed
synchronously which may result in a DataObject being returned which is not
initialized. Specifically there are two problems during DataObject creation: 

1) the DataObjectPool registration happens in DataObject's constructor
2) once this call to register is done other threads can (and do) find this 
partially constructed object in the DataObjectPool
3) we consistently see test failures because of this on MP machines. 

The following example illustrates one stack trace to obtain these results.

Thread 1 -- CPU 1
DataObject.find
  -> getLoaderPool().findDataObject()
  -> DataLoader.findDataObject()
  -> DataObjectPool.callHandleFind()
  -> DataLoader.handleFindDataObject()
Assume MultiFileLoader          
  -> MultiFileLoader.createMultiObject()
  -> MultiDataObjectInstance().super()
  // at this point the MDOInstance constructor has not completed
  -> MultiDataObject.MultiDataObject.super
  -> DataObject.DataObject
  -> DataObjectPool.register()
  -> map.put
  -> loses control
                                                                

Thread 2 starts
DataObject.find
        -> DataObjectPool.find
        Can return partially intialized DataObject. 
        
Thread 2 may then start using a partially initialized DataObject.

Investigating this issue also highlighted a performance problem in the
loading process. As you can see from the pseudo stack trace from Thread
1 a find may cause unnecessary garbage collection. The final test to
determine if the object exists is performed in the constructor where
the memory has already been allocated. Another problem is that
exceptions namely DataObjectExistsException are being used to handle
control. A solution should eliminate the unnecessary object creation
possibly by separating the creation and find stage and moving to a
synchronized block.

Other potential problems:
DataObjectPool.find accesses does not access toNotify in a synchronized block.
This can lead to threads running on other CPU's not seeing this value was set in
the register block. Solution: changed DataObjectPool.find to

public synchronized DataObject find(FileObject fo) {
  if (toNotify != null) {
      return null
  }
  
  Item doh = (Item) map.get(fo)
  return doh == null? null: doh.getDataObjectOrNull()
}

short_description: Maven project with jtds 1.2 artefact hangs Netbeans
long_description:
Observation:

This occurred when adding jtds 1.2 (amongst other things) to an existing project. After a while Netbeans hanged and had
to be xkilled. Further restarts either hanged during startup or just after the UI appeared. Luckily Netbeans 6.5 also
hanged when opening the project for the first time so I knew what to blame.

Other info:

messages.log shows no issue at the time Netbeans hangs.

Possible cause:

jtds 1.2 may have some sort of cyclic dependency causing an infinite loop. It would be good if Netbeans could detect
that (maybe keep track of depth) which I'm sure it did anyway. Leads me to think jtds may even depend on itself which
may not be caught.

Steps to reproduce:

 * New Project -> Basic Maven Project
 * Add to POM
    
      jtds
      jtds
      1.2
    
 * Download artifact
 * That's it

--

Regards

Syntax

short_description: Document difference between  find*/wait* methods in FAQ
long_description:
Suggestion from new user of Jemmy to document convention of find and wait
methods. The difference is:

find* methods immediatelly return null if they find nothing but wait* methods
wait and throw TimeoutExpiredException if waiting fails.

4. Switch the browser to Embedded WebKit browser
5. Run the application again
6. Click again on app.js:8 to unset the breakpoint 

=> Breakpoint is not unset instead another one is submitted the icon in the gutter is changed to two red squares and its tooltip says Multiple Breakpoints

short_description: NbJavaFoldMaintainer causes synchronous parsing during file opening
long_description:
It greatly reduces the IDE responsiveness during
opening of java file. Basically it invokes a java
parser and waits for it to finish parsing
blocking AWT for nontrivial amount of time.

Much more visible on multi-open.

short_description: Apply Code Changes on a Maven project fails to reload inner classes
long_description:
Created attachment 94840
Test case to reproduce bug

Invoking Apply Code Changes on a Maven project during a debugging session only reloads the top level class and not any inner classes within that top level class.

See attached class Outer.java for a test case. This class must be run as part of a Maven project in Netbeans 6.8. Steps to reproduce:
1) Create a new Maven project in Netbeans 6.8.
2) Copy the attached file Outer.java into the package testdebug.
3) Set the Compile on Save option in the project properties to Disabled.
4) Start a debugging session with Outer.java as the main class.
5) Click on the Inner button. The console will print Inner as expected. A dialog with the message Inner is displayed as expected.
6) Click on the Outer button. The console will print Outer as expected. A dialog with the message Outer is displayed as expected.
7) Uncomment the two commented-out System.out.println() lines.
8) Invoke Apply Code Changes from the Debug menu.
9) Click on the Inner button. The console will print Inner when two lines Inner and Inner 2 is expected. A dialog with the message Inner is displayed as expected.
10) Click on the Outer button. The console will print 2 lines Outer and Outer 2 as expected. A dialog with the message Outer is displayed as expected.

Output after Apply Code Changes is invoked:

=== BEGIN NETBEANS OUTPUT ===
NetBeans: Executing 'mvn.bat -Dmaven.test.skip=true -Djpda.stopclass=testdebug.Outer -Dnetbeans.execution=true compile'
NetBeans:      JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_18
Scanning for projects...
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building TestDebug
   task-segment: [compile]
------------------------------------------------------------------------
[resources:resources]
[WARNING] Using platform encoding (Cp1252 actually) to copy filtered resources i.e. build is platform dependent!
Copying 0 resource
[compiler:compile]
[WARNING] File encoding has not been set using platform encoding Cp1252 i.e. build is platform dependent!
Compiling 1 source file to W:\TEST_NB\TestDebug\target\classes
------------------------------------------------------------------------
BUILD SUCCESSFUL
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Total time: 1 second
Finished at: Mon Mar 08 15:30:14 EST 2010
Final Memory: 9M/24M
------------------------------------------------------------------------
NetBeans: Classes to be reloaded:
 testdebug.Outer
NetBeans: Reloaded classes: [testdebug.Outer]
=== END NETBEANS OUTPUT ===


Note that only the class testdebug.testdebug.Outer is reloaded although there are 4 other classes that should have been reloaded:
testdebug.Outer$1
testdebug.Outer$2
testdebug.Outer$Inner
These classes have been recompiled correctly in the the target/classes directory.

Consequently any changes made in these inner classes is not recognised by the running debugging session.

This only applies to Maven projects in NB 6.8 running the same test case outlined above in a non-Maven project in NB 6.8 reloads the inner classes correctly. The output after invoking Apply Code Changes:

=== START NETBEANS OUTPUT ===
init:
Deleting: W:\Test_NB2\TestDebug2\build\built-jar.properties
deps-jar:
Updating property file: W:\Test_NB2\TestDebug2\build\built-jar.properties
Compiling 1 source file to W:\Test_NB2\TestDebug2\build\classes
compile-single:
Classes to be reloaded:
 testdebug.Outer$1
 testdebug.Outer$2
 testdebug.Outer$3
 testdebug.Outer$Inner
 testdebug.Outer
debug-fix:
BUILD SUCCESSFUL (total time: 0 seconds)
=== END NETBEANS OUTPUT ===

short_description: IDE adds space before any macro in Macro Expansion View
long_description:
IDE adds space before any macro in Macro Expansion View therefore 6 automatic tests fails.

Scenario:
- C++ file:
#define AA int
#define CC float

int main(int argc char** argv) {
    AA a = 1
    int b = 1
    CC c = 1.0f
    float d = 1.0f
    return 0
}

- Call Macro Expansion View

short_description: Interim live cpu results can display incorrect time for the last executed method
long_description:
The live results or snapshot taken while the application is running includes a 
time for the last method entered in each thread.

This time is larger than zero although the method has not exited yet. The time 
is computed by subtracting the time of taking the snapshot and the time the 
method was entered.

Due to inaccuracy in the timers and the fact that there is somem more agent 
code executed before the timestamp is taken the computed time can actually be 
larger than the actual time the method took (and thus a time listed for the 
method in subsequent results) making a bad impression about the results 
accuracy.

short_description: Adding  menu item to server node
long_description:
For server installs that support the Glassfish Update center (Glassfish V2 onward) we want to add a new menu item that
will let the user launch the update center from within NetBeans.

View Update Center to be added just after View Server Log.

Selecting this item will launch a new process running the Glassfish Update Center thereby allowing the user to easily
update and configure new software for their glassfish install.

could perhaps see it for compile run and debug.

short_description: Usage logging option not available in Mac installer
long_description:
[NB 6.5 Beta]

The user is supposed to enable/disable the Usage Logging feature in the installer. Unfortunately the native Mac
installer cannot be extended to let the user choose at install time. Therefore the IDE should prompt the user upon the
first start and ask if it's OK to enable the option or not. It's yet another ugly dialog at startup but there doesn't
seem to be a better way to turn Mac users attention to this option.

short_description: Move EJB Methods actions into Insert Code popup
long_description:
The editor contextual menu contains various actions generating code snippets (Insert Code EJB Methods Enterprise Resources Web Service Client Resources). 
For 6.5 we want to clean up the menu and make the code generation consistent. This effort includes moving all code generating items from the contextual 
menu into the Insert Code popup.

For EJB module it means the following:

- Add a Business Method... item into the Insert Code popup.
- Remove the EJB Methods submenu from the editor contextual menu

If there's more EJB related items generating code please let me know.

short_description: encountered a NoSuchElementException when trying to rearrange source packages
long_description:
I was trying to reorganize some source packages in my java project when it threw a java.util.NoSuchElementException
warning. In the projects window i right click on a source package -> Refactor -> Rename... then typed up the new name
of the package (prepended a string to it). It displayed a progress bar that went up to 100% then displayed a dialog with
the warning and a prompt to submit it as a bug. At first since it was a warning and not a fatal error I just went
ahead and refactored anyway but it doesn't seem like it completed the task. I had to go to some of the files and
manually correct the ones that didn't get renamed.

them had this warning.

short_description: Classic Debugger cannot find source-code when debugging Servlets
long_description:
I am trying to debug servlet code using the Classic Debugger.

I have mounted all my source folders in NetBeans.  I set my main class to 
com.sun.web.shell.Startup in order to invoke Sun's servlet engine.

I set a break point in my servlet invoke the debugger and then hit the URL 
that should invoke the servlet.

The debugger starts up correctly opens up my servlet.

However when I try to step-in to code that is in a different folder than the 
servlet (but still in the classpath) Netbeans cannot find the source.

I have configured Netbeans to prompt when source cannot be found but this does 
not work.

I am using Java 1.3.1.

short_description: splashscreen retrieved entry in projects.properties not deleted
long_description:
When I empty the text box for the splash screen in the project properties dialogue (right click project) the
project.properties file is not correctly updated. Within the project.properties file the entry application.splash is
left blank. When compiling the project with webstart configuration the build will fail with the following output.

/home/henri/NetBeansProjects/JavaDemoTestkastenMVC/nbproject/jnlp-impl.xml:61: The following error occurred while
executing this line:
/home/henri/NetBeansProjects/JavaDemoTestkastenMVC/nbproject/jnlp-impl.xml:115: Use a resource collection to copy
directories.

The solution is to remove the empty application.splash= entry within the project.properties and recompile. 

I think the application.splash= entry should automatically be removed when making the splash screen textbox within the
project properties dialogue (category Application) blank.

Kind regards 
Henri

short_description: selection for unfocused windows is not shown
long_description:
jdk-1.5/ocean/gtk (gnome 2.6)
linux
daily 12 aug 2004

1. select some node in a tree in some window
2! click in some other window. the selected node
in the original window is no longer shown when the
original window loses focus.

this is not a trivial problem because slide-in
windows do not have focus when they are slid in.
thus you can not see what the selected node is
unless you click inside the window possibly
changing the selection. clicking on the titlebar
doesn't help because it doesn't put focus inside
the window.

in general it would be nice to see the selection
in unfocused windows anyway.

how about showing selected nodes in unfocused
windows in the usual selected/unfocused color? if
this is already the case for other L&F's it needs
to be fixed for 'ocean' as well.

short_description: Debugger show 'false' instead of NPE
UNABLE TO DEPLOY MULTIPLE STATELESS EJB WEB SERVICES TO A GLASSFISH 2.1 DOMAIN
long_description:
Transferred from BugDB:
https://bug.oraclecorp.com/pls/bug/webbug_print.showbug?c_rptno=13894004

====================================================
*** HNASSIRY  03/27/12 12:02 pm *** 
Client has created a test case to mimic the issue on our side.  I've included 
in this ticket and including all of the jars needed.  One of the projects in 
the newly attached zip has two libraries that you'll need to create.  I've 
sent you those jars.  The JMSJCA library has uses the jmsotd.jar file.  The 
alerter uses the com.stc.* and com.sun* jar files.  You should be able to 
fully compile these projects once you create the libraries in NB.  Once you 
are able to compile all of the projects.  Follow these exact steps: 
1.)  Compile project WEFIWebServiceExternal. 
2.)  Once the compile is complete deploy it out to a glassfish instance. 
  2a.)  As the project is deploying build and compile WEFIWebService 
Internal. 
3.)  Once the second compile is complete deploy the second project to 
glassfish. You should see the first project get undeployed. 

Feel free to set up a webex if you get stuck and we can investigate this 
further together. 

Regards 
Haroon 
*** HNASSIRY  03/27/12 12:05 pm ***

@ ftp://bugftp.us.oracle.com/upload/bug_13/bug13894004 :  SamplesForSupport.zip

short_description: It's impossible to override customized colors in JEditorPane
long_description:
In debugger module we have several dialogs with one-line JEditorPanes with Java
mime type because we need to provide code-completion.
However the ugly side-effect of this is that customized colors are propagated
into that JEditorPane. And also the active line is displayed which has no
purpose in a single-line document.

This looks strange because other fields in the dialogs are white. We need some
way to use the default colors and also supress the active line highlighting.

short_description: Callback D&D support
long_description:
Usecase taken from nbFeature1143:

The editor needs to provide an SPI where various modules could plug in a drop
handler that would get invoked when a user drags&drops some object to the
editor. The handler should be able to handle the drop operation (e.g. open a
customization dialog generate some text into the editor).

An example use-case is code clips. The provider of code clips wants to offer
them in some kind of a clips palette. User should be able to d&d a particular
clip into the editor. A clip may be customizable (it is not just a plain text) -
a provider should be called as the clip is dropped to the editor so that it can
display a dialog for customizing a clip (e.g. in case of generating an EJB call
to allow user to select an EJB the code should invoke etc.) after that the
provider should be able to generate code at the cursor position.

short_description: Confusing warning dialog displayed
long_description:
In a NB dev build running the 6.0 profiler on JDK 6 I open a dev NB module
which is set to use JDK 5. I right-click the module and select Profile Project
and get a warning dialog:

The specification version of project Java Platform is greater than
specification version of platform that will be used for profiling. [there may be
problems etc.]

(note: English is poor here get someone to review)

Now what does this mean? What are the specification versions in question? The
project currently uses source level 1.4 but is requested to run in a 1.5 VM (in
my nbbuild/user.build.properties) nothing unusual there. What exactly is the
platform that will be used for profiling? Tools > Options > Profiler > Profiler
Platform also says 1.5. I guess I could set that to be platform used in project
but I don't know if the profiler understands Java platform settings for NB modules.

In fact if I just accept the dialog everything seems fine. So what was it
warning me about?

short_description: Make the API impl. independent of view models
long_description:
Currently the view models are somehow split between JPDA debugger impl. module
and JPDA UI module. This is confusing.
The view models in JPDA debugger impl. module are used as a basis for JPDA API
implementation. This is an unusual pattern that complicates the code.

The API implementation classes should be made independent on view models and all
models should be moved into JPDA UI module and based just on the API provided by
JPDA API module.

short_description: Reporter should respect Previous/Next selection
long_description:
When multiple exceptions are thrown in a row out Exceptions window offers 'Previous' and 'Next' buttons allowing user
to browse between them. 'Report Exception' tools always selects the last exception which has been thrown and there is
no way to force ie. the first exception.
For example if the root couse of a problem is an exception from ie. Form module and the subsequent stack traces are
from ie. Openide the issue will be reported against Openide module and the stack trace from Openide will be part of
description.

short_description: VSS: Undo Check Out on folder can't be cancelled that causes data lost.
long_description:
Forte for Java CE 3.0 EA on Windows 95/98/NT/2000 with JDK 1.3.0_04

Description:
============
There is no way for user to cancel Undo Check Out command once it is invoked 
on folder and if user has some locally modified files underneath s/he will lose
everything that was changed. Ironically the workaround is to confirm Undo 
Checkout Recursively dialog and stop the process in following dialog requesting
confirmation of Undo Check Out for changed files. Considering this is pretty 
dangerous data lost I value the issue as P1 that requires immediate fix.

Steps to reproduce:
===================
1. Mount VSS filesystem using Generic VCS module with at least one non-empty fo-
   lder with [Current] file(s).
2. Check Out file from such a folder Open it and make some changes so that
   it becomes [Locally Modified] (your_name).
3. Invoke Undo Check Out action from the popup menu of its parent folder.
4. You will be asked whether you wish to do it recursively. Don't set anything
   and just hit Cancel button.
5. Undo Check Out will be executed (!) and note that you are not asked to con-
   firm the lost of changes made in step 2.

short_description: Thread Analyzer works unstable
long_description:
I created ThreadAnalizerDemo project with deadlock potential deadlock and race (read-write and write-write). Sun Studio
Analyzer can find it in ~100% cases. but NetBeans Thread Analyzer can find it very seldom.

ThreadAnalizerDemo project is attached on http://wiki.netbeans.org/CND68THA page.

short_description: Import Management: Shouldn't it suggest a package for unresolved names
long_description:
I had an unresolved identifier.  I had entered:

    JButton btn = new JButton(Hello)

Step 1 of IMT found the unresolved identifier and allowed me to specify
its package.  I expected the IMT to try to find the package especially
since it is from the JDK.  Ideally it would be able to find a package
anywhere in my classpath.  Of course it needs to deal with duplicates
but that would be part of the value of IMT.

I'm guessing that this is an enhancement request as I don't know 
the original design.

short_description: missing server ref problem in EJB module
long_description:
[build 200503201900]

- create new enterpise application with ejb module and web app
- put them to cvs

- start ide with new userdir (or as other user) and setup AS
- check out enterprise app from cvs and open it in IDE

=>
EJB module tells you Missing server reference problem but another two parts
(web module j2ee) set up app server

This should be consistent so all modules should be compilable after checkout or
all components should show Missing server reference problem

short_description: NullPointerExceptions from Find utility
long_description: NullPointerExceptions that I am afraid are hardly reproducible.

short_description: Build Menu does not switch Compile item
long_description:
When switching to edit a file with multiple files displayed in a split window the Build menu does not switch to show
the new file selected.  Selecting the item will compile the shown item rather than the one selected in the editing
window.  A screenshot will be added showing the build menu extended with the file InterunitToken shown for compiling
while the InterunitTokenBuffer file is selected for editing.  Changes had been made yet there is no way to select
the file for individual compiling.  I had noticed in a previous session that the compile item would only let me do a
package compile (the source package name seen in the upper left hand corner of the screenshot is what appeared as the
item in the menu).

short_description: The freeform project ant task check is incorrect
long_description:
The freeform project tries to validate whether the ant target selected by the 
user for profiling is correct. This check incorrectly searches for nbprofile 
task it should search for nbprofiledirect
